29.description: Granted it's new, it could still use a complete overhaul. Food is not good. Ingredient quality is poor. Service is acceptably poor- new starts are rocky, but the food and wines could use some serious help. I live so close to it, so I hope it gets better.

42.description: The Greek turkey burger was good but the fries were soggy. Had the hummus which was bland and the pitas were fried...who fries pitas with hummus?  We had some dirty martinis with blue cheese stuffed olives and frankly it tasted like toothpaste I am not even kidding. My friend had the green salad and asked for chicken which came on the side in a cup that was cold. Service was confusing the bartenders all pitched in and if it wasn't for my beautiful girlfriend we would have been forgotten. All in all, you can catch me at Jefferson tap.

23.description: Wow.  What a complete disappointment.  I give this joke of a place 6 months.  "Ultimate nachos". Are you kidding me?  Hmm...last time I checked nachos consisted of more than 4 individual chips with some sour cream on them. The blonde server/bartender is the worst...so rude.  Don't waste your time going to this epic failure of a "bar".

8.description: I love this place! Great menu with great drinks. The staff is awesome. I had the deviled eggs and the nachos which were both delicious. The southwest salad was awesome. I'll definitely be back

31.description: Great new spot with some tasty food. Had the buffalo wrap and turkey burger on my date night with some friends. Met my expectations of how a turkey burger should taste, and the Greek yogurt was a nice surprise! Had the saison beer and it washed down the meat into my belly. This place is also dog friendly on the patio  so bring the pooch!

34.description: Great re-design. The food was delicious, especially the Turkey Burger. All the wait staff was very friendly and responsive. Will be back.

16.description: What an improvement over what was used to be the Point. Whereas the Point was just a ho hum bar and grill in a sea of similar joints in the Chicago market, Black Iron is a welcome and quite unique revision. The bar cocktails are expertly mixed to any palates tastes. The bar grub is well beyond average as it is refreshing to order beyond fries as your side dish items. Here the bar 'chef' offers a delicious vegetable of the day from scratch that could make any foodie drool. My gf's veggie burger with side of corn succotash was phenomenal and made me slightly jealous as I ordered a salad for my side. It's always nice to see an establishment offer delicious sides other than just stereotypical 'fries'. One of our companions did order the fries though and they came with this really groovy 'disco' sauce on the side - made up of a beef gravy similar to curry sauce and was phenomenal.

13.description: We held a private event at BIT and the staff was awesome! We had a great turnout and it was more than anticipated but the staff worked well under pressure. They kept smiles on and kept the drinks flowing! The food was also great! We had mini burgers, wings and nachos. All delicious! I am eager to return and try some other menu items.

11.description: I live nearby, and Black Iron Tavern is the obvious choice for a drink close to home or a great place to watch the game. The environment is cool and a bit quirky, while still being modern with an industrial vibe. The food is better than I expect from drinking establishments, including a great kale salad that balances out all the alcohol (maybe?). The grilled cheese and tomato soup combo is anther great option for winter. The service is always amazing, and the crowd is pretty laid back. I've never had trouble grabbing a seat, which surprises me. This place is a hidden gem just steps from the blue line.

39.description: I live right across the street from Black Iron and was eagerly anticipating its opening ever since The Point shut down. I think the management rushed the opening and should have spent some more time preparing.  A friend and I went there to enjoy the patio and watch the first Bears game. The two outdoor TVs had too much glare that the picture could barely be seen. Not a big deal because we could have just gone inside. The reason for this post and 1 star review, though, is the food.  Upon arrival, we were told that they were only serving appetizers and the classic burger - lame. I was looking forward to trying the Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup, but it wasn't available. As a vegetarian, I was basically then limited to the $8 "Ultimate Nachos" from the appetizer menu. When it arrived, my friend and I busted out laughing.  There is nothing "ultimate" about these nachos. I was expecting a large plate of filling nachos common to any other establishment, but these were basically 4 large tortilla chips, each topped with some beans, cheese, and guacamole. The "chips" were greasy and soggy to the point that I ended up rolling each of these 4 nachos up like a taquito.  The entire plate of 4 nachos was consumed in less than 3 minutes. Completely unsatisfied, we left. For fairness, I guess this review should be considered only for the "Ultimate Nachos".  But they were bad enough to make me write my first Yelp review. Complete ripoff and gross.

37.description: Went on Saturday night after scooting by earlier in day and seeing turkey burger on yelp.  Guess it just opened.  Great looking bar (I like triangle bar look and all the window seats.  Turkey burger was Mediterranean and we both thought it was one of if not the best in the city.  Also had wings and they. Were cooked well and had great flavor.  Service was good. Overall it was great

0.description: I had the best customer service here ever. I have a (stupid) soy and soybean oil intolerance, and if you know anything about soy, that shit is everywhere. Eating out usually ends with a lot of stomach pain. I asked the manager if she knew what foods I could eat and she came back with the head chef who sat down with me and went through every single thing on the menu, saying what I should avoid and what he could do just for me (like an olive oil dressing).It really doesn't get better than that. The food I got was super tasty. Highly recommend this place, especially if you have food problems.

38.description: I went to Black Iron Tavern on opening weekend. Things were a bit hectic but to be expected for a brand new bar. The decor is a great upgrade from the Point and the vibe feels a lot more fun. I started off the meal with the spicy Korean wings. Next stop was the mixed green salad with apples, walnuts, and goat cheese(amazing!), a healthy addition after the wings :) I topped off the meal with a cosmo and delicious chocolate brownie. Can't wait to spend some upcoming weekends enjoying the spacious outdoor patio and inhaling the Bloomer's chocolate aroma from next door. Great addition to the neighborhood.

27.description: We held a private event at BIT and the staff was awesome! We had a great turnout and it was more than anticipated but the staff worked well under pressure. They kept smiles on and kept the drinks flowing! The food was also great! We had mini burgers, wings and nachos. All delicious! I am eager to return and try some other menu items.

32.description: We absolutely loved it and are so happy to  have it in our neighborhood. We had the burger, Mac and cheese, and chicken sandwich. They were all an A+. The staff is outstanding. Our server was flawless and Chef Paul came by to talk to us. We sat on the patio which is great for a nice day. They also have tv's outdoor which made a great environment for football / hockey / baseball. We can't wait to go back and work our way through the menu!

44.description: Outstanding!  Chef Michael Taus does it again.

24.description: Had a party melt and it was amazing! New great local bar that's always an awesome time. Quickly becoming a regular hangout for me and my friends.

7.description: Same place different name...very disappointing that all they did was add a telephone booth and changed the face of this place.The menu remains the same and not for the better. The fish tacos and nachos remain average to decent but the veggie burger is dry and flavorless as cardboard.The drink menu has barely changed and although they have a brunch menu I don't see myself giving it a try.  Rather unfortunate seeing that they have a great amount of TVs to watch Sunday football on.

40.description: Great evironment and good prices. The carnitas tacos were excellent and the beer selection was really good. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

30.description: CassyThanks for the contact.  I have the necessary tools to read webpages, but your menu is "unreadable".I did visit and my experience was not good.1.  The beers are priced at downtown hotel bar levels.2.  The Manhattan arrived with no cherries (as described in the menu).3.  The daiquiri was tiny and I could taste no rum.4.  The deviled eggs were not prepared to order nor were they fresh.  At almost $2.00/half egg I was surprised and since it takes about 2-3 minutes to prepare, why they are pre-made is beyond me.  When were they made?  That day?  Day before?  What else is not made to order?The service was very good.That's all we had. Rating remains.  These issues were not mistakes...they are deliberate business decisions.  Won't be back.

46.description: Tonight was opening night. Started off at the bar with very knowledgeable bartender Rich. Good selection of a wide range of drinks and he helped me select a new beer that was spot on. The decor was pretty cool with a combo of rustic lux meets hipster trendy, which totally nails the location given being near the Loop, Fulton and River West. Servers were all nice. Started with the chili which had awesome flavor and elbow pasta in it which I had never seen. And, the Greek turkey burger was honestly one of the best burgers I have had. Solid fries too and I am not a big fries guy. Finished with a double chocolate brownie featuring Blommers chocolate right from the factory across the street! Doesn't get much more local than that!Noise level was perfect, good vibe, solid mix of people.Excited to go back and sit out on the patio, and try other items. This is just was this transition neighborhood and location needed.

1.description: A C+ / B- experience. When we first got there the bartender was busy - he was the only bartender. We didn't even get an acknowledgement for 15 minutes. Once he got us he was very abrupt in taking our order. We ordered some apps and when they arrived we had no plates, napkins, or silverware. He finally noticed and he "flung" some plates and roll ups our way. To be fair he was busy. Apps were ok.We finished up at the bar and decided to sit outside since the weather was nice. I got a burger and it was quite good. I recommend it. We ate and came back inside since it got chilly and sat at the bar to watch the rest of the Cubs game (yes this review is overdue) which they lost. The bartender gave us a free shot since we looked sad.

9.description: Soooo happy that this place is open!!!  It's in the same location where The Point used to be, with a major face-lift.  The decor is what I would describe as "Modern-Hipster-Chic" and the bar looks great...They did a great job with it.  As far as the food is concerned, I only had the hamburger, but it was awesome.  Since this was opening night, it was a little hectic, but the bar staff did an amazing job of keeping up.  Pretty decent beer selection, but I also had an amazing manhattan.So glad that the neighborhood has a new bar for this spot...There are a bunch of flat-screen TVs in the bar area, so this will definitely be on my list of places to go during football season!

26.description: The most amazing turkey burger I've ever had!! The vodka sodas, Lagunitas, and shots of Jameson were flowing and the service was perfect. Such a great vibe with a West Loop decor and outstanding food! Must check this place out for happy hour or after a night out!!!!!

25.description: I had a great experience at black iron tavern. I went during the opening weekend and had the turkey burger, wings and a few of their signature cocktails. Everything was good and the atmosphere is awesome. The real stand out though is the turkey burger. It was one of the best turkey burgers I've ever had! I would definitely come back for that!

12.description: The most amazing grilled cheese and tomato soup.  This alone makes the place worthy of a destination.  I'm hungry just thinking about it.  I'm surprised there isn't a line out the door for it like there is for the Au Cheval burger. Cool, small bar with good service, and a surprisingly culinary-inspired menu.  But I would warn against the Brussels and Bacon.  I'm a big fan of Brussels sprouts and this side left a lot to be desired.  Our table ate about three of them before just pushing the plate away (the waitstaff didn't pick up on this clue that it was not good).  But the grilled cheese and soup combo more than made up for that one bad plate.

21.description: Great addition to the neighborhood!  Stopped in here for dinner.  The food was delicious (chopped salad and chicken tacos), the service was great, and the music was a fun mix of alternative and rock.  Will definitely be returning soon!

17.description: Went on Saturday night after scooting by earlier in day and seeing turkey burger on yelp.  Guess it just opened.  Great looking bar (I like triangle bar look and all the window seats.  Turkey burger was Mediterranean and we both thought it was one of if not the best in the city.  Also had wings and they. Were cooked well and had great flavor.  Service was good. Overall it was great

10.description: I've been here over ten times. I live down the block and their Mac and cheese is one of my favorite breakfast items, so I end up coming in and getting it and a drink after work The experience depends on the staff. After my experience today I doubt I'll come back.Pros The food is consistentThe setup is nice Televisions to watch the sports gamesThey offer a discount (sometimes) to local residentsCons The bartenders are inconsistent so it's not the best place for a cocktailIt's expensive for what it deliversThe kitchen doesn't keep consistent hoursThe service is inconsistent and the place could benefit from better training.Tonight- I sat in the bar with eight other customers. I watched three employees gathering for fifteen minutes socializing while no one worked the bar or took care of customers waiting to order/closeout. The bartender was eating something while they were chatting, licked her fingers and then came back to serve folks with her newly "cleaned" fingers.

5.description: Ok...in order here are the three best triangular-shaped things associated with Chicago. #1 The Bulls offense in the 90's #2 A slice of Pequod's deep dish (yes Pequod's)#3 Black Iron Tavern If you're wondering why "Viagra" didn't make my list, first of all, STFU. Second of all, even though your taste in neighborhoods sucks, you'd still probably have a good time here. This bar is for everyone and attracts a very diverse crowd. From the power broker I saw still wearing a suit at 10pm, to the guy with a tuxedo T-shirt, it's been pretty across the board on each of my visits. This a neighborhood bar that's caught right at the crossroads of River North, West Loop, and River West which are pretty opposite neighborhoods. So how does Black Iron appeal to the different demos? Awesome upscale bar food and an unexpectedly fantastic Old Fashioned. Try their Korean-style chicken wings, the meatball appetizer, and the Greek turkey burger. All really delicious regardless of what hood you hail from. Pair the food and beverage with some incredibly sweet service and it's no wonder all customers can coexist here. It's your friendly neighborhood bar, only with much better food.

3.description: Recently went here not expecting anything crazy, just some ok food that's not far from my apartment on a cold Sunday night. Dude, I was honestly really surprised. Great beer and drink selection. I had the blackened salmon which was delicious. Boyfriend had a cheeseburger with fries. Both were delicious. The guy running it is really nice and accommodating. We'll be back. Especially since the other bar just next to it recently changed their menu and now this is the closest place with good food and drinks.

35.description: Had an amazing Wednesday date night at the new Black Iron Tavern.  We sat on the spacious outside patio and ordered dinner and drinks.  My fiance had the buffalo chicken wrap and I had the shrimp tacos.  Both were amazing, and the service was definitely on par. Will absolutely be coming back here :)

19.description: I love this little bar. The burgers are great. For some reason I can't get enough of the pickles they put on it! I can't comment on the other food cause that's all I've ordered all 3 times I've been. They have a lot of beer choices and a good cocktail menu. Staff is nice and attentive. It definitely has a permanent spot in our neighborhood bar/restaurant rotation.

28.description: Great new spot!!  The food and the service is great.  Friendly bartenders and really good food!  The grilled cheese was probably one of the best I ever had.  I will definitely go back to this neighborhood gem.

45.description: Greek Turkey Burger!  Honestly one of the best burgers I've had in a while!  This alone will keep me coming back.  Black Iron Tavern is a huge upgrade for the area.  I had a few drinks which were great and I really enjoyed my Old Fashioned.  The food menu has a lot of great options.  I need to come back and try the chili and grilled cheese which looked really good.  If you're looking to sit down for dinner I recommend grabbing a spot behind the bar or back bar area as the front bar can get a little crowded as folks wait for their seats.  Also, the outside patio is just awesome.  Definitely plan on coming back!

33.description: What an improvement over what was used to be the Point. Whereas the Point was just a ho hum bar and grill in a sea of similar joints in the Chicago market, Black Iron is a welcome and quite unique revision. The bar cocktails are expertly mixed to any palates tastes. The bar grub is well beyond average as it is refreshing to order beyond fries as your side dish items. Here the bar 'chef' offers a delicious vegetable of the day from scratch that could make any foodie drool. My gf's veggie burger with side of corn succotash was phenomenal and made me slightly jealous as I ordered a salad for my side. It's always nice to see an establishment offer delicious sides other than just stereotypical 'fries'. One of our companions did order the fries though and they came with this really groovy 'disco' sauce on the side - made up of a beef gravy similar to curry sauce and was phenomenal.

43.description: Soooo happy that this place is open!!!  It's in the same location where The Point used to be, with a major face-lift.  The decor is what I would describe as "Modern-Hipster-Chic" and the bar looks great...They did a great job with it.  As far as the food is concerned, I only had the hamburger, but it was awesome.  Since this was opening night, it was a little hectic, but the bar staff did an amazing job of keeping up.  Pretty decent beer selection, but I also had an amazing manhattan.So glad that the neighborhood has a new bar for this spot...There are a bunch of flat-screen TVs in the bar area, so this will definitely be on my list of places to go during football season!

2.description: Decided to give this place a second try this past Sunday. It is in the neighborhood, afterall. This experience was better than my first, although there's still room for improvement. If management works a few more kinks out, this could be my go-to sports bar.Came in during their Sunday brunch hours (11AM to 4PM) to watch the Seahawks game. They have a smaller brunch menu available during this time. We got started with some drinks -- my boyfriend had a Revolution beer, but unfortunately my first choice Seattle Cider was sold out. Not ideal, but I settled for a glass of chardonnay. For food, my boyfriend ordered the Korean Wings and I opted for the Turkey Burger. Both items were great, better than standard bar food and came out really hot and fresh from the kitchen. However, the place was severely under-staffed for a playoff weekend game (1 server for the entire restaurant), and service was painfully slow. If we weren't here for a long game, we would have been pretty annoyed. This is no fault to the server on duty, and more a management / staffing problem.An addition issue with this place for sports purposes is TV placement. The bar has dangling light fixtures throughout the front room, and with the TVs flush against the brick walls, the light fixtures get in the way of the picture from various tables. I find myself craning my head to look around the light bulbs. I notice that they do have TV Stands set up in the middle of the bar area, but no TVs set up here yet. Would be ideal if they put in TVs in this area! I want to love it here, and I think with some better staffing (more servers) and TVs placed in the center of the bar, it could be a slam dunk.

18.description: I went to Black Iron Tavern on opening weekend. Things were a bit hectic but to be expected for a brand new bar. The decor is a great upgrade from the Point and the vibe feels a lot more fun. I started off the meal with the spicy Korean wings. Next stop was the mixed green salad with apples, walnuts, and goat cheese(amazing!), a healthy addition after the wings :) I topped off the meal with a cosmo and delicious chocolate brownie. Can't wait to spend some upcoming weekends enjoying the spacious outdoor patio and inhaling the Bloomer's chocolate aroma from next door. Great addition to the neighborhood.

41.description: Just finished dinner on what feels like the first night of fall- atmosphere was warm with great lighting and the new bar design looks great! We started with the potato skins which I'd highly recommend, and I got the patty melt which was delicious. My friend got the meatballs and they tasted homemade, almost like my grandmas. Got the brownie for dessert and it was sooo good- it's made with bloomer's chocolate from across the street which I've always wanted to try!  Also we sat at the bar for a bit after- drinks were much better than expected (def try the penicillin!) and they had apple pie shots. What a perfect start to the season :) will be back!

4.description: Came in for brunch this morning and found myself pleasantly surprised. This place is conveniently located walking distance from my apartment, so I'm sure I will be returning soon. The restaurant itself is actually really cute. It features interesting lighting fixtures, cute wallpaper, etc. I ordered the Southwest Breakfast Wrap and a Bloody Mary while my friends had the Biscuits and Gravy, BIT skillet, and some other things that I can't remember (lol). My breakfast wrap was really good, and I'm a little picky with Bloodys (bloodies?), but enjoyed mine thoroughly. The Biscuits and Gravy were soo good omg--I'm definitely getting that next time. The service wasn't incredible, but I think they're still getting into the swing of things since this place is fairly new. They are very friendly though. The portions are large especially for the price. I had half my breakfast left that I intended to eat later, but I absentmindedly left my box at the table :(

6.description: When I heard Michael Taus had opened up a new place close to where my friends live, you can bet I was the first to suggest to those friends we go there and check it out!  Did I over anticipate?  Have I been there on off nights?  I'm not sure.  But for this bar lovin' gal, Black Iron Tavern didn't really differentiate and still has my friends shaking their heads and muttering, "it's just okay".And while okay isn't bad, I doubt it's what was the vision for this highly touted spot.So let's separate the "oohs" from the "nahs".The oohs are I love the old repurposed building at the corner of Milwaukee, DesPlaines and Kinzie- the mural of the guy walking into the bar on the north side made my inner artist smile.  And it has other cute things inside, like a red English style phone booth which the bartender told me tells secrets (I have to go with his word as I ran out of time to check it out!)Another ooh was the service.  Adam, the bartender was friendly and made a darn good Moscow Mule!  And when our food came up wrong, he offered to get it replaced but we didn't have time for that as we were on our way to another place.So where were the nahs?  Well let's talk about the food.  The "ultimate nachos" need to come with a disclaimer that they really aren't that at all.  More like 8 loaded chips which made the men in my group groan when they arrived with each person gingerly grabbing their one chip.  I get that this place is going for more upscale bar food, but those nachos still come up every time I suggest we stop back in.And I've already mentioned the food snafu with a food item requested prepared a certain way showing up the wrong way.On a positive note, my taco carnitas were quite good as were the fries with the dipping sauce.My only regret was that we didn't have time for the Bloomer double chocolate brownie.  That thing sounded amazing (like the smell that wafts from across the street)  I know I will be back just to bite into that heath bar crunch.Three stars isn't bad . . .but I was really expecting this to be a 4 star review.

22.description: I had been wanting to try this place for a while since I live just a few blocks away. I went with my parents and fiancé on a Sunday night and ordered a few appetizers to start. The wings are absolutely delicious and so are the deviled eggs. We were all able to try each others main meals which consisted of a turkey burger, grilled cheese and the patty melt. The turkey burgers were great and both parties really enjoyed them. The patty melt was nothing special and the grilled cheese and soup came out mildly warm, at best. I figured it had been sitting out a bit since our service was not that great. I love the ambiance of the place but the service definitely needs some work. Very slow. I will keep coming back but probably just eat at the bar area.

15.description: I had dinner here on a Saturday night - which had it's pluses and minuses. The good: When walking into the bar, the place was next to dead. There were maybe 5 other people in the joint. That made it nice for the fact that I was starving and we didn't have to wait to be seated. We ordered the hummus, skins, and shared a greek turkey burger. All were delicious. The skins came with pulled pork and were portioned into perfect 2 bite sizes. Also, our bartender had the kitchen split the burger and put on two plates, which was great!The bad: For a Saturday night, I expected the place to be a little more crowded. I can't fault the restaurant for that though, as I feel like the location makes it hard to pull in a crowd. With it being so slow, I thought our bartender would be a little more attentive. My water glass was empty much of the dinner, and not because I kept drinking it but because it didn't get refilled. Overall, I did enjoy my dinner. The food was delicious and just what I wanted. I would come back if I knew I wanted to eat quickly. I don't see the bar/restaurant as a place I'd go to hangout and drink though.

20.description: My husband and I are fans of Michael Taus and were eager to try this place. Let's say he's good with bar food, and ambience. The decor is beautiful but still bar-appropriate - all grays and blacks and very comfortable, plus lots of TVs. The service was friendly and efficient but not cloying. The bar has a nice wine list and my husband enjoyed his old-fashioned. The veggie burger was the best I've had in this city, and Mr. Man's grilled cheese with roasted-tomato soup was terrific, and looked so cute - the soup was in an earthenware disw with a little handle. The best part: My veggie burger came out as a turkey burger. Server realized his mistake even before he set it down. The veggie burger was out in about five minutes, then the chef (sous chef? chef de cuisine?) came out personally to apologize, and offered us a gratis brownie sundae. We tried to say no - servings were big enough to leave us stuffed - but he insisted. It was good - made with Blommer chocolate - and the size was just big enough to split. Loved Black Oak Tavern. We will return.

36.description: Great wings!  Phenomenal beer selection.   Solid scene.  Cleanly.  Service = delightful.   BNF or Bailey Night Football promotion of Lagunitas and classic burger was exceptional.  Great energy and vibe.  I'll be back!

14.description: Great new spot with some tasty food. Had the buffalo wrap and turkey burger on my date night with some friends. Met my expectations of how a turkey burger should taste, and the Greek yogurt was a nice surprise! Had the saison beer and it washed down the meat into my belly. This place is also dog friendly on the patio  so bring the pooch!

58.description: I was disappointed with Dagostino's. I had read some reviews that the one in wrigleyville had some of the best thin crust in the city. I thought the pizza lacked flavor and the crust tasted like cardboard. I would not go back.

56.description: I always feel like when I give three stars it is a little mean. Not this time. D'Ags is really  just A-ok. I mean when it is 11pm where the hell else ya gonna order from? Mc'd aint deliverin' and you really aint goin out anywhere so why the hell not?If you order traditional, known pizza combinations you are safe. Veer into their specialty pizzas and the uncharted territory becomes very murky and quite unpredictable. I mean really really unpredictable. The BBQ chicken pizza is chunks of chicken breast with cheese on top then BBQ sauce is seemingly added on top. And it seemed like where the tomato sauce should be was BBQ sauce too. I was confused to look at it and my taste buds were entirely perplexed.Ordered garlic bread with marinara. Got charged for the marinara but not the garlic bread. Only got the marinara. Not the garlic bread. Why the hell would anyone order a side of marinara sauce with BBQ chicken pizza? The idea made me want to vomit.Never been to the brick and mortar restaurant. Pretty sure I'm not missing much. I'll continue to order from here basically because it is in my hood and the options are limited late night. Will I like it? Who knows, it's like a crap shoot with this place.

29.description: Love the thin crust pizza.  Sausage is a little sweet which i like.  Solid place great menu.

42.description: Why the heck do I even try to give this place another try? Ordered through GrubHub. Had to pick up food for my entire companys dinner meeting. GrubHub said order was ready for pickup.Once again, I come over and they haven't had anything cooked.Messed up my company meeting + a surprise birthday party about a year ago.Place is terribly managed. Get your sh!t together man.

23.description: D'Agostino's is good, but its nothing phenomenal. My boyfriend lives near this location, so we'll stop in every now and then to grab a pizza. We went in last weekend and sat at a high top in the bar area. The bartender (I think his name was Mike) Served us. We got a thin crust and a half antipasto salad (perfect for 2). The Salad was really good, it was our first time getting it, and the thin crust is always pretty tasty. I like that the sauce is sweet.  Everything came out in a timely manner and our server was really nice. My only complaint is that we sat right near the area where the servers congregate in front of the kitchen window, so we heard every bit of their personal conversations. I worked in restaurants for years so I understand how it goes,especially since the place was dead, but we would have liked to not hear every detail of their night's plans or how they wished they would be sent home soon. I've also noticed that almost every time I come here, I am absolutely freezing. I am not sure if its because there are so many windows or just a coincidence. Overall the food is good, the servers are nice and personable, definitely a nice place to stop in to grab a pizza and a casual drink or two.

47.description: Love Dags!  Great neighborhood place! So cheap you cannot bitch about anything being not haute cuisine.  Great drink specials and  Their pizza is actually very good. They have a full bar and have great food and drink specials. Service is attentive from both the bartender and the waiters.

8.description: I really want to like D'Agostino's.  I live really closeby and the service has always been great.  I just really don't like the pizza.  I've had the thick and the thin, and a couple bites in, I start wondering if I have a cold.  Where's the flavor?  I'll be back again in 6 months in hopes that they've changed their recipe.

31.description: My all time favorite pizza place. The pizza is thin, not too much cheese and the sauce is on the sweeter side. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because there are times I order and the pizza is under cooked because of adding too much cheese when I order a pizza with a chunky topping like pineapple. Most of the time the pizza is perfect. I guess it depends on who's working that evening.

34.description: Currently my go-to place for delivery (only b/c I'm outside of Piece's delivery zone). This place is great for thin crust square slices.  The crust holds up very well - not soggy at all. The Greek salad is also excellent and comes with a delicious dressing.

16.description: The food is always good.  The delivery is fast and they deliver alcohol too.

13.description: Used to live down the block from this place, pizza is awesome. Thin crust, sweet sauce, good price. Got a taste for thin crust pizza and your in the area

11.description: Take out customer service is always on the ball! On a pinch this place is great. I usually pre-order before I get on the blue line and then walk over. I must admit there fries are the bomb! However I was disappointed in there mini burger sliders. The meat tasted too tough... The BLT here isn't too bad, but try there jalapeno poppers. They do have a large selection of food and appetizers to choose from.

39.description: Another mediocre pizza joint. Its not bad pizza but its not great pizza either.Its one block over so its easy to order from for us.  If we weren't so close I don't think we would be ordering.If you're excited about middle of the road pizza then come here.

37.description: HORRIBLE!  We ordered a pizza and it came completely burnt and not edible.  It was so burnt that the crust and cheese were charred black.We also ordered cookies as desert and they were completely stale and hard as a hockey puck.I won't be ordering from here again.

0.description: I LOVE THIS PIZZA! I gotta tell you.. without fail.. the pizza comes out A1. We usually get double pepperoni (make sure you call and specify any additional toppings) sausage and jalapeno. I had gotten the giardinera from here before and it's overwhelmingly spicy (but that's just me personally). Again, I cannot stress enough that this pizza comes out amazing every time. LOVE. Also, the wings. The wings here are amazing. They are always on point with getting us the sauce that we need and delivering the wings naked (as preferred!) We order from here at least 3 times a month!

38.description: Love the thin crust pizza. They must add sugar to the sauce. Pizza is so deliciously sweet. Also get many of the meals. Pasta sauce is great. House made Italian dressing is yummy as well. Always very quiet, yet family friendly. Servers are so friendly. Excellent value. Daily specials. Wednesday 1/2 price pizza. Take leftovers for a second meal. #1 neighborhood go-to spot.

51.description: Amazing. My favorite thin crust in the city. The sauce is delicious, a little too sweet for some but I think perfect. Expert tip: ask for extra sauce on the bottom for maximum efficiency. The delivery is always quick and correct. My only complaint is the fact that they only let you use one coupon at a time when they saturate you in them via snail mail and text. Really? You have a monthly special yet you cannot use a coupon for free delivery in conjunction with that? Doesn't really make much sense...sigh...I will be back again...and again....and again...despite this issue.

27.description: We love their thin crust pizza so much that I frequently drive out of my way to pick it up on the way home.  (We live in oak park and can only eat so much Malnati's.). Haven't tried other menu items but they look, smell and sound wonderful.  (As does the ice cream selection). I Always get quick, friendly service at pick-up and can usually use hazards to park right outside the door.  I love that when I call they already have my contact info and can even guess what I want to order.  If I had one suggestion it would be to open an oak park location.

32.description: It took 27 minutes for them to put together 2 salads and an order of chicken wings while I waited.  The food is just so-so.  I wish they were better because they are so close to my job, but every time we order from here, I am reminded of why we don't regularly order here!  Their air conditioning is not functioning also.

54.description: I use to eat lunch at this place all the time a few years ago, from time to time we would have to give them a break because lil dude behind the counter had a fucked up attitude, but the pizza was good so we would always end up going back, i would sometimes day drink on my lunch break and they made a pretty good martini , well the other day i was hungry as hell and just so happened to pass by this place. we had to stop for a slice so i went with the usual deep dish sausage plus sauce with a ginger ale for $5. It was the same massive slice of goodness i remember the kinda sweet sauce, tons of cheese(you must eat this hot or it will turn into a big ass brick of cheese) big bites of sausage good filling slice of pizzza

48.description: 2 stars because the customer service sucks other than that the pizza is good. This is my 5th or 6th time here on a half off large pizza Wednesday. Every time except maybe once I've experienced bad customer service. Once my aunt and i ordered a ground beef pizza because she cant eat pork only to eat most of the pizza before realizing its actually pork sausage and after asking an employee are they sure its beef she says yes its italian beef sausage then we got home and called and spoke to someone else who said they don't have beef Italian sausage on another occasion I received a medium pizza and was charged for it which actually costed more than the large. When I asked about it the server lied and said it was a large he just made a mistake on the bill but instead of arguing I just made a note to never eat here again! But here I am once again but this time the rudeness started at the door. No way should I walk in a non-busy restaurant and stand by the bar as 3 employees walk by and barely glance at me for like 2 minutes before I'm acknowledged. And even then I don't get a "hello" I get a "dining in?" I started to say I was but not anymore and walk out but I was hungry. Out of the 5 times I've been here I've only experienced satisfactory customer service once and that was from a guy I had classes with months before. I live right down the street from this place and the pizza is great but the employees need reevaluating.

44.description: Lasagna with a block of meat and seemingly broccoli. I was born and raised in this neighborhood, resulting in higher expectations for this long-standing restaurant. I have been away for 10 yrs and time has not been good.

24.description: Enjoy stopping in for lunch.  Regardless eat in or carry out,  the service is top notch and the food delicious.  Enjoy their pizza very much.

7.description: DO NOT EAT HERE !!!!!!disgusting I ordered delivery The wings were cold and chewy . They also had visible freezer burn scabs on them . I assume from being in the freezer too long or not stored at proper temp ....Disgusting The rueben was chewy and cold. They slice the corned beef incorrectly with the grain so that it is chewy and fatty . Disgusting I asked for the burger well. It was red . No attention to detail . Disgusting They forgot my salads as well . I called in . They sent out replacements , but it took like 2 hours This place is not only a joke , but their food is disgusting!!!!DO NOT EAT HERE !!!!!!!!

49.description: Out of town friend prior to D'Agostino's visit: "Lou Malnati's and Giordano's is awesome!"Out of town friend after D'Agostino's visit: "Lou who?"Malnati's may have a lot of hype and out of town group think, but Chicagoans know what good pizza is.

40.description: we order from here all the time (i'm talking 3-4 times a month) but this time they forgot all our condiments, we called and they said they'd deliver it (we're 4 mins away from the restaurant), after 30 mins we call back and the chick tells us the guy should be here in 10 mins because hes out delivering somewhere else first. ummmm, hello customer service?! if you forget something that customer should be getting their order delivered first as you're the one that effed up. annoyed.

53.description: Believe it or not, I was actually in the neighborhood for a Girl Scout Leader training two blocks down the street on Halsted and Chicago.  This place was recomended by the staff at the Journeyworld facility.  I was here today with two girlfriends/co-leaders for lunch.  The restaurant space behind the small bar area is pretty sparse and lacking in atmosphere.  But the service was friendly and efficient.  The $6.95 salad and garlic bread special with the order of a drink, $3 for Bud Lites and $4.50 for Blue Moon's, is a pretty good deal.  I had the Tuscan.  It wasn't the greatest salad ever but it was pretty good with lots of crispy fresh romaine and not too much dressing.  I wasn't really too full afterward but the garlic bread helped.  I would stop by again at one of their other restaurants when in the neighborhood.

30.description: I am extremely disappointed in the service.  I have been here countless times and have never received such bad service! !  It's a Sundayand there are only three tables in the entire restaurant, one table was only  drinking ,with two servers.  I set up a table for 7 because they couldn't do it for us.  They brought us the wrong order. We weren't asked once if we wanted refills on our drinks, or water. I had to look for the server because we needed condiments.  Katie S. did not come and check if our food order was OK, or if we needed anything else.  I had to look for whenever I needed something.  Extremely inattentive!!

46.description: This place is a great neighborhood pizza and beer stop. (Their pizza is awesome) their drinks aren't too over priced (which is good for the area) and their bartender Liz is awesome. I had mentioned to her that I was building a website for a non-profit I work with and she actually offered to take a look at it for me. Not only did she take a look at it but offered some really great insights as well. This place is well worth a visit :)

1.description: So this used to be my hangout spot when I lived close by, so it holds a soft place in my heart.That being said, the last couple of times I've been here have been a bit underwhelming. The garlic parm wings used to be tasty as heck, the last time I got them they were meh. I did have a grinder though, Italian, it was way good. I mean I usually come here for pizza, wings and beer but the last time I was there I wanted an sandwich and man did this deliver! Oh and they deliver! I typically don't like delivery though. I want to come to a place that I can sit at the bar, chat with the bar tender or other locals, watch some sports on the televisions, and enjoy a cold one. This is that place if that is what you are looking for. Decent food and a great environment.And man the beer specials are insane. With the new happy hour laws, they have reduced drinks from 3-6. Oh and on Saturday all beers on tap are only $3! They've got craft and mass beers on tap.The ice cream here is pretty good too. Check out the place. Stay for a bit. Have a beer.

55.description: "Yay! I'm a fan" is an accurate rating description. Been doing dine-in and delivery for 9 years.  Not much has changed in those years - and that's good.  For what it is, it does a great job. Pizza is delicious - my fav is the BBQ Chicken Pizza.   Delivery is always speedy. Nice little outdoor space. Im glad its in the neighborhood.

9.description: Really disappointing experience. The pizza is excellent. The service was absolutely terrible and the follow through was even worse. We ordered pizza for a birthday party and asked that they be delivered around 12:30. Now I know that ordering on a Friday during lunch means its busy and hard to nail down a time. BUT. The pizzas came at 11:40. When I complained I got a really SO WHAT attitude. Thanks. Cold Pizza. Soggy Pizza. Sitting around for 40minutes.

26.description: The pizza is yummy and the SERVICE WAS AWESOME!!! We sat at the bar and KATIE, our server was so fun & sincere. She's very relaxed yet prompt, which really made for an enjoyable experience for my girlfriends and myself! We will definitely come back and hopefully our new friend will be there! ;)

25.description: Eh, pizza sauce was pretty bland. Crust was ok. There's many other pizza places I'd rather go to. I probably won't go back. If you like great thin crust pizza, you may want to keep looking, because you're not going to find it here.

12.description: Delish pizza but overall overpriced. Lived in the area for 5 years and have eaten inside, and ordered delivery multiple times. The last time my pizza was very burned-almost inedible. I called and spoke with a manager who didn't seem to believe me or care. I offered to send photos, and they told me to go right ahead. I was assured my next order would be credited appropriately. Next order-they took a whopping $5 off my bill and didn't care about my last unpleasant experience-or the fact that I WAS a frequent customer/under the impression I would receive an apology/appropriate credit (for a pizza at least). Take care of your "regulars" or they will find other places that do, Chicago is one of the main pizza hubs in the world after all-plenty of options!

59.description: I like this place. I order take out from here often.The restaurant is bigger than I expected. Sit down table seating on the side and a bar with bar table seating.Prompt, friendly service. Appears they have specials (food & drink) throughout the week. Pizza is decent for a quick slice. Sandwiches are tasty. They have Pepsi products...yay.I will be back.Bike parking on the street.

21.description: I would give the food a solid 3.5 stars, and I still order frequently- but I never seem to get what I order. Seriously this place could screw up free lunch- I mean EVERY SINGLE TIME I order from here something is missing, not correct, or the pizza shows up kinda cold. They offer gluten free pasta options but the staff never know what half the menu or what gluten free really is. Multiple times I've ordered gluten free pasta I got regular- which is problematic. I still order from here because it's convenient, the pie is decent, and heck- I'm a gambling woman ;-)

17.description: I drove by D'Agostino's on my way back to work and decided to stop in and see what they had on the menu.  I'm so happy I did!!!  I ordered the Southwest BBQ Chicken salad (with hot chicken).  It was delicious!!!!  I'm super picky about salad dressing. The BBQ ranch dressing was YUMMY - perfect for the salad ingredients.  I will definitely be back!

10.description: I was here one day; just in the area, wanted to have a quick bite and sit outside. When my order was taken there was a total of 9 ppl in the restaurant. 5 were already done eating. I ordered a very simple chicken parm sandwich with sweet potato fries. Do u know it took 32 mins to get my food!!! Again the place was empty!! When I got the food it was awful and flavorless. THE fries were burnt the sandwich had no flavor. I'm never going back here again.

5.description: This was so bad that it made me angry ... angry that I wasted calories, stomach-space, time and money on a meal here when I only had a weekend in the Windy City. If you told me they were serving frozen pizza from the grocery store, I'd believe you. That's how bad it was. It even had that recently-but-not-completely thawed look to it. After writing this review, I'll have to go back to my review of Santullo's to add a second star. For my recent trip to Chicago, D'Agostino's literally redefined bad pizza!

3.description: Meh, I dont really like their pizza.  The deep crust is too doughy and flavorless.  The thin is good, but I prefer a good deep.Its overpriced and not delish.Meatballs tasted like frozen ballsOnion rings were chewy and super greasyI wont be ordering from here again.

35.description: Pizza is usually fantastic, but delivery is hit or miss and lately has sucked. Delivery dude can't even operate the door buzzer to get into the building, and this after taking 1 hour and 20 minutes to arrive?? Pizza was cold, refused the order and sent it back. I have loved Dag's for years, but lately the service is really bad...

19.description: Currently my go-to place for delivery (only b/c I'm outside of Piece's delivery zone). This place is great for thin crust square slices.  The crust holds up very well - not soggy at all. The Greek salad is also excellent and comes with a delicious dressing.

28.description: Used to live down the block from this place, pizza is awesome. Thin crust, sweet sauce, good price. Got a taste for thin crust pizza and your in the area

45.description: I am in Chicago visiting a friend and wanted to try Chicago pizza, in Chicago.....and we stumbled upon the right place! I live in Nashville, not exactly pizza capital but raised in New York, and I know the discrepancies between NY and Chicago pizza....all that aside, this is some of the best pizza I have ever tasted! Loved the sauce and fresh cheese, homemade sausage, really great little place. Friendly service, when I return to Chicago, I will visit again and tell other friends in the Chicago area.....job well done! I am now a believer in Chicago pizza, thanks to D'Agostino's :)

33.description: The food is overpriced considering what you get. We ordered the BBQ thin crust pizza and it looked like a $3 oven pizza you buy from a convenient store. Okay place for grabbing a beer after hopping off the CTA. I might give other menu items a try

43.description: I will think twice about ever coming back to this place.  I got carry out -- two sandwiches, a kids meal ("chicken tenders" with a side of fruit), and  three bottled drinks -- and the total came to over $30.  My biggest complaint, aside from value, was the quality of the kids meal. The "chicken tenders" we're processed chicken nuggets I could have gotten in the frozen section of the grocery.  They probably did.  The fruit was a joke...  The apple that was peeled and sliced sloppily (parts of the core still remained) was brown and rotten on the bottom third of the apple.  I could not believe that they would serve such poor quality food at that price.  I didn't have time to go back to the restaurant to let them know how disappointed I was; however, I doubt I will ever make time to patronize this place again.

2.description: I've had pizzas ordered form here for work meetings, and they are usually pretty good. I've ordered things personally from here, and gotten decent service and decent food. They have a large selection of gluten free options. I've never felt like anything was good enough to write home about.Today though? I am not returning, on principle.My guy and I are starved, hangry in fact. Why? We waited over an hour for our food, only for a guy to call us from a different location to tell us that we called and ordered at the wrong location and he needed our card number again. After my guy hung up, I said, "no, I know I told you the right number." We double checked and called back, yep. We did call the right one. The woman who took the order was slow and not a good listener. She got the address wrong, even after having repeated it multiple times. Instead of calling us back to make sure, she up and sent the order to another location, that's who called us. So obviously, the original location calls us back 10 minutes later and says, "Hi, can we have your order and credit card number please, since we had to void it we don't have it." I won't recap that convo, but she basically she apologized lazily, didn't offer us any compensation, and acted like it was just a small deal. So, we said, never mind. Because let me tell you, to hangry people in search of comfort food on a Sunday night, it's a HUGE deal.So ultimately, you mean to tell me that it would have taken us 2.5+ hours to get our food from a place that is 4 blocks away, and they want to run us in circles and THEN act like it's not really a big deal and is a small mistake??? No one is perfect, but they really could have handled this whole thing differently. Not amused. Starved. Not going back. Is it wrong to mention that all I've had since 1pm was coffee, and it's now 11:30pm and with a lot of food allergies, I literally have NOWHERE to get food from, it's late, I don't want to leave the house, and now the coffee has eaten a hole through my stomach. Great job D'Agostino's, you've managed to pi$$ me off, starve me, and give me an ulcer. That's great work right there.Now, on top of this, I should note:Do not expect high quality meats here. Do not get a gluten free burger, I think McDonald's patties are probably better quality. The gluten free bun was ok, the gluten free pizzas are good, but I haven't tried anything else out of fear. Now I really won't. I also wouldn't attempt to dine in at this location. It basically just has a bar.

18.description: I would give the food a solid 3.5 stars, and I still order frequently- but I never seem to get what I order. Seriously this place could screw up free lunch- I mean EVERY SINGLE TIME I order from here something is missing, not correct, or the pizza shows up kinda cold. They offer gluten free pasta options but the staff never know what half the menu or what gluten free really is. Multiple times I've ordered gluten free pasta I got regular- which is problematic. I still order from here because it's convenient, the pie is decent, and heck- I'm a gambling woman ;-)

41.description: So we stumbled upon this place after a race downtown, and I was a little scared because it only had 1 1-star review on Yelp.  For shame, Yelp, this place is awesome- how about showing it some love?It's a small hole-in-the-wall joint off Milwaukee and Ogden.  If you blink you'll miss it.  Fortunately my girlfriend is a regular here and was able to navigate us here.  If you're going north/east on Ogden, turn before Milwaukee and there's a small parking lot in back.Anyway, the food.  Good stuff awaits you here!  I had a grilled veggie wrap with mushrooms, zucchini, squash, and red peppers.  All rolled into a spinach tortilla and served with sweet potato fries.  Totally delish!  My girlfriend had the chopped salad which was huge and had a huge amount of good stuff in it.  I thought it was over-dressed a bit, so maybe order the dressing on the side.  Our friends had a steak sandwich and the buffalo chicken wrap.  Everyone said their food was awesome, so there were no misses.Service was super fast and friendy, and the waitress got the orders right.  I would definitely come back here for a pizza or anything else again sometime.  4 well-deserved stars.

52.description: Gross. Just ordered the margherita pizza and had to throw it out after 2 bites.  It was way OVERLY loaded with raw garlic. The must have used a soup ladel to load it on.  Literally disgusting, at one point we were actually chewing whole pieces of raw garlic. Nasty.

50.description: This is my usual Friday Lunch joint provided my boss isn't on a power trip.  While this place is known for it's specialty pizzas, I prefer their sandwiches, paninis, salads, and wraps.  I really like their Chicken Cordon Blue and Club grinders.  I also love their BBQ Cheddar Bacon Burger on days when I have a bigger appetite.  Any of the above topped off with a side of sweet potato fries and you will be leaving fat, full, and happy.  If you are fiending for pizza and don't order a specialty pie, skip the slices and grab some of their pizza bread.  You won't be sorry.  The staff is always great and if Janetta is around, you will know it as she will be checking up on and chatting with you.  If you have time for a beer definetly grab a Kentucky Bourbon and oh yeah...don't sleep on the Gorganzola Walnut Salad.  Try it with their Cilantro lime vinagrette.

4.description: Carl who delivered our pizzas just now was so nice! 5 delicious pizzas got delivered in the time quoted despite the snow!

6.description: Pizza by the slice was pretty solid.  The Italian Beef sandwich was great.  Service was quick.  Fries were hot.  Did not like aggressive panhandler that made four trips through the place during lunch.

22.description: Been ordering delivery or pickup sporadically  from this D'Agostino's for nearly 12 years.  The second star is only because their food is edible.The menu is huge with lots of options, which is appealing.  I've never come close to genuinely liking anything I've eaten from there, though.  I recently ordered their "Create Your Own Pasta".  They only offer Spaghetti and Mostaccioli.  Not a big deal.  Pasta is pasta, so far as I'm concerned.  I opted for the Mostaccioli with Alfredo Sauce, which is a $2 up-charge, bringing the meal (which includes a small soup or salad) to $10.25.  I received a container stuffed with Mostaccioli, with maybe a few tablespoons of watery, flavorless, most-definitely not homemade Alfredo Sauce on the bottom of the container.  To add insult to injury, it was dotted with giant pieces of cracked black pepper.  Very unpleasant and inappropriate. I understand this is not fine Italian dining, nor am I even opposed to using a good-quality, commercially manufactured Alfredo Sauce, but come on!  Be a little more generous with the sauce and season it and TASTE IT before serving it!  It's embarrassing!  So, $10.25 for a pound of noodles and an almost equally crappy tiny container of soup.  I was relatively pissed off to put it mildly.  The kitchen manager is a genius or a rip-off artist depending on how one chooses to look at it.  They must make a killer profit on these pasta dishes.Their appetizer menu, while containing many options of bar food, is comically overpriced.  With exception of garlic bread and fries and maybe a couple other small things, appetizers start at $7.95.  Onion Rings and Jalapeno Poppers... $7.95.  What?  We don't order pizza from D'Agostino's.  Several other better options in the area.  I do recall their sauce being too sweet, and the utilization of what seems to be cheaper part-skim mozzarella cheese.  The cheese is unpleasantly rubbery and flavorless rather than greasy and flavorful with a "normal" creamy texture.  I can say that their broasted chicken is quite good, but can be too salty.I've never eaten in their dining room so I'm not sure about that experience.  The phone order takers have always been pleasant.  I can't recommend D'Agostino's food whatsoever.  It's just pizza and bar food overpriced and poorly done.

15.description: I ordered the Tuscan salad with anchovies and really enjoyed it. My sister had the Mozzarella Basil Panini and it could have used a bit more basil. Our server Ceaser was very attentive. Not sure what their official dog on the patio policy is, but he kindly accommodated us and our two pooches. Ogden is busy with traffic and therefore it can get loud, but the patio was nicely shaded.

57.description: Echoing other reviewers... I like this place. Neighborhood bar/restaurant. Good, inexpensive food for delivery, eat-in, carry out. Love the thin crust pizza. Service is very good, and friendly. Favorite place of many locals to hang out and grab a bite to eat.

20.description: Ordered delivery and gave them the benefit of the doubt due to bad weather, but they just simply never showed up and then it was past midnight and they were closed, but they definitely made sure to charge my account.

36.description: D'ag's is just fine. It's a decent New York Style thin crust, sweet sauce, nice and greasy. A slice of cheese and a can of coke will cost you $4 at lunchtime, one of the best lunch deals in the neighborhood.Is it the best pizza in town? Nope. But it's cheap, consistently good, and the service is always really friendly and awesome. They have a rewards card too, so your 10th slice is free. Tip: don't get the cannoli, it's stale.

14.description: Eh, pizza sauce was pretty bland. Crust was ok. There's many other pizza places I'd rather go to. I probably won't go back. If you like great thin crust pizza, you may want to keep looking, because you're not going to find it here.

3.description: What a great place to do stand up and hear up and coming comics.A place where you and your friends can hang out with laughter that is good for the soul. Meet unknown and known comics because you never know who may stop through to tell a joke.Don't meet me there beat me there.

1.description: Checked out the "Ha Ha Hotties: All female comedians" show last night. $12 a ticket and the show was approx 90 minutes with about 6 or 7 comedians. In the description of the show it says "Other comedy clubs might have a good female comedian or two, and a few might even have a looker in the line up. Ha Ha Hotties, however, is the best of the best, the funniest of the hottie-est. There's nothing bomb about these bombshells." I disagree a bit with this statement, at least the latter portion of it. The ladies which started the lineup were... Take one; young lady from Texas, her overall show was just hard to watch.  Imagine, in your seat gritting your teeth, trying to hold a half ass smile so that it alerts the comedian to change topic or save herself! Bad to terrible, with a few minute giggles. I'm glad there was a gradual transition of comedy from bad to fucking hilarious. A few comics which stood out; Stars: Kellye Howard was the closer, her routine was a fucking riot. (I'd seen her at the Comedysportz, also a great show. IF you get a chance check her out or find her You-tube clips. Chicago comedian) Couple other memorables which closed out the night, they announced her as Curve magazine's 7th funniest Lesbian comic, Tamale is her name, sexy and funny. Bailey Bing, Chinese American comedian that tackles comedy with that dry slow sarcasm that asks if your really paying attention. The in betweens were take it or leave it. If your friends caught some advertisements and are thinking it's a show of sexy comedians in sexy gear...   it's not.  It's different, different styles of comics and a pretty good time. The place itself.. we were seated in a small theater in the basement. Seats are so close to each other an average sized person in a jacket will be uncomfortable between people. (Which reminds me of the urinals in the Men's room. Obviously someone funny spaced those things. They have these metal dividers nailed into a tile wall with just enough space that a petite girl would be able to manage using. I'm a fat man that needs space damn it!) The walk down stairs is cold! The bar downstairs was closed and there wasn't a waiter. Drinks, I got two 312's and a Coke which ran $14 dollars!! Shit!, if you like crappy Bud light you can get a bucket for about the same cost and are allowed to bring it into the theater.If you join their mailing list you can score a Bo-Go coupon good till March 2009. At the very end they do a random drawing to pass out tix to future shows.  Most people are unaware that there is a free parking lot across the adjacent street.

2.description: So good!!   The EDGE is  a great mix of first timers, and killers.  No pretension, no comedy snobs, just a great place to fulfill your dream of doing stand up, or getting over your fear of  being in front of a crowd.  Its also a great mix of races and genders so you get all types of funny points of view.  They also sell beer which is always a good idea no matter where you go.  I wish it were still open!

5.description: The Chicago Center for Performing Arts has some really great shows.  We have attended a few that have been outstanding.  It's something different and fun to do.  However, the BYE BYE George (Bush) show was HORRIBLE!!!! The host came out and tried using insults on every race and ethnicity to make us laugh.  He had absolutely no talent.  If you are going to do a show about George Bush or politics in general, try to get your facts straight or your better off telling jokes off a laffy taffy wrapper, buddy.  AND one of the comedians who was suppose to be the headliner was reading her jokes from a piece of paper....and to twist the knife, she kept loosing her place on the paper.   I felt like I was in someone's basement in high school.The funniest part of the whole evening was when a young lady in the audience loudly proclaimed that she will never get those two hours of her life back.Save your

6.description: The shows on Friday and Saturday nights have recently been moved from 1030pm to 900pm. Thankyou!

7.description: The Edge is a great place for comedy!  The theme shows really keep the material fresh and audience members come knowing they will see new (and ORIGINAL) material.  My friends and I have had a great time ever since we began attending the shows last summer.  Highly recommended!!!

8.description: Went for the first time and after confusingly navigating to actually find the show we were pleasantly surprised.  Cheap tickets and acts that rival the insanely expensive Zanies.  Cheap bar, good comics, people should check it out.

0.description: The club is called "EDGE COMEDY CLUB" - if you don't like comedy go see Blue Man Group. Edge puts up the best comedians in Chicago. Good times. I'm glad we have a place that puts up regular stand up showcases.

4.description: I like open mic nights probably more than regular nights with a handful of "pro" comics. Maybe it's because I love variety, or I love watching people bomb. I've been to the Open Mic night when there have been 20-25 comics who show up. It's like a machine-gun of short sets, some funny, some abysmal... but always entertaining. A lot of people who do Lincoln Lodge, or Zany's or Fizz on Wednesdays come to CCPA to test out new jokes, which to me is more interesting than watching a polished routine.I've been to a few of the other shows... the last one was downstairs in this cool little theatre... that must be the cabaret... it's a great set-up with enough space for a good crowd, but still close enough to the comedian. Dave welcomes a lot of new talent in this town and does a good job of lining up themed shows, which is more than I could say for a few other bookers in town. Overall.. big-ups. I haven't been to ALL the clubs in town to compare, but I'm always guaranteed a good time when I go.

address: Chicago Center For the Performing Arts

3.description: Always come In and get my coffee med cream and Carmel sweetener love it!! I have sat inside twice with my son he has a chocolate cake donut , and I have coffee .

1.description: Guys, there comes a time in every coffee drinkers (or just any customer of anything ever) life where they have to set a standard. I've been coming to this DD, for the last few months, as its on my way to work. During that time, my non-complicated coffee order has been wrong like 35% of the time. Somewhere between the cashier and the barista, a word or 2 is lost in the 100% aribican nether. When your coffee can honestly set the tone for the day, a botched order 1 out of 3 times can have an impact on your well being. Might be time to hit big shoulders across the street...2 stars cuz its cheap and the muffins are solid and they've hooked me up with free bananas before.

2.description: Oh Dunkin Donuts... this location is pretty bad but I'll be honest, I'm going to keep coming back because it's close and convenient.  I usually order a bagel and an iced coffee and every single time they ask me "would you like the cream cheese on the side or on the bagel?"  and every single time I say, "on the bagel, please."  And (no exaggeration) 75% of the time they just throw the container in bag and give it to me.Why even ask the question?????? Life is hard when your cream cheese is on the side.  Welp, see you tomorrow DD!

5.description: What's not to love? Glazed donut and an iced latte for under $5 - delicious and consistent.

0.description: DUNK IN THE HOOD!I am kind of hooked on there iced coffee right now, so this new location opening up in my neighborhood is a sight for sore eyes.  I order the iced coffee with no sugar and just a touch of cream and it tastes fantastic. Typically iced coffee can be icky without a bucket of sugar. I am really impressed at how good it is by itself.This location has been open for a few weeks now but it is not even on the Dunkin Donuts website nor did it even exist on Yelp. I finally decided to add it because if no one knows it is here then who is going to come here. Plus someone might have a donut emergency and this is the perfect location to cure it.I must say that this is one of the more comfy Dunkin Donuts I have ever seen.  There are four nice leather chairs around a small table.  A great place for a group to hang out and talk. There is one booth in here and also a bunch of stools that are facing the windows. The one thing that I love is that this location had the foresight to add in power outlets and they are all high near the tables.  So this is great if you are looking to plug in your smart phone or laptop. There is also free wifi here too. Bonus! Dunkin Donuts is really doing it right to keep up with the times.So welcome to the neighborhood!  I am sure that Big Shoulders Coffee, across the street, is not happy to see you but honestly I do not need a coffee with a timer...it really scares me! I am also sure the Gelato shop is not happy with your BR ice cream either. Don't worry about them because I am happy you are here.  Just keep serving your delicious iced coffee and I will be a regular. I might have to sneak in a French Cruller every once in a while...that is my favorite donut here.

4.description: I was actually told by the disrespectful manager of this Dunkin Donuts location to not come back. I don't plan on returning to this Dunkin Donuts, or any Dunkin Donuts location for that matter, after one of their employees CHEATED ME OUT OF MONEY! Back in July 2015, I visited this location and ordered a 99 cents ice coffee. I gave the cashier Maria a $20 bill and I remember doing so because that was the only bill in my wallet and I needed change. Instead of putting my $20 in the cash tray, she slipped it under the tray and gave me about $3 back in change. I told her that she gave me the wrong change, and she claims I only gave her a $5. I told her that was impossible because all I had was a 20. I asked to speak to the manager, and the manager showed me the video footage of the register, which was basically useless. I left the store discouraged and defeated, but returned with my mother, who offered to help me calmly mediate the situation, as I was very upset after being cheated out of my money. My mother was only trying to help, and they were extremely rude to her. The manager told literally told my mother "We don't want your money, and you don't have to come back here!" I contacted that store's franchise owner, who was extremely rude and helpful. He hung up on me and refused to answer any more of my calls. I contacted Dunkin Donuts corporate, and they were extremely unhelpful and completely dismissed the matter. So I decided to take that rude manager's advice, and I have not been back to that Dunkin Donuts, or any Dunkin Donuts since that nightmarish incident occurred. Long story short, if you don't want to deal with rude and incompetent employees who text on their phone while taking your orders, cheat you out of money, make mistakes that cost you money, always has dry and hard donuts, and ALWAYS burns all your food, I would not recommend Dunkin Donuts, especially this Dunkin Donuts.

3.description: Honestly as good as it gets Staff:Staff is super helpful and caters to all customers - beginner to advanced users everyone is welcomeFacility: You can tell these guys put a lot of effort into making this a nice relaxing place open to all. I suggest you skip the coffee shop and bring your laptop here if you need to get work done - they have ample seating , free wifi and even a pool table free for everyone to use. Bathrooms were clean.Product line:They carry all major juice brands as well as a couple local juice producers lines. They have everything from basic setups to really advanced regulated mods. OverallI have nothing bad to say, I really enjoy going here since they have opened. I live near this shop and am glad to have them in my neighborhood.

1.description: Stopped in for the first time today to reup on Juul pods (addicting) and was very impressed with the look of the shop. Very friendly people and good vibes. Recommended.

2.description: Awesome place and great service! Wide open area and a great selection of starter, mid range, and high end Vape gear. The owner Jason has a great mind for the business and his service is some of the best in the industry. Plus this makes you feel like you're at any Vape312 store, so you know it's all quality products and services.

0.description: Hands down the BEST Vape Shop I've been to. Location is super accessible. I've visited more than a handful of times and I always find free and close parking! The shop has tons of space inside. You'll never be without a seat or table. They have nice large high top tables with stools if you want to get some work done (FREE WIFI) or they have a huge comfy couch if you just want to kick it. They also have a pool table that anyone and everyone can use for FREE! Staff is super welcoming. They definitely care more about the customer than they do the sale! They give their honest opinions and share their knowledge based off of your personal needs. They go above and beyond to help get you the juice/build/product/set up you need! Also, Bring Your Own Booze!!! Need I say more? Overall this place, and the owners, have really out done themselves! Amazing location, excellent customer service and super chill ambiance!

4.description: Great shop!! Awesome deals on eliquid and vaporizers. They have a great selection of beginner devices all the way up to highend mods. They have a huge eliquid bar, plenty of tables, comfy couches, and a free to use pool table. The owners and workers are very knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely a one stop shop for all your vaping needs.

3.description: This place is horrible. The hours are clearly posted on the door and it says walk ins welcome, but 3 out of 4 times I have walked in for pedi and a brow wax they quickly shoo me out saying they are closed. The pedicures aren't great but I was looking for a convenient local spot. This is NOT it.

1.description: Despite the hours posted on the door not matching the ones on their website, I arrived with the neon sign "OPEN" clearly lit up, and it says "Walk-Ins Welcome", I was turned away saying that they're closed. I don't recommend, and will not be coming back.Get it together.

2.description: Ladies beware this is a "massage" parlor. Gentlemen if you wish to help support the horrible trafficking business, stop by.

5.description: Had a pedi done here, didn't have an appointment and I was seated right away.  It was fairly hot in there and it would have been nice if the massage chair had been working and there had been magazines to read.  Can't complain too much though as my toe nails came out very nice and I thought the girl did a great job.

6.description: They do not do gel nails. I called ahead for an appointment told them I was coming for a gel fill, and a pedicure. I arrived to be turned away because they do not do this service. Also, when I called, they answered the phone with no indication I was calling a business. Just "hello". Very shady.

7.description: Horrible experience. My nails were so streaky and bubbly! I picked a nude color for my nails and it was streaky. When she offered to re-do them, she insisted that I pick a dark color, as they aren't streaky...will never go back!  She kept telling me that they did not have time to fix my nails as there were customers waiting for massages.

0.description: I AM SEEING PURPLEI hope you like this color! The spa is called Lavender and I can see why! All of the walls in here are a shade of purple. I noticed a few weeks ago that this nail place had opened up in our neighborhood and pointed it out to my wife.It was raining really hard this past Wednesday and we were taking our little one to get her nails done.  When we drove by the location at 4pm, it was really dark inside but the sign was blinking, "OPEN".  My wife said, "They look closed , so let's go some place else!" I said, "Let me go around the block and pull in front!"  We pulled up and noticed a nice lady standing in the window. We asked her if she was open and she invited us in. There is also a loading zone in the front, so parking was very easy.My little one had a fun time too. And guess what? I dressed her up in a purple outfit that morning. So weird! It looked like we planned it.  The price was also great too. It was only $10 to get her nails done. So if you are looking for a new place to get your nails done, then give this place a try. I loved the fact that there was no waiting but I am sure that the buckets of rain falling from the sky had something to do with this.

4.description: I'm not one of those guys who frequents the nail salons, but after being pressured for quite a while by the gf due to some perceived notion of the condition of my toe nails and feet in general, I finally caved in, like a lid!Since this place is a stone's throwaway from where my gf lives, I thought I'll give it a shot and walked right in without an appointment. Luckily for me showing up on a Sat morning didn't mean that I was going to be juxtapositioned between a bunch of yakking ladies, rather it seemed nice and quiet for a noob like me and I was eased into a corner massage chair in the line of sight of a TV and even handed a remote, and I thought to myself "so far so good!". The girl who was attending seemed to sense the fact that I was like a Fresh-off-the-boat and wore a smile that seemed to convey that she understood, but once she asked "Have you had a pedicure before?", there were no lingering doubts about her intuition.Soon enough I had my feet soaked up in the whirly pool, and shortly thereafter they were being put to the test. I went through all sorts of weird and ticklish sensations (realized just how sensitive and raw my feet are) and as much as I tried to make no bones of it, it was evident and written all over my face I guess.
