I don't know how someone is expected to thrift in the dark, but the section with the clothing has NO lighting, making it hard to see what you're looking at. Plus, most of the clothes seem a bit over priced. Also, they had music playing from somewhere in the corner. I couldn't hear it very well, so it was more of annoyance than anything.Honestly, I would recommend going here once - to see how interesting the building is, then never going back.

11.description: I was amazed at how organized and clean this location was compared to a few other stores.  I was torn between 3 & 4 stars because of the furniture pricing (as others have mentioned) but the employees really bumped it up to 4.  The ladies working the 2nd floor were incredibly sweet and nice.The clothing was not as good as the SA on Clybourn, but I did find a banana republic sweater I remember eyeing in the stores last year for $3... yahoo!  We had so much fun going through the 2nd floor "antiques" and lower level doo-dads... I'll probably swing through when we drop of donations every few months.

3.description: This place is ok to check out every once in a while, but don't get your hopes up too much. The clothes section on the 2nd floor are very dimly lit and dusty. A lot of the things are also really really worn, so the "finding an almost new name brand piece" day dream will stay a day dream. The main floor is mostly furniture and household decor. They do have some quality stuff, but also at quality prices. Sofas and desks are at least $200. I also saw them selling 5 place settings of china at $20 - $30, and many cup and saucer sets at $10.50. C'mon, at these prices I could have gotten brand new china on sale. The basement, or the bric-a-brac floor, is where I usually spend the most of my time since I collect china. Even though they mark up a lot of their stuff, the person setting the prices is definitely not an expert and usually marks up nice looking at first glance but in fact mediocre to poor quality items, especially they are sets. With a lot of digging you can still find some hidden gems. I was able to walk off with 2 Royal Worcester bone china plates at $1ish each the first time and 2 Royal Doulton bone china tea cups at $1.56 the second time. I also found an extremely rare Tuscan Naples saucer for about $2. On a pure economical standpoint I'm not sure if they were really worth the time, but since I think of it as "a treasure-hunting pass time" I still enjoy it.  Service is also not very friendly and the cash register can be left unattended for long periods of time. I mean I know I shouldn't expect much from a thrift store, but the nearby Goodwill people are much nicer.

0.description: One of the largest Salvation Army's I've ever been to. In all my Salvation Army reviews I say how I don't like to support them due to their anti LGBTQ ideals. But honestly I'm a poor college student, and also a brand-named maniac. I love finding/wearing brand names for cheap so that's why I keep shopping here. The men's section is a totally secluded area on the second floor. Last time I was here everything was half off and I have to tell you about my finds.Topshop Men's Cardigan - $2 (Retail at around $60-80)Banana Republic Tee-Shirt - $1 (Super soft retails at around $30)Arizona Co. Tee-Shirt - 50cents (Nothing special probably retails for $10)These were unbelievable finds for around $4 including tax! I don't know why people don't thrift shop because I can replace my entire wardrobe for less than the price of a new jacket.My only complaint about this store is it's really hot and humid on the inside, I assume because they don't have central air or maybe it's broken. Customer service is awesome though, and the workers are very friendly.If you want to find great name brands for less, shop at this Salvation Army.

20.description: Seems like the only times folks wander into this place en masse is during Halloween in search of that perfect hideous prom dress to recreate your Carrie moment. But there is so. So. So. SO much more worth checking out. The basement alone is like, so full of ridiculousness you don't even know. A big rack of vinyl containing obscure classics such as "Sing Along With Mitch!" and "Sing Along With Mitch: Even More!", for example. Atari games, 8-track tapes, old computers, old typewriters, ice skates, golf clubs, china. The mind boggles. The ground floor is all furniture, rugs, old kitchen stuff, chairs, couches, etc. and while some deals are pretty good, some of the pricing seemed a little steep for what (and where) they were.Second floor is where the magic happens. Clothes, clothes and more clothes. Leather jackets, fur coats for $100, shoes, handbags, etc of all shapes and sizes. The back room is full of glassware, obscure bar items and old tools, and today folks I scored the best score ever: a 15" "gold" bottle full of whisky (tax seal still in place) shaped like Elvis which has a music box base that plays "My Way". No I am not making that up - who could?

19.description: 2nd floor in the back is where all the old bridesmaids and prom dresses go to become funky costumes. It used to be cool stuff from the 50's & 60's now it's the 80's and 90's ... time marcheth on. They have an "antique store" on the same level. It has gotten overly inflated on prices but you can still trap a catch in there. Some prices are a joke - but there are deals to be had... retailers dump inventory so you can find new things too. I usually find better regular clothing at the S.A. on Clybourn.

2.description: This is an awesome Salvation Army.Compared to other thrift stores, it's good. Compared to other Salvation Armies, it's awesome. This is one of the largest and most filtered salvation armies. By that I mean the store sorts through tons of junk to find things that are actually decent and purchasable. I have purchased everything from kitchen plates/silverware to clothing and a coffee table. The goods they select to sell in this store are decent and I will return here when I need cheap furniture or thrift clothing

18.description: This place has racist employees, who scrutinize and treat minorities differently. Check out the posts for the same location on the other Yelp group. My wife and I won't be going back.

13.description: Ridiculous overpriced indeed! I was thinking it was me! But yeah they want millions for their crappy old furniture! Come on  greedy bast@&" ! You got it for free! The reasonable thing to do is market afortable!You suck!! Salvation army! We r in a recesion !! Helloooo!!

4.description: The lack of air conditioning and lighting made my time here short and unpleasant. I have a love of all things resale and have picked my way through many Salvation Army's. I like this one the least. The prices were decent and there is a lot to look through- if you can see it. Truthfully, I was so hot I just kept looking for fans to stand in front of instead of any hidden treasures (and with the lack of decent lighting, they were truly hidden). I would go back in cooler months and bring a flashlight.

6.description: I seriously love this pace. There is ALL kinds of stuff here and you can pick up literally anything. Like I wish I would have frequented this place while I was in school, cheap school supplies. Full set of *old* golf clubs? Not a problem. Lamps? Computer accessories? Cables for electronics? Check, check, check. Not to mention all the clothes you can pick up here. I recently got a job back in the white collar world and after wearing scrubs for the last 3 years I was short on, ahem, white collars. Picked up a plethora of clothing and restocked my wardrobe for minimal amount. I even picked up some belts for the cheap and honestly I think I finally have more than two colors. It is also a great place to dump off a bunch of things you don't need. My fiancé and I recently moved back to Chicago from out of state and dropped off a bunch of things we no longer needed/used in Missouri. If you do this, don't forget to get a recipe because its a TAX WRITE OFF! Yeah!So go there, get some new stuff, drop off some old stuff. They even take credit cards.

15.description: This store is 3 levels - basement, main level (entry level), and 2nd floor.The main level is unfortunately NOT worth your time.  It's their furniture level - and they get some cool looking furniture, but it's always SO overpriced.  I mean, 2nd hand store pricing should not be ridiculous in my book.  However, both the basement and 2nd floor ARE worth your time.  Basement is "Bric-a-brack" - and has tons of fun glassware, games, random art, etc.  The 2nd floor is chock full of clothes - and the clothes prices are totally reasonable.  You have to spend some time (since there are a ton of clothes) - but you can find some great stuff.  Things to note:  there is no dressing room, so it's a try-it-on-over-your-clothes kind of deal.  Also, they make you check your purse when you come in... so I just usually leave mine locked in my car and just come in with my wallet and keys.

7.description: this location is so so. I love a good deal, so thrift shopping for me is so fun. This location has three floors. It is messy, even for a thrift store, but does have some nice things here. The furniture is a no-go though. Some of it is nice, but EVERYTHING is over priced. Negotiating is worthless here too, the manager always says no. She'll just tell you how much it would cost in a regular store. If I wanted to pay the price of a regular store, I would have went to one. Plus they get the stuff for free... just saying. Honestly though, I like it though.

8.description: The prices are ridiculous, simply ridiculous.  I'm pretty sure there is something shady going on behind the scenes here and I really doubt this place is looking out for the mission of the Salvation Army.  Service was incredibly rude as well.

14.description: This is the most over priced thrift store I have ever been to. The prices are totally outrageous.  Its too bad since it is such a huge store.

58.description: I work for a charity in Chicago called Rock For Kids (rockforkids.org) which provides free year-round music lessons to children living under the poverty level.For years, April 7s has been one of the three main framers that we use every year to frame items in our Annual Rock & Roll Auction. Every year we have nearly 200 items signed by bands and other celebrities, and most of those items need framed.Martin and Julie at April 7s are so helpful and are creative geniuses. We basically drop off the items and 95% of the time ask them to just do something cool. However, when we have our own bright ideas they are very thoughtful and accommodating, offering us their advice. They never disappoint! Their hand cut mats are particularly spectacular. One year they created an amazing boom box frame for a signed Beastie Boys microphone, and another year they created a light box to backlight a Tom Waits poster.  People who come to our auction always want to know who frames our stuff!I love April 7s so much I've even had them frame a number of personal items for my apartment and for gifts.To see samples of the stunning framing that April 7s have done for Rock For Kids visit the following link:flickr.com/photos/rockfo…Thank you April 7s for all that you do for Rock For Kids!

56.description: I'm tickled pink by the quality and service at this small, locally-owned shop. Martin and his crew may not be the fastest game in town when it comes to framing, but I didn't mind the little bit of extra time the job took because they paid attention to all the little details. And they're just so gosh-darned nice! Definitely bringing all my custom stuff over here from now on.

29.description: I first found out about April 7s when I was interning and would go there to pick up framed prints for the person I was working for. Everyone was so nice, knowledgeable and helpful that when it came to framing some prints that i had purchased, it was a no brainer that I would go to April 7s. I had an idea of what I wanted, but I wasn't 100% sure. I worked with Evan and he helped me find exactly what I was looking for. I picked my frames up today, and they came out beautifully! I can't wait to hang them on my walls this weekend. I will definitely come back here again and suggest you come here too!

42.description: While searching for local framers, I figured I should write a review for April 7s seeing how they have framed two separate projects of my original work (this was back when they were on Chicago Ave). They did such an amazing job that their custom matting and framing not only enhanced, but added to and became a part of the finished piece.This time around I'm looking just to frame some posters and prints.  I highly suggest April 7s though if you ever need stellar customer service and a fun, but contemporary framing job.

23.description: I had three items recently framed here using a Yelp deal.  Friendly, knowledgeable, professional.... Also will suggest options based on your budget.  A wee bit expensive but then the quality of work is superb.

47.description: These guys have way more frame options in store than other places I've been to, and I had a great time picking out an awesome frame from the gentleman who helped me.Along the way, things happened and they lost the order slip, which is fine -- it's just that the slip says that I can't pick it up until the middle of May (even though I dropped in off some time in the end of March/beginning of April.  So props to their level of flexibility for letting me keep it there for that long).  However, I keep getting calls saying that my piece is ready to be picked up even though I leave them a voice mail every time they call saying that I'm a May pickup.  They don't seem to know about my messages and don't have email, so I'm dropping a star for the lack of information flow if you do have a problem but can't stop by the store.I'm sure the piece is lovely, though.  I'd just like for them to call me back telling me that they're received my voicemails.  I'm the bluegreen water and dock poster with a thick black textured frame.  I don't know what else to do but post this information here, honestly, hoping that they'll read it.

8.description: This store is amazing! They really walked me through the process and I am thrilled with the results. I had three things framed, each very different, and they are awesome. Each person was very patient and very professional. Cannot recommend this place enough!

31.description: They are so nice here. Really friendly and helpful, and as far as framing goes, not too pricey. They're also great at suggesting ways to bring the price down for a piece, (different frame, matting, etc). Definitely go here, it's a great small business.

34.description: This is the best place for framing in Chicago.  I stumbled upon their original location because the displays in the window were always so interesting.  So glad that I decided to go in.  I've being going to them for framing ever since and am enchanted by everything they've framed for me.  Owners are so dedicated to producing exceptional work.  I appreciate the care they've always taken with my pieces.  They have creative ideas to complete any piece of art and are extremely personable and professional.  Adorable pooches in the shop seal the deal.  Going in April 7s is always a great experience.  Selection of frames and mattes is extensive. If you care about what hangs on your walls, make sure you've had it framed by the pros at April 7s.

16.description: I'm probably jumping the gun on this review since I haven't gotten my frame yet. But I just love this place and these people. Sooooo nice and so polite! Not to mention, they have two dogs in the shop, which immediately won me over.I took my huge map in to get framed and the guy (I'm mad I can't think of his name) was super helpful and went to pick out a really sweet clean matte white frame to go with it. So minimalist. I love it.Be ready for an update when I get to pick it up!

13.description: When my daughter was born I bought an adorable picture frame that documented all her month bdays for the first year. I searched forever to find one that wasn't overly cheesy and found the perfect one on RedEnvelope. After 12 months I put Baby R's very last picture into my beloved frame...and was so excited to have a frame documenting her entire first year. A few days later it fell off the bookcase and shattered into a bunch of pieces. Ahhhh! My first thought was to reorder it from RedEnvelope and was devastated to see it had been discontinued. Apparently I was the only one buying it for myself and gifts.  I tried to find a similar frame, but couldn't find anything I liked nearly as much. And sooo I turned to Yelp to find a frame store to help me.I came across April 7s Custom Framing and took my shattered frame over to Marty. He was very sympathetic and promised to help me fix it.  I can't remember how much paid, but believed it was around $50...and said he would charge me the rest later (he thought it would be another $50-75, but said it would depend on if he had to build it again from scratch). And he said it would be ready in a few weeks. Three months later I was still waiting for the finished product and hadn't heard from April 7s because a voicemail after 3 weeks saying they'd need a bit more time.  I called Marty and asked what the deal was. He was extremely apologetic, promised to have it ready by that weekend and said he wouldn't charge me anymore than my initial payment.Marty was true to his word this time and did have it ready by the weekend. And when I picked it up I was excited to see that it looked even better than it initially looked. I'm pretty sure it would now withstand a fall off a bookcase, but then again I don't plan on trying it. And he also didn't charge me more than my initial payment even though he did end up having to completely rebuild it.Three months of waiting for something would usually result in a negative Yelp review, but Marty was such a pleasure to deal with that I actually still had a good experience. And I would actually even consider going back to him for other framing needs...he assured me that regular projects typically go much faster.

11.description: Great people who create a wonderful experience. If you like your art to be taken care of with the best service and solutions then this is the place to go.

39.description: My Dad sent me a print he got for participating in ChicagoFest VI at Soldier Field (1985 I think?).  It was wrapped in torn cellophane and glued to a Styrofoam "frame".  Quite frankly, I'm surprised it last 25 years!April 7s not only salvaged the print but they provided me with suggestions for matting and framing since I went in without a clue.  Looking at it now, no one could guess it has been sitting in a storage locker for the past quarter century.  While it's only a "poster", they treated it like a piece of art and understood the the sentimental value of what I brought them.  Great people, great service, and great product.

37.description: Love Marty! They do mounting as well. Super great job. Very professional and courteous. GO HERE!

0.description: The guys at April 7s are fantastic.  Truly, truly fantastic.  I bgouth five diplomas in to April 7s to be framed.  Two different guys helped me and my husband choose frames, mats, and glass for the diplomas.  They were well priced and they got the diplomas framed quickly.  They even found a program from my swearing in ceremony in the envelope with my law license and put a little pocket on the back of the frame to keep the program with it--free of charge.  It was so thoughtful and such a nice touch.  Fantastic local business that will really take care of you and anything you need framed.

38.description: Really these guys deserve 10 stars!  They are artists.  I took four pieces of art I had painted to their store a few weeks ago.  I wanted to get the pieces framed to gift them for Christmas.  Not only was Julie patient, she was conscious of the message of each piece and careful to think about the recipients character and style when matting/framing.  The art looks even more beautiful after April 7s work.  I will definitely return, and I recommend that you support this independent framing store.  By the way, artists get a discount.  Plus they're dog lovers!!!!

51.description: Simply the coolest ideas, the best execution and the nicest people in one store. Period. If you need some thing framed w/ amazing results for your hip pad....this is the place. Look no more.

27.description: Love. This. Place.Super helpful people, lovely recycled frames, and just really a pleasure to deal with.  I cannot say enough good things about them.

32.description: They have become our "go to" framers in Chicago. They always seem to be able to pick the right frame for the job. They really care about their work and community.

54.description: I don't bandy about this many stars lightly, but the folks at April 7s are simply the best at what they do. The first thing I ever asked them to frame was a 2ft by 10ft original work of art on a roll of butcher paper. It was, and remains, my most prized piece. I waltzed in, showed it to Martin. He unrolled it and laid it out with the care of a museum curator and we spent the next hour and a half talking through a good technique for framing this monster. It took a while to get this job done because of all the custom work required, but Martin made good and delivered beautiful work. I've gone back several times since. Martin approaches his work as the art form it is. Combine the quality work with their great customer service, charitable contributions and the perpetual art gallery that is their workspace, and you have the total package. In sum, April 7s is not the cheapest option for framing (you can pick up DIY frames from Target). April 7s is not the fastest option for framing (you can't rush this level of care and craftsmanship). April 7s is the best option for framing.

48.description: Based on previous stellar reviews, I had April 7s frame a 20x30" photograph of mine for a gallery show. I am very glad I did! Relaxed environment (two in-shop doggies!). Great selection. The owners & staff are engaging and happy to gently guide you toward the right choice for the work you bring in. Martin, who helped me initially, was very patient, as he watched me choose between two similar frames for quite a while. They also offered to stay after closing for me to come in.  I will be coming back to April7s for my future framing needs!

44.description: Great place.  I entrusted them with a print containing unusually dark and delicate black ink (that the artist warned could scratch EASILY).  They guided me through frame and mat choices and then went to work.  I couldn't be happier with the final results and am grateful that the piece is now properly protected and beautiful to view behind a pane of museum glass (more pricey but it reduces reflection which was key for this piece).  Their work alone is enough to get excited about but they are also real cool people.  I would recommend them to anyone.

24.description: We worked with Martin and got amazing service. He picked out several frames for us after hearing what we were looking for. He also gave us a variety of options with those frames to find the best price for us.This is the first frame store I've been to, but after visiting, we will not go anywhere else. It's great to be able to support local businesses and also get great customer service.

7.description: Thanks to all the great reviews I stopped at Aprils after breaking a painting on the way home from an art show.  Amazing customer service.  Fixed the painting in an hour!  I'll be back - a customer for life. Friendly service and great pricing. You won't be disappointed.

49.description: I picked these guys for custom framing because their reviews on here were AMAZING! They lived up to their reputation, and then some! I had a somewhat complicated triptych I wanted done, but with slightly different dimensions. I also came in with vague ideas of the types of frames I would like. The staff there looked at my art and each gave their opinions about what frames would look best and they were SOOO nice. My order was done exactly when they promised and it looked ten times better than I pictured. I will ALWAYS choose them in a heartbeat! Highest rating possible and well worth the cost!!!

40.description: I'm probably jumping the gun on this review since I haven't gotten my frame yet. But I just love this place and these people. Sooooo nice and so polite! Not to mention, they have two dogs in the shop, which immediately won me over.I took my huge map in to get framed and the guy (I'm mad I can't think of his name) was super helpful and went to pick out a really sweet clean matte white frame to go with it. So minimalist. I love it.Be ready for an update when I get to pick it up!

53.description: What a wonderful framing store.  I popped in today, a week before Christmas, with a print I wanted to get framed for my boyfriend.  I was greeted by two charming and friendly dogs, and a very nice young man with great smiling eyes.  He helped me pick out a perfect frame for the 14" by 24" art print I wanted framed, and worked with me to pick out the most economical but still very nice frame and glass for the print. The entire time he never pressured me to pick something more expensive, and he bent over backwards to help me choose the right frame to get completed within 24 hours. I paid on the spot and went home, thinking I'd just go back tomorrow to pick it up.I got a call 3 hours later that my framing was done!  The week before Christmas and April 7's was able to custom frame my print within HOURS?!  Outstanding.  Its gorgeous - sturdy, handsome, with a nice quality back papering and a copper hanging wire. I am so happy with how it came out, it was a shame to cover it up with wrapping paper - I want to hang it on the wall right now.I cannot thank April 7's enough and I will be back so soon with more things I need framed.  Support this local small business!

30.description: I have had several pieces framed here for myself and clients. I also recently purchased framed art they had hanging on their walls.This is the most amazing place to have framing done, pet a puppy and/or buy art work. I made a mistake with framing once and they were amazing about fixing it. Martin is amazing and helpful. I have been to framing shops from Michaels to gallery framing and April 7s is the best service and the best price.

46.description: I knew of April 7s because they were the home of my bird wall hangings that my husband bought me for Christmas the year before. We made mental note of their framing capabilities for future framing needs.For my birthday this year, I got my very first real pieces of artwork. Of course, I wasn't going to trust these pieces with any Average Joe Framer. No way. April 7s it was. The owners and their employees are friendly, kind, and full of good tips. They were helpful in figuring out colors of frames and what would best accentuate the artwork contained therein. The finished project was beautiful. It was exactly what I had ordered and made my beautiful screen prints even more lovely.Pricing is typical of what you pay for quality framing. You might not have the coupons from the big chain stores, but you will get customized frames at a competitive rate.We have since been back for a matting here and a frame there. It is really nice to patronize a local shop that gives you attentive customer service and has excellent advice. Gotta love the pups in the shop as well.April 7s is now my go-to for framers. (I feel like such an adult in that I need a go-to framer).

1.description: Hard to remember name.  But really nice work.  And I guess since it's the work and service that you pay for, I'll try to do better to remember the name.  But I can't make any promises!I had 4 pieces that needed to be matted and framed and were going to be hung in my office.  The tricky part?  They were all different sized vintage posters with different colors and highlights and yet needed to all look like they were a part of a set.Well these guys were great!  They started by pulling frames and mats off the walls and just about the time we think we've landed on something, my friend shows up and starts pulling even more options off the walls.  Good thing there wasn't anyone else in the shop or customers would have been shopping on my table!  Ha!After looking at many combinations, I picked what I thought worked the best and left the shop knowing I was going to love the work!  And when it was delivered a few weeks later, it was even better than I could have anticipated.The prices are in keeping with what you might expect to pay at any higher end frame shop.  Parking is a bit of a challenge here so know before you go if you are picking up a piece, they have a back entrance which makes it easy for them to put things in your car.  Otherwise you might get lucky and grab some street parking out front.Also know that the front door may be locked during open hours.  Seems like some people who really aren't interested in framing wander in from time to time so they lock the door, so be sure to ring the bell or knock and they will let you in very quickly.April 7's really did a nice job on my prints.  But then with all the great reviews here on Yelp. I expected nothing else.  Now, if only I could remember the name!

55.description: My husband and I just took our favorite wedding photos to April 7s and were very happy with our experience. The owners are very friendly and helpful and are great at listening to what you want and helping you get exactly that or better- they suggested some things we would not have thought of for the framing style and arrangement and we loved their ideas. We are very confident that when the framed pictures are ready to go and on our wall, we will be very happy we ended up using April 7s.

9.description: This is the second time I have been here. This time, worked with Martin's wife, her name escapes me. Brought in 4 pieces. Ended up doing 3 pieces due to budget constraints.  Was looking for something imaginative to make the pieces stand out for the new office I was decorating. Was shown several options that would compliment the frame and give me the look I was looking for. Prices are pretty much on par with other frame shops. Michaels charges just about the same if you use their 'custom frames' or custom framing services. Difference, in my opinion, is the artistic talent they share with you to help you design the frame and come up with ideas. If you have pictures that just need a standard frame, you would probably save money going elsewhere like target. Great place to go if you are looking for quality framing work done, to be creative with your frame, and/or want the frame to really showcase the art.

26.description: Wonderful place, they will spend plenty of time with you selecting the perfect frame - a task that usually takes me forever. And they have a great selection. The only reason I witheld one star is that sometimes the turnaround isn't as instantaneous as I'd like. But you can't expect next day frame service from a place that is rightfully busy!

25.description: Great service and great selection of unique frames at a variety of price points.  Really helpful consultation to get my picture framed up just right. The shop itself is welcoming and eclectic with a bunch of neat artwork displayed all over the walls.

12.description: What do you mean it normally takes more than 24 hours to custom frame a picture?I'm sorry I forgot the guys name, but he could not have been more helpful. Knowing he had to turn it around quickly using stuff they have in the shop already, he spent a full hour with me digging up different options for mattes and frames. He gave great suggestions and assisted while I putzed around taking my time deciding which frame to use.  Could not have been a better customer service experience.I was tempted to give one less star just because the price seemed high, but you know what, I have no idea what custom framing costs. I think it costs more than I want it to cost. Maybe if I had framing done frequently, I might be wise to shop around for a good deal.  But since I have something framed about once every ten years or so, this was a pretty wise choice.

59.description: Had a couple of prints framed here and they did an amazing job.  they can make a 50 dollar print look like it's worth 5000 dollars.  The people that work here are super friendly and helpful with all your framing needs.

21.description: I've had a few pieces framed here and each time I'm impressed with how helpful and creative they are.The last time I brought in a very large piece to be framed. They were able to help me select the perfect frame and delivered and installed the picture when it was done, which was fantastic since there was no way I would have been able to fit it in my car. They even gave my chubby, over-friendly cat lots of love and attention when they were at my place hanging the picture on the brick wall. Great people and great work; I'm a loyal April 7's customer.

17.description: You get what you pay for. And here you pay for high-quality custom framing and get pleasantly surprised by the results. These guys were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about how best to preserve and present my items. Their excellent service was matched by the quality of the work they completed in a timely fashion. I would recommend April 7s to anyone with a valuable item they want beautifully displayed who is okay with paying for high-quality work from a local small business. And they have a friendly dog.

10.description: Very professional, courteous and knowledgeable. I bought three of their Yelp vouchers and have been very happy with all six items I've framed. Highly recommend!

5.description: These guys have helped my photo business my getting my clients the framing they needed in a timely manner.

3.description: Just the best, really. Very highly recommended!

35.description: First things first, the duo who run this shop have a great eye for what frame would work with your piece o' art.  I had a vintage 1960s Fernet Branca poster and they picked a very nice looking white gloss frame that looked great against the predominantly orange hues of the poster.Second, framing ain't cheap.  For real, every time I frame something I cry a little inside because of how much it costs.  And April 7s is no exception, but let me just say that the prices are fair and middle of the pack.  Data: my poster was 35 x 50.5, so pretty darn big, and I used UV plexi, and I needed to have the poster backed with mumbo jumbo for preservation purposes.  $279 for the frame, $162 for plexi, and $55 for preservation mumbo jumbo.  With tax, this was just short of $550.  Like I said, I almost cried.  But you gotta do what you gotta do (what's the alternative, thumb tacks?).Third, service was great here.  April 7s had stated that the job would take two weeks, but it actually took four weeks, which was not a big deal to me, but they knocked off $100 from the price, which was awesome.  Also, they delivered to my house at an odd time for no charge.In short: framing costs money, but you might as well have it look good and come from cool people.

19.description: Just as the other reviewers have said: Martin is incredibly knowledgeable and helpful in providing options. Work quality was fantastic! (you get what you pay for!)

28.description: I love April 7s. I've had Martin frame three different pieces for me. He is so lovely to work with and so calm and just NICE. He will really consult with you about what might be best for your piece and it's always fun to see the other works that he has up on the wall. I really love these guys and can't recommend them enough. Super nice people, huge selection of frames and mats, knowledgeable staff, and quality work. It doesn't get much better!!!

45.description: April 7s is nothing short of AMAZING!!!!  I had a wonderful experience with them, and I would recommend them and use them again for all of my framing needs.  They really take as much time as you need to assist you in selecting the perfect frame.  Their prices are reasonable for the very high quality of their work.  I had three pieces framed shortly before I was moving out of Chicago.  They made sure to have the pieces done on time and even offered to deliver to my home since I was so busy preparing for the move.  Look no further - you will not be disappointed!

33.description: When my daughter was born I bought an adorable picture frame that documented all her month bdays for the first year. I searched forever to find one that wasn't overly cheesy and found the perfect one on RedEnvelope. After 12 months I put Baby R's very last picture into my beloved frame...and was so excited to have a frame documenting her entire first year. A few days later it fell off the bookcase and shattered into a bunch of pieces. Ahhhh! My first thought was to reorder it from RedEnvelope and was devastated to see it had been discontinued. Apparently I was the only one buying it for myself and gifts.  I tried to find a similar frame, but couldn't find anything I liked nearly as much. And sooo I turned to Yelp to find a frame store to help me.I came across April 7s Custom Framing and took my shattered frame over to Marty. He was very sympathetic and promised to help me fix it.  I can't remember how much paid, but believed it was around $50...and said he would charge me the rest later (he thought it would be another $50-75, but said it would depend on if he had to build it again from scratch). And he said it would be ready in a few weeks. Three months later I was still waiting for the finished product and hadn't heard from April 7s because a voicemail after 3 weeks saying they'd need a bit more time.  I called Marty and asked what the deal was. He was extremely apologetic, promised to have it ready by that weekend and said he wouldn't charge me anymore than my initial payment.Marty was true to his word this time and did have it ready by the weekend. And when I picked it up I was excited to see that it looked even better than it initially looked. I'm pretty sure it would now withstand a fall off a bookcase, but then again I don't plan on trying it. And he also didn't charge me more than my initial payment even though he did end up having to completely rebuild it.Three months of waiting for something would usually result in a negative Yelp review, but Marty was such a pleasure to deal with that I actually still had a good experience. And I would actually even consider going back to him for other framing needs...he assured me that regular projects typically go much faster.

43.description: I nearly peed myself when I saw that they'd relocated so close to my apartment! I took my most favorite thing ever to be framed at their previous location. -- a huge print of this photo images.wisconsinhistory.… that I got for participating in a study. It had been rolled up in a tube for 3 or 4 years before I finally took it to be framed.It was a busy morning when I showed up, but they had cute dogs to keep my company, and a big frame selection to browse while I waited. I liked that even though a lot of people were waiting, I didn't feel rushed to make my choices. I described the decor of the room it was going into (erm, non-descript?) and a few weeks later I hung my beautifully framed historic photo print over the bar in my dining room. I thought the price was reasonable, I got good advice on my selections, and the owner is easy on the eyes, which really didn't hurt (is that inappropriate to mention?).I have 2 other pieces waiting for framing but they won't be waiting too long with the shop so much closer to home.

2.description: Great experience at April 7s Custom Framing! I had two old and fragile pictures that were family heirlooms - one charcoal drawing of relatives from generations past, one landscape in pastels. All kinds of problems with them - chipped and destroyed moulding, broken frames with loose nails and no structural integrity, dirty old glass that had absorbed the images, wires on the backs that I can't believe held them up for half a century in my grandparents' house, and plenty more.I took them to April 7s and Alex, a manager there, knew exactly what to do with them right away. He examined them closely and pointed out details that I hadn't even noticed before, and laid out clear plans to fix and refresh every issue they had. He also was able to give me a little more background about how they were made, which I found fascinating. Also, the price he quoted me was amazing - I almost couldn't believe it. Huge bargain.They were done in a couple short weeks, and when we went to pick them up I almost couldn't believe my eyes. Wow! First, the backs were all totally new and redone, and as secure and sturdy as I could hope for. Nice new wires and good hooks for the walls. The glass was new too, and good preservation quality with buffers to keep the panes away from the art. The landscape was brighter, more vivid than I'd ever seen it. The frames themselves were still the same material, but strengthened and reinforced, and all the cracks and fractures in the intricate woodwork and claywork were touched up, corrected, and painted to match. They look incredible on my walls.I'd highly recommend April 7s, great experience, great price, great product, great employees too. Thanks for making my family heirlooms last many more generations!

18.description: Amazing service and frames! Not cheap but you do get what you pay for. Very high quality! Now I can finally hang my artwork that was hidden away for years.

41.description: OH MY SWEET GHERKINS! So these guys are friends of friends and I had heard about their shop several years ago. The stack of things I intended to frame kept growing and I finally went in to see them. AMAZING. They are so helpful and nice. Martin and Julie took their time with me and went through all my pieces, picking out unique options for each. I picked them up today and they are AWESOME. I have to decide where to hang everything! THANKS APRIL 7s!

52.description: I need to have my certificate framed, searched Yelp, and went to April 7s. I had searched around Lincoln Park, Wicker Park and found that April 7s was simply the best. They did a great job on my framing my CPA certificate and it looks perfect.  I enjoyed working with the owners to implement my vision and deliver spot on.

50.description: Late last year I was looking to get an expensive Eric Clapton Crossroads Festival poster framed and I wanted to go to a new place. After researching Yelp I noticed that April 7s was not only close to me, but amongst the highest rated frame shops on the website.When I first arrived at the store, the door was locked. If this happens to you, it probably means that the staff are in back working. Just knock on the door and they'll get you. After being let in, they guy who worked there (I forget his name, sorry) came up with several different framing options. Although I came in with a specific idea, he showed me a few really cool frame designs that proved to be better than what I had come up with. Long story short, they did an excellent job putting a frame on my  poster that complemented it's color scheme. On top of that, the guy was unsure if a particular deal that they had been running on Yelp was still valid or not, so he just decided to give it to me. I wasn't even aware there was a Yelp related deal. The impression I got was that they not only really loved coming up with new and creative ways to frame artwork, but that the people at April 7s wanted to be good to their customers. I'll be going back.

4.description: After waiting over a decade to get a special artifact from our travels framed, we finally wandered into April 7s. We knew the item deserved special treatment, but didn't have a clear idea in mind. The staff member we worked with had an art background, and used it to give us some good direction. When our vision was bigger than our budget, he helped us find cost savings. We picked up the item late last week, and it was gorgeous. The piece was almost four feet long, and to make hanging it easy April 7s created a cardboard template, with drill holes. It was an extra bit of service we didn't expect, but made it easy to get this large piece up on the wall. We've definitely found our Chicago frame shop.

6.description: If there was one word to describe how you feel every time you walk out of here with your personalized picture it would have to be euphoric. I have been working with Martin for several years now. He has done everything from a sports photo, to a Thailand souvenir to a WWII keepsake. Every single time I wonder how he could possibly get better and he exceeds any expectations. He truly is a genius and it is so wonderful to have a partnership with someone that is not only talented as he is just a nice person. These items hang in your house and you would think they only mean something to you, but the pride, skill and time he puts into it shows how much those items mean to him, too!  Such a fantastic shop filled with wonderful people!  I cannot say thank you enough!

22.description: Best frame shop in Chicago hands down. I have had over 10 pieces custom framed here and have been nothing short of ecstatic with the turn out. Martin and company are wonderful at helping you to find the perfect combinations of designs to fit your work. They're very affordable and very efficient in getting your order done on time.

15.description: I am so happy with the work that April 7s had done for my custom framing project.  I had bought some artwork from Etsy that was unique and important to me-- We worked with Alex who was awesome and very flexible.  We had changed our idea a few times and he worked with us.  The price was a lot higher than I had expected, but his work was very much worth it.  I hated putting a time pressure on them, but they were able to complete this complicated project in a weeks time.  I hope to have these pieces forever! I will be back for our next project.

57.description: Ok, after the previous review, I had a lot more framing done.  My spouse and I have accumulated a lot of wall decoration, and not much in frames.  So we got some Ikea frames and went here to get matteing.  We had about 35 things that needed mattes.  I stopped by in mid-December.Martin said it would normally be about 2-3 weeks, but with the holidays, it would be a week longer.  It ended up being about 3 times that.  But this is a small operation, and the biggest job they had, probably.  Sometimes it was tough getting updates on the progress, but eventually we got everything back and it all looks amazing.  We even recommended my brother-in-law go here.

20.description: What do you mean it normally takes more than 24 hours to custom frame a picture?I'm sorry I forgot the guys name, but he could not have been more helpful. Knowing he had to turn it around quickly using stuff they have in the shop already, he spent a full hour with me digging up different options for mattes and frames. He gave great suggestions and assisted while I putzed around taking my time deciding which frame to use.  Could not have been a better customer service experience.I was tempted to give one less star just because the price seemed high, but you know what, I have no idea what custom framing costs. I think it costs more than I want it to cost. Maybe if I had framing done frequently, I might be wise to shop around for a good deal.  But since I have something framed about once every ten years or so, this was a pretty wise choice.

36.description: My husband has had many pieces framed at April 7's. I think it's been about 7 or 8, now, including a Banksy. They do an amazing job, every time! They also offer discounts if you have multiple things framed at the same time. I highly recommend using April 7's for any of your framing needs! They are friendly & really easy to work with.

14.description: We worked with Martin and got amazing service. He picked out several frames for us after hearing what we were looking for. He also gave us a variety of options with those frames to find the best price for us.This is the first frame store I've been to, but after visiting, we will not go anywhere else. It's great to be able to support local businesses and also get great customer service.

58.description: Sushi X is always delicious. I love that they have BYOB and half off rolls every month. I have never been disappointed with their food. However, about 50% of the time the service is unbearably slow, even when there's not a lot of people in the joint. The servers seem rushed and stressed most of the time. Several times we have had about an hour wait to get our food. Lately we have been ordering takeout rather than opting to stay in.Still - they have great sushi and half of the time the service is good! :)

56.description: Sushi x is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant in Chicago. I have tried a ton of different spots for sushi but this is my absolute favorite. Others barely come close to the food here. I have dined in and had delivery and both are always great. Great job sushi x! :)

29.description: We had been at "sushi X" multiple times, brought friends and referred the place. All feedbacks were positive. Casual, laid-back atmosphere, good service and the best sushi. You cannot get wrong, whatever you order. Excellent deal for lunch. It's called "lunch X box" for $10. Easy access and always street parking available.

42.description: Fun tasty rolls! But most of them have cilantro which I cant stand!!! I don't know if I didn't say clearly that i needed all of them without cilantro or our server didn't hear me (cause music is pretty loud) and didn't double check.... but 3 out of 4 rolls came out WITH cilantro. When we told her that all rolls are supposed to be with no cilantro she had a very bitchy attitude about it and she completely forgot to place an order for one more roll and told us that we didn't order it.... she had this attitude the whole time we stayed there and in the end she didn't even say "thank you, good night". She just dropped off our check and left. Seriously?? Sorry but we had to leave her just 12%... I think her name was Rachel... Overall I really enjoyed the food. Wish the service was better

23.description: I came here for lunch one day because I did not feel like waiting for the 66 bus after getting off the blue line. The outside is mysterious and if the name did not say "sushi x" I would have guessed it was some porn shop. The sushi was awesome. I tried salmon, octopus and tuna. They were decent sized too for rolls. The lunch special came with Perrier. I will come back for dinner sometime.

47.description: Food is good. Atmosphere and service not so much. Was there for lunch - both water glasses had lipstick still on them, the other glass that was brought out for another drink was cracked down the side. I dropped something and while picking it up saw the scariness of the floors - looked like it had not been swept or mopped in some time.  Drinks - they are bottled.  I was expecting a glass of fresh tea with honey and instead  got a bottle of tea that's primarily sweetened by cane sugar and was super disappointed.   I could have gotten the bottled crap at CVS across the street and it would have been cheaper.I really like the food but will probably only order take out from this point on.

8.description: Rolls are pretty solid, but nigiri is weak.  I like the oyster shooter. I would give 3.5 stars, but I can't so, it has to get 3 cuz it doesn't rise to 4 stars.  Been here plenty of times out of convenience.

31.description: This is by far the best sushi place in town! It never disappoints and has something for everyone, even for people who don't love sushi! They have a nice mix of raw and cooked foods which make it the perfect place to take friends. Plus, you can't go wrong with BYOB! The rolls are unique and delicious, definitely some out of the box flavors that are amazing! The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is very fun. It's a small place but worth the wait. It's a West Town staple!

34.description: Ordered to-go from here as a first timer a month ago because I live very close! I was hoping this would be a new go-to for sushi take out but I'm really hesitant to give it another try. Pros: some of the rolls were quite good. Cons: one of the rolls came with mango in, and on top of it. I know I would never order a roll with mango as I am very allergic, but thought I probably read the menu wrong or something. Mango wasn't listed on the menu but was put on the roll. Not really a fun surprise, when I called to let them know my order was not only incorrect, but that I was allergic to the ingredient they added, the employee on the phone asked what I wanted in return for the mistake. While I asked for a refund for the roll, I just thought it was a little insensitive due to the error being a food allergy issue...and now I had less food! The other thing that really irritated me was the portion of the tuna tartare. I am not sure if they give a smaller portion with to-go orders or if this is their norm, but it was SUCH a sad portion size for $14. It was tiny and there was NO tuna in comparison to all the accompaniments. Really a shame. Ordered a ROK bowl that also lacked flavor, maybe this is better in the restaurant? Not a good experience in general and for that, it makes it difficult to try out again, especially for around $15 a roll.

16.description: From the outside, it looks like a night club. When you walk in, it looks like a former nightclub....but very small. It has a large screen playing old Anime movies which is pretty cool .Our waitress was really sweet. The food is good but it pretty much has your standard sushi restaurant menu with the gyoza, seaweed salad etc. apps and then the usual sushi rolls. They do have a nice selection of more complex sushi rolls and I got the megatron roll - good but just had too much stuff in it so the flavors of all the different items' seemed to cancel each other out.I would recommend Sushi X because it's inexpensive and it BYOB!

13.description: I have had the pleasure of dining here twice and had wonderful experiences both times! The highlights you ask?- Amazing customer service - Amazing sushi rolls and apps!- Amazing ambiance - BYOB... soooo... also awesome. Check it out!

11.description: Best Sushi spot in Chicago. I tried em all & this place is by far #1. Godzilla roll is amazing!

39.description: Went for dinner recently and it was delish!! Still craving the tuna tartar which is not only yummy but the portion is nicely generous. Service was spot on, with our servers checking in and ensuring we had everything we needed. We absolutely loved it and will be back soon.

37.description: This place is awesome. It has parking, a unique vibe, and some of the most original rolls/combos. The employees are always helpful and spunky, the prices aren't ridiculous like some 'hip' sushi places, and their monthly specials are always worth it.Eaten here a bunch of times-- both take-out and dine-in with some BYOB. The Black Widow roll is phenomenal, the scallops are CRAZY GOOD, and even the simpler rolls are wonderful.Overall, great place. Love dealing with them.

0.description: The first time we came we celebrated my fiance's birthday with a very large group of friends. The restaurant was very accommodating and allowed us to book half of the restaurant, the area behind the curtain. The level of service stayed great, the food was absolutely delicious and everyone had a blast, even though there were a LOT of us there.We also came tonight for dinner and ordered the dragonfly and the double stack rolls. Both rolls were delicious and HUGE. We ordered 2 rolls to share, 2 misos, 4 pieces of salmon sashimi, and chocolate peanut butter cup dessert and it was more than enough food for the 2 of us.The sashimi was very tiny pieces, a lot smaller than what I am used to, and I get salmon sashimi at every sushi place. But the fish was very fresh and deliciously fatty.They are BYOB so bring a bottle of your favorite libation.They do not take reservations for small groups, but we were able to come in and get a table on a Friday. I assume with a small wait you ca do a walk in.We have done take out before as well and the quality of the sushi was still great.I highly recommend Sushi X for a regular dinner or for a celebration in the reserved private area.

38.description: Sushi x helped host a bridal shower for us recently.  The prices were reasonable and they went above and beyond making sure we had everything we needed.  The food was really good and even put the left overs in little goody bags for people to take home!  I can't wait to go back to sushi x for lunch or dinner.  Thank you again teresa and sushi x crew for your work!

51.description: Awesome sushi! Great atmosphere. Kinda small so go in a small group. But the food is amaaazzinnggg. Not to mention byob what whhaaatt.

27.description: Excellent choice.   If your looking for a large selection with good quality, you have to try this place. The rolls are large, fresh and tasty. Delivery is fast and there was no fee. I like their specials.  The have some pretty creative options. If you want sushi and you'd like to eat in you own home, this is a great option!We've never dined in at this place but we have picked up our food. Looks nice inside.

32.description: Love this place!  Been here a few times.  Byob, friendly staff and cool music and vibe.  The coconut shrimp was really good and all their rolls are great! The giant larger ones will really fill you up so if you're hungry would recommend that. Every month they also have a roll on special but you have to ask! Got the crab Rangoon roll, the mango, the jalapeño roll and some other ones.. All super freaken amazing!  It's super small tho so you might be waiting if you come during a busy time and I don't think they take reservations.  Def recommend this place for a cute date night!

54.description: For sure get the Godzilla! Byob , bring some Prosecco. Can't find any? Head to Lush or noble grape!!!! (Or cvs if you want a standard selection) no excuse to not have booze!

48.description: I've ordered a few times from Sushi X and I must say that it's exterior is somewhat off-putting (a building painted black without windows), but this is in no way indicative of the great food inside.  Yesterday, I tried some of their wasabi ceviche that was a great twist on a classic peruvian dish; I found it to be very refreshing.  The red chicken was absolutely delicious! The dish included grilled chicken served curry style with a red pepper marinade and other vegetables; I requested it spicy and it turned out incredible.

44.description: I expected this place to suck about as bad as a binky at a warehouse rave. Don't get me wrong I love a good innuendo as much as the next guy, but party drug references on a website (rollingatsushix.com) doesn't exactly give me confidence in the Caterpillar roll. I was totally wrong though. Went in expecting a bunch of kids sake bombing and being obnoxious and actually found a pretty decent BYOB. The rolls are affordable and tasty but I recommend doing one of their bowls. There's a couple of different options, but they're basically deconstructed makis served with either sashimi or stuff from the hot menu.  It's small and has some trippy artwork on the wall so unless you're dining with a Mormon or Jehovah's Witness who'd be horrified at the insinuations I'd say it's a pretty decent place to take a date.

24.description: Delicious sushi, decent sized rolls (you actually get what you pay for), and byob. What more could you ask for... maybe bring back the bento lunch boxes?

7.description: Normally I would not write a bad review. This time around, I am compelled to do so because the service was so bad, we left before ordering food. We walked in, we were seated, but a couple was getting up from a table further from the door than ours, so we politely asked if we could switch to the table they were vacating. The hostess said this was no problem. After the table was cleaned, a server finally arrived at our table and asked if we had ordered food yet. We had not even been given menus. Then, our server brought one menu, telling us they couldn't give us two because "there is a big party taking them all". Then we asked if we could switch to the table we were told we could switch to. The server said, "oh wait, the hostess said you could do that? Hold on." She proceeded to consult the hostess, and after they decided not to let us sit at the other table, the hostess shouted from across the restaurant, "Oh sorry!"We brought with a bottle of wine to drink, since it's a BYOB.  We asked for a bottle opener, and they brought one.  But they really just dropped it on our table nonchalantly and walked away. There was no offer to provide ice to keep our bottle chilled, nor was there any real concern for anything regarding our experience. I am not one to nitpick with service people, but our experience was so subpar, we just left before ordering. Maybe the food is good, but I can't recommend this place based on service alone.

49.description: As far as BYOB sushi places go, I'd say Sushi X would be slightly above average if you're looking for a pre-bar dining option. The black walls, high ceiling, and cheap artistic marilyn monroe prints make you feel like you're in a staging area for a club.  However, once you get past that, the service is good and the sushi is as fresh as you'll find in the Midwest.

40.description: Just ok, I've heard people raving about this place and I wasn't that impressed. Any place that uses lettuce in their sushi rolls always has me a bit suspicious. Rolls were all a bit forgettable. The space was also pretty jam packed, and they were playing anime vids, blasting music, and servers were running around like mad- so it just made me pretty anxious. Not the typical soothing sushi restaurant vibe I prefer. The punny sushi roll names and fun design of the menu did help a bit to distract me from the chaotic vibe of the place. I felt like everyone around us was on an awkward tinder date, which I guess I could have expected from the exterior of the building, which is completely black with no windows. Can't say I'm rushing back here.

53.description: WORST service ever! Food was good.Came here with a friend for a lunch meeting on a Tuesday. I ordered a lunch box and the Godzilla. My friend ordered a sashimi combo and soup. The waitress forgot to bring out the soup, and we had to go up and tell her. My lunch box came with a water bottle which she also forgot and I had to ask for at the end of my meal. I finally got my water bottle with my TO-GO box!In the end, we felt rushed to leave. She completely disappeared (they close at 2pm..we had NO clue! would have been nice to let us know rather than disappearing on us!!)  and our water was never refilled. While we sat there thirsty, she tells us that they are closed. Wtf?! Okkkk... Guess it's time to hurry up and leave in the middle of our meal!! At least give us some water! Or a heads up!WORST service ever.

30.description: The service is TERRIBLE. My fiancé and I waiting for 25 minutes at our table just to order our appetizer. When we finally ordered,they forgot our seaweed salad and the sashimi was thin and tough. When we received our sushi, the rolls were very sloppy. Everything was thrown together in a messy fashion and the taste was subpar. When we received our bill, the prices were worse than the actual sushi. $9 for spicy tuna..are you kidding?! To conclude, don't waste your money. Sushi is an expensive habit so at least be satisfied when you leave.

46.description: If you like Anime, House music, and sushi then this is your place!  The rolls are Godzilla size (huge)!  In fact you can get the Godzilla roll.  I had the white tiger and the Megatron, both very good. The tuna tacos are excellent.  The servers were fun and welcoming. Very trendy spot, looked closed from outside but once your in its totally chill spot!!  Find the ninja and get a free desert!!Cool spot!

1.description: Meh. Meh. Two mehs; one for each star.  I'll begin with saying the atmosphere is pretty nice, but there may be too many tables, which made navigation to the bathroom somewhat difficult.  Once I got there, I realized it was being used.  No biggie, except I was literally five inches from someone eating dinner.  I went with two friends and the BYOB aspect, as many heave mentioned, was nice.We got the tempura green beans, but had to order two since the first order was cold.  The gentleman who served us rushed another round over.  We also had edamame, which was standard, and the veggie potstickers.  The potstickers were my favorite thing of the night.  We each ordered a plain roll and one p the fancier options.  All three "fancies" we're meh.  I ended up picking the maguro and super white tuna out since the rice was a bit hard and the roll as a whole had too much cilantro and was just meh. Sorry for all the mehs again, but it's the best word I can use to describe the bland tasteless dinner.Again, the staff was awesome but $90 for two mehs, especially when there are so many much better sushi places, was a bit of a bummer.This place has loads of high reviews, but I won't be back to see what I missed.

55.description: Hands down our favorite sushi spot in Chicago. We get Sushi X takeout almost every week. Thai Stick, Godzilla, Stingray, and Honey roll are staples that we can never get enough of.

9.description: Loved Sushi X! Myself and two other friends went on a Friday night, without reservations, and we were seated in less than 10 minutes. Next time, I'd make a reservation, because I think it was just pure luck that that happened. I think the fact that it's BYOB makes this place even cooler, and it kind of sets a different mood in the restaurant. The staff seems chill and relaxed, lending bottle openers should you need them (one of my friends with was 21+, so she brought herself a couple beers to enjoy). This place reminded me of a club, but the music wasn't obnoxiously loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation. Anyway, even though the ambiance was chill and the staff did their jobs, the true highlight is the sushi. Although it's a little more pricey, it was definitely worth every splurging dime. We ordered a variety of sushi between our little group, and venturing outside of my typical sushi order seemed more accessible and not as scary as it usually seems (in my case). Next time I have a sushi craving and a few extra dollars together, I definitely plan to go back.

26.description: Great service, good sushi that is inexpensive yet has the quality of a more expensive restaurant.

25.description: We have all had those days when it's too chilly to go out, but you're craving sushi sooo bad! I can say I've been let down with delivered sushi even from my favorite places before. This was not the case with Sushi-X though. They REALLY put the extra few minutes into packaging your to go order, so that when it arrives it still looks nice and tastes great! I've now had them deliver to me twice, and my only complaint is that I didn't care for the bacon in the Maui Waui roll. That's just a personal opinion though, and I'm sure they would have no problem substituting with extra pineapple or something. Definitely my favorite close, quick sushi joint!

12.description: Oh my goodness, where to start?! This place is great! The sushi tastes fresh. Innovative sushi ideas, general sushi staples all present.Do yourself a favor, get the Chocolate Reeses cup for desert. You will not be sorry.

59.description: Sushi X has been on my bookmarked list for quite some time and finally a Saturday night came around where we were craving sushi and didn't have reservations anywhere else so we decided to try this place hoping we wouldn't have to wait too long since they don't take reservations. Got in around 6:30pm and snatched one of the last 4 top tables there so that was a positive since I hate waiting, especially during winter weather in Chicago. The atmosphere is a little too funky for me with a big screen monitor playing Japanese cartoons and such. There's music as well, which got a little too loud at one point, but despite those things, we still had a great time and definitely enjoyed our sushi.So onto the goodies, we started with a spicy tuna salad for $9 which was a decent portion of tons of spicy tuna with spicy mayo and siracha, some avocado pieces on top a bed of lettuce, definitely recommend it. We also got an edamame which was a large portion as well while we waited for our creative and super size make rolls to be made and let me tell you that these rolls were huge. Some of them barely made it in my mouth, they were big so although on the pricier side, they were worth it. -Honey roll for $8 had white tuna, tempura flakes, cucumber, honey sesame mayo. One of the smaller rolls but definitely worth it.-Godzilla roll for $14 which happened to be my favorite one and is definitely worth the hype here had tempura shrimp, siracha, scallions, roe, cream cheese, tempura flakes, avocado, mayo, topped w/ eel sauce and wasabi mayo. Seriously, get it now!-Double Stack for $16 (this one was what my hubby really wanted since it had plenty of raw fish for him to eat, but I have to say I didn't love it, maybe I'm just not a fan of cilantro in my sushi but it was made of tuna, albacore, salmon, cilantro, jalapeno, avocado, mayo, roe, citrus chili ponzu. Definitely an adventure item.So the sushi was awesome overall and definitely filling because the rolls were huge in size and pieces. So the best part was when our super sweet server saw me take a pic of the gorgeousness she said "hey, if you upload your picture at sushi X on instagram, I'll get you a free dessert." Now that gets a star in itself. I love that kind of service, since I would have probably done it anyway. We ended up trying the mango mousse cake with some mochi ice cream, which was light and a great way to end the meal. So Sushi X is definitely worth trying if you're in the area for some good sushi and great service. But I wouldn't come in the winter since the door keeps opening and it gets a little chilly inside since the place isn't huge.

21.description: Consistently amazing fast friendly service!  Favorite sushi place in Chicago!! I've been coming here for 10 yrs.  I hope it's open forever!!

17.description: The sushi was sooo good and not expensive. First thing to review is of course the food!  We had the creamy ginger salad which was light and delicious. I'm not a salad person but that was really good.  The miso soup was about the only item we ordered that was just ok.  Our party of 4 had the white tiger roll, dragonfly roll, megatron roll, caterpillar roll, honey inside out roll, bombshell zero roll and waters all around for a little over $100. The place itself was nicely decorated and not loud which was nice because we didn't have to shout to have a conversation.  It had a huge screen in the middle playing animae from that was a little different.  There was actually some dance music playing like you're in a club so that was really different...not in a bad way because it wasn't loud.  It's not that big so I could imagine having to wait for a table but luckily when we went on a Saturday night around 9 pm we got a table right away.  The waitress was super nice and she had us look for a ninja figurine she hid somewhere around the restaurant for a free dessert.  We closed the place out so we weren't bothering anyone but that was cool.  The other 4/5 star reviews are spot on.  You should definitely visit if you like sushi!

10.description: I expected this place to suck about as bad as a binky at a warehouse rave. Don't get me wrong I love a good innuendo as much as the next guy, but party drug references on a website (rollingatsushix.com) doesn't exactly give me confidence in the Caterpillar roll. I was totally wrong though. Went in expecting a bunch of kids sake bombing and being obnoxious and actually found a pretty decent BYOB. The rolls are affordable and tasty but I recommend doing one of their bowls. There's a couple of different options, but they're basically deconstructed makis served with either sashimi or stuff from the hot menu.  It's small and has some trippy artwork on the wall so unless you're dining with a Mormon or Jehovah's Witness who'd be horrified at the insinuations I'd say it's a pretty decent place to take a date.

5.description: Great place for sushi, if you like an intimate hole-in-the- wall. It was busy and our table was a bit neglected when it came to ordering, but an apology and complimentary salad made up for it. I never have a problem when there's an apology. Steven was great, love that it's BYOB, the rolls were fantastic. We will definitely be back!

3.description: This is my go-to place for sushi. This place allows for BYOB.  The sushi is amazing, the service is fantastic, and I always leave satisfied.  I start with the edamame with the hot sauce (they should bottle this stuff and sell it).  Then we get a few rolls such as the Godzilla, rainbow and double stack. Check this place out.

35.description: HOLY CRAP ITS LOUD IN HERE!!Seriously though.... If youre able to get passed that, the sush was just ok. I dont quite understand all the raving of this place.

19.description: I came here for lunch one day because I did not feel like waiting for the 66 bus after getting off the blue line. The outside is mysterious and if the name did not say "sushi x" I would have guessed it was some porn shop. The sushi was awesome. I tried salmon, octopus and tuna. They were decent sized too for rolls. The lunch special came with Perrier. I will come back for dinner sometime.

28.description: we order sushi x quite often, and the food is always great. the double stack is the go-to roll, no question, but I gotta switch it up once in a while with a silver haze bowl. Both are packed with great fresh fish. I love this spot because the food is consistently fantastic, the rolls and other dishes are huge!, and the service is always great... dine in, carry out or delivery. I definitely recommend sushi x.

45.description: I ordered a lunchbox - couldn't believe the value! I got the miso soup, salad, drink and 6 rolls of spicy tuna, $15 dollars with change including delivery and tip! The sushi was spicy and delicious, soup pipping hot, salad a little tired but still fresh, and soda...well, as good as Sprite gets :)I looked up their website and it looks that if I was to order it separately, I'd pay $18 without delivery & tip, so the $10 lunchbox is definitively a steal! Will get it again for sure!

33.description: I really wanted to like this place. I really did. I wanted to try a new sushi spot but was disappointed.Went to this place on a Tuesday around 6pm with my partner. I thought it was a cute place because my partner is into anime and they have it playing on a wall with a projector with no sound, only music. The place is fairly small but roomy. The place was dark and lit with candles and some light. I liked it. The place is not as loud as I thought either. There was a boy and his mom sitting 3 feet from us and he was crawling on the floor and looking around looking for a toy in the place and I guess he one something, like a game. It was distracting and the place looked unprofessional. Immediately after picking our table we received paper menus and glasses of water.We started of with the Godzilla roll since I read on here a lot of people enjoy/recommend it. It was my favorite from this place sadly out of 4 rolls. This sushi roll took about 10 min to get to our table. Wasn't even a lot of people. I though they took forever.We got 3 rolls after that and that was it. We got the omega, spider and black widow.Tasted like they out panko in all the rolls.The presentation wasn't worth taking a picture.They all sounded pretty amazing except I wasn't impressed. The tempura tuna in the Omega wasn't as good. The sushi rolls weren't rolled tight. They were falling apart as I tried picking up some pieces. My partner called them amateurs under her breath. I don't wanna  disrespect anyone's hard work in this place but I called this cheap sushi. Not the best I've had. The service was okay. We certainly didn't get as much attention as the other tables. At the end I paid $63 for all 4 rolls which is decent for the sushi I usually eat. But I felt ripped off because the rolls were disappointing.I don't wanna give them one star because it wasn't the worst place but 2 stars because the sushi was sad.I will not be back here.

43.description: One of my favorite Sushi spots in Chicago The staff are all top notch, and the sushi is great. The sushi is seriously outstanding, hands down.

2.description: BYOB! This cute little sushi place is pretty good! There isn't took much around this location, but we took the Blue Line and grabbed a drink at the MatchBox before wandering over to try the sushi.. we obviously stopped by the CVS to grab a bottle of wineThe ambience was really nice, dark with some interesting art on the wall. The rolls are very inventive. For example, I had the Five-O, which is a roll made with prosciutto and bacon. It was really different and while I would probably rather stick to more traditional sushi, it was nice to step outside of the box on that one. We also ordered a Nigiri Platter, which was good quality and another MegaRoll

18.description: Sushi X has been on my bookmarked list for quite some time and finally a Saturday night came around where we were craving sushi and didn't have reservations anywhere else so we decided to try this place hoping we wouldn't have to wait too long since they don't take reservations. Got in around 6:30pm and snatched one of the last 4 top tables there so that was a positive since I hate waiting, especially during winter weather in Chicago. The atmosphere is a little too funky for me with a big screen monitor playing Japanese cartoons and such. There's music as well, which got a little too loud at one point, but despite those things, we still had a great time and definitely enjoyed our sushi.So onto the goodies, we started with a spicy tuna salad for $9 which was a decent portion of tons of spicy tuna with spicy mayo and siracha, some avocado pieces on top a bed of lettuce, definitely recommend it. We also got an edamame which was a large portion as well while we waited for our creative and super size make rolls to be made and let me tell you that these rolls were huge. Some of them barely made it in my mouth, they were big so although on the pricier side, they were worth it. -Honey roll for $8 had white tuna, tempura flakes, cucumber, honey sesame mayo. One of the smaller rolls but definitely worth it.-Godzilla roll for $14 which happened to be my favorite one and is definitely worth the hype here had tempura shrimp, siracha, scallions, roe, cream cheese, tempura flakes, avocado, mayo, topped w/ eel sauce and wasabi mayo. Seriously, get it now!-Double Stack for $16 (this one was what my hubby really wanted since it had plenty of raw fish for him to eat, but I have to say I didn't love it, maybe I'm just not a fan of cilantro in my sushi but it was made of tuna, albacore, salmon, cilantro, jalapeno, avocado, mayo, roe, citrus chili ponzu.
