I question her about the key, and she suddenly remembered what she told me earlier, and quickly mentions that the customer just came back and returned the key.So if no key is required, then where did that story about the customer walking off with it come from? And if a key is required, then why wasn't it given to me the second time I asked about the restroom?I totally understand if the restroom is reserved for paying customers only. But if that's truly the case, then just say so. Don't lie to your customers! If they were up front about it, I would have ordered my drink and then gone to the restroom. And honestly, I would have ordered something to eat, but I didn't because my hands were dirty.

25.description: Excellent fast drip at a fair price. Smooth and balanced. No caffeine spike nor crash, and I don't get the coffee-cough like I do with SB's.. I'm in town for four days, and will stop in four times. No need to experiment elsewhere. They should try serving giant toast, like "The Mill" in SF. Friendly service by all. Check this place out.

12.description: Highly recommend Big Shoulders over any Starbucks.  The Marshmellow Latte was awesome. Make the effort to stop in.

59.description: I stopped by after 9am to grab a cup of joe and also grabbed a apple muffin. The space is small, but cozy with a few tables and higher seats against the windows. I can imagine this place being super packed during the morning rush.As for the coffee it was really good. It was the house coffee and was not too strong. The muffin however was dry and did not taste like apple at all. Both items set me back almost $7.If you want to grab a good cup of joe ONLY and a cozy spot to do work or look out the window AFTER rush hour than come here other than that there is a DD across the street for muffins.

21.description: Ah, the independent coffee shop remains strong here in Chicago, and Big Shoulders fits the mold.  Sitting right at Chicago, Milwaukee and Ogden,  Big Shoulders is easy to find and easier to enjoy.  Very simple no frills interior with amazing (and strong) brews.  There's really nothing not to like about this location.  Internet can def be a little spotty, so leave the laptop and home and plan on reading a book.  Generally a quiet spot, save for the occasional artist who thinks the world is interested in overhearing his/her conversations about their writing style.  Big Shoulders is worth the stop if you're in the neighborhood and worth making a hike over to even if you're not.

17.description: Simple!  Good coffee and pastries in a well ventilated, clean comfortable setting with knowledgeable and informative staff.  Now, I have a new list of lattes to taste in house made syrups/infusions.

10.description: Ah, the independent coffee shop remains strong here in Chicago, and Big Shoulders fits the mold.  Sitting right at Chicago, Milwaukee and Ogden,  Big Shoulders is easy to find and easier to enjoy.  Very simple no frills interior with amazing (and strong) brews.  There's really nothing not to like about this location.  Internet can def be a little spotty, so leave the laptop and home and plan on reading a book.  Generally a quiet spot, save for the occasional artist who thinks the world is interested in overhearing his/her conversations about their writing style.  Big Shoulders is worth the stop if you're in the neighborhood and worth making a hike over to even if you're not.

5.description: Big Shoulders Coffee is the epitome of coffee done right and it's a place that makes me so glad (ecstatic, in fact) that coffee culture exists. They have high quality beans, a straightforward menu and the friendliest, most hard-working baristas who care as much about preparing the coffee as ensuring that you're enjoying it.  Wonderful.If you have the Indie Coffee Passport, they don't have a separate drink menu to choose from; you can have any drink already listed on their menu. Even more wonderful.  The moment I walked in, I was greeted with a "Hi, how are you?"  For every person who leaves, the staff wishes them well with a "thanks for coming by" or "have a good one."  Even the call-and-answer way the baristas communicated with each other behind the counter displayed the fluidity of their teamwork.When I was seated at the counter, I was kind of fascinated. They would constantly give each other tips or experiment making different kinds of coffee.  I realize now that they're relentlessly perfecting their trade.  I ordered a Uganda dark roast in a press which is timed to 4:00 minutes.  I absolutely love how they talk each other like scientists geeked out in a lab... along the lines of: "Is your timer set?" "You bet, it's to 4 minutes."  I did have a front row seat to witness their craftsmanship.Words from Carl Sandburg's "Chicago" poem were painted on their walls:"Hog Butcher for the World,   Tool Maker, Stacker of Wheat,   Player with Railroads and the Nation's Freight Handler;   Stormy, husky, brawling,   City of the Big Shoulders:"Their space is open and inviting, and somehow they capture some of Chicago's history and embody its hardworking spirit. There are bar stools at all the windows and their counters even have purse/jacket hooks underneath!  You will see shelves of pour over contraptions with names like kalita wave, stacked alongside beakers, kettles, scales and timers.To go with my coffee, I also ordered a Basque pastry (like a petit madeleine in the shape of a tart, dusted with powdered sugar) and those run about $4.00.  It was exceptionally good.  If I hadn't gotten a dark roast coffee, I would have ordered their Cardamom Latte.  A friend (also with the Indie Coffee Passport) had raved about the Marshmallow Latte that comes with a toasted marshmallow.It has been awhile since I've given five stars to a cafe, but both their coffee/staff top the list in the coffee world and are nothing short of wonderful.

3.description: Big windows, 1 big table, but also counter seating. Music chill, not too loud.Staff wonderful. Right by the Blue line entrance.

35.description: If I ever want to introduce the local places to my out-of-town friends, Big Shoulders Coffee is certainly on my bucket list.  That was my first time this late morning.  The location is just as prime as it can be; take the "southbound Chicago ave." exit of the CTA Chicago Blue Line station, you will see BSC and can't possibly miss it!  It's a small place, but they utilize windows and simple, clean-looking decors to visually enlarge the entire venue.  Without any hesitation, I ordered the marshmallow latte, while hubby had the cappuccino.  I've been browsing through pictures on Yelp and curious about what and how the marshmallow latte tasted like.  Let me be as descriptive as possible with this human ingenuity.  The latte was pretty "honey-strong" with a mild tone of marshmallow to draw a correlation between the "toasted-marshmallow stick" on top of the latte.  I anticipated that some might not like the sweetness, yet some would go bananas with it since it definitely added playfulness and innovation to a regular latte.  So what did I think about the marshmallow latte?  I'm a fan of this, especially when I want to have a lazy day in the city.  They do have restrooms available; they share the facilities with the playwright theater next door.  Please ask for a key at the service counter.  They have bus trackers on the big monitor (56 Milwaukee and 66 Chicago).  If you're catching a train, you can track the progress on the monitor attached to the entry/exit of the Chicago Blue Line station.  In the meantime, you can enjoy people-watching, the free show of the day.

19.description: As silly as it feels ordering a marshmallow latte and having the workers fire up the torch just for you, it was damn delicious!

28.description: Happened to be nearby and wanted to give this place a try due to having a lot of positive reviews. It took a bit to find parking which may explain why it seems popular among commuters not worried about where to put their wheels. Found a spot after two loops and headed in. The guy at the counter was helpful with making a drink selection. I originally wanted the Horchata Latte, but he advised that it's made with sweetened condensed milk so it wouldn't work as a nondairy option. I went with the Cardamom Spice Latte instead (with almond milk) and it was delicious! I'm a big fan of baking spices anyway and the combination with their house roasted espresso was a great balance. I don't find myself over here often, but I'd definitely go back if I were, and would highly recommend it.

45.description: You have forever ruined other coffee for us! We get big shoulders beans and LOVE them! We are all turning into coffee snobs thanks to your amazing coffee! Guests love it when we make it for them and we usually end up stopping in and buying a bag for them when they are in town!

33.description: Pretty solid coffee

43.description: Big Shoulders Coffee is the epitome of coffee done right and it's a place that makes me so glad (ecstatic, in fact) that coffee culture exists. They have high quality beans, a straightforward menu and the friendliest, most hard-working baristas who care as much about preparing the coffee as ensuring that you're enjoying it.  Wonderful.If you have the Indie Coffee Passport, they don't have a separate drink menu to choose from; you can have any drink already listed on their menu. Even more wonderful.  The moment I walked in, I was greeted with a "Hi, how are you?"  For every person who leaves, the staff wishes them well with a "thanks for coming by" or "have a good one."  Even the call-and-answer way the baristas communicated with each other behind the counter displayed the fluidity of their teamwork.When I was seated at the counter, I was kind of fascinated. They would constantly give each other tips or experiment making different kinds of coffee.  I realize now that they're relentlessly perfecting their trade.  I ordered a Uganda dark roast in a press which is timed to 4:00 minutes.  I absolutely love how they talk each other like scientists geeked out in a lab... along the lines of: "Is your timer set?" "You bet, it's to 4 minutes."  I did have a front row seat to witness their craftsmanship.Words from Carl Sandburg's "Chicago" poem were painted on their walls:"Hog Butcher for the World,   Tool Maker, Stacker of Wheat,   Player with Railroads and the Nation's Freight Handler;   Stormy, husky, brawling,   City of the Big Shoulders:"Their space is open and inviting, and somehow they capture some of Chicago's history and embody its hardworking spirit. There are bar stools at all the windows and their counters even have purse/jacket hooks underneath!  You will see shelves of pour over contraptions with names like kalita wave, stacked alongside beakers, kettles, scales and timers.To go with my coffee, I also ordered a Basque pastry (like a petit madeleine in the shape of a tart, dusted with powdered sugar) and those run about $4.00.  It was exceptionally good.  If I hadn't gotten a dark roast coffee, I would have ordered their Cardamom Latte.  A friend (also with the Indie Coffee Passport) had raved about the Marshmallow Latte that comes with a toasted marshmallow.It has been awhile since I've given five stars to a cafe, but both their coffee/staff top the list in the coffee world and are nothing short of wonderful.

2.description: My friend and I decided to stop in Big Shoulders Coffee before dinner one night.  This place is not your fancy coffee shop and doesn't offer many options, but everyone is friendly and their options are truly unique.  My friend tried the marshmallow latte and I opted for the horchata latte.  For my lactose intolerant friends, they do offer other choices of milk: soy or almond.  The flavor of my latte was delicious.  It truly embraced the flavors of a horchata while still having the rich aromas of coffee.  It was a tad sweet for my liking, but nothing asking for less sugar (or even no sugar) won't help with.  Overall, this is a great place to sit and enjoy your cup of coffee or on the go in a hurry.  It's conveniently located steps away from the blue line.  Definitely go grab yourself a cup.

18.description: Every once in a while the coffee truck parks in front of the Deloitte building on Monroe and Wacker. I look forward to this rare event. Simple, Fresh, hot, robust coffee. One of the best! looking forward to my next cup!

41.description: Good Vibes & Great Coffee. I will never forget my first time going to Big Shoulders and getting a coffee to go. I totally underestimated the strength of their coffee, but man was i in for a surprise! The staff is super friendly, a quick place to get away or kill time to get a coffee while waiting for the blue line or 66 bus. They really blew my mind when i ordered the toasted marshmallow latte- everyone needs to try it!

52.description: Went there to do some work on my computer one afternoon. Service and the marshmallow latte was great!  Seating was somewhat limited as the place was kind of small and not too many tables, but definitely worth going to I think if you want to try a different coffee shop that isn't so generic like Starbucks.

50.description: While I'm not a huge coffee drinker, I do love this place.  The coffee is really strong  (for me anyway), but I love their tea and hot chocolate with soy and vanilla. They also have this carrot cake that will blow ya mind. The staff is super nice and approachable, and the vibe is very laid back. It may not be the best kick it spot (no comfy chairs to be found) but it's a great cafe overall.

4.description: If I ever want to introduce the local places to my out-of-town friends, Big Shoulders Coffee is certainly on my bucket list.  That was my first time this late morning.  The location is just as prime as it can be; take the "southbound Chicago ave." exit of the CTA Chicago Blue Line station, you will see BSC and can't possibly miss it!  It's a small place, but they utilize windows and simple, clean-looking decors to visually enlarge the entire venue.  Without any hesitation, I ordered the marshmallow latte, while hubby had the cappuccino.  I've been browsing through pictures on Yelp and curious about what and how the marshmallow latte tasted like.  Let me be as descriptive as possible with this human ingenuity.  The latte was pretty "honey-strong" with a mild tone of marshmallow to draw a correlation between the "toasted-marshmallow stick" on top of the latte.  I anticipated that some might not like the sweetness, yet some would go bananas with it since it definitely added playfulness and innovation to a regular latte.  So what did I think about the marshmallow latte?  I'm a fan of this, especially when I want to have a lazy day in the city.  They do have restrooms available; they share the facilities with the playwright theater next door.  Please ask for a key at the service counter.  They have bus trackers on the big monitor (56 Milwaukee and 66 Chicago).  If you're catching a train, you can track the progress on the monitor attached to the entry/exit of the Chicago Blue Line station.  In the meantime, you can enjoy people-watching, the free show of the day.

6.description: finally got a chance to try the much hyped big shoulders coffee experience. it did not disappoint. even the drip coffee (bottomless for customers who hang) was rich and delicious. they also have the chemex method of brewing for those with deeper pockets. its a small space so i cannot complain about hard chairs and limited seating. the employees were mellow and provided musical ambiance that was chill and perfect for a greyish sunday. chicago, you have many great roasters and big shoulders is one of them.

22.description: Great coffee. Good environment. Air conditioning was on full blast and was freezing which kinda sucked, and the wifi connection was pretty shorty as wel

15.description: It's taken me awhile to write this review, partly because I hold it to such high esteem so I feel the need to make the review commensurate. But screw it, it's time I write this review.Big Shoulders is great. My go-to coffeeshop for great espresso, roasted right inside the shop. The drip is barely too acidic for my taste, but nothing beats Big Shoulders' espresso drinks. Nice baristas that are always approachable.There's about 20 spots to sit, which isn't a lot, but there's always an open space. Ample amount of plugs around the nifty, triangular table that conforms to the shape of the place. If you're lucky, you'll leave with aromatic white flakes on you, coming down from the ventilation once the roasting machine gets roastin'. It's basically free caffeine sitting atop your big shoulders.

57.description: Fantastic coffee shop right off the Blue Line at Chicago.  All of their coffee is great, in particular the Kraakamandel which has a lot of almond taste and is truly fantastic.I also love how they provide bus and train estimated schedules.  Perfect for those headed into work in the morning.323/365

20.description: Every once in a while the coffee truck parks in front of the Deloitte building on Monroe and Wacker. I look forward to this rare event. Simple, Fresh, hot, robust coffee. One of the best! looking forward to my next cup!

36.description: Tim the owner insisted I try the slow drip...changed my coffee game forever.  I stop in for some beans and a brew whenever I'm in the area.

14.description: I love this place. It's not on my way to work, in fact it's the opposite way for me. But I often find myself going out of my to go grab coffee in the morning. The space is simple, but really nice. Not too modern, but looks new. The staff has always been as nice as can be. The prices are good, the coffee is amazing. I like to sit by the window and wait as long as I can before catching my train which is located steps from the door. They even have screens with the train and bus trackers! It's a great place for commuters to stop in before work. They have bar seating and a communal table. Since they roast their own coffee, I like to grab a bag and take it to work so I can press my own.

12.description: I usually hate shopping for clothes, especially jeans. Probably because I'm more picky with my clothes that my food (which says a lot), so it normally takes me hours just to find a style I like and then i get really agitated once i realize they just dont fit my body type.So I tried Zipfit a couple years ago. I found a style I liked and they fitted me within 30 minutes. I still get compliments on the fidelity jeans i got then to this day.  Its weird you dont realize that something fits you well until someone who knows this stuff does it for you.I think the best part about this place is that since they have my size and measurements saved in my profile, I can just order new styles online at anytime, and its shipped straight to my door. Shipping is free and i have 30 days to return if my belly grew a bit and i forgot to tell them :)

7.description: Whether you love shopping or hate the sound of it, zipfit can help. The service was great. Liz was knowledgable and had a good selection of jeans. It was a simple and easy process to find what I was looking for without any hint of hard sell or commitment. I walked away with an order for jeans that were then expertly tailored to my specifications. When the jeans arrived, they were a little too long. Zipfit offered me the option of return or refunding the tailoring at my local place. I opted to do it locally to save time and was promptly credited the value to my account. In all, very happy with the service. I'm hopeful to see a greater selection soon, as I really do love the service and will buy more.

19.description: Great service!  The fit was great.  I can be sort of hard to fit based on my body shape, but ZipFit Denim nailed it.  Strangely the price was same as other stores, despite getting a more customized service.  Would recommend to others for sure - big time saver

1.description: I find it terribly difficult to make my way to a department store, let alone find something that fits me well. ZipFit alleviates both issues of efficiency and fit. I don't have to go into a store anymore and now when I order online, I know I'm getting the exact right pair of jeans, fitting the exact right way, no matter what.Also...their Chicago showroom is a fun space and environment is great. Not to mention they'll come to your office for a fitting if you're too busy to even get there!

2.description: ZipFit is the best! Liz and the team make the experience of getting high quality jeans and clothing simple and fun. For me, trying on clothes in the store was a painstaking process. ZipFit solves that problem by getting you measured and allowing you to then shop online with the confidence that everything will fit perfectly.Schedule a fitting with them or have them come to your office and take care of everyone at once, you definitely won't regret it!

9.description: There's nothing that is more American than entrepreneurship and denim. And when it's backed by an amazing team that does their job to a perfection and enjoy what they do, you get Zipfit. I usually despise shopping for jeans, trying on multiple pairs in 50 different stores until I find one I like. Zipfit has made me a believer in a new way: they use an algorithm (awesome) to take my pair I like and match it across all their top named brands for the perfect fit. And I never have to try on another pair again! You get free alterations, and when UPS messed up my shipment Zipfit sent me a free pair of socks. Who does that?! Best experience I've ever had buying denim. Every guy needs to experience the Zipfit way!

6.description: Great jeans and service. Buy once, never ever worry about hassle of shopping the right fit and size in the future.

18.description: I accidentally discovered ZipFit at it's original location.  I walked in skeptically, like I do in most stores with jeans, expecting to be disappointed...again.  It's pretty customary for me to find jeans I love just to realize I can't get my thighs or butt into them.  Alex, the young lady who helped me, confidently blew my mind.  By the time it was said and done, I'd bought three pair of jeans.  I've not looked back since - when I need jeans, I call on ZipFit.  Moreover, the ladies of ZipFit have gone out of there way (years later) to ensure my satisfaction with their product.  Their personal touch and responsiveness is what customer service is all about.  Trust me, you will not go wrong with ZipFit!

10.description: I made an appointment last Wednesday for the following day after work, showed up and was in and out in about 8 minutes flat.  It was great.  They ran my specs through their algorithm and I tried on 2 pairs of pants and the 2nd ones were the best jeans I've ever tried on.  They were at my house 2 days later.  My wife can't wait until they expand into women's jeans.

13.description: Not until I bought my first set of Fidelity Jeans did I ever have anyone compliment my jeans...or my butt! At 50-something, it's gotta be the jeans. You get what you pay for with ZipFit. The sizing is great. The team is professional and courteous and being able to order a new pair that fit so well online....priceless!

16.description: I am the LAST guy to go shopping for jeans.  I admit freely that fashion is not the first thing on my mind, if it is there at all.  So when I got introduced to ZipFit, I agreed to have a fitting just because it sounded like something that would make life a little easier and I didn't have to buy any jeans of course...  The ZipFit people are great and the fitting turned into some really nice jeans that really really fit!  Never thought of buying jeans as a fun experience, but it was and I will do it again and again with these guys.  Thanks for some great jeans (not to mention a very cool shirt...)!

17.description: Just got another perfect pair of jeans from ZipFit! I got my first pair about 2 years ago - their staff helped me find the jeans that looked great and fit perfect. Since then, I have just been able to order jeans online and they come sized custom and perfect!

15.description: I got fitted for a pair of jeans, and settled on Fidelity Caminos.  They fit my body perfectly and I really love the way my butt looks in them.  Seriously a perfect fit, I'd recommend them to anyone, regardless of body type.  They fitted me and a friend and we have two totally different builds and we both love the jeans they put us in!

0.description: Awesome experience   I went in wearing Levis and came out confident and very comfortable.  I really love the feel and cut of their clothing   The cool thing is that not only can ZipFit fit me in the store but they can fit me online anywhere.  I like that versatility   I am a tough size and they had it, along with lots of color optionsMy wife is happier too because she wanted me to upgrade  She says the lines of these jeans flatter me a lot more than cheap Levis  Well worth the price, and the experience was seamless (pun intended)

5.description: Another fashion gem in Chicago! I love the convenience Zipfit offers, not to mention their ability to match my style and build, for the best fitting jeans.  Liz is kind and incredibly knowledgable. The other great element is they keep all your dimensions on file so reordering can be done without a hassle.  I love not having to go back to a tailor every time I get a new pair of jeans.

11.description: They do an incredible job. Not only are my jeans fantastic but when I got a whole in the crotch (like I always do) they arranged a full replacement on the house and the jeans were returned to me perfectly hemmed. How could you not love such an  awesome business?!

8.description: I'm really difficult to size. I'm about as odd sized as they come.  Alex did great job of finding the brand and fit based on my feedback.  I learned my exact pant measurements, and now I have 2 go to brands and fits(that I never heard of, not a big fan of shopping) that are now my go to for denim: Paige Federals and Joe's Brixton.  Hecks yeah!  The denim is pricey, but what's the cost of having that go to pair of jeans that you look money in?

3.description: During a visit to Chicago we stopped in ZipFit Denim Store so my fiancé' could get fitted for a pair if jeans.  The staff were OUTSTANDING and really know their products.  It only took 10 minutes to be fitted with a pair of Agave jeans, which were the perfect fit.  Needless to say he now owns five pairs of these jeans, different colors of course, and will not wear any other brand of jeans.  We also have purchased underwear and socks that he loves.  Now that they are selling women's apparel, it is my turn to be fitted.I would highly recommend ZipFit.  You will never buy jeans anywhere else.

14.description: I've been using ZipFit for years now, and I'm happily satisfied with the quality of the jean recommendations; I always walk out of the store with an impressive pair on. Since I live in NC now, it's not a problem for ZipFit to deliver a tailored fit to my doorstep. For me the sign of a good fit is when I receive unsolicited compliments while I'm out; that's happened since I've been a ZipFit customer, so needless to say my ego is on steroids lately. These guys are awesome, check them out!

4.description: I hate shopping, really hate it.  I've ordered too many pants and clothes online, with mixed results and wasted money.  But with ZipFit, it doesn't feel like shopping.  I worked with Julianna Conenna.  She is delightful and has great taste.  I would hire her as my personal shopper if I could.  No sales pressure, whatsoever.  She just found pants that fit me.  She has great taste in shirts and sweaters too.  She met me after work during the week, which was really convenient.  No more on-line pants shopping for me.

58.description: Living around the corner, I've been anticipating this restaurant's opening since I saw them renovating the space - and they were clever to put up signage first. In short, it seems like a lot of great choices followed that first one and I'm impressed. They opened today at 9 and I was there at 9:15, and neighborhood folks are clearly excited or at least just curious. I saw at least 10 patrons in 10 minutes. They've done really well by the space - new windows, and clean warm decor makes this an inviting space, and the smell when you walk in is fantastic - chicken, spice, biscuits and butter - without the overwhelming quality of fry oil you can find in the air of so many place serving fried food. I haven't been to their other locations, so i was excited to put them to the test. I kept it simple: a chicken biscuit with ranch. I almost never get chicken breast, I usually opt for thigh, but I knew I had to assess them on their mainstay. I saw them brush their signature sauce onto the fried chicken - a technique that saturates it with flavor but doesn't the compromise integrity of the crisp fried batter - or compete with the juiciness of the bird. It wasn't until the third bite in that I noticed the balance of richness in the biscuit just a good richness to complement the juicy chicken and luxe pour of ranch. This is the real deal. Another perk was that the biscuit didn't fall apart as I made my way through the sandwich. The ratios are great, and that attention to detail will continue to serve this place (and me) really well. I'm looking forward to making my way though the menu - their proximity to my house could be dangerous.

56.description: The nashville spicy chicken is ridiculously good and actually spicy. You know when things are labeled as spicy but barely are, well it's not the case here! I came in just to give it a try. Will be coming back to try a few other things on the menu.

29.description: This place is AMAZING. The spicy chicken is the perfect amount of spice and the mac and cheese is delicious. The staff is friendly and helpful!

42.description: AWESOME!  Spicy Chicken Sandwich, Mac & Cheese, and Cole Slaw - the BEST!  Staff is friendly, the food oh so good.  Portions are good size and the chicken is the best in the city.  Plan on going back to try the rest of the menu ASAP.

23.description: WOW!  This place is so good.  A few girlfriends and I went in on a Saturday night and we ordered half a chicken, the tacos, and all the sides.  EVERYTHING was so good.  I will definitely be back.  In one week, 3 of our friends ate here and said it was amazing.  They were right.  It's definitely not your healthy meal, but it is so worth it.  I saw the mounds of butter they use....ah ha!  This is why it was so delicious!    They definitely know what they are doing here.

47.description: Stopped here on a whim before the Blackhawks game and boy was it worth it!  Great service, fantastic good and very very fresh and delicious.  I wish I worked closer to there, it'd be s regular spot for me.  Will definitely get back!

8.description: We had habanero and original chicken. We enjoyed Hananero more. Habanero was not very hot, so we will probably try Nashville style next time. The service was also amazing. I don't understand the negative review on the service.

31.description: Soooo...it all started when I overslept this morning and missed my workout:/. It was all downhill from there. Huge, buttery, almond croissant for breakfast...and then this happened.I was scouring yelp for some westloop eats for lunch. Stumbled upon this 4.5 star gem about a mile from work and decided to call in an order. I ordered the Nashville hot chicken sandwich on a buttermilk biscuit with pickles and chipotle buttermilk ranch on the side. No sides(I already missed the gym! Didn't want to go overboard!) It was delicious!! Upon the first bite it was spicy but didn't seem overwhelming. With each subsequent bite, however, the spice compounded and got stronger and hotter. The buttermilk biscuit was perfect in consistency and held together nicely as I went to town, swiftly inhaling the sandwich. The chipotle ranch was a nice addition, but the sandwich can definitely stand up on its own without it, too. I'm not done. It gets better. In comes the HOT peach cobbler that I also ordered. Perfection! The peaches tasted uber fresh. It had the perfect balance of sweetness. Perfect balance of crust to peaches ratio. Simply delicious and a nice portion size to boot! I'm good and full right now, trying to fight the afternoon, post lunch, sleep monster:/I'll definitely be back to try the sides and other menu options. Glad I found this place!

34.description: It is up and down with this place and unfortunately you never know what you are going to get here with the exception of two things: 1. The Chicken  2. Customer ServiceYou always know you will get great chicken and horrible customer service, everything else is in limbo.  As usual last night was great chicken and some of the best I have ever had.  Yet their biscuits were burnt and horrible.  I could see the staff putting the biscuit into my box and clearly see from behind the counter they were burned so I asked for different biscuits (we had a total of three), they said no you get these ones.  I fought with them for a moment and clearly lost the battle but it was yet another explanation of horrible customer service at roost.What really frustrated me last night was that they were going around cleaning up the rubber floor mats and THEN handling the food with the same gloves on.  Luckily the man doing this never touched my food (when I was there at least) but I still called them out for doing this and they said that the floor mats are sanitary.  Hmmmm.... not really sure about that one but yet again poor service.They would get 4.5 stars for the food and 1 for the service but unfortunately lately the service has been so bad it outweighs the good food and we will likely not return.

16.description: Fried chicken! That is what this place sells, so if you don't want fried chicken go elsewhere.The fried chicken was really tasty, the "spicy" sandwich had just a bit of a kick, but won't set your mouth on fire (there's a "Carolina Hot" for that, which I didn't try).They have a few sides, and you can add two sides or a side and a dessert to your sandwich for a few bucks more. The sandwich is made to order, so there is a bit of a wait. I'd suggest ordering ahead.For sides, I wanted mac & cheese but they didn't have any ready at the time, so I went with chips (they don't have French fries) which were salty and crispy, as chips should be. They also offer coleslaw, I think, or a biscuit (if you don't opt to get your sandwich on a biscuit, or you really like biscuits... or you get the fried chicken not in sandwich form). I went with a dessert, bread pudding, which was excellent.One little downer, toward the end the SO found a hair on his sandwich. They might want to try wearing hair nets in the kitchen.

13.description: Very, very happy to say that three visits in, The Roost's River West location is as good as the Irving Park location.  I wish the interior was a little bigger, but the tradeoff of this location being just a five-minute drive from my house means that I'll do more takeout here.  Prices on sodas are still a bit too high but since I'm not dining in anymore, I'm able to avoid that issue (but I do miss my grape Fanta in glass bottles).This location also seems to be making sammies a little faster than in Irving Park; I actually came in this past Monday and ordered on the spot, and had my sandwich in 15 minutes...usually, it takes about 20 minutes to do that at lunch time in Irving Park.I still need my frequent eater card replenished, and I'm sure they'll get a supply to the River West spot soon.  Otherwise, solid first month!!

11.description: So happy the people behind The Roost chose to open this location. While not ideal for Wicker Park denizens (we aren't in the delivery zone), it does make for a much faster drive or L ride than the Irving Park Road flagship. You get the sandwich here, and maybe the peach cobbler. I personally like the standard spicy chicken sandwich rather than the Nashville Hot. I think the latter is just a little too much for me. But the standard is perfection. I would get it on a biscuit, since after all, these are the best biscuits in the city.Be prepared to wait a little bit as everything is made fresh to order. I guarantee that you will love it though! It's worth a grab and go location to have this closer by than the spot further north!

39.description: This place has the best biscuits in the city. The biscuit was so good that I had to go back and order more biscuits before I even got to eat the sandwich I initially ordered.  As it turns out the chicken is also more than outstanding.

37.description: So happy the people behind The Roost chose to open this location. While not ideal for Wicker Park denizens (we aren't in the delivery zone), it does make for a much faster drive or L ride than the Irving Park Road flagship. You get the sandwich here, and maybe the peach cobbler. I personally like the standard spicy chicken sandwich rather than the Nashville Hot. I think the latter is just a little too much for me. But the standard is perfection. I would get it on a biscuit, since after all, these are the best biscuits in the city.Be prepared to wait a little bit as everything is made fresh to order. I guarantee that you will love it though! It's worth a grab and go location to have this closer by than the spot further north!

0.description: I am from the south, Nashville, and have eaten at every fried chicken place I can find and Roost is by far the best fried chicken I have ever eaten.The owner, Joe, is a legit-good dude. He is from the south and takes great pride in making his fried chicken.

38.description: Fried chicken! That is what this place sells, so if you don't want fried chicken go elsewhere.The fried chicken was really tasty, the "spicy" sandwich had just a bit of a kick, but won't set your mouth on fire (there's a "Carolina Hot" for that, which I didn't try).They have a few sides, and you can add two sides or a side and a dessert to your sandwich for a few bucks more. The sandwich is made to order, so there is a bit of a wait. I'd suggest ordering ahead.For sides, I wanted mac & cheese but they didn't have any ready at the time, so I went with chips (they don't have French fries) which were salty and crispy, as chips should be. They also offer coleslaw, I think, or a biscuit (if you don't opt to get your sandwich on a biscuit, or you really like biscuits... or you get the fried chicken not in sandwich form). I went with a dessert, bread pudding, which was excellent.One little downer, toward the end the SO found a hair on his sandwich. They might want to try wearing hair nets in the kitchen.

51.description: Never been to the Lakeview location but when I found out that a southern fried chicken restaurant opened down the block from me I had to try it. Now, after trying it, I'm worried that I may gain more than a few extra pounds this winter. The location is small but you can't miss it, what with the big red rooster painted on the side. Luckily, they deliver and they do it quickly. The Nashville Fried Chicken Sandwich is worth 5 stars on its own. Spicy, but also savory and only $6. The Roost is the pig out spot River West has been waiting for.

27.description: Great fried chicken. Best i have had to date. Super crunchy and deep golden color. Not the cheap garbage coatings. Will go back again for sure.

32.description: Good lord this place is good!! I have been getting the sandwiches from the truck for ages so I was happy to see they set up shop in my neighborhood and even more happy that the quality is as good. The spicy chicken is on point as is the Mac and Cheese. The peach cobbler is also really yummy. I actually haven't had something from this place that I don't like.

54.description: Biscuits are amazing. Mac and cheese is tasty. Peach cobbler is delicious. The problem is the chicken, or really the spicing of the chicken. The texture is good. The moisture is good. The flavor of the chicken itself is even good. But we've now tried the herb roasted (mild) chicken and the spicy sandwich, and didn't love the spicing of either. If they offered just plain chicken (which doesn't seem like an unreasonable request), or even a mild sandwich, this would be an easy four star review.Also, they weren't open for dinner on Sunday evening, which made me unhappy. We'll still go back, but I'm going to keep asking for plain fried chicken until someone takes notice and they start offering it.

48.description: Food was delicious and the staff was friendly. Nashville sandwich was my favorite!Only downside was the wait for the food, and the limited seating.The wait for the food was understandable considering every piece of chicken is made to order!Great place to do a grab and go if you live close by.

44.description: Very, very happy to say that three visits in, The Roost's River West location is as good as the Irving Park location.  I wish the interior was a little bigger, but the tradeoff of this location being just a five-minute drive from my house means that I'll do more takeout here.  Prices on sodas are still a bit too high but since I'm not dining in anymore, I'm able to avoid that issue (but I do miss my grape Fanta in glass bottles).This location also seems to be making sammies a little faster than in Irving Park; I actually came in this past Monday and ordered on the spot, and had my sandwich in 15 minutes...usually, it takes about 20 minutes to do that at lunch time in Irving Park.I still need my frequent eater card replenished, and I'm sure they'll get a supply to the River West spot soon.  Otherwise, solid first month!!

24.description: Food Is Great...Service is horrible the lady at the register was rude & not as inviting as the cashiers at the other location. The food is great of course! I'm happy they put a location closer to the city because the drive to their other location for me is 45min because I live in the city. there is really no place to sit & eat here. It is very small, the kitchen takes up the entire restaurant.

7.description: Just as good as the first one!Sometimes when restaurants open a second or multiple locations, I find that the quality and/or concept of the original gets lost. Not in this case! The Roost is my favorite chicken place in the city and this new location serves the exact same food. It's nice that they are opposite sides of tow and this one has a pick up window. Also this location is easily accessible by public transportation, unlike the original. I have gotten the biscuit sandwiches and the chicken dinners, and it's all amazing. I've been to Nashville and I dare say this chicken is better than the hot chicken I've had there. But that's just my opinion. No matter what chicken dish you get, make sure to try the peach cobbler or bread pudding. They are equally as good as the chicken!

49.description: Add me to the list of those who love this place, we got the hillbilly tacos, nashville spicy plus every kind of side they had. it was awesome, I would return to try the desserts.The wait is a bit on the long side, but its nice to know everything is fresh to death, I keep getting chips instead of fries, unless these guys are from the English side of the Carolina's ain't no crisps up in hurr. Mac and cheese is great, love that they have the cherry wine soda and the slaw is incredible. I will keep coming back. its nice to sit outside and eat some fried crap then go shoot pool at city pool hall next door.

40.description: I took a leap of faith grabbing a bite here without knowing much about the joint. I must also preface that I am a bit of a Mexican't when it comes to spice, you see I'm lacking the spicy food loving gene in my Mexican roots.  So when it comes to anything really spicy I tend to opt out but today, the sun was shining, I was hungry and the chicken smelled deeelish!   The only reason this place got only 4 stars was the wait, which is clearly stated but I'm not a patient person and with only one other person waiting on food I think 10-15 min is a bit much but then again, did I mention I wasn't a patient person? ;) so onto the grub: they have a sign on the door that states something to the affect of best biscuits in town says everyone. That is quite a bold statement so of course I had to try one of these alleged best biscuits, and boy was I not disappointed. These are the best biscuits ever! So flaky, buttery, flavorful and just plain delicious. I went with the chicken tenders since I was on the road and didn't want to deal with bones.  They don't give you an option for spice level with the tenders as they do the regular chicken and I'm guessing it's just the standard medium to hot. So I was taking a spicy gamble when I ordered them.  I will say they have a bit of a kick but not too overpowering, just enough for a great spicy flavor and was easily calmed down by honey as a dipping sauce. I'm a dessert whore so I wanted to grab something a little sweet and opted for the peach cobbler. This was the only real disappointment of my meal while decent, it was just that, decent. I will for sure be back to try some of the other chicken options as well as the appealing breakfast menu, this place looks like it's here to stay if only they could get those wait times down it would be 5 stars in my book.

53.description: Well, the potato chips are really good.  They ended up being the main course of my first meal from The Roost.Had high expectations since they've been included on "best fried chicken in Chicago" lists.  Turned out to be a huge disappointment.  To begin, the online ordering service they use is terrible.  Ordered a 1/4 Herb Seasoned Fried Chicken Meal.  You're presented with the option of white, dark, or mixed,  I chose mixed, assuming the white would be a breast.  Nope.  Received the smallest thigh and wing ever.  Both pieces were mostly bone and breading.  What few bites of chicken I did have tasted ok.  The breading is very thick, and very intensely seasoned.  The mac and cheese is ok, but tastes like it's made with Velveeta.  The biscuits were under-baked and tasted raw.  Probably would have been good had then been baked longer.  They shorted us a coleslaw side.  The lids were not secured on the foil containers.  Just barely holding on.  How lazy can somebody get?  Haven't tried the desserts yet, but not holding out much hope.Not sure if the problem is because this Roost location is so new, or if this is as good as it gets, but we don't plan on finding out.

30.description: Thumbs up for this place!  Solved my craving for really good fried chicken.  A little patience required for the food if eating in but it gave ample time for good conversation with my colleagues.

46.description: I really like this place. The good is good but the chicken can be dry some times. The spicy chicken biscuit really isn't that spicy if you like spicy food. Its a bit pricey. The Mac and cheese was probably the best thing out of everything. The biscuit is also good as well. The Chipotle sauce is okay but can be a little over powering. But overall good food. I did leave my green blender bottle there though :(

1.description: Spicy chicken sandwich w everything and slice of cheddar on a buttermilk biscuit. The biscuit was delicious crispy crunch in the dark spot nice n buttery. The chicken was fresh and crisp not overpowering spice just a little kick. The downfall I would only get this w a piece of chicken and biscuit w a slice of cheese I felt the slaw took away from the sandwich and made it soggy and the pickles were okay. Everyone has there own version of Mac n cheese this taste just like the one I make called 7 min Mac n cheese from all recipes.com. It's good but again I make the same version at home. It's very creamy and Rich alittle goes a long way. The peach cobbler was good sweet on the softer side not so much biscuit but it depends your version of cobbler I perfer this style vs a biscuit style. The inside was very clean the staff was welcoming and helpful to myself and all customers coming in. Everything is made to order so if you are in a hurry I would call ahead it was a 12 min wait at 2pm on a Sunday and they were busy for a cold wintery mix outside. The price was fair for the area and the amount of food you did receive. Would I go back yes for the biscuits and chicken not for the sides or dessert. Two things I can make at home in the amount of time it would take me to walk there.  Other than that great place definitely try at least once.

55.description: Lol, i have been back here now , oh quite a few times.. the Roost has me hooked; any  comments about service being slow, well, you come here for the food, the folks are friendly and by the time you get your food, it is phenomenal.

9.description: 4.5 stars. After hitting up Hot chicken in Nashville(which bar none may actually be my favorite meal of all time), I have perpetually been on the search for comparable chicken without the drive down South. Heard good things about this spot and wondered it was really comparable to true southern cooking. Verdict: Hattie B's is still better, but with the Roost just over a mile a way(and almost as delicious), I'm not gonna be booking any tickets to Tennessee anytime soon.Menu is pretty standard for hot chicken. You can order bone-in chicken, in 1/4 or 1/2 bird sizes, or you can order a chicken and biscuit sandwich. These can be standalone or come as a meal, with two sides(or one side and one dessert if you want to upgrade). I was hungry so I opted for the 1/2 bird w/mac n' cheese and a biscuit, Nashville hot(that's sort of a given). The Mac n' cheese was solid, and the biscuit was soft and flaky, but the chicken though...thank you Poultry Jesus. Made to order, and crispy as ever, the flavor, texture, and general messiness was all there. All my friends who went also said great things about the biscuit sandwich, which foodporn just to watch them make. Deliciously spiced fried chicken, cole slaw, cheese, pickles, and sauce piled high. Also, there's a blowtorch. Because nothing says gourmet chicken sandwich like melty cheese to order.

26.description: 4.5 stars. After hitting up Hot chicken in Nashville(which bar none may actually be my favorite meal of all time), I have perpetually been on the search for comparable chicken without the drive down South. Heard good things about this spot and wondered it was really comparable to true southern cooking. Verdict: Hattie B's is still better, but with the Roost just over a mile a way(and almost as delicious), I'm not gonna be booking any tickets to Tennessee anytime soon.Menu is pretty standard for hot chicken. You can order bone-in chicken, in 1/4 or 1/2 bird sizes, or you can order a chicken and biscuit sandwich. These can be standalone or come as a meal, with two sides(or one side and one dessert if you want to upgrade). I was hungry so I opted for the 1/2 bird w/mac n' cheese and a biscuit, Nashville hot(that's sort of a given). The Mac n' cheese was solid, and the biscuit was soft and flaky, but the chicken though...thank you Poultry Jesus. Made to order, and crispy as ever, the flavor, texture, and general messiness was all there. All my friends who went also said great things about the biscuit sandwich, which foodporn just to watch them make. Deliciously spiced fried chicken, cole slaw, cheese, pickles, and sauce piled high. Also, there's a blowtorch. Because nothing says gourmet chicken sandwich like melty cheese to order.

25.description: Probably my favorite fried chicken in Chicago and one of my favorite places in general. Chicken is made fresh to order and it's very juicy. Great take-out in River West. I didn't notice a difference in food from either location. I really like the spices on the breading and how crispy it is. I usually go with the "Spicy" or "Nashville Hot" Fried Chicken. "Spicy" has good flavor, but not a ton of heat, whereas the "Nashville" had me grabbing milk. I get both when I go back. The sides are good, but I usually stick to the 1/2 Bird by itself. The Chicken itself has a ton of meat, not a lot of gristle. Yeah it's awesome.

12.description: Living just a few blocks away, I stopped in on Monday, January 18th.First, let's start with the good.  Awesome fried chicken!  In fact, I would say it was cooked near perfect with great flavor.On the flip side, I have a few critiques.- It would be far better to more accurately manage consumer's expectations by letting them know it takes at least 25-30 minutes to receive food fired to order.  The sign at the register politely mentions a wait of "at least 10 minutes", but my experience was 30-35 minutes.  From now on I will only be calling in for carry-out, and not dining at the location.  Also, there were three gentlemen who had ordered prior to my arrival, seeming equally confused about the order time.  Furthermore, all four orders came out together.  I'm not sure how long those guys were waiting before me, but seemed pretty settled in.- Portions are inaccurate .  If I'm ordering a 1/4 bird, which is advertised as two pieces, I should be getting a 1/4 of a butchered bird's yield.  Watching one of the cooks breaking down the chicken in the back, the portions are nowhere near large enough to be provide two pieces making up 1/4 of a bird.  I also experienced quite small pieces in my order, 1 drumstick, and 1 drumete with knuckle meat.  Not sure if economics are at play here, but I would happily pay a buck or two more to get what I thought I was paying for.For sides, I ordered mac 'n cheese and a biscuit.  The biscuit was quite delicious.  The mac was just ok, too mild in my opinion.  I can actually see the mild flavor being advantageous with the super spicy options.In conclusion, I'm sincerely torn, 4 star food, but 1-2 star experience.  Right now, I will only being stopping by randomly, and with far lower expectations.  This place has potential to be so much better.

21.description: I have been meaning to try this place for a while since I had seen that the old pizza spot was gone and hadn't gotten a chance to check that place out. I finally got in and place my order with a very nice and friendly girl at the front, and she really helped me out with deciding on the peach cobbler. Let me tell you it was a good decision maybe not on the caloric intake part, but it was delish. I decided on the half the bird and I'm not sure how I ended up getting 2 wings instead of a drumstick so that was kind of bummer. I didn't get to choose on the substitution in that case which was disappointing. The prices were reasonable. The coleslaw was also very good. I really like the spicy breading they do which requires no hot sauce dipping on the side. I'm sure I'll be back again.

17.description: Just as amazing as their original location on Irving Park Blvd. The only negative is that they only have 3 tables, so the seated is very limited.

10.description: Some of the best mac and cheese I've eaten in the city. The biscuits are fresh, and the chicken is terrific. It's a small space, so call ahead and order.

5.description: Great Fried Chicken- and Cheerwine- what more do you need to know- well, 1 thing- call ahead and place your order- tight quarters- maybe best to take it to go- or maybe in the nicer weather, they will have a set up to eat outdoors- although kind of  some dusty roads on that little corner for eating outdoors at this location.

3.description: Tiny restaurant, simple menu, perfectly delicious!I had the spicy chicken biscuit sandwich, it was a bit messy to eat but the biscuit was a flakey pillow of dough - sooooo good! The chicken was crispy on the outside but still juicy on the inside and not too spicy. The Mac and cheese was solid. I tasted a bite of the Nashville hot, Mmmh great kick!

35.description: Wow! I normally wouldn't hit a fried chicken place, but I decided to try this new place on a lunch break in the neighborhood. I was completely blown away! I had the spicy chicken sandwich on a buttermilk biscuit, and it was hands down one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. This place is oddly hidden away despite being near the Grand Blue Line station and Grand, Milwaukee, and Halsted bus lines, but it is totally worth seeking out this little corner place.

19.description: Hands down the BEST chicken sandwich I've ever had! Went with the spicy chicken (just the right amount of spice) topped with pickles and cheddar cheese, the chicken was fresh and juicy as were  the toppings that added an extra umph. You can choose from just the sandwich or a meal that comes with TWO sides. I picked the cheeeeeeeesy macNcheese and baked chips both a nice complement to the sandwich. The restaurant it self is small so we got it to go and was still good once we got settled. You really won't be able to find a better chicken sandwich, so go get one!!

28.description: Stopped by on Milwaukee/Hubbard- First time customer and now forever customer. Picked up a spicy chicken biscuit sandwich w everything defuckinglicious!! Crispy on the out n moist inside, coleslaw is excellent, pickles n cheese. Had it w a cup of coffee, oh marone!! It was good. Sad I'm gonna lose it all in the process of digestion.

45.description: This is basically a yuppified Harold's chicken, which isn't a necessarily a bad thing.   I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich w/ Cole slaw and Mac and cheese.   It was pretty good the slaw wasn't as sweet as I usually like but that might be a good thing. Like Harold I would recommend ordering ahead of time.

33.description: These are the best biscuits I've ever eaten.  Nice people too.

43.description: Great food but they need to work on the speed. I've been twice and waited way longer than I should have for a chicken sandwich - about a half hour. Other people in there look equally frustrated. I even tried calling ahead of time and I still sat in there waiting.

2.description: First time to Chicago and the first place I get taken was here. Having traveled quite a bit through the south and have had numerous chicken an a biscuit meals, this one here definitely holds it own with the good ole southern styles. Not to mention it's fried when you order an not sitting under a light. So be prepared to wait or call it in earlier I went with the Memphis heat and it ain't for the faint at heart. It's got dayum good flavor along with a pretty good luck of heat to go along with it. Had the mac an cheese and the fried chips for my side and they both were pretty well spot on. If you find yourself wanting a taste of the South, I would definitely not think twice bout this joint here.

18.description: I have been meaning to try this place for a while since I had seen that the old pizza spot was gone and hadn't gotten a chance to check that place out. I finally got in and place my order with a very nice and friendly girl at the front, and she really helped me out with deciding on the peach cobbler. Let me tell you it was a good decision maybe not on the caloric intake part, but it was delish. I decided on the half the bird and I'm not sure how I ended up getting 2 wings instead of a drumstick so that was kind of bummer. I didn't get to choose on the substitution in that case which was disappointing. The prices were reasonable. The coleslaw was also very good. I really like the spicy breading they do which requires no hot sauce dipping on the side. I'm sure I'll be back again.

41.description: I have never had Carolina fried chicken but if it is this good I may move there...or at least visit. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich on a biscuit with chips & peach cobbler for dessert. I was warned the Nashville spicy was very spicy so I figured to judge it fairly I wanted it bland.  The biscuit was good flaky yet doughy, the chicken was fried with a crunch yet tender on the inside. The chips were very good but the peach cobbler was heavenly the only problem was I didn't have any vanilla ice cream. It is good to eat out and only regret the calories and not paying for bad food! A must visit if you are in the area!!

52.description: This fried chicken spot is fire, and not just their spicy Nashville hot chicken. I mean it is the best damned fried chicken in town. This is moist, juicy, flavorful, and never disappointing. I can't get enough. I might need rehab for this one. Ma'ma, I'm sorry, but I'm a roost chicken addict. Please take me away. If you can't hit this spot, get to the food truck, or the northside (irving and ashland)

50.description: As always good food but this was my first time to the new location. It's is smalls but the service was exceptional.

4.description: Soooo...it all started when I overslept this morning and missed my workout:/. It was all downhill from there. Huge, buttery, almond croissant for breakfast...and then this happened.I was scouring yelp for some westloop eats for lunch. Stumbled upon this 4.5 star gem about a mile from work and decided to call in an order. I ordered the Nashville hot chicken sandwich on a buttermilk biscuit with pickles and chipotle buttermilk ranch on the side. No sides(I already missed the gym! Didn't want to go overboard!) It was delicious!! Upon the first bite it was spicy but didn't seem overwhelming. With each subsequent bite, however, the spice compounded and got stronger and hotter. The buttermilk biscuit was perfect in consistency and held together nicely as I went to town, swiftly inhaling the sandwich. The chipotle ranch was a nice addition, but the sandwich can definitely stand up on its own without it, too. I'm not done. It gets better. In comes the HOT peach cobbler that I also ordered. Perfection! The peaches tasted uber fresh. It had the perfect balance of sweetness. Perfect balance of crust to peaches ratio. Simply delicious and a nice portion size to boot! I'm good and full right now, trying to fight the afternoon, post lunch, sleep monster:/I'll definitely be back to try the sides and other menu options. Glad I found this place!

6.description: This place is pretty tiny inside and there's a chance there might not be enough counter space for you to eat there. It takes at least 10 minutes for them to cook, so don't expect to get in and out really fast. Their fried chicken is pretty good. The meat is juicy and the skin is crunchy, however, the breading is a little on the oily side. The buttermilk milk biscuits are fluffy and buttery, but they crumble a little too easily. I thought the mac and cheese was a bit bland and the cucumber slaw was refreshing. And in case you were wondering, the nashville hot is spicier than the spicy chicken. It may not be my favorite fried chicken, but it's still a decent option for that area.

22.description: Just as amazing as their original location on Irving Park Blvd. The only negative is that they only have 3 tables, so the seated is very limited.

15.description: Had the tacos-filled with a hot piece of herbed fried chicken and topped with slaw, chipotle ranch and a piece of melted sharp cheddar. You also get to choose two sides-I got the coleslaw and the biscuit. From now on I don't think I can ever go there without getting 1+biscuits-it was soft, fluffy and buttery. Friends tried the chicken on a biscuit sandwich meals and we're pleased with the peach cobbler and creamy Mac n'cheese. Only the slaw was lackluster. Everything else was amazing.

57.description: Just as good as the first one!Sometimes when restaurants open a second or multiple locations, I find that the quality and/or concept of the original gets lost. Not in this case! The Roost is my favorite chicken place in the city and this new location serves the exact same food. It's nice that they are opposite sides of tow and this one has a pick up window. Also this location is easily accessible by public transportation, unlike the original. I have gotten the biscuit sandwiches and the chicken dinners, and it's all amazing. I've been to Nashville and I dare say this chicken is better than the hot chicken I've had there. But that's just my opinion. No matter what chicken dish you get, make sure to try the peach cobbler or bread pudding. They are equally as good as the chicken!

20.description: The biscuits are to DIE for! We love coming here for a quick bite. My husband loves the chicken and we definitely tell our friends and family about this place every time they come and  visit.

36.description: I moved to the area just a few weeks before Toni's closed, and was very sad to see it go. Hadn't heard of Roost before they moved in, but holy moly, this place is fantastic.Breakfast: Went with Ali (Nashville hot chicken, pickles, egg). Amazing. The biscuit is already falling apart by the time you get it, but that's because there's so much deliciousness inside.Dinner: Nashville hot on a bun with ranch/coleslaw/pickles and more coleslaw/mac and cheese on the side. Pretty solid deal for $10 out the door. Coleslaw does the job and the mac and cheese is as decadent as you'd want it.They do cook to order, so call ahead if you're in a hurry. But this is definitely the place to go for fried chicken.

14.description: I moved to the area just a few weeks before Toni's closed, and was very sad to see it go. Hadn't heard of Roost before they moved in, but holy moly, this place is fantastic.Breakfast: Went with Ali (Nashville hot chicken, pickles, egg). Amazing. The biscuit is already falling apart by the time you get it, but that's because there's so much deliciousness inside.Dinner: Nashville hot on a bun with ranch/coleslaw/pickles and more coleslaw/mac and cheese on the side. Pretty solid deal for $10 out the door. Coleslaw does the job and the mac and cheese is as decadent as you'd want it.They do cook to order, so call ahead if you're in a hurry. But this is definitely the place to go for fried chicken.

58.description: Well, leave it up to Yelp to help me find yet another perfect spot.  Just moved back and picked them based on the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint.  Called Friday and was able to squeeze in on Saturday.  Granted I am a guy and the difficulty of cutting my hair is pretty basic but Leslie did a great job.  It's awesome to nail it the first time and never look back.  Thank you Yelp and Leslie!  Awesome Sauce.FYI:  You can't tip on the Credit Card, bring some bills.

56.description: After an unfortunate incident wherein I found myself at an Airbnb apartment equipped with bachelor-esque amenities (bottle of Head & Shoulders + used bar of soap), my scalp was literally itching for a professional blowout and some TLC courtesy of a round brush and fierce scalp massage.I was able to make what essentially amounted to a walk-in appointment (I called an hour before closing) after searching for blowouts in Wicker Park on Yelp, and Shelly did me soooo right. She gave me a perfect blowout that resulted in four days' worth of compliments and inquiries into my hair colour, cut (of which I hadn't had either at Robert Jeffrey), probably thanks to the thorough washing and smoothing Shelly gave me. Once my hair was dry and sleeker than I'd seen in months, Shelly noticed I needed a bang trim so she gave me a quick one (my bangs have never looked better!) and then had the nerve to only ring me up for $35 for the whole shebang (I'm assuming $30 for the shoulder-length blowout and $5 for the trim). An absolute steal, and you can bet when I return to Chicago for summer music fests I'll be paying this salon another visit for a blowout!

29.description: Moving to Chicago was great... having to find a new "person" for my locks was not something I was looking forward to. Robert Jeffrey and Megan at the Wicker Park location were and continue to be equal to the task!! She is easy going, does exactly what you want or gives input depending on what mood you are in that day, effortless convo, and does a great job keeping my highlights and cut fancy fresh! Once I totally spaced and missed an appointment and they were so nice and understanding about it. They never push product on you either which is atypical for a salon of this caliber.  Always try to and do fit me in when I inevitably schedule last minute. Would recommend Megan and the salon to anyone!

42.description: Annie is the best! She's been cutting my hair for the two years I've lived in Chicago.  She carefully guided me as I grew out a super short cut. Amazingly, from pixie length to below the shoulders, my haircuts were always great. In complete earnestness, Annie is a magician. Actually she's a super smart, sweet professional who knows her stuff. Today she colored my hair for the first time and she did an amazing job. She's brilliant.

23.description: This place is fantastic... it always has been.  The previous salon at this location TRIO was wonderful and I wasn't sure how Robert Jeffrey would do once taking over.  They have surpassed my expectations and I will continuing getting my hair done here.  My favorite stylist is Christie - She is fantastic.  I have really thick, course ethnic hair and she has mastered cutting it.  She has given me both long-layered hair cuts and medium to short and always manages to make my hair look fabulous.  In addition I have come to find out what an amazing colorist Christie has become.  I went from hair jet black, over-processed hair, which I thought would have to be cut off or stripped.  Without stripping it or damaging it any further, Christie got me back to a light to medium brunette.  Absolutely love Christie and Robert Jefrey Hair.Let me add... the staff here is incrediably friendly and I have taken notice as to how well they work together.  This place get fives stars!

47.description: I couldn't have been more impressed. I had an appointment with Megan for a partial highlight and cut. Not only did the services exceed my expectations but she offered me useful advice about hair care throughout the appointment! The interior of the salon isn't any fancy but it gets the job done. Overall, fantastic experience!

8.description: Love Love Love KATE at Robert Jeffrey!!!I want to start out saying my hair is very important to me....so when it comes to choosing a stylist I am very Particular.  After having the same stylist for 8 years I decided to make a change due to budgetary reasons.  My hair was costing me $300 every 6 weeks....My friend referred me to Kate.  Since my friend had great hair, I decided to give her a try.My hair is 90% gray, wavy, extremely thick...and has been dyed dark brown for about 10+years.  In an effort to reduce the obvious gray re-growth we decided to give being  blonde a try.  The first day was time consuming.....She spent 7 hours on my hair  and 3 hours the second visit. It looks like I was always a natural blonde....Quite a feat.I would highly recommend Kate for Color, Color Correction, and a great haircut.

31.description: Annie is fantastic! She's one of the best stylists I've been to in my whole life. She does a phenomenal job on my hair, is never rushed, and takes time to get everything completely the way that I like it. I would highly, highly recommend her!

34.description: Love getting my hair cut by Meagan. She always listens to what I want and does a fantastic job with the actual cut. Plus, she gives a great shampoo...my favorite part of getting my hair cut. I am not usually very talkative during haircuts, mostly because I think it feels great and like to just relax during. Meagan doesn't make me feel uncomfortable in silences where some stylists just have to talk the entire time they are cutting your hair.I have referred my roomie and my boyfriend to Meagan. Go see her!

16.description: Elida is the absolute best!! Exceeds your  expectations every time!! The best stylist I've ever been to!

13.description: This was my first time here at RJ and I have a great experience. My stylist was Christie and she did an awesome job. She was super nice and gave me exactly what I asked for. I have pretty long hair so I typically just cut a few inches and re-layer but she took her time and made my hair look fab. The Bumble products they use are great. One that I wanted was out of stock and they took my number down to call me when it's back in. Really good customer service. I would definitely recommend and have already set my next appointment.

11.description: Elida is excellent at what she does! Always knows how to pick out the best and cutest ideas for you! I came in wanting a basic plain color and I left with a dark red balayage that I absolutely love! 100% happy with my visit and will be back again soon! Everyone go see Elida!!! :)

39.description: Awesome.  GREAT Men's haircut.  I've been to several salons in Bucktown and this is by far the best.

37.description: After a year of self-inflicted punk buzz cuts, I finally decided to grow my hair out.  A few months of this resulted in a truly horrific growing-out-your-hair-mullet, so I gave this salon a call.  They managed to fit me in for an appointment the same day, which was really niceMeagan was fantastic--I'm TERRIBLE at describing what I want done with my hair, but she took my vague "kinda short, but, like, shaped, and I guess a trim" and produced the cutest haircut I've had in years.  I was doing the check-myself-out-in-windows all the way home.  Well worth the money and right off the Blue Line--I'll be coming back!

0.description: I got a really great haircut here from Tori. Now, I have a history of mega tears when I don't like my hair. My husband gets nervous every time I make a hair appointment because of the probabillity of needing to comfort me afterwards. Let's just say he was super relieved to get my excited texts from Tori's chair.  I'm not proud, but I'm sharing to provide context....Anyways, I wanted a trim and some highlights. Trying to learn from past experiences, I showed Tori not only pics of what I was looking for, but also some examples of what I did NOT want. This seemed to be very helpful. I really love how my hair came out! She somehow managed to synthesize the various pictures and my probably confusing explanations to create the look I wanted. As a bonus, Tori is very sweet and personable. The price is reasonable. I will return.

38.description: First experience trying out a salon in Chicago after moving from LA & being reluctant to try a new place. Received a simple cut & style from Annie. What I liked most about this experience was how she gave me tips on how to style my hair throughout the process & did not push me to cut off more of my hair then I wanted to (as hairdressers often do). Love that they carry Moroccan Oil products. Extremely reasonable prices... they offer 20% off for your first visit!

51.description: Meagan cut and colored my hair for the three years that I lived in Chicago and she is amazing! I now live in San Francisco but still go to see her every time i'm in town, even if its just for a fabulous blow out before going out. This past weekend we took it to the next level and had Meagan do all of the hair for my sister's wedding. She did everything from updo's to sleek bobs and soft curls and everyone looked FABULOUS and loved their hair. Meagan is the bomb. End of story.

27.description: CJ is awesome, I've gone to him a few times. He always listens to what I would like and offers his own ideas as well. Great skills, and great conversation- thanks CJ!

32.description: I'm addicted to the Keratin treatments, and I saw online that they did the Keratin Express for $99, which is a fair, standard price.The stylist did an excellent job, and the staff was very professional and friendly.When I went to check out, I was told that it would be $125.  I was told that the website was "under construction" and was going to be under construction for the next month or so.  I picked up a price card in front of me and I didn't see that price anywhere either.  I asked the lady at the front desk how people are supposed to know the prices.  She simply repeated that the website is the best avenue, but will take up to a month to reflect accurate prices.  No where on the website does it say that it is in the process of being modified, and who knows how long it has been "under construction".  I hate that salons are so elusive with their prices, and one of the things that this place is known for is it's "fair" prices.I tipped the stylist, paid and left.  I was clearly frustrated.  I received a call shortly thereafter apologizing for the misinformation, and that they were going to honor the listed price.Conclusion:The services were great, but I think people should know to expect at least a 25% mark-up on prices listed on the website.  It may be a good idea to call and double-check the pricing within the "next month or so".

54.description: Simply put, Jen Levi is dream come true for gals with curly hair.

48.description: Meagan is the best stylist at Robert Jeffrey!  I see her for regular haircuts and she always does an amazing job.  Plus she is hilarious so we always have lots of fun when I'm there.  Naturally I asked her to do my hair for my wedding.  She told me on the big day that she had been practicing in her free time how to achieve updo perfection for me...I mean, that is above and beyond!  It turned out so perfect, exactly how I pictured my hair to look on my wedding day.  And she did a fabulous job on all the girls and mothers too.  I love Meagan, book an appointment with her today!

44.description: This one's for you CJ!I'm new to the city and was in desperate need of a trim.  After checking out other Yelp reviews for salons in the neighborhood I settled on Robert Jeffrey.  I left a VM on Tuesday morning and was called back that afternoon and got booked for the coming Saturday.  Kaitlyn (?) asked who I wanted to see but since the reviews for all the stylists were so great I told her I was indifferent so we booked for CJ.When I arrived I was immediately greeted by the two sweet ladies at the front desk who took my coat and made me a cup of coffee.  Just a couple minutes later CJ was ready for me and did his magic.  Like I said, I just needed a trim and told CJ as much.  I'm usually pretty carefree when it comes to my hair so I asked just that we keep as much length as possible.  CJ did not only that but made my hair look SO healthy and light.  Needless to say, I'm VERY happy with the experience and will definitely be going back.  The price was fair, the salon was clean, light and airy, and CJ was nice as could be.  Even got a few recommendations of other places in the neighborhood to check out.

24.description: The absolute worst haircut I've ever gotten. I made an appointment the evening before my appointment. They scheduled me for 11am even though they didn't actually open until noon. I ended up going in at noon and was very understanding and forgiving about the mix up. When I actually sat down for the haircut I was excited to try something new. I showed the stylist various photos of EXACTLY what I wanted. My hair was originally a little bit above the top of my waist. I asked her to please only cut it so it was touching my shoulders and still pretty long. A long bob is what I was essentially going for. 3-4 inches is at most what I expected. She instead cut about 6 inches, way above my shoulders. My hair now lays somewhere below my chin at my neck. I hated it as soon as she finished and I grow even more upset as the days go on. So, three days later and I'm still fuming. Perhaps others have good luck here. I will never return.

7.description: I saw Kate last week for the standard cut I request when I go to salons--cut the dead ends and trim my layers. While I know it's nothing crazy, I'm really happy with my cut. I thought I had just lost my natural wave over the past few years, but apparently I just hadn't been to see Kate.
