I've bounced all over salons since coming to the city a few years ago and have never returned to a stylist. However I'll definitely be returning to Kate in the future. Thank you for bringing back my natural waves!

49.description: Annie is the best colorist I've been to in the Chicago area at any price and experience level. My sensitive skin issues don't exist here.  Not sure what magic Annie puts in the color,  but it works.  For years I wanted my blonde to somehow mix with my very white gray.  No no no is all I heard until Annie.  Again, it is magic and the most complimented color I've had on this old head of mine.  Thank you Annie!

40.description: I am only writing this because I am moving out of state and can now let out the secret of how great this place is. After hating Art + Science (so pretentious) I have been coming here since it was Trio (RIP) and tried a number of the stylists that were alright before finding Jen, my hair soul mate, another jew from Boulder. Seriously, she's the cutest thing ever and has that enviable hipster look with just one too many mismatched accessories that somehow works that so very few can pull off. She's damn good at wavy hair, and I even trusted her to do bangs, which I never thought I would let anyone do. Always a perfect cut and love the Moroccan oil products they use. I will miss you guys!

53.description: I have been to RJ many times.  I have never had such great service as I have here!! Sandra Huizar does my hair and she is amazing! I used to get my hair done somewhere else and the girl COMPLETELY ruined my hair! Thank God Sandra caught me just in time.  My hair still needs more time, but because of Sandra, I can see such a difference! All the workers there are super friendly and I never feel uncomfortable there.  RJ always has beverages for you while getting your hair done, they always have smiles on their faces, and it is in a great friendly neighborhood.  Go to RJ to get your hair done! You will not regret it! Sandra is amazing and loves what she does, but you can tell her coworkers are the same!! Thanks Robert Jeffrey!!!!!! =)

30.description: Christy is great! I called in for an appointment last minute Saturday AM, and they were able to schedule me with herabout an hour later. She was professional, attentive and made it her top priority to give me a great cut and comfortable experience. I love my haircut, and will definitely go back to her.

46.description: This place was beyond wonderful. Meagan is a sweetheart who not only fixed the disaster that my hair was before, but also made it look really good for my face and for its texture. She only charged me half because she mainly cut the front part and also gave me samples to take home so my hair would stay pretty. I am so glad to have found an amazing, well-priced salon here in the neighborhood. What a lovely lady and a great experience.

1.description: I had not visited any salons, since moving to WP.  The ease of online booking, the positive reviews, the reasonable prices, and being opened on a Sunday is what brought me IN... What will bring me BACK is the great experience I had there! It had a calm atmosphere with staff that all seemed very friendly. Elida cut my hair, and she was wonderful! She asked questions to ensure I would get what I wanted, and gave honest feedback when I asked for her opinion. She was gentle through the entire process and easy to talk to. Not to mention, I left loving my hair! I definitely would recommend her!

55.description: Having come from five years of terrible men's haircuts by the haircuttery I thought that the only way to get a good haircut was to spend over $50.  Not so.  I get my hair cut by ANNIE every time and I've always been really happy with it.  Not only does she give great affordable haircuts but she is super friendly.  I never have a problem getting an appointment within a reasonable amount of time and I certainly will never have to look anywhere else for a haircut as long as I'm in the city.  This place has earned its five star rating.

9.description: Kristen is my TV hair superstar. She's been with me for over 5 years and has taken my hair to the next level.

26.description: I always compare looking for a hair stylist to looking for a boyfriend.  It is just as hard to find someone who understand your sense of style and aesthetic.  I am very glad to say that I have found MY stylist in Chicago.  Jen is an amazing hair stylist and colorist.  She listens and give you what you ask for (Tips: Bring a picture to show her what you are trying to achieve).  I have been going to her for 2 years, and I always get compliments for my hair.  I have thick dark Asian hair and I get highlights to give it more dimension.  My highlights are always artfully weaved in that gives my hair some "natural" dimension.  I have recommended friends of different ethnicity to give her a try and I always come back with positive feedback.  She is also an awesome person and give you really good product advice is you need anything.  I absolutely love everything she recommended me so far.

25.description: Mariah did an amazing job ! She is a fellow blonde and knows the deal w highlights ! No stripes no brassyness and gets close to the scalp w bleach. She made it look natural and gave great dimension. She was super chill and not awkward at all. Robert Jeffery salon is lucky to have her! Good job Mariah ! I'll be back -

12.description: Nicole, the friendly and considerate woman who answered the phone when I called and Elida the stylist who gave me my hair back really saved the day! I was having the worst day ever, it started with a terrible customer service experience at a different salon that brought me to tears and it ended with Elida at Robert Jeffrey  making me feel beautiful again. I had never been to this salon before but I'll be a regular now. I was scrambling hoping by some small chance some salon in the city would be able to get me in on very short notice to put in tape in hair extensions (no small task) so that I wouldn't have to spend a single day out in the world feeling bald and ugly and Elida agreed to see me within hours. I even showed up to the appt without the tape! And had to rush back home to get it making myself half an hour late (I was such a mess!) but Elida was nothing but kind and willing to help! She worked with me on everything and was very flexible, she gave me a great deal on the price and she did an EXCELLENT job in placing the extensions! I've had them in a couple times before and always hated how they never quite fell and layered like real hair, I have been to nice top salons and so I just figured this was how it had to be and that maybe my own very thin fine hair was to blame, but this is the first time I've felt that my hair actually looks perfectly layered in with the extensions, they don't look blunt and fake, Elida's placement was perfect! Thanks again to you and all the ladies there for their warm smiles and kindness, their willingness to help someone out and Elida's care and attention to detail and talent! You really saved my day! I highly recommend this salon and Elida for all hair extension needs!

59.description: I can't say enough about Jen Levi.  I recently moved to Chicago and Jen cuts both my hair and my partner's hair.  She's a pro with both of us and we have VERY different hair.  My hair is extremely curly and my partner has bone straight, thick hair.   I was very impressed with the entire experience with Jen but I think I was most impressed with her consultation.  She really took the time to ask me meaningful questions and really got to know my hair and the way it falls before she even looked at her scissors.  When she did start cutting, she used some great techniques that I had never seen before.  To all you curly-haired people out there -- I am now void of the random, straight-hair fly-aways!  We are so happy to have found Jen; we would follow her anywhere!

21.description: I used a Living Social Deal to try out Robert Jeffrey Hair Studio. I had a fabulous visit.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  My stylist Jaimee (sorry I'm misspelling his name) gave me a wonderful treatment, cut, and blow.  I've not had as good a cut in quite awhile.  Truly appreciate the full service! I hope to be back!

17.description: Went last week for a haircut. It was an "ok" experience. I don't particularly like my haircut but I don't hate it either. It's not exactly what I asked for but hair grows so, oh well. The shampoo-ing kind of felt like I was being baptized... half of my forehead was wet, water was dripping into my ears and down my neck. The woman doing it was a little rough and she seemed rushed. Not a relaxing experience like I've had at most salons. The thing that rubbed me the wrong was, and actually prompted me to write this review, was the front desk associate. She was texting on her phone in plain sight when I walked in (she was also doing this when I checked out) and didn't even put it away when I was right in front of her. She wasn't very warm or welcoming which wasn't ideal since it was my first time at the salon. The other thing I thought odd was that she didn't acknowledge that it was my first time and she didn't ask if I needed to schedule my next haircut or if I needed products. I didn't need to do either but just thought it was odd considering that's usually the protocol for salons and it made me feel like she just wanted me to pay and leave.All said and done, it wasn't terrible but I probably won't be back unless I'm in a bind because it's so close to my apartment.Bottom line: "Ok" experience but I'm not too excited about dropping ~$80 for an "ok" haircut and an "ok experience"

10.description: I got highlights and a trim by Megan today. She knew exactly what I wanted even though I was having difficulty describing what I was looking for. My hair looks great (she really brightened it up) and she's as sweet as can be. I'll definitely be back!

5.description: I am an Atlantan, who travels frequently for work, my hair stylist in ATL is out on Maternity Leave (how dare her have a child!) Le Sigh, my hair was in dire need of a color and cut. I visit Chicago frequently for work, and began reading yelp reviews for different salons. Robert Jeffrey Salon, Wicker Park, has tremendous yelp reviews, and so I went for it. Unfortunately, I had to schedule, re-schedule, & re-schedule AGAIN because of : Flu, Reroute of the plane, and a death in the family. Originally, I was supposed to see Kate, but as I was sitting on the Jumpseat of the plane heading to Chicago, I decided to give it a shot and see if I could be seen last minute. Kate was not available, but Tori was. I said sign me up! I was not sure what to expect, as Tori did not have any reviews on Yelp, but I may or may not have stalked her IG: Tori.RJ and I liked what I saw! So, I hopped my happy self on the blue line, and off I went to Wicker Park.Upon arrival, I was greeted in a friendly manner, the receptionist asked to hang my coat, and asked if I needed anything. I then met Tori, gave her a background of my hair, and let her consult me on what she thought. The consultation was great, she was friendly, matter-of-fact, and listened to what I wanted. I showed her a few pictures, that honestly, confused myself. I wanted dark, but with a bit of ombre, but not blonde, also not red, not to bronzey...the list went on and on. She went to the back, whipped up some color and bam it was PERFECT!Exactly what I wanted, EXACTLY. How is it that I have lived in ATL for 25years, and have not been able to find ONE stylist to do exactly what I want, but I on a whim, book an appointment in Wicker Park on a Monday Afternoon, and its perfect! My hair cut is simple, blunt, straight across, Lob. She nailed that too, Im not sure what is difficult for most stylist to understand when i say, "Keep it simple, keep it blunt, keep it a lob" But apparently a straight across haircut, is HARD. Tori Killed it, in a good way. I am ecstatic with my holiday hair, and WILL absolutely be coming back to see her. Just gives me an excuse to work in Chicago some more.5 stars! From one Tori, to another!

3.description: I'm very picky about my hair, and Danni did an excellent job. She understood my concerns (as silly as they are) and I ended up with very pretty, very healthy looking hair. I would recommend her to anyone that needs color done. My boyfriend had his hair cut by Tori, and she also did an amazing job. She also recommended a type of wax for his hair, which I thought was kind considering that we were completely clueless about what to use. There was also a super nice gentleman that shampooed my hair that educated me on how to take care of my length and what products to use. The salon was beautiful and everyone was helpful. I enjoyed my experience and will definitely return in the future. Thanks guys!

35.description: Another fantastic experience with Shelly. Good conversation, never being too pushy. She is always so good with helping me figure out what I want to do without pressuring me into something I don't want. She also is personal enough to remember what I liked from last time.Thanks for another fantastic visit!

19.description: Love getting my hair cut by Meagan. She always listens to what I want and does a fantastic job with the actual cut. Plus, she gives a great shampoo...my favorite part of getting my hair cut. I am not usually very talkative during haircuts, mostly because I think it feels great and like to just relax during. Meagan doesn't make me feel uncomfortable in silences where some stylists just have to talk the entire time they are cutting your hair.I have referred my roomie and my boyfriend to Meagan. Go see her!

28.description: SANDRA is a GODSEND! She's the best stylist and gives the best blowouts in the city. I'm very particular about blow outs because I feel like most stylists have no idea what they're doing (like you'll end up leaving with damp hair??)Any way, sandra has given me EXACTLY the cut i've wanted every time and I leave with a  big voluminous blow outI recommend her to all my friends and everyone has switched to her and visits her religiously.can't praise her enough! love!

45.description: -MEAGAN-Love this girl. I'm new to the area and have been to a couple of different salons but now I'm home.I came to Meagan for a color correction and she worked wonders. Best part? I told her how much I loathed how my hair hangs on to red and when the color application had a slight tinge of red she set me up to come back the next week to fix, no charge. I didn't even need to bring it up/ask. She is super easy to talk to and I felt very comfortable with her from the start. She is now my girl :)

33.description: appointment based on their excellent yelp reviews.   The receptionist was super nice.  And that is the only positive thing I can say.   The stylist never cane to greet me.  And after waiting 20 minutes AFTER my appointment - with nobody coming over to at least apologize for the wait - I decided to leave.   The stylist told the receptionist (still didn't come to meet a new customer) that it will be 2 minutes.  I left anyway as I figured it was a lie.    HORRENDOUS  first impression

43.description: First time going and last time. I was very unhappy with the hair color they use (Wella I believe). After a week of being there my grey hair was coming through already. The color seemed translucent over the grey roots if that makes sense. The person that did my hair did a good job but I think if you've been doing this for over 5 years you should know what color to use and appropriate processing time to completely cover pesky grey hair or maybe I just need to blame the quality of their hair coloring products.

2.description: At last! I've finally found my go-to salon! I had my hair cut and colored this week by Kristen and it looks so great. The cut was just what I was wanting! It was a drastic change from my long hair to a much shorter cut (right at my shoulders), and it was executed so well. I know who I'll be seeing for my future hair cuts. This was my first time ever coloring my hair and I was slightly nervous for the change, but Kristen made it look so natural! After the the first day with my new color, I wanted to go a little more drastic so Kristen had me come back two days later just to add a few more lighter pieces. It made all the difference in the world and I'm 100% satisfied! I couldn't be any happier with the job and service that I was provided here. I would strongly recommend to anyone looking for a new hair salon!

18.description: I used a Living Social Deal to try out Robert Jeffrey Hair Studio. I had a fabulous visit.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  My stylist Jaimee (sorry I'm misspelling his name) gave me a wonderful treatment, cut, and blow.  I've not had as good a cut in quite awhile.  Truly appreciate the full service! I hope to be back!

41.description: What an awesome salon!  I was impressed right when I walked it with how clean and open it was.  Not to mention it was very busy and everyone in there was smiling and laughing which made the energy in the place so fun! I got my eyebrows waxed by Meagan and that girl knows what she is doing!  Not only did time go by so fast because talking to Meagan is like talking to a long lost best friend, but I have never seen my eyebrows look so good.  Even my roommate noticed them when I got home!  I've also met some other stylist out on the town before and everyone is super friendly and welcoming.  If you want a salon that not only knows what they are doing, but also knows how to treat people try this place out!  You won't be disappointed!

52.description: Shelly is awesome! Normally I hate going to new hair salons because I am very picky with who does my hair due to horrible experiences in the past. I decided to try something new because although my previous hair stylist was nice and good, I just felt a little awkward going there because I wasn't comfortable in the atmosphere. My friend referred me and I also checked out the reviews on yelp for this location.As soon as I walked in I was greeted by Shelly and she also shook my hand (which I think that's a huge plus --- very professional) AND she offered me something to drink. The entire experience was awesome. I felt very comfortable and at ease to ask questions. I did not have to repeat myself as to what I wanted done. She was quick, efficient, and did a wonderful job. My hair turned out amazing! The color fit me perfectly, It wasn't too light or too dark and it blended very well. I am very pleased to have met Shelly as my new official hair stylist :)

50.description: This is probably the best hair cut I have ever had. Thanks, CJ!

4.description: I have now been getting my hair cut (never tried coloring) by Sandra at Robert Jeffrey for four years, and I couldn't be more pleased. She's easy and pleasant to chat with while cutting my hair, and I always leave feeling beautiful. Definitely recommend.

6.description: I have been going to this salon for about 6 months after a referral from a friend to go and see Kate. And she has never disappointed! I have had color twice and 3-4 haircuts, I have loved her haircuts but I am obsessed with her color!   I have been getting blonde highlights for about 15 years and I don't think that my color has ever looked better.  It has such shine and the ombré looks great for all the months between highlights!  She's even encouraged me to step away from my hot rollers and try some different styling methods.  Love Kate and would definitely recommend her to anyone!

22.description: Annie has been my stylist and colorist for 2+ years now. She is seriously talented with short and long hair, and is always ready to do something new to satiate my ever-changing hair preferences. Color-wise, we have done everything from bleach and tones to creative colors (pink and copper last summer) to strawberry blonde. Cut-wise, she always pulls off exactly what I want, even when I come in with only vague ideas. She can even do lines/designs with clippers! She is also just a genuinely wonderful person and a pleasure to be around.

15.description: So so happy with this salon!! I've had my hair done by Elida each time I've come and it's been amazing. She does both my color and cut and I have been extremely happy with it. Even if I don't know how I want it cut she always gives me her opinion. She doesn't push you to buy anything either which is nice. If your looking for a salon that isn't to overly priced with good customer service and good stylists then definitely check out this salon! I recommend Elida, she's one of a kind :)

57.description: I just want to say that Shelly Wilson is awesome at updo's!  Actually she rocks at color and haircutting too.

20.description: The stylist didn't say more than five words to me throughout a two hour highlight and cut and while the color was mediocre, I had to ask her to stop cutting because she was using blunt scissors. Definitely not worth the premium prices.

36.description: When I first moved to Chicago a few years back, I was looking for a great place to get a men's haircut and had no clue where to turn.  Fortunately, I lucked out and came across Jen after reading other yelp reviews.  She gets it right every time, and even when she transitioned from the lakeview location to wicker park, I didn't hesitate for a moment on whether I would travel every month to see her specifically. This is a top notch establishment in every way, and if you're looking for a new place to go for a men's haircut you have no need to look further.

14.description: The absolute worst haircut I've ever gotten. I made an appointment the evening before my appointment. They scheduled me for 11am even though they didn't actually open until noon. I ended up going in at noon and was very understanding and forgiving about the mix up. When I actually sat down for the haircut I was excited to try something new. I showed the stylist various photos of EXACTLY what I wanted. My hair was originally a little bit above the top of my waist. I asked her to please only cut it so it was touching my shoulders and still pretty long. A long bob is what I was essentially going for. 3-4 inches is at most what I expected. She instead cut about 6 inches, way above my shoulders. My hair now lays somewhere below my chin at my neck. I hated it as soon as she finished and I grow even more upset as the days go on. So, three days later and I'm still fuming. Perhaps others have good luck here. I will never return.

58.description: What the hell is this place?It's like a bar affixed to a train car with tiny tables and 50s pin-up girls on the walls.  As you sit there, it has a "secret clubhouse" feel - the kind of hideout you'd want up in a tree if you were a kid.The place is dark and cramped, so prepare to get cozy.Upon intense advice, I ordered the Three Little Piggy sandwich (double smoked & braised ham, pork tenderloin, bacon, fried egg & gruyere cheese).  I opted out of the fried egg because... well... ew.But this sandwich was a gut-busting bomb of pork pleasure.  Sickeningly enormous.  There's virtually no way to attack this thing without ham escaping out the sides.But it's good.  Really good!  Does my stomach hate me 12 hours later?  Yes.  Would I eat one again?  In a (ham-slowed) heartbeat.I also enjoyed my drink.  I think it was called a Double Ginger Pop.Although this place seems to have fallen out of the sky and wedged itself on an otherwise dead corner of Chicago, I'm sure I'll make the trip out of my way to decimate another herd of swine.Here's video of the meaty beast: eatmedaily.com/2009/02/b…

56.description: I live around the corner and have been eying this place for months on end. Last night, we finally made the visit.DRINKS:The Silver Palm is connected to The Matchbox. They even hand you a cocktail list from The Matchbox when you sit down. I would suggest just about everything on that list. My group of four tried about 6 or 7 different cocktails from the list, and everything was tremendously good. Good serving sizes too - you either get a very tall glass, or a martini glass with a sidecar.FOOD:The food selection here felt fairly limited. It's just one page, front and back. There were only two salad options. I had a Rutherford salad. It was pretty tasty, but the fried avocados tasted kind of gross. I ended up "shucking" them and eating only the avocado inside. AMBIANCE:Love it. Walking into an old school train car is just an exciting thing. They even include a little blurb about the history of the car (yes, it's a real train car -- it used to run the loop between Florida, New York, and Chicago). It's very dark in there, so despite the many tables it still managed to strike an intimate feel.OVERALL:Food selection is iffy, food is okay.Bonus points for drinks and ambiance.Planning to go back for drinks!

29.description: Ralph Wiggum would most certainly Choo-Choo-Choose this place if he had a hankerin' for a fried chicken sandwich. This old railroad car turned restaurant puts one bomb ass bird on a bun. Add the homemade onion rings and you'll def run a train on your dinner! (shout out to Augie from Role Models youtube.com/watch?v=kL-1…)Yes...quarters are close, but the staff is super neighborhood friendly and it is one of the more unique settings in all of Chicago. Definitely worth a stop in if you're ever near Chicago Ave and Ogden.

42.description: Start with a drink at matchbox, Chicago's smallest bar and then dinner in the silver palm, a railroad dining car. All at Chicago and Ogden. Then dining car should rock a little to make you feel like you're moving but the food was good. I had the smoked pork chop which was very good. Most of the menu has recipes from railroad dining cars.

23.description: I was in town checking out a cubs game and saw this spot on a foodie channel and wanted to try it out.I loved the train car as restaurant pretty cool.I ordered the the three piggy and was in awe.Great food one of my favs if ever on a Chi Town trip.

47.description: Get the Three Piggy Sandwich. It will be a good evening.

8.description: This is one of the places along Milwaukee that 'just gets it'.Great drinks, great food (don't overlook the apps or salads, all are fantastic). Typically we order a few things here and there, and share.I prefer the patio, but if its full, just head to the train car, its pretty fun as well.

31.description: Came in the night of the reopening with a friend.[it wouldn't let me do all caps here so read with epic movie trailer voice in mind] For far too long have we been without the three pigs sandwich...While the menu was LARGELY reworked, the sandwich and onion rings remained.Rejoice!!!!

34.description: It may be small but it is worth every second. Food is casual yet 5 star right down to their cheeseburger. Recommed Rutherford salad with fried avocado. Pollo with mashed and poblano peppers with cheese, all sandwiches, and best drinks in Chicago (manhattans and lemon drops). Alex is our favorite server. My fiance and i met and got engaged downstairs at their sister location "The Matchbox.". We can't love it more!

16.description: The food was DELICIOUS, service was fine. However, the experience fell short because the ambient music was being well overpowered by the music the kitchen had going on. The kitchen either had no door or it was kept open and they were blasting their music. Made the experience a bit unpleasant. I wish the server would have either closed the kitchen door or asked the cooks to lower the volume a bit as to not interfere with the dining area.Not to miss: The Three Piggy, quite a heavy yummy meal (stay away from it if you are on a diet!) and mashed potatoes were very good too, with small chunks and skin, not just a puree. Check can get pricey, but the food is great.

13.description: Very consistent restaurant. Food is good every single time. I'm a fan of their side dishes and their cocktails. I come here often now.

11.description: I came here for the first time a few years back for the 3 Pigs sandwich (after seeing it on No Reservations). I've recently moved to the neighborhood and returned to try some of the other sandwich options. I have not been disappointed, as every sandwich has been unique and a step above average (fried chicken sandwich may be the best I have had in the city). The atmosphere is one of a kind as you dine in an old train car, and the Matchbox next door is a great place to grab a drink before or after your meal.

39.description: Traincar setting was really cute & fun to dine in.  Very small but it was something different for sure.  Service was really good.  Our waitress was nice, fast, and made good suggestions.  Fried Chicken was delish!  Friends got the 3 Little Piggy sandwich and said it was good but not amazing.  The duck sandwich was really tasty.  Overall good food and service on the more divey bar side.

37.description: It has a very cool "I'm riding on train to New Orleans, but got delayed for an hour on Chicago Ave. while in the dining car" atmosphere. But then we realized eating on a train can be quite claustrophobic, and we wished we were eating in a big, wide open restaurant with large sunny windows.The vegetarian options are limited. I mean common' this place was featured on Anthony Bourdain's show, so I didn't expect much. However, even the garden sandwich was sloppy and greasy. Overall, the atmosphere is fun for a one time visit, and the food was decent enough pre/post hangover. We don't plan on visiting again, but the bar next door is certainly worth patronizing.

0.description: We do this stuff all the time, go out for a big dinner & hit other spots on the way home. By the time we're on the way home, I am so full I can't breathe! That said, pants unbuttoned or not, I am so very happy we stopped in here!Go big or go home, right?! Right. Here we go! Walking through the front of the house onto the train car was a pretty cool experience. It's not like I've never been on a train before but it felt different. I can't describe it. So we ordered a few of their fancy schmancy drinks (can't remember the names) & off to ordering we went. Here's what we decided to share:Pork belly Asparagus 3 piggyAlright. So , the pork belly wasn't cooked the right way & was very dry. It was nothing like we're used to & I was very disappointed. I was nervous moving on to the 3 piggy after how the pork belly was but fear not, my friend... That sandwich was out of this world! I don't understand how it went from one extreme to the next, but it did & you need to eat it. Like as soon as you can! So although the belly wasn't as amazing as the 3 piggy, I think we'll be back to try other menu offerings. If all else fails, that 3 piggy is worth the stop!

38.description: My fiance and I had our first date at Matchbox, so we thought we'd try the outside seating area at Silver Palm one warm summer night. Worst service I have ever experienced in my life. The waitress was clearly in over her head. But instead of asking the other servers for help, she just yelled at us. Very rude, very unprofessional. We really had no idea if she'd even put our order in for dinner bc we had to shout it at her as she was walking away from our table for only the 2nd time all night. Long story short, we won't be eating here again. At least as long as that bitch is around. We'll stick with the drinks at Matchbox only. They're strong.

51.description: Good value, simple, no fuss food. Huge portions...almost too big. A nice place, although I think the Anthony Bourdain hype is overrated. The ribs are amazing.

27.description: Severely disappointed.  The wait staff was mediocre at best, the steak sandwich (was supposed to be medium) was burned and over cooked.  In the train car, we noticed the staff right next to the kitchen eating food, the glasses- from the mixed drinks to the water glasses-had a very stinky rotten egg smell to them.  My advice:  keep driving.  There are far better places to spend your money and time worth being in.  The train car was an experience,  but the rest:  an experience we'd (my family) would like to forget.

32.description: Bring an enormous appetite and some Tums.I saw this restaurant on a Chicago-centric episode of "No Reservations." Mr. Bourdain's review of the Three Little Pigs sandwich was pretty intriguing, so I gave it a shot.It's just about the greatest sandwich simultaneously on the face of the planet, in the universe, and in the history of the world. It's enormous and stacked with everything you could want to die from eating: double smoked ham, pork tenderloin, bacon, Gruyere cheese, and a fried egg on a brioche bun.If you don't have the stomach of some freaky bastard of science rhinoceros-elephant hybrid, bring a pillow and blanket. Halfway through this sandwich, you'll want to take a nap.We also ordered a tower of onion rings, which was probably a mistake. They were fantastic, but they took up valuable room in my stomach where I could've stuffed more food from the farm.Let's not forget that you're dining in a rail car. It's close quarters to be sure, but it's quaint and adds an element of character to dinner. You won't find a spot like this outside Chicago. Seriously, don't even bother. The Silver Palm is a big, fat bullet point under "Why Is Chicago Awesome?"The only thing I would change is my arrival time. There's a tiny sliver of a bar sharing a spot with The Silver Palm and I really wanted to try it. After we ate, I just wanted to go home and pass out for three straight days.

54.description: Second visit - had the Steak Sandwich.  I don't know if it's just my luck, but between the rubber duckie I had last time and today's steak, I just can't get a lean cut of meat out of these guys.  I hate to throw out this 'old saw', but you'd think a $14 sandwich wouldn't have so much gristley fat in it, duck OR steak.  And what sucks the most is that steak was especially tasty, less the fat.  The tomatillo sauce was good, too.But the wife and kid got their 3 Little Piggies orders just fine.  The service was quick and the beer was cold.  I'm thinking they could go with a bigger serving plate for the 'Piggies' choice than the 9" one they provide.  There was more than enough fries on my steak's plate.  The chicken sandwich we ordered to go tasted great the next day.SP, you STILL need more train memorabilia on your train.  Maybe simulate going through a tunnel once an hour with the lighting/sound!  And get some real lighting in there.  Remember the train scene from "White Christmas"?  At least bring the lumen count up to that much?!!

48.description: Anthony Bourdain was not lying!  Of course I had to go here to try the "3 Little Piggy" sandwich....It did not disappoint!  I can honestly say that this was THE BEST sandwich I've ever eaten before.  On top of that, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere was great!  Just to give you an idea of how good this sandwich is: I at this at aprox 8:30/9pm, went out and drank til 4am on Division and took a cab back to the Silver Palm in hopes I could get my hands on another Three Little Piggy sandwich...needless to say, i did not get my second...I'll be having dreams of that sandwich until I get my hands on another!Goodbye my love; until we meet again...

44.description: The food, drinks, and energy at The Silver Palm is so great.  I have no problem spending an afternoon on the patio or an evening at the bar.  Trino is a den-O-mite bartender!

24.description: When opening a restaurant it's very important to have one idea of what it should be.  Things that seem to have been designed by committee never seem to work, especially when a place like a restaurant, bar, theater or lounge is in question.  Unfortunately it seems that The Silver Palm suffers from a bit of a split personality.  Upon arriving in front of the old school Florida-esque facade, you have a pretty good idea of what might be inside.  However, upon entering the old station bar decor you are greeted with alternative rock and backwards baseball caps.  This can be slightly off putting especially in light of where the rest of the meal might take you.  The dining car portion itself is quite nice and even a tad upscale.  Very much in keeping with the rest of styling (unfortunately however the alternative rock follows you).  The menu is extensive and appealing with a selection of old favorites and some new tricks.  The food however did not seem to be able to cash the checks the decor was writing.This is not to say that I was expecting 5 star food.  This is, after all, a restaurant inside an old railway car.  However, it seemed like perhaps today the shrimp used for the shrimp cocktail had been around for nearly as long as the train car.  The Italian Prime rib was tasty if perhaps a bit large and the Sidecar cocktail I ordered had a novel touch.... a powdered sugar rim.  Certainly not what I was expecting from a restaurant that seems to pride themselves so highly on their bartenders.  Now we come to the biggest split personality of the lot... the pricing.  It seems that while they are trying to capture a more casual atmosphere with the casually dressed staff, patrons and bartenders, they are trying to charge 5 star restaurant money.  A glance at that ever popular far right column on the menu would certainly seem advisable.The greatest shame about this place is that it has a lot of potential.  If someone who had a very clear vision of what they wanted bought it up, it could be a great retro bar.  For now, however, it seems like The Silver Palm is delayed indefinitely from departing to greatness.

7.description: Silver Palm has continued to be my favorite bar in Chicago. Great drinks, nice atmosphere, friendly and personable bartenders and waitresses. Where most drinking and eating establishments have become pretentious and over priced, Silver Palm has been able to maintain some real authenticity and fair prices. They have the same signature drinks as Matchbox such as gilmets, margaritas, etc. Great wine selection. The only reason why I am giving it 4 stars and not 5 is because of some changes in the menu. They used to have a great burger - thick and juicy. Now it has changed into two thin over cooked patties that seem that they were once frozen. They also used to have a great steak sandwich which they dropped from the menu. I will continue to go back, but no burgers for me there anymore.

49.description: Amazing place to eat, intimate atmosphere with impeccable food. Service is not the best but the food and quality of drinks definitely made up for it. BBQ ribs with spicy BBQ sauce were some of the best I've had.

40.description: Silver palm is one of the reasons why the west loop is my favorite place to hang out! Drinking in a matchbox car, followed by amazing food at the silver palm.  Get the duck club sandwich-- it's definitely one of the best things I've had and I usually don't even like duck.  Another drink special to check out is the gimlet-- get it with either vodka or rum! It's well worth the price as they leave the mixer with you to fill your martini glass again and again.  Great drinks, amazing food, and the smallest bar in chicago, what else could you ask for?

53.description: My buddy was in town for the Super Bowl and he happens to be a huge Anthony Bourdain fan. Going to the Silver Palm for the Three Little Pigs was on his Chicago bucket list. We went on Friday night after Second City. We got a table in the train car and loved the atmosphere. 4 out of 5 of us got the Three Little Pigs. It is definitely not low calorie. It was a good sandwich - not great. Definitely gets gluttony and unique points. I think my only complaint was that it was a little dry. Perhaps some honey mustard or some other sauce/condiment might have helped. The other person in our group got the duck sandwich which he raved about. There were definitely other things on the menu that I wanted to try. Pretty good beer selection as well.

30.description: New menu! All the goodies from before plus some improved items and some totally new items. Same warm friendly staff and neighborhood vibe. Have a new burger or the great fish tacos. Hopefully the summer warms up soon many of the newer items are patio drinking friendly

46.description: My review might only be quasi-useful as I have only had 2 things (plus many many many beers) - The 3 Little Piggy (fine, ridicule me for being unoriginal, but seriously, why would you have anythig else?) and the onion rings.  I will note that I almost did not darken The Silver Palm's door as, to my dismay, it apparently is a favorite of Mancow's, and I hate that imbecilic, simpleton, unoriginal d-bag.  I hope at some point in the near future he is violated by a syphilitic camel.  But I digress.  The 3 Little Piggy is, in my sandwich universe, second only to the Torta Cubana at That's It Market in the Mission District (the Torta Cubana, btw, might hold my lifetime achievement award in the food porn category).  Tenderloin, bacon, ham, gruyere and a fried egg.  If that doesn't make you tingle just a little bit, then I don't know what would.  And the onion rings are some of the best I've had.  The service is always nice, not rushed but not "hey we're still here."  Good variety of beers.  You can order a mixed drink other than a Jack-and-Coke or martini and not get a confused look from the bartender.  And perhaps best of all, The Silver Palm is a stone's throw from the greatest sh!t show on earth, aka Mahoney's.

1.description: Finding the entrance of The Silver Palm is way confusing for first timers! I was one such newbie when I went this past weekend and thankfully some gentleman on the street pointed us in the right direction. The Silver Palm is one of the cooler atmospheres for dining being in a silver train car...but you enter around the corner from where you see the train car. I've had The Silver Palm on my list for awhile since they are Anthony Bourdain approved. And when I went, I had to get their Three Little Pigs sandwich which Bourdain proclaimed as the "Best Sandwich in America"! I gotta say...he may just be right. It's beastly and indulgent and you won't be able to eat it in one sitting. At least I sure couldn't. The Three Little Pigs is a layer of cheese, topped with breaded pork, stacked with an insane amount of thick delicious ham, crispy bacon curls on top of that, then a fried eggs that has a nice runny center, one big deep fried onion ring,then more cheese on a bun. When you put it all together, its stacked so darn high...the only way to fit it in a mouth is by pressing it down a bit or taking out some of the meats. It's good though. Real good. Makes my mouth water just thinking about it good. It's $13.95 and comes with a side. I did the tater tots and really liked those, as well.I had one of their cocktails that cost me $13 and seemed a few bucks overpriced. It was decent though. We also tried the butternut squash soup which was also just okay....it was more chunky than expected. I'm used to a creamy version of this but it was aiight.Our server was robotic but I saw some other servers that were super friendly, outgoing and engaged so I think ours was just having an off night. I'm so glad I finally got to The Silver Palm and that sandwich made the whole trip worthwhile!

55.description: Excellent food for very fair prices. Great service, fun dining experience. Food is served to you very quickly which I like. The ribs are awesome and huge! And they keep me happy because they have Wittekerke.

9.description: Pros:Atmosphere is cool, the dining area is placed in an old train car. Drinks are very good. Food is aight. Cons:Limited space, don't bring a big group here (more than 4) otherwise you will have to sit at separate tables They only allow one card per group to pay. And very rude about it. "We only do one check here so it'll all be together" but their menu says they take 2 cards per table. So a little weird.

26.description: I was there this weekend after they closed down for renovation. The place still looks pretty much the same. Christmas lights, really how about LED's? The shrimp is gone!!! Come on, Bad move!!!!! Then this blonde waitress has the nerve to charge us for cold food?!!! Omg this place got worst!

25.description: Super delicious. Everything was great. We had the tilapia tacos and ceviche (lemoney) and tater tots were exquisite.

12.description: We enjoyed The Silver Palm very much. Love the train car! Great wait staff. Food was good, I had the fried chicken sandwich which was excellent - nice piece of chicken and it had pickles! Oh yeah! We had the crazy gator to nachos - so bad they are good. Just one of those things where you just couldn't not eat them! Nice night out.

59.description: Saw this place on Anthony Bourdain (yes i know, cliche right?) and had to try out the heart attack of a sandwich "3 little pigs" while I  was in the area visiting my brother.The place is located on a main corner, dining in the train car which is kind of a trip...as in school bus crowded trip. The area seemed a little seedy, and it definitely is a place where "regulars" and "tourists" can be easily distinguished. Nonetheless I still came, ordered, and stuffed my belly and arteries with delicious swine.+1 star for staying open late for me and a friend, literally we got there and they were about to shut the kitchen down and keep only the bar open. The guy/gal working were really cool about it though. Told them we would just grub/drink and leave asap...I've always hated being the "last person" in a restaurant/establishment, years of working in a restaurant will do that to your soul.The sandwich is massive, and loaded with ham...so much ham that I actually had to pull some out in order to take a bite.... :( and this was after splitting it with my buddy....sad I know right?  The thing tasted great a tad dry, and definitely will give you the meat sweats...the egg was a good touch but really seemed wasted since we split the sandwich...It all really about the yolkporn anyway right? The fries were good, but nothing special or greatIf I was in the area, then I would likely come back to try the ribs that everyone else raves about, but otherwise I feel that lots of area in Chicago can fulfill my artery clogging cholesterol needs...

21.description: A typical looking Chicago dive bar in the front, and a train car converted into a restaurant in the back. I had dinner in the train car portion. The train car was cool looking. Definitely the type of restaurant gem you should keep in your back pocket if you want to impress a casual date or tourist. The food was pretty good. I had the veggie burger. It was one of the better veggie patties I've had, full of flavor and colorful vegetables and more than just mashed beans in the shape of a patty. It was a very typical (and good) Chicago pretzel bun burger. I would definitely consider going back. Only 4 stars because the seating in the train car portion is really cramp yet the chairs are big with large backs. I had to push the unused chair next to me in my "booth" away from the table just to have room to move my arm comfortably. Also where I was seated, the heat kept coming on aggressively. Don't get me wrong, I love a good warm restaurant in the Chicago winter, however it was blowing directly in my face and it made it uncomfortable to sit where I was, I'm not sure if this is true for the rest of the restaurant.

17.description: I was in town checking out a cubs game and saw this spot on a foodie channel and wanted to try it out.I loved the train car as restaurant pretty cool.I ordered the the three piggy and was in awe.Great food one of my favs if ever on a Chi Town trip.

10.description: Ralph Wiggum would most certainly Choo-Choo-Choose this place if he had a hankerin' for a fried chicken sandwich. This old railroad car turned restaurant puts one bomb ass bird on a bun. Add the homemade onion rings and you'll def run a train on your dinner! (shout out to Augie from Role Models youtube.com/watch?v=kL-1…)Yes...quarters are close, but the staff is super neighborhood friendly and it is one of the more unique settings in all of Chicago. Definitely worth a stop in if you're ever near Chicago Ave and Ogden.

5.description: All aboard for a fun time!  I love the ambience so much here I'm willing to overlook the shortcomings.  And I'm definitely coming back.The Silver Palm is like no place else I've eaten in Chicago.  It's an authentic retired dining car, resurrected and dropped into the middle of River West.  It brought back wonderful childhood memories of traveling across rural Illinois with my grandmother.  I could go on and on about our "adventures," but enough with the nostalgia, this review is supposed to be about the restaurant.I scoured the Yelp reviews for suggestions, as I had no idea what to expect. Based on what seems popular, we started with the warm goat cheese appetizer.  It didn't look that appealing when the server placed it on the table, but the tomato sauce packed a real punch and a lot of flavor... a pleasant surprise.  The grilled calamari appetizer had a wonderful flavor but was a little overcooked.We split the 3 piggy sandwich, which is the big draw here, and it's massive.  I had a quarter of it, and it was tasty but too salty for me.  My friend devoured the rest, so it's definitely a winner.  The onion rings were not worth the calories.Not many people write about the desserts, but I'd left room and ordered the (molten) chocolate cake with warm chocolate filling, topped with ice cream.  Not the best I've ever had, but close.  I scraped the plate clean.  The coffee was pretty good, too.The downside here is the service.  The kitchen is slow.  The servers are friendly and accommodating, but the restaurant needs more of them.  I think ours had tables inside the train car and out on the patio, too. As for the patio, it was packed on a warm summer evening.  But the tables are just a few feet from a street with heavy traffic, and mixing exhaust fumes and food isn't my thing.

3.description: Straight to the point - get here, NOW, and order the freakin' "3 Piggy". This sandwich undoubtedly rivals one of my favorites, the Senor Pan Cubano.  A mound of smoked ham, crispy bacon, salty, breaded pork tenderloin, an over-easy egg, Gruyere cheese, and an onion ring...GO... RUN...NOW! Sheer perfection. Had our side of Pork Belly not been overcooked (still, its pork, and our stomachs enjoyed it), and the asparagus left on the grill a few minutes longer (tough to chew), we'd have ourselves a 5-star dining car. House cocktails were a job well done, flavorsome with our hats off to the barista. Return visits to this quaint train-car are a certainty when traveling the North Milwaukee Ave.

35.description: This place is everything you want it to be.  A train car!  Its fun because it maxes out at groups of 4.  If you're by yourself you're eating at a big table.  If you're a party of 6 then you're at 2 tables.  Although they do have that front bar area but I'm not sure if they're serving the full menu up there.  So if you have a problem with small spaces then maybe wait until its warm out so you can eat outside.  We came early and scored a spot by the window.  This is a great date place!  Of course the cocktails are great.  This is the number one gimlet in the city.  You get a little biscuit which we thought was just ok.  Then we started w/ the white bean bruschetta which was messy but delicious.  My boyfriend had to get the Three Little Piggy with onion rings (because they make them there)  If you don't get onion rings ask for the onion ring sauce because it elevated the 3 pigs sandwich.  He was in heaven.  And its not just a meal its like three meals!  I had the grilled shrimp which was very tasty but hard to eat.  I don't understand why it was peel-and-eat in all of that butter and sauce.  Have you ever tried to remove a shrimp peel with a knife and fork?  I would come back here in a heartbeat.

19.description: Well, it seemed that the "3 piggy" sandwich was a favorite here on yelp, so I figured I would try it. I mean, who doesn't love bacon, pork and ham on a bun with cheese and a fried egg? Well, I can now say that I too am now a fan of this sandwich! Be warned, it's a very large sandwich. I had to cut it in half just to get part of it in my mouth! The sandwich is a work of art in and of itself! Service was very good - waitress took good care of us. Atmosphere is great! Was a little stuffy in the train car, though. I can only imagine how stuffy it would have been had the whole car been full!! But overall, I enjoyed the experience and I will be back again!!

28.description: Three Piggy is the famous sandwich. It was really good and super heavy. The seating area in the boxcar is kind of cool, but not ideal for large groups.

45.description: Had the Three little piggy sandwich. After having seen it on Bourdain, I did not expect it would live up to the hype. It didn't, but it was a very, very tasty sandwich. Coupled with a unique setting and it made for a good experience.

33.description: 3 little pigs sandwich is SOOO salty. I didn't taste pork... Just salt.. Service was terrible. We waited almost 20 minutes at our table before a waitress came out to take our order. They charged us for a beer that we didn't order and when my husband tried to calmly explain that we didn't even have beer, she (not a waitress... Maybe a bartender or management?) handed us a piece of paper and asked us to write how much we "thought" we should pay for our drinks. Extremely condescending.

43.description: This place is ok. Sometimes even good. But waitress Lauren is an entirely unpleasant person.

2.description: Located in a vintage dining car, built by Budd for the Atlantic Coast Line Railroad in 1947.  However, this is not the place to look for a museum-like recreation of the mid-century rail travel experience.  Interior fittings are not true to period; in service on ACL's Florida trains, there would have been white tablecloths and napery, fresh flowers, heavy silverware, fine china in the railroad's own pattern.  And of course there would have been a swarm of uniformed waiters, presided over by a steward in suit and vest.  At Silver Palm, on a moderately busy Sunday evening, there was one waitress and one busboy.  They did their best, but service was a bit slow.(Ironically, one of our party of five was a current Amtrak dining car server, just off duty from a run from Oakland on the California Zephyr, and still in her Amtrak uniform when we arrived at the restaurant.)Entrance to Silver Palm is through a separate building, the Matchbox Bar.  Full bar service.  A small selection of wines, available by the glass at one quarter of the bottle price.  Modest beer selection, a combination of domestic and imported industrials and a few craft brews.  Our dinner choices:  - Louisiana fried chicken. A half chicken marinated in buttermilk, in a rather flaky-textured breading.  Tender,  tasty, and not unduly greasy.- Barbecued pork ribs, tender and mildly sauced; a spicier sauce would have been available.  Served with three large onion rings.  Fries or roasted vegetables would have been alternatives.- Reuben sandwich.  House-smoked corned beef, thicker-sliced and smoother in texture than usually encountered.  Grilled with Gruyere and sauerkraut on marble rye.   Accompanied by a side of house-made spicy remoulade.  Again, choice of onion rings, fries, or veggies.- Portobello sandwich.  Thick grilled mushroom with aspirations to burgerhood.  Topped with goat cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and red onions, all in a brioche.  Same three side options as the Reuben.Beer choice:  Six Points Resin Imperial IPA.The near northwest side location is a bit off the beaten track, but has good transit access:  near the Chicago Avenue Blue Line station; also served by the 56-Milwaukee and. 66-Chicago bus lines.

18.description: This used to be one of my favorite places for a while, but that changed recently and I'll get to that. The atmosphere is awesome, a nostalgic train car turned diner with quirky signs and mood lighting. A great casual date spot. The patio is really neat too, on the side of the train car, though next to a busy street it's not even a distraction. They have a nice selection of micro brews as well as some draft options. I always liked the menu, even though for me it's limited, till recently. I'm vegetarian and my friend is vegan, so we ordered the asparagus and kale appetizer, the veggie burger and eggplant sandwich. The kale was deep fried and super oily when it came out, but the asparagus was good. Eggplant sandwich was really fresh and tender. And the veggie burger seemed great, even ordered one to go, except then we learned that the frozen patty was cooked in pork lard... I mean WHAT? Oh and the kale we had for the appetizer... Yup! Oozing with greasy pork fat!  I mean who does that? I shouldn't have to check or ask. The only vegetarian friendly options on the menu should be vegetarian! Now I can't trust your menu and I can only wonder if the drinks are worth the risk. This was a big blow for a really cool spot :(

41.description: Yes it's a train car, the windows need washing for sure but overall the atmosphere was good. I had the best salad ever here, a BNSF Rutherford Salad, omg it was amazing.  The perfect amount of cherries, apples, proscuitto and the fried avocados were a great touch, although they could have used a bit of salt or maybe some spicy heat.  My boyfriend had the Three Little pig sandwich and ate the whole thing, it was too much even for him but he finished it!  I also had their key lime pie, delicious!  Will definitely be back again.

52.description: I'm not exactly sure why this place is rated so poorly and I refuse to look at my fellow Yelper's reviews for fear it will influence my sacred duty as an impartial ranker.  I also don't understand why The Matchbox is a separate Yelp entry, one that is held is such high esteem.  To me these places are one in the same and the reviewers got it right with The Matchbox.The Silver Palm is well above average bar food with very interesting twists. The Southern Pacific Railway's Duck Club Sandwich is my go-to but really everything they offer is delicious.  Plus, for the bold they offer the famous feat of gluttonous excess (redundant?), the Three Little Piggy.  If you love food, specifically the act of force-feeding yourself over-indulgent, artery-clogging awesomeness, then eating the Three Little Piggy should be an experience akin to seeing the Louvre is to an Art buff (Three Little Piggy:glutton::Louvre:Artist).

50.description: Went to the Silver Palm this past Friday with a group of friends for dinner and drinks.  Some of us got beer while the others got cocktails.  The gimlets were strong and for one of my friend's drinks, they gave her the shaker so she ended up getting 2 drinks for the price of one.  We shared some appetizers which included the fried calamari and caesar salad.  Both of these items were really good.  The calamari serving was pretty big and fried just right.  The caesar salad was really tasty also, great dressing!  For an entree, I split the Seaboard Airline Railroad's Shrimp and Scallop Po' Boy sandwich.  It was huge, but very tasty.  The decor inside was probably my favorite part as you are seated in a railroad dining car to eat.  The biggest party you can have is 4 and my group had 7, so we ended up having two tables next to each other.  All in all, it was a good experience.

4.description: Came here for the 3 little piggy sandwich. Hat tip to Anthony Bourdain. I came, I saw, and I somehow conquered that not so little triple piggy. The ridiculous (looking, tasting, and sized) sandwich aside, the atmosphere was really cool--the attached matchbox bar and the dining car make for a legit drinking and dining experience full of history.

6.description: Masters of the fryolater.While drawn to the Silver Palm for the challenge of taking down the 3 Piggy Sandwich, actually got to sample more of the menu over two trips.3 Piggy Sandwich was as tall as advertised; with an imposing tower of ham, baked pork, and bacon, among other elements.  While bites of pure pig were a tough swallow, the saving grace was the substantial fried onion ring on the upper sandwich, which allowed a change-up in texture.  So robust was this onion ring that it kept its shape and crunch through the sandwich's demise.Returned to have the Louisiana-style fried chicken.  Again, an impressive batter-coated half-bird offered massive crunch at every bite.  Unlike the sandwich, however, the chicken itself was a bit dry and lacking of flavor.  Sauces were offered, but why mask the taste of expertly cooked chicken (see Mission Chinese Food and Momofuku Noodle Bar, both in NYC for salient examples)?For the teetotalers and designated drivers out there, the Silver Palm offers Gosling's ginger beer as a non-alcoholic options.  Definitely the cheapest complement to a not-so-pricey sandwich.

22.description: The food was DELICIOUS, service was fine. However, the experience fell short because the ambient music was being well overpowered by the music the kitchen had going on. The kitchen either had no door or it was kept open and they were blasting their music. Made the experience a bit unpleasant. I wish the server would have either closed the kitchen door or asked the cooks to lower the volume a bit as to not interfere with the dining area.Not to miss: The Three Piggy, quite a heavy yummy meal (stay away from it if you are on a diet!) and mashed potatoes were very good too, with small chunks and skin, not just a puree. Check can get pricey, but the food is great.

15.description: Three pigs... Yep. Just eat it and don't ask questions. Ok, maybe on a subsequent trip you can look around, but not until then

57.description: Not very good. Pretty overpriced and slow service

20.description: Fun Fun Fun place BUT go for the drinks (they are FABULOUS), and leave the food behind!!! Not too many places can mess up fried chicken, but they did. And Mom's ribs tasted like lighter fluid. Like I said, the drinks are FABULOUS...potent and plentiful, and the place is a BLAST!Oh, and remember to ask the bartender for the brandied cherries...they are a TREAT!

36.description: The venue is cute and different.  Service was fine.  the grilled calamari was good, it comes grilled with lemony butter and capers - yum.  I got the corned beef - it was fine.  My friend got the three piggy sandwich.  It was bigger than her head and after she was done, it didn't even look like she made a dent in it.  She said it was good, but WAY too much.  Her dad was happy when she brought it home.The fried chicken and French onion soup looked and smelled good.  But b/c of our gluttonous choices, the smell of meat may keep be away for a while!  But definitely worth checking out.

14.description: Fun Fun Fun place BUT go for the drinks (they are FABULOUS), and leave the food behind!!! Not too many places can mess up fried chicken, but they did. And Mom's ribs tasted like lighter fluid. Like I said, the drinks are FABULOUS...potent and plentiful, and the place is a BLAST!Oh, and remember to ask the bartender for the brandied cherries...they are a TREAT!

58.description: I went after I'd been eating all day, so I got a few plates to share with a friend, and our bill was modest. We left over 20% tip, or tried to, but they helped themselves to 10 TIMES the tip I tried to leave. I mean I guess it's possible it was a typo, but I've never had that happen in years of charging my meals, nor have I ever heard of it happening. The "tip" was more than twice the cost of my meal. And believe me, the service was not that good, and I did not intentionally leave such a tip. Booooo.As for the food, the lasagna in particular, it was so salty it made my mouth burn. And I'm not especially sensitive to that, I can't think of another time I've ever had that thought about restaurant food. If I want that experience again I'll just go gargle some sea water and save myself the scamming.A few co-workers recommended it so I tried it for dinner when a friend visited and wanted to do Chicago stuff. Fail.

56.description: I ordered La Scarola through DoorDash for delivery and it was awesome! Authentic dishes and really good ingredients. The escarole and beans dish was so yummy. I will be going back and visiting the restaurant instead!

29.description: How do you describe a restaurant that is 500 yards from your home that makes each visit a treat? La Scarola always welcomed us and let's us know they welcome our choice and will make dining more than routine but special.Joe  and Armando run an incredible place with food that matches the attentive service. Many describe this as "old school" but surmise that every popular restauranteur envies a place open as long as La Scarola that people describe as their favorite.

42.description: First, props to @mancowmuller for the suggestion.  See his review as mine will not come close to being as extensive and passionate.  If you want a real, family-owned, Italian dinner experience in Chicago, this is the place.  Chicken Parmigiana on special, tiramisu, cappuccino was my meal.  The tiramisu cannot be beaten and I left full and happy.  The type of place that makes you wish you lived in the neighborhood so you could be there weekly if not more often.   Met the owner Joey on Mancow's suggestion, he came right down and sat at the table and gave me a personal tour of the place and he'll do the same for you.   A million stories not the least of which is his picture with Sinatra, proudly displayed on an interior wall.   And Joey is now a new friend.

23.description: This is true old-school Italian at its best. If you strolled by the restaurant, you would never know one of the greatest Italian restaurants in the city existed. But upon entering, be prepared to be transported into an Italian masterpiece. Ambiance is fantastic- don't think modern and sleek, but very old-school, where the waiters have been there for decades and the walls display a story of famous Hollywood royalty. Food is classic, huge portions, with unbelievable flavor profile. Our favorites are the Spaguetti Loquercio (Al Dente Pasta) and Pasta Lorenzo ..some of the best pasta dishes ever...seriously.You will feel like you've been transported into The Godfather or Goodfella's while you are eating, and you will enjoy every second of it. People watching is fantastic.

47.description: Food was great. The drinks were also really well done. If you're into Mediterranean food, I would definitely check this place out.

8.description: Small (kinda cramped) hole in the wall in Chicago that has AMAZING Italian food.  We started with grilled and fried calamari.  Both major delicious.  I ordered the chilean sea bass (from the specials) and wow, this was soon good.  If it is on the special list when you go I recommend getting this.  I tried a friend's chicken parm (not on the menu, you have to ask for it) and it was incredible as well.  Service was above par (from making reservations to the servers)Be warned though:  this place is a little cramped and it is LOUD.  I had a hard time hearing what the people around me were saying.  I had gone in with a splitting headache and this unfortunately didn't help.

31.description: Great food.  Large portions.  Expensive but worth it. Bits classic heavy Italian.  Great for eat in or take out.

34.description: Simply one of the best Italian restaurants in the City.  Superb service, lovely ambiance; the closest thing to dining in Italy!  Thank you for the beautiful experience!

16.description: Home style Italian, stick to your ribs, food coma kinda goodness. Huge portions of delicious and heavy Italian grub.  No muss. No fuss decor but solid service and decent prices for the size of the plates.  I need to make a stop here at least once a year, because that's about how long it takes I'm the gym to burn a meal off :)

13.description: Had 7:30pm reservations on Saturday night for my birthday. 6 people including my parents. We were told they were running behind and to go next door to have a drink and come back at 8pm. We came back and were told it would probably be another 15 minutes. We stood there waiting until almost 9pm. Everyone was starving at that point and we had to eat bar food somewhere else. The owner gave us a free round of drinks but that is not enough compensation for ruining my birthday night. Do NOT go here even if you have reservations because they obviously don't know what that means. Too bad I never got to try the food. Almost could taste it however with how close we had to stand to people's tables while waiting... Very uncomfortable as well. Terrible experience.

11.description: I've been going here for three years now and it never disappoints! The food is amazing every time! Please go, order anything, and I guarantee you will return.

39.description: Went to this place on a Monday night after a boat ride with my parents and wife. From outside the place looked small but when we went inside it gave a very authentic Italian feel. There walls were filled with Italian people ( i guess the people who started the restaurant) and framed all over. My dad ordered the Minestrone soup and it was just awesome, very thick and creamy. My wife and mom shared the brochette and I ordered the chicken gnocchi. We finished the dinner with a Tiramisu and it was complete. The place gave a very homely feeling.My only concern was that I smelt cigarett smell inside the restaurant, may be I could be wrong. But other than that they served some good food with very good service.

37.description: Great place, great environment, great food. Particularly noteworthy are the fried calamari and squid.

0.description: I'm going to start this review by saying that La Scarola was one of the best dining experiences I've had in Chicago and, in fact, anywhere.  I'm also going to say that any reviews for this place that were less than 5 stars because it was "too crowded," or "too noisy," or because there was "no where to wait" for your table should be tossed out the window. I'm sorry, but if you go to an Italian restaurant and you give it 2 stars because you had a headache going in to it and you decided to go at peak time on a Saturday night when it's obviously going to be busy and loud, that's your own fault that your headache got worse, not the restaurants. Obviously if you know enough about Yelp to leave a review afterwards, you know enough to check the reviews beforehand and get an idea of what you're in for, and the restaurant (especially one as incredible as this one) shouldn't be faulted for your own ineptitude. That being said, YES, La Scarola is about as authentic of an Italian restaurant you'll find anywhere in the city and it's amazing in every way.  The walls are covered with photographs, underneath which are the classic wall murals that highlight scenes from a Tuscan countryside. The restaurant is made up of several rooms, all of which are packed with tables so that you feel like you're eating in someone's house with all of their extended family and friends.  So is it noisy? Yeah, obviously.  Is it so noisy you can't hear the person across from you? Absolutely not. But if you're expecting a tranquil, white tablecloth, candlelit dinner, you should probably make reservations elsewhere.  But if authenticity and delicious food is your thing, keep reading.So we had a reservation for 9:00 the Saturday night before Valentine's Day, which obviously is a busy restaurant night. Having read some reviews that said they are notoriously late with reservations, I called ahead to see if they were running on time (what a concept!)  They were only running about 10 minutes late, so we headed straight to the restaurant. As soon as we arrived I could see why people said there was little room for waiting, but again, this isn't the restaurants fault---The Dawson, Emmitt's Pub, and Richard's Bar are all literally RIGHT next door to the place, so if you need somewhere to wait you have plenty of options. Since we only had a few minutes, we ponied up to the tiny bar and ordered a beer until our table was ready and it was perfectly fine.On to the food: AMAZING. Even if this doesn't sound like your kind of place atmosphere-wise, you should still come for the food!!!!! Holy crap.  I don't often rave over taste because I feel that aside from the stand outs, lots of things tend to taste generally the same, but this place is one of the stand outs!!  I woke up this morning unsure of how I could possibly wait until an appropriate "lunch time" to eat my leftovers. Writing this review is part of how I'm distracting myself!  So, my advice: starve yourself before you go here. Seriously. You want to be able to consume as much as possible, and that's exactly what we did. We started off by ordering the sausage and peppers---INCREDIBLE. And I don't usually like Italian sausage, but my fiance does so we ordered it and I was hooked!!!!  We also got grilled calamari which was insanely fresh, steak-like and not at all "rubbery" as it almost always is. The bruschetta was fantastic too!! After our healthy order of apps, we ordered entrees. I had read rave reviews about the penne a la vodka, but I was also super interested in one of their specials which was the Penne Amore and included a lot more seafood (scallops, lobster tail, shrimp).  I explained my predicament to the waiter and he immediately suggested that I combine the two and customized my order no problem. And there are no words for what came out of the kitchen 20 minutes later....pure magic.  One of the best vodka sauces I've ever tasted, and the freshest seafood you'll get anywhere that is not immediately on an oceanic coast. WOW. Wow wow wow. I had dreams about it last night. I'm dreaming about it now!! I'm salivating just thinking about my leftovers in the refrigerator. Especially the scallops...they were so tender, they just absorbed the vodka sauce so they became little vodka sauce bombs that exploded with flavor on each bite!!! Incredible.Okay, this is now officially the longest review I've ever written, so I'm going to wrap it up by adding that the cherry on the top of the La Scarola sundae was the staff---very friendly and attentive without going over the top, or interrupting your meal every 10 minutes to see if you need anything. FIVE STARS ALL AROUND!

38.description: Absolutely loved this place!!!The place is not a looker and I have been to many Michelin star restaurants and have not rated them 4-5 stars.Forget the service and the ambiance go for the food!!!!I'm usually a stickler about service but it's worth the finger licking good Italian food you will be served.The grilled calamari was unreal if you like the texture of calamari. It was so finely chard it melted in your mouth. We also ordered knoki with penne and Shrimp in Vodka sauce. OMG I ate paste the next two day's. They were so full of taste and amazing!!!I will go back there any day for a delicious serving of fine Italian food. Highly recommended...

51.description: Don't believe the hype.  I have been here a couple of times in the past--a friend of mine and I split a $250 gift card at a charity auction.  Dinner for 4 (to my surprise, we went over).  It is my understanding that in the restaurant business, there is a concept called "Chicago Style".  This means pretty decent food, and PLENTY OF IT--that is what they offer here.  The place is a real dump--some may mistake this for charming, but it is not.  Lowest end of chairs, tableware, etc.  Staff is a super professional operation, really hustling in this totally packed  dungeon We were almost seated in the kitchen.Loaded with tourists with bags from American Girl and Macy's due to the location.  There are SO MANY OPTIONS  for this kind of food at this price, why come here?

27.description: Home style Italian, stick to your ribs, food coma kinda goodness. Huge portions of delicious and heavy Italian grub.  No muss. No fuss decor but solid service and decent prices for the size of the plates.  I need to make a stop here at least once a year, because that's about how long it takes I'm the gym to burn a meal off :)

32.description: This is an old style restaurant with a family feeling.  The food is very good, the portions are large and you can find a place to park on the street!  My complaint is just that their wines and liquor selection are too sweet for my taste.  Having been to Italy, I know this is pretty much the way it is...It is a unique Italian place and worth checking out.

54.description: Totally full of character, nice guy working there, free shots, fun, big portions, food was tasty, an institution.

48.description: I absolutely love the pasta at this joint! They do some traditional pasta that is delicious as well as some coloring outside of the lines. My favorite unique pasta here was the jalapeño pesto. Never disappointed here.

44.description: This place was FANTASTIC!Total family feel, 100% authentic, and you can tell this place has been around for a while. We ordered the specials of the day: Grilled Calamari and the seafood risotto; they were delicious. Not only was the food extraordinary, but the service and portions were as well!!Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area and looking for some nice home cooked Italian food :)

24.description: I would eat here every night if I could. It's a cozy environment with a lot of people and even more good food. This isn't a dressed up, Mickey Mouse restaurant like the Olive Garden. The focus is on great food. Come hungry!

7.description: Horrible.  We kept getting pushed around by the staff,  literally,  while we waited for a table.  "Go to the bar" they would say,  there was no bar area!  We sat at our table.  Ordered slowly.  Appetizers,  entrees,  dessert,  bottles of wine.  We would eat,  and talk,  and the servers kept trying to take our food,  although we weren't done.  Finally we finished,  paid our bill,  and the servers decided we were done.  They took everything off the table,  including our water,  and then asked us to leave! We had paid and done,  not even 5 minutes later.  We looked in the window after we left,  and they didn't sit anyone at our table.  I have no idea why we were asked to leave!  The restaurant was so quite full.  I will never go back.  The menu was over priced,  service sucked, food was ok, and the experience was horrible.  Would have been better off at McDonald's!

49.description: I've been going here for three years now and it never disappoints! The food is amazing every time! Please go, order anything, and I guarantee you will return.

40.description: Wow, this place is amazing! Owner greats you at door, very friendly and outgoing, seems to know everyone there, checks on you too during meal! Good was AMAZING. Red mussels for appetizer, steak mushroom masala was unbelievable, everything ordered at table was top!! Thank you for meeting Chicago food expectation!

53.description: What is happening to La Scarola?Closed for lunches?So dissapointed. I have to say the last 2 times we order take out the sauce on the entrees was watery, and tasteless. This has been one of my old time favorite restaurants but ls been dissaponting this past year. The inside of the restaurant  is looking run down and dirty to be honest with you, it makes you not want to go in at all. I have to beg my friends to go there now. I miss you La Scarola...  sight.Needs remodeling ASAP. Need new energetic happy staff (New!! All new.) needs the owner in the kitchen like he used to be. He has the magic touch.
