0.description: I'm not much of a club/lounge chick anymore (oh yes, I have stories!) so my requirements when I venture out these days are simple, but very high: It's gotta be a joint where I'm A) Not going to get my purse stolen; B) Not going to get shot.Very, very, very happy to report that Butterfly Social Club fulfills both my requirements!My friend throws a party there on alternating Fridays called "Deeply Rooted" and I finally took him up on the offer to come out. I'm so glad I did. Great little spot, great crowd, good vibes and outstanding music. It was just grown folks who like to dance -- no shenanigans or tomfoolery and no attitude -- from the doorman, bartender or patrons. You really can't ask for much more.Not sure if it's like this every night, but there was no cover when I went and no ridiculous line to get in. Only thing I didn't like was the doorman yelling at everyone to "GET OUT" within 45 seconds of the music ending and the lights coming up. Still, I was buzzing from such a good time that it didn't bother me much. No one gets too out-of-pocket when you know the dude throwing the party! For the grown, no drama, non-poser, non-violent, non-attitudnal, like-to-dance-and-kick-it set, this is your spot.

38.description: Butterfly has an earthy tropical feel that goes well with the organic drinks they offer. They drinks are very good and quite a bargain for being all organic.The bartenders are very friendly. The no cash policy is a bit strange.

27.description: What an absolute let down. DO NOT use their website for a point of reference, it's useless. There are a few other reviews here on Yelp which mentions details of how it's been revamped. It is not in any way associated to the uber cool it once, was. It is not an Eco friendly treat. I had high hopes to host a party here after reading through their website and multiple articles I'd read about them on-line some time ago. Too bad I never set my feet in motion to check them out while it was still a big buzz. It's a good reminder that when an establishment is hot, check it out then and don't wait too long. I loved how there was ample information on the website explaining of the affordable party packages involving organic wines, beers and tropical drinks. Pricing was given by the hour. This is not true of the new Butterfly social club. Same rules of Funky Buddha Lounge apply here. $30/$35/$40 for a two hour package, well/call/top shelf. Organic wines and beers only offered with the $40 dollar plan. Don't bother submitting your info via the Butterfly website, that goes unanswered. Better to call and leave a message or try to e-mail Rene or RSVP at funkybuddha.com I sent two emails and left two messages before getting a response. Since Butterfly was under different management before, not one person is completely sure about pricing, offers and the etc's. I did some reconnaissance on a Friday evening to check it out. The moment I walked in I caught a smell of the sewage system and cakes used in their urinals. Ugh! I can't believe that smell caught me at that distance. As I drew closer to the rear of the room the smell grew stronger. Sniffing the air you catch the smells of incense, smells like patchouli. Likely they hoped the scent would mask the odorific sensation of the urinals. White walls, white ceilings, white everything. Wow, how plain. I drove down to the area just to see a white room. Nothing special here. The music was Reggae, Reggaeton and Salsa, not bad, music was pretty good. Women were 21+. Men were mid 20s plus and the oldest in their early 30s, good mix of different people. No cover charge helps, but still it's nothing special. What a let down, I say again. I cancelled my party. Hopefully the silly person that decided to redecorate and change things up here isn't allowed to decide what happens to the fate of the Funky Buddha lounge.

32.description: Some change is NOT good.The old Butterfly had a nice warm feel to it. Very earthy and inviting I wish I took pics before. Sooooo I was excited to see how it was re-done.  I walked in and almost died.Now its like every other bar here in Chicago, cold and white. Think of  Sounbdar in a lounge. I went last night for the Sneak Peek Grand RE-Opening so the crowd was a lot older than I'm used to.  Which is probably because Kingsbury Plazas whole building was invited.  The bartender was great even though no one left the bar after getting a drink(well there was no where for anyone to go anymore!!!) You just had to squeeze your way in, but he always took and gave me my order pretty fast.  Sigh.... the music....I was expecting Hip hop and Soul which is what butterfly is known for...Nope not today my friend -but again maybe it just was for that one night.Thank Buddha!!! Peaks Organic was the brew in open bar because I LOVE that beer and the vanilla organic vodka with the cream soda flavored pop was so good.  I ordered my beloved Gojitini and it wasn't as good as last time but the bartender just didn't have the amount of time to do it right so it's ok.  Oh Butterfly I don't know if I will go back to you my sweet dear lover.  I really do want to love you again so if I am reassured you have hip hop and soul nights still and the same crowd I will go back. Oh and some guy from california pointed out there should be recycling bins inside the place. I agree.  Wanna be Green, do it all the way.wow i hate being a bummer. you get 2 starts cause you're an eco friendly bar....

44.description: The decor leaves something to be desired.  It looks like the trading spaces version of Rainforest Cafe.  The drinks are interesting and worth trying.  I had the long island iced tea.  I didn't like it originally but when the coconut ice melted it was pretty tasty.  Just don't wait too long to finish your drink or you'll be drinking all coconut.  Yuck.  Then I wanted something "normal" and tried to order a gin and tonic.  They didn' thave tonic there but they put it in sparkling water.  Interesting and tasty.They don't take cash at the bar, only cc.  My friends had gotten overcharged by using cc so beware.  Drinks should only be 5 or 10, nothing more or less!  You can use cash but you have to exchange your cash for drink tickets like you would at the Taste.  Very odd.  Someone know why they do this?

24.description: This place is cool, despite some of these bad reviews. For one thing, there is no cover. yeah the drinks are expensive, but damn they're good! Oh, and they do have new decor now, the walls are not plain white anymore.

7.description: My boyfriend and I went to Orange (next door) for brunch and we were shuffled down to this place to wait for our table. Does one own the other? I don't know. There were drink specials (mimosas $6 and bloody marys $5) and there were Orange menus on each table. We sat down and waited. The bartender was the only person working so you had to go up to the bar for service. Drinks were served in a plastic cup with a lid. The Orange host came into the bar to announce names to be seated....it was a very weird situation. There is a DJ booth toward the front behind a big butterfly panel, but I guess on the weekends no DJ during brunch hours ;-)I gave it 4 stars because for being a waiting area for Orange....it really worked. I don't know if I would return here for any other reason though.

40.description: I love the butterfly social club. The 100% organic drinks are amazing. The bartender is super nice, polite, friendly and helpful. I am not a picky drinker (read- I mix things) so I have tried about 15 of thier cocktails. Only one I did not like. Which the bartender let me return and order another. They are not doing tickets anymore. You can now pay cash at the bar. Personally I liked it better the old way. The reason they had initially tried selling drink tickets at the door, was so that the bartender did not contaminate the drinks by handling money which we all know is filthy, but dont seem to care if a bartender throws a handled lemon into our drinks or touches your straw ofter handling copius amounts of cash all night. I would give them 5 stars, but I'm not a fan of the interior decoration. It reminds me of a smurf village. I tend to prefer more upscale venues, clean lines, contemporary furniture, classy bathrooms etc.... but despite the tree and earth motif, I still invited everyone I know there for my birthday party, and I still will be a regular, because the drinks and service is amazing.

30.description: We WERE going to have Yvette E.'s bachelorette party here. We had been meaning to come check it out and got a chance to do so at their re-opening party.I never got a chance to see BSC before the remodel, but this was disappointing. I thought the kitschy decor was supposed to be a part of the experience? How about no decor? Boring white walls. That's what you get now!We enjoyed our free booze and headed out of there as soon as the open bar was over. Long story short - we picked another venue for the bachelorette party. And I will not be returning to this place.

46.description: Well this is an eco-friendly atmosphere vibe but a little too G-rated. Wish they went more eco-friendly the sophisticated way. Maybe, if they got an HGTV person designing it. Hmmm anyways, my drink was good. Maragarita w/ a eco-friendly juice mixture. What I gotta say is check it out and then move on to the funky buddha or hit the next lounge, RESERVE, etc, etc.

1.description: Disclaimer: A close friend of mine works at Butterfly and I noticed that it wasn't gettin' any Yelp love. So, here's my story: I only went here once before the renovation. Gone are the fake trees and the earthy vibe. Post-renovation, Butterfly has a sleek, modern vibe to it. The walls are white and so is most of the furniture, so you get that uber clean feel when you walk in. There was a dj spinnin' on Friday night (mostly reggae and other laid-back tunes) and they had a projector showin' stuff behind the bar (think Pink Panther). There's also this lit up image of a butterfly on the wall by the dj. I thought it was a cute touch! This place is intimate, ya'll. It's a total 180 from Buddha next door. You don't have to push through crowds and crowds of people to get a drink. The bartenders are super friendly and down to earth. Their priority is to take care of their customers (and that's witnessed through the awesome service!). I noticed them actually bringing the drinks out to the booths, instead of having people wait at the bar!  Plus, the cute booths are way conducive to groups chattin' with their friends or just hangin' one-on-one with someone. They have a huge speciality drink menu (remember, they're all about everythng organic!), so, after much debate, I tried the mint and gin drink ($12). It tasted just like a moijito, but with gin!  Amazing.  We were also graced with trying a white grape shot as well as a mint chocolate shot.  While they both looked unappetizing in the shot glass, they were actually two of the most delicious shots I've ever had.  So, while Butterfly may appear to be full of pretentiousness because of the ultra-modern decor, that is just not the case.  This is one of most the laid-back bars I've been to, but with a trendy design to it.  And, you have to admit, that's a pretty tough combination to find!Unique drinks, awesome service, chill environment...those are my three top reasons to stop by Butterfly.  Come by and check it out!

9.description: No cardigans here. Really really awesome time with some sick beats. Loved the decor. A lot of top 40 club beats. Got down on the dance floor and rocked it.

26.description: I came to the place back when it originally opened and it was dope! Nice earthy atmosphere and was just a cool, interesting place to be. I walked in recently and wondered if I stumbled into the wrong place. The walls are just plain white and bland. The drinks are even more expensive now. I got one of those organic vodka raspberry drinks and they told me it was $12 (It was originally $10). They gave it to me in a cognac glass and originally it was in a regular glass and was a couple of bucks cheaper. They gave me some organic beer (I think it was called Dead Man's Curse) which was ok and only $4.There is still no cover and the bar staff is still pretty cool. Obviously this place needs to go through a third renovation, especialy if they want to uphold the Funky Buddha Lounge tradition.

25.description: Disclaimer: A close friend of mine works at Butterfly and I noticed that it wasn't gettin' any Yelp love. So, here's my story: I only went here once before the renovation. Gone are the fake trees and the earthy vibe. Post-renovation, Butterfly has a sleek, modern vibe to it. The walls are white and so is most of the furniture, so you get that uber clean feel when you walk in. There was a dj spinnin' on Friday night (mostly reggae and other laid-back tunes) and they had a projector showin' stuff behind the bar (think Pink Panther). There's also this lit up image of a butterfly on the wall by the dj. I thought it was a cute touch! This place is intimate, ya'll. It's a total 180 from Buddha next door. You don't have to push through crowds and crowds of people to get a drink. The bartenders are super friendly and down to earth. Their priority is to take care of their customers (and that's witnessed through the awesome service!). I noticed them actually bringing the drinks out to the booths, instead of having people wait at the bar!  Plus, the cute booths are way conducive to groups chattin' with their friends or just hangin' one-on-one with someone. They have a huge speciality drink menu (remember, they're all about everythng organic!), so, after much debate, I tried the mint and gin drink ($12). It tasted just like a moijito, but with gin!  Amazing.  We were also graced with trying a white grape shot as well as a mint chocolate shot.  While they both looked unappetizing in the shot glass, they were actually two of the most delicious shots I've ever had.  So, while Butterfly may appear to be full of pretentiousness because of the ultra-modern decor, that is just not the case.  This is one of most the laid-back bars I've been to, but with a trendy design to it.  And, you have to admit, that's a pretty tough combination to find!Unique drinks, awesome service, chill environment...those are my three top reasons to stop by Butterfly.  Come by and check it out!

12.description: So...I went to this place when it first opened a couple of years ago and hated it. They had some weird ticket system to buy drinks that I didnt appreciate, plus they didnt have a wide variety of spirits or beers at the time.Fast-forward to now... oh my how things have changed! Its like a whole different place. They have a GREAT beer selection! And good deals too... on wednesdays you get a free shot w/ your beer!  They have little theme nites and good music. Not really a popping place (at least not the times I've been there), but a good place to chill with a few friends. Bartenders are really nice too, which is a rarity in the city.

21.description: Place is chill.. they offer a good selection of beers and have decent specials during the week... go on a wednesday and get a free shot with every beer...

17.description: Place is chill.. they offer a good selection of beers and have decent specials during the week... go on a wednesday and get a free shot with every beer...

10.description: A couple of my girlfriends and I went here for 2 reasons and 2 reasons only: organic beer & to dance. None of us have ever been here before but by the end of the night? Mission accomplished.After arriving there at around 11 pm on a Friday night, I was surprised to see that it didn't look very crowded upon entrance. I was wrong. Right when you enter is the dance floor and the reason why it was semi-cleared out was because there was a performance going on and the place was actually packed. We squeezed our way into the crowd and to the bar where I ordered this one Japanese beer a friend of mind recommended: HITACHINO. It was perfection. Stella's cousin from another beer mama, one might say. Ask for it in a glass. After the performance, we were able to grab a booth by the dance floor where the beers kept coming and the deejay kept playing the sickest jams! From Bell Biv Devoe's "Poison" to a remix of Brownstone's "If You Love Me"...you bet we were tearing up the dance floor and singing our hearts out! :)Awesome music + awesome beer + awesome company = awesome time. (Say awesome one more time.)

5.description: I came to the place back when it originally opened and it was dope! Nice earthy atmosphere and was just a cool, interesting place to be. I walked in recently and wondered if I stumbled into the wrong place. The walls are just plain white and bland. The drinks are even more expensive now. I got one of those organic vodka raspberry drinks and they told me it was $12 (It was originally $10). They gave it to me in a cognac glass and originally it was in a regular glass and was a couple of bucks cheaper. They gave me some organic beer (I think it was called Dead Man's Curse) which was ok and only $4.There is still no cover and the bar staff is still pretty cool. Obviously this place needs to go through a third renovation, especialy if they want to uphold the Funky Buddha Lounge tradition.

3.description: Chill afro-Latino beats, great non-pretentious crowd, and organic drinks. Much respect.

35.description: This place is cool and probably unlike most other bars you will ever visit. Although I couldn't exactly tell at what points I was having drinks with alcohol in them or not. That being said, I went with an organic porter which wa pretty good. There's all kinds of earthy drinks and new flavors to choose from. I probably won't make it down there much but when I do I will try to stop in again. And yes, the bartenders are great.

19.description: ok, as someone who frequents the buddha area often i've gotten to know the folk there pretty well and i'll give you all the inside scoop...when the original Butterfly opened it was this grand vision of Mark's, and it really was a wicked concept...however i think the spot kinda ran away from everyone a little bit and the mainstream just wasn't ready for such an establishment...so after a rollercoaster of a year they decided it was time for a revamp...the spot was redone well...simple and clean...however it opened to the public a little prematurely, so the highlights, details, bells, and whistles had yet to put into place...the bar is now totally functional, with not only organic drink options, but a full standard bar as well serving everything from PBR ot Grey Goose...the led light system they're putting in there is sick...and the sound system is top notch...i was there last wednesday and the place was banging...i'm someone who's kinda picky when it comes to joints i'll hang out at...but when you can get a PBR and a shot of whisky for $3 and listen to Kid Cut Up or Zebo rip tracks all night with no cover, i'm a pretty happy guy...

28.description: Alright I've been to both the original version and the new "white" version.  I really do mean white, everything is bright white.  Well except the bathrooms, they get some color.  I kinda miss the old feel, although I appreciate the greater number of tables.  My friend works here and I have to say I think the staff is more of a draw than the sparse and antiseptic themed environment.  That said, I kind of like the fact that it is not crowded at all.  They were playing Dark Crystal and Easy Rider when I was here on the projector, so the place isn't all bad.  The place is kind of nice if you are up for a dressy lounge type, but don't like crowds.  I guess every night depends on the DJ or band that is playing.  The actual club is not very large at all, and there is plenty of seating, not much room for dancing, but that doesn't seem to deter people.  Drink prices are commesurate with the upscale type atmosphere.  My major complaint is the music is usually blasting way too loud, since there isn't much of a crowd.  This place would make for a nice cool place to make conversation, but the volume level kind of kills it.

45.description: I had an amazing time here, perfect for a nice romantic evening. The staff is great, drinks are amazing (including the non alcoholic drinks), music and the people are eclectic ( girls walking around in butterfly wings, a guy playing a djimbe etc). A non smoking venue, this is the best date place I have ever been to and I would highly recommend it.Situated next to The Buddha Lounge and they share the valet just in case you couldn't find parking.I am posting the text from the venue's site because I think it is a perfect description of the room. so here it is....The BUTTERFLY SOCIAL CLUB is a first of its kind, eco-built, superfood and tonic bar. BUTTERFLY SOCIAL CLUB supports organic, chemical free and wild crafted food production in over 30 countries. BUTTERFLY SOCIAL CLUB utilizes solar energy, kinetic energy from a bike in the front window and high efficiency lighting and amplifiers. The interior is one of the largest indoor earthen structures in the world curved to look like tree trunks using recycled wood. BUTTERFLY SOCIAL CLUB is one of the warmest sounding and feeling rooms in the city. Living vines on our trees and a gurgling fountain in the front make BUTTERFLY SOCIAL CLUB the perfect oasis in downtown Chicago. Come and enjoy the best drinks in the world from the best places around the world!For More Infobutterflysocialclub.com

33.description: I hope I can revise my rating in the future, but my review stems solely from trying to go to Butterfly Social Club last Saturday night (July 5th) with a small bachelorette party in tow.  We had gone onto the website recently, and NOWHERE did we see any mention of the place being closed for construction until the 10th (July? August? I'm not sure).  Total bummer!  We were not about to pay $25/person for Buddha, as we were looking for something a little bit more relaxing and a lounge vibe.Hopefully I can make it down again, though not with the fun group we had gathered together.Too bad, as Salud got our business & was really accomodating!

43.description: so i walk in and the guy at the door says no cash accepted at the bar, you have to pre-buy all your drink tickets from him.  i ask him how much they are, $5 for a small drink, $10 for a big.  I thought it was weird but i bought twenty tickets, i felt like i was at a raffle.  then i look at the menu which is obscure and hard to see in the dark room with almost no light and some cheap ass looking plastic logs for couches and tree trunks and crap which were not comfortable to sit on.  i settled for a margarita and the long island, both were $10.  they give me the smallest margarita i have ever seen in the smallest margarita glass it looked like it was less than 6 oz.  the long island was bigger, but it was all organic and tasted like somebody mixed sugar water and coconut and threw in some diet coke...nasty.  maybe it didn't help that out of the two bartenders behind the bar, one wasn't really doing anything while the other seemed to have no clue what to put in the long island.  i say go next door to funky buddha.

2.description: After a tremendous dinner at Publican, we ran around like a couple of bar-minded Godilocks trying to find the right bar to park ourselves.We really enjoyed the drinks at Butterfly but the place was dead. I loved it though. It reminded me of the old-school (but now defunct) Goldfinger in LA (in that 70s private detective/ disco sort of way). They encouraged us to go next door to Buddah Lounge (which I assumed they owned) and after we left, they locked the door behind us. I guess they were done for the night. Bonus- great craft beer (in bottles)

18.description: Some change is NOT good.The old Butterfly had a nice warm feel to it. Very earthy and inviting I wish I took pics before. Sooooo I was excited to see how it was re-done.  I walked in and almost died.Now its like every other bar here in Chicago, cold and white. Think of  Sounbdar in a lounge. I went last night for the Sneak Peek Grand RE-Opening so the crowd was a lot older than I'm used to.  Which is probably because Kingsbury Plazas whole building was invited.  The bartender was great even though no one left the bar after getting a drink(well there was no where for anyone to go anymore!!!) You just had to squeeze your way in, but he always took and gave me my order pretty fast.  Sigh.... the music....I was expecting Hip hop and Soul which is what butterfly is known for...Nope not today my friend -but again maybe it just was for that one night.Thank Buddha!!! Peaks Organic was the brew in open bar because I LOVE that beer and the vanilla organic vodka with the cream soda flavored pop was so good.  I ordered my beloved Gojitini and it wasn't as good as last time but the bartender just didn't have the amount of time to do it right so it's ok.  Oh Butterfly I don't know if I will go back to you my sweet dear lover.  I really do want to love you again so if I am reassured you have hip hop and soul nights still and the same crowd I will go back. Oh and some guy from california pointed out there should be recycling bins inside the place. I agree.  Wanna be Green, do it all the way.wow i hate being a bummer. you get 2 starts cause you're an eco friendly bar....

41.description: Great in concept, bad in execution.  I first stumbled on to this particular venue prior to its opening, following the various articles describing its concept and intentions.  I was thrilled at the concept of a Green/Organic bar, and I still think it's a fantastic idea, but on visiting it fell a bit short of my expectations.I love the interior.  Miguel Elliott's efforts yielded outstanding results with the decor.  It is earthy, with sculpted nooks for seating which gives the interior an intimate feel.  Because of this, I can't give a lesser rating to it.  If the execution had been different, I could really see this as a recommended place to visit.But when it comes down describing it, the word that comes to mind is "pretentious".  I suppose it could be due to my expectations from the pre-opening descriptions, but honestly, I wouldn't recommend this as a venue.  The experience was rather disappointing.  While Latin pipe music sets a very laid-back, earthy atmosphere, playing it at decible levels on par with your average deafening dance club tends to negate the relaxed atmosphere that they seem to be trying to create.  We couldn't hold a conversation outside of yelling at each other.  The staff and clientele on my visit...ecosnobs.  Seriously.  You know the type.  The staff was somehow organically snooty, and the patrons had the falsely superior air of the fatally trendy.  Essentially it felt like plastic people in a granola hangout.  I would like to revisit this establishment about a year or two hence, once they settle more into their niche and hopefully the artificial Greens have moved on to the next big trend.

4.description: Came here last Friday night after day 1 at Lolla.  There was an event called Deep Rooted and they were playing some soul house, breaks, afrobeat and whatnot.Got to the place and it wasn't very packed for a Friday night, but the music was great though.  There were some people dancing and enjoying themselves.  Went to the bar and ordered a jameson/ginger, but the bartender lady was really light handed w/ the alki.  We chilled at a booth and enjoyed our drinks for a little bit and then we headed next door to Funky Buddha to check it out.Overall, Butterfly is a pretty chill spot.

6.description: This place was where we were directed to go when waiting for brunch/lunch at Orange.Nice little spot to wait. Got a bloody mary for my friends and I, and a mimosa for my cousin. $5 bloody marys and they were pretty good! However, the mimosa was $6, is that normal? IDK. They serve it in a plastic see-through cup (with lid) because we were allowed to take it to Orange, which was BYOB. Cool.The bartender was cool, sincere and nice.Decor is funky. I like it.

22.description: my new summmer spot enough said! even if i don't drink on the night i go, i can sit there and watch the hilarious projections all night and giggle to myself.

15.description: This place had the makings of a really cool bar. It was cozy, trendy ( not my fave, but I can see the merit), and it had a good dj. So, why didn't it get more stars? Because, I guess we came in on a random private party night, but the bar was still open to the public, but oh wait! The bar doesn't have a private party space, so it was just a bunch of people convening in the "back." But since the place is tiny, that means they took up most of the bar and awkwardly they had brought catered food and there was no place to set it. So, they put each dish on a different table throughout the bar...a bar that does not serve food...a tiny bar that does not serve food. I think you get the picture. Dear Social Club, if you're gonna have a large private party, close the bar to the public or get a back room.

20.description: A couple of my girlfriends and I went here for 2 reasons and 2 reasons only: organic beer & to dance. None of us have ever been here before but by the end of the night? Mission accomplished.After arriving there at around 11 pm on a Friday night, I was surprised to see that it didn't look very crowded upon entrance. I was wrong. Right when you enter is the dance floor and the reason why it was semi-cleared out was because there was a performance going on and the place was actually packed. We squeezed our way into the crowd and to the bar where I ordered this one Japanese beer a friend of mind recommended: HITACHINO. It was perfection. Stella's cousin from another beer mama, one might say. Ask for it in a glass. After the performance, we were able to grab a booth by the dance floor where the beers kept coming and the deejay kept playing the sickest jams! From Bell Biv Devoe's "Poison" to a remix of Brownstone's "If You Love Me"...you bet we were tearing up the dance floor and singing our hearts out! :)Awesome music + awesome beer + awesome company = awesome time. (Say awesome one more time.)

36.description: Ommmmmm my god.  Get it.This place blew my mind.  I got drunk and received my daily allotment of antioxidants.  Which is great for my hectic lifestyle.Verda is amazing and the bar staff was fun too.  Thanks to Dave for making our drinks and thanks to us for drunken em....

14.description: Every time I come here, I have a great time, but I think it might have something to do with traveling with a pack of awesome Chicago dancers, cause we are usually the only ones on the dance floor. The DJ's usually pretty good and I enjoy the space, but the drinks are definitely overpriced. I think this is a better place to go with people you already know rather than a place to go in hopes of meeting someone new, for those of you who like to pick people up in bars, haha.

3.description: I see Kat for massage here..She's awesome!

1.description: I've seen a lot of people for massage over the years. I've been going to Kat for about a year now. I highly recommend her. She has changed how my back and shoulders feel, not just right after the massage, but all the time. Kat is a great find and at an affordable price. The Healing Room is a peaceful and quiet space, the perfect vibe for the great bodywork that I get.

2.description: Clean, calm, soothing space.  Lawata pinpoints the spots you need to work on, or can deliver the most relaxing full-body massage you have ever experienced.  She is an independent massage therapist, and is in great demand.  Book early and often, you won't regret it.

5.description: Loved the time, attention and quality of service given to us by the practitioners here.  Street parking can be a little bit of a challenge, but better than a lot of other downtown locations, and better than a pricey garage.

6.description: My fiancée bought me a massage on Lifebooker. This review is not going to cover the actual service provided because I didn't even get past the front door. I scheduled my appointment for Oct 15 at 5:30PM (I have the email chain as verification) and even sent an email earlier on the 15th to confirm, which was never responded to. I also called three times trying to confirm and none of calls were returned. Since I had the email that backed up my appointment time, I still decided to go. Needless to say, it was a worthless trip. I stood outside the building knocking on the door for 10 minutes before Lawata Brown, who was going to perform the massage, answered the door. She had scheduled another appointment and offered to reschedule, but I am not going to waste my time to travel there again. I hate it when my time is not valued, especially since I am a customer. I don't expect anything more than I pay for. What I do expect, is if you offer a service, at least be competent in running your business. Scheduling should be the easy part....

7.description: The Healing Room is a lovely space that is very nice and quiet becuse the therapist work by apointment only.  You won't find a snoby lady at the front when you show up and there will not the the heavy smell from that chick getting her roots done.  When I go to the Healing Room for a massage I see Charlotte Phillips.  I love my visits!!!  Charlotte is always very professional and puts me at ease.  I work in a high stress job but I almost always get so relaxed I fall asleep during a massage.  Plus, she keeps records of what we have worked on and where my problem spots are so I don't have to tell her everytime.  Give her a try and you'll be back.

0.description: Lawata Brown is my go-to Massage Therapist. She is fantastic and I would definitely recommend her.I met Lawata last year after purchasing a Lifebooker Loot massage package. It was easy to set up an appointment. I prefer email and that's how we scheduled our first meeting. I've seen her many times since then.Lawata's space at the Healing Room is conveniently located in River West with street parking either in front of the studio or around the block. I've gone to see her on different days at various times and I've never had an issue finding a spot.  Her space is very clean, quiet and calming. I like the sound machine that she uses in the massage room as I find it to be relaxing. Some people may not like it, but I'm a fan.Lawata is very engaging and passionate about her career and is educated on various massage techniques.  When meeting and interacting with her, you can also tell that she leads a very healthy lifestyle. Throughout my massages, Lawata asks the right questions and applies the right amount of pressure as needed. If I have any trouble spots, she focuses on those to ensure that everything is worked out. She also makes sure that I am comfortable at all times. I have often fallen asleep on the massage table because I am completely relaxed. When I get up, I always feel more energized. She's great!Please Note: This is my first review. I often use Yelp and other reviews to get information regarding different businesses before frequenting them.  Before purchasing my LIfebooker Loot, I researched Lawata and found this link that describes her services: youtube.com/watch?v=rbps…

4.description: I used to be a regular at Urban Oasis; however, I decided to try the Healing Room because there was a great coupon on Lifebooker. At first I purchased a single visit because I wanted to experience the service before committing to more. I used the 1st voucher on Sunday, July 15th. And, I was sooo IMPRESSED with Lawata's expertise and technique that I purchased the maximum number of 3-visit vouchers that Lifebooker allows immediately after the appointment; and I have since purchased enough of the 3-visit vouchers to get weekly massages until May of 2013. In fact, I have a standing appointment with her every single week! OMG! I just did the math. I've been there 13 times since the 1st visit and I have ALWAYS been pleased with the service. (I had to cancel 2 appointments due to illness and workload.)She consistently goes above and beyond - whether it's the mixing of techniques, the use of just the right fragrances, the right balance of hot and cold, etc. And, most importantly, the persistent pain that I that had in my left shoulder for over 6 years is dissolving for the first time.I'm a HAPPY customer!

1.description: Your own art gallery that doubles as a Salon, with the Artist personally attending you.  You'll get tea, astrology advice, one on one consultation and an unbelievable haircut. Since Jeff's other passion is restoring art, his eye for color and shape is unmatched.

0.description: After 3 bad haircut in a row over 20 years ago I found Jeff!  I've been going to him ever since.  Recently a hairdresser and colorist asked me who did my hair - she loved it!  Jeff is the best - i've never been disappointed and that is saying a lot after all these years.

58.description: I never write yelp reviews but relied so heavily on others reviews of this salon before I went there so I thought I'd add to their praises! If you're on the fence about finding a new hair place, Kelly Cardenas will not let you down!I have lived in Chicago for almost a year and still haven't found a new hair place.. I thought I could make it another month until I go home for a cut and color with my long-time stylist, but I couldn't take it anymore so I yelped a bit and found Kelly Cardenas and I couldn't be happier with my results! I called yesterday and they were able to get me in on a cancellation today, which was so great. I did a brief phone consultation before I arrived then when I got there my stylist (Bethany-- who was fantastic!) and Travis, another employee, were so welcoming. Actually every person there was so friendly and so helpful, it was great. There is definitely a good vibe and working relationship amongst staff which is always nice. After chatting with Bethany we settled on color and she was very upfront and open about the cost of the appointment. Of all things, this was one thing I was very grateful for because it's pretty nerve wracking going to a new salon and being blind sided by cost. It ended up being cheaper than I was expecting and for a transitional color appointment from dark brown/blonde ombré to a lighter summer color, I couldn't be happier with my results. I love the location--right in the heart of WP-- and will definitely be going back.

56.description: I had a great experience at this salon!  Amber was awesome, she gave me a masterful "Sombre" (subtle ombre) color and cut!  Excellent service as well, you definitely feel pampered from start to finish.  I will definitely going back to Amber for my next cut/color and highly recommend this salon if you are willing to throw down a few extra bucks for a sophisticated on-point style.  These guys know what they're doing!

29.description: I had a GREAT experience! I had Travis and he went above and beyond. He listened to what I wanted and gave me exactly that, and more. I couldn't be happier! He is great with color! I would highly recommend him and the salon. I'll be back for sure!

42.description: I have been going here for a few months and love it! Diana is absolutely the best! My color and cut have been phenomenal. My hair looks healthier than ever. It is expensive but worth every penny!

23.description: This review is sooooo long overdue. I've been going to KCS for almost 3 years now and Taya an absolutely godsend! Besides being the sweetest girl ever, she always understands exactly what I'm looking for and sends me off with an amazing cut. I always get compliments on my hair and have easily referred half a dozen friends to her/KCS. I've gone to some of the most upscale (not to mention, stuffy) salons in the city and none of them compare or deliver the quality product and experience KC give clients time and time again. They're super professional, but always friendly/cool/laid back. Just call and book your appointment already - you will not be disappointed ;)

47.description: had a GREAT experience at KC! I went in yesterday and (unfortunately) was not 100% in love with the color I got, but went in today and they fixed it and i am TOTALLY in love with my cut and color! Eli was AMAAAAZING. The entire staff was fun, professional, and great at what they do. I felt like a super model walking out of there. Definitely worth every penny and will absolutely go back again!

8.description: Amazing. After seeing that my hair needed a huge "pick me up"after almost a year of negligence, I turned to yelp. Recently moving to Wicker- KCS was at the top of the list and I immediately booked. I walked in as a (almost) color virgin and with no idea of what I wanted. Bethany was absolutely fabulous! She talked me through the process and asked detailed questions to narrow down what my indecisive mind was looking for. After the consultation, color bar, amazing wash/massage- my hair came out beautifully. I never thought I'd enjoy the color & highlights (as I apprehensively agreed to prior) Long story short- Bethany, along with the team @ Kelly Cardenas Salon was a perfect decision. They deliver nothing but the best, flawlessly appealing to every client that walks in. I highly recommend to anyone who wants nothing but perfection in their style -oxox

31.description: I just got back from my first haircut and deep conditioning treatment appointment at Kelly Cardenas with Cristian as my stylist. I have never been so happy with the service and end result that I immediately decided to write a review. I had no wait time at all and was warmly greeted by the receptionist. They offer an array of beverages from simply water to tea to hot chocolate... of course I opted for the hot chocolate ;)Next Cristian met me and gave me a quick tour of the salon and explained how they operate which was actually great because I knew what to expect. He then sat me down and asked me what I was hoping out of this haircut and any issues I have with my hair. I liked that HE wanted to know what I wanted and didn't pressure me in what HE thought I should have (which i've experienced at many other salons.) As other reviews have mentioned the massage is amazing. The washing station is blocked off from the rest of the salon and has a spa feel to it as it's dim, they lay a blanket on you, and calming music is playing. Cristian took his time to properly massage my hair as well as gave me an arm and neck massage. Literally at this point I was thinking "can this get any better?!"During the haircut Cristian was genuine and we had great conversation. The environment is open, friendly, not snobby at all. The way the salon is set up allows customers to interact with one another too, which is different but cool. He didn't push any products on me excessively, just told me a bit about the hair spray he was using and pretty much let the product speak for itself when he worked it into my hair. I left with healthy, beautiful, wavy hair and a big smile on my face. Having lived and travelled in over 30 countries I have to say hands down this salon has been the best I've ever visited. I promise you will be pleased if you go to Kelly Cardenas Salon!

34.description: I finally found 'my salon' (and stylist) and couldn't be happier! They really have the whole customer experience thing figured out here. Everyone is SO friendly and nice... I feel so welcomed and comfortable as soon as I walk in the door. Travis, in particular, is wonderful and so incredibly talented! I always leave with exactly what I want. :)

16.description: Travis is awesome. Although KCS is on the pricey side, you definitely get what you pay for.

13.description: I've been going here for at least 3 years or more. I've seen multiple stylist and have been happy with them all but within the last year I've shifted my loyalty to Cristian!  He always gives me the cut and color I want, he doesn't over cut or color and my highlights look natural which means I can go less often and my hair still looks great! Recently, I had him cut my seven year olds straight as a board hair and it's the best hair cut I've ever had for him-seriously! (It's been a long painful adventure finding someone to finally give him a great cut) now I have!

11.description: My regular stylist is on maternity leave and I am overdue for a hair cut. I scheduled an appointment with Travis based on yelps reviews.  Very very satisfied with the result!! My hair looks exactly like the picture I showed him but a shorter version as I requested.  Will return for color soon!!

39.description: I did a ombré hair with Bethany and I couldn't be happier with the results , she is super friendly and she knows what she is doing , I highly recommend Bethany for whomever want a perfectionist hairstylist .

37.description: Love love love this salon - Travis is the best and bobby at the desk couldn't be more helpful!!

0.description: Yay for KCS and everyone who works there!!!! My new salon in Chicago as I just moved here from NYC; you truly can't find this kind of quality + kind and wonderful service in Manhattan--the kind of service where you get to know and love all the employees and become like family to them.Diana is easily one of the most talented on staff here and the kindest heart. She's incredible at both cut and color. I would refer her to anyone!

38.description: My stylist was the lovely, talented, and friendly Diana. She gave me a tour of the salon and explained the layout. Then she led me to the bathroom where I could put on a robe to protect my clothing. (Not necessary since I was only getting it styled, not colored or cut, but I appreciated the gesture.)Diana then sat down and asked what I was looking for in my style that day, even looking at a picture of my dress for the event to get a feel for what was appropriate. Then she went to work! We chatted because I love to talk to people, and she was very energetic. She let me have total authority over what I liked and didn't like, even showing me with her own hair what the crimper would do. In the end, I was totally pleased and would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for great service with a smile. (And it won't totally break the bank, either...my styling took about an hour and cost $65 before tip.)

51.description: Beth, knows!!! I'll start by saying I was pretty scared with booking with anyone. I've never been able to trust anyone with my hair. I'm mixed with Black and Puerto rican. I have long, THICK, wavy, curly and coarse hair. It's hard for me to do my own hair and especially someone else who doesn't do "my type" often. It took me yearrrsss to find the place I've been looking for. Beth was amazing. She listened. She asked questions. Told me what she could and what she couldn't. I walked out with more than the results I expected. I have found my hair stylist. Not going anywhere else. Oh to name other stylist that were sooooo helpful and talented.... Jessica. (She's amazing with her curling wand) and also Selina at the front. If you have curly/wavy natural hair. PLEASE take her advice. Other than that... book with BETH. that red head knows her hair and work.

27.description: JESSICA! I went to this salon for the first time today and Jessica did such an amazing job on my dark brown dye and short hair cut. My hair was super long and lighter before and I was nervous on what I wanted but she did amazing. This salon is so great! Will definitely go back! Choose Jess!

32.description: For a decade, I had my hair done near where I work in the 'burbs. That stylist left and I looked for a place closer to home.Enter...Yelp. Kelly Cardenas had great reviews, so I made an appointment with cautious optimism. That was two years ago. Today, I can't imagine going elsewhere. I'm certainly no hipster, even though I live in a hipster neighborhood - I think I have a more classic personal style. A lot of hipsters work here, but not once have I ever felt out of place or uncomfortable. In fact , this is my respite of calm every eight weeks. The people here are so polite and friendly, with you and with each other. It seems like a very genuine and not forced environment. That's important to me, as my PR career makes me skeptical of people's motives.If you're looking for perspective on pricing - it's reasonable. It's not cheap, but by no means is it out of line for customer that is single and in middle management.

54.description: I love getting my hair done thanks to this salon.  I used to be SO nervous about getting haircuts because it never came out the same or the way I wanted it. I've been there multiple times. Each time Matt cuts my hair it looks amazing. I get complimented multiple times a week. I went for highlights and they are perfect! The prices are a little on the high side, but for me- it is worth it. The head/neck massage makes my day every time I go to the salon. The salon is also timely, I've never had to wait for more than 5-8 min. They do a really great job of making the experience as relaxing as possible, and then you leave looking beautiful. What more could you ask for ?

48.description: This is actually my first Yelp review, as I felt the need to write about my horrendous experience at Kelly Cardenas. I am extremely picky about my hair, and have gone to enough salons and hair transformations to know what a good cut and color looks like. I had not dyed my dark brown hair for about 7 years, but had been thinking about having the ombre look done to my hair for a couple of years now. Last week I went into Kelly Cardenas to have the ombre done to my hair, where I met Taya, my stylist. I showed her a picture of exactly how I wanted the ombre to look, expressed and reiterated to her how I wanted it to be SUBTLE, how I hadn't dyed my hair in about 7 years so I was nervous, and told her I would like the color to be more on the ends and underneath my hair. Taya basically did the exact opposite of everything that I wanted. When she washed out the color and blow dried my hair, the color was not subtle. The bottom half of my hair had various shades of blonde highlights, and she kept telling me, "You'll like it when it's all done." Needless to say, I did NOT like it when she was finished. I told her it was way too light, and she proceeded to tell me to go home and feel it out for a couple of days, and to come back if I still didn't like it. Knowing right then I didn't like it, I asked her if she could darken the blonde highlights. She ended up putting a gloss toner on my hair to darken everything. My hair ended up looking better than what it first looked like, but I went home still unsatisfied. It was not an ombre, but more like highlights that started from the bottom half of my hair, it wasn't subtle, and it was not the color I asked for. While she did my ombre, she was doing the weaving technique to highlight my hair, I should have known right then it was not going to end well. A couple days later I called back because I disliked everything about the color Taya did, where I was told to come back in and she would fix it. The next week I came in, explained what I wanted again, and showed more pictures of the color I wanted. To my surprise, the ombre turned out WORSE. The top half of my hair was colored black, and the bottom half had more various shades of blonde, nothing was blended, and I just thought I completely ruined my natural hair that I had for so long. I would have been better off never going in to have the ombre done to begin with. Being really upset with my experience, I called back and asked to speak with a manager. The manager told me come back in for a third time to get my hair done by someone with a little more experience. I decided I absolutely did not want to go back to this place again, so I asked for a full refund. This is where the two stars comes in, the manager did not give me a hard time about the refund, gave me all my money back, and had it ready for me to pick up that day. Fortunately, I went somewhere else where they did an amazing job fixing up the botched ombre from Kelly Cardenas. They knew exactly what I wanted, could see exactly what went wrong with the ombre, and used the balayage technique to create my desired ombre.

44.description: Quite possibly the best haircut/style I've had, ever. Dani went through a thorough process understanding what kind of cut and style I wanted. The shampoo and conditioning before the haircut was great. Dani was extremely detailed and meticulous with my haircut. When I saw the finished product, I couldn't be more happy. My only regret is that I didn't come here sooner. This place is the only salon you need to go to in the City of Chicago.

24.description: I am a total control freak when it comes to my hair or makeup. The last haircut I got was about a year ago, and it was traumatic - I asked for a couple of inches off, ended up leaving with 8 or 9 inches off and about to cry. It's not easy for me to find a good hair stylist, and once I find one, I stick to the same person. I moved to Chicago in August, and this was my first time getting my hair done here. I did extensive research online, and narrowed it down between a few. One looked promising but the pricing was absolutely ridiculous! High prices on their site, but when I called to book an appt, they said "Oh yeah actually the prices are $100 more than listed and we've been meaning to get that fixed on our site"It would have cost me at least $500 to get my hair cut and balayage done. So I decided to come to Kelly Cardenas. Taya is amazing. She is friendly, very skilled, and works quickly. I have had all kinds of things done to my hair in the past.. from perms to dyeing to ombre, but it was my first time getting balayage. I absolutely love how it came out, and she exceeded my expectations.The entire salon was full of friendly and courteous staff. I will definitely be returning when I need something else done :)Thanks Taya!

7.description: I went to Kelly Cardenas Salon for almost 3 years and was never once disappointed! The overall experience from start to finish was fantastic! Taya always took great care of me, and the rest of the team truly enjoyed the work they did. They even went out and fed the parking meter for me when my time ran out. Taya did phenomenal coloring and cuts over and over. I always got compliments on my hair and she knew how to change it up with a fresh new look without going outside of the client's comfort zone. They also make you feel like what you want is the priority. Sadly I recently relocated to another city, but next time I'm in Chicago I may make another appointment to catch up with Taya and get a new style. I highly recommend Taya for a stylist, among many others! Get a glass of wine and enjoy the massages while you are there.

49.description: I just adore this place. I made my usual very late "6 week appt" staying with my usual short cut but bringing pictures for something a little different. Once again Taya performed a perfect cut. This time she suggested adding highlights to roughen up my hair texture (virgin hair for about 10 yrs) so I do remember color making my hair less prone to flatness. It turned out beautifully. I'm so happy she talked me into it. Also a benefit of having color done as well as haircut I did two shampoo room visits today. It was heaven. Honestly the young lady who shampooed and massaged today was outstanding. I love that room and gladly make the half hour drive to experience it. I also need to add: Somehow I ended up confusing my appointment time and showed up 2 hrs early. They graciously fitted me in. It was totally my fault but they never made me feel like I was putting them out. And I was personally mortified about my mistake.

40.description: I'll start with the positive first. I can see why some people like this place. It's energetic and the people are quite friendly. The service is also very good. They will run and refill your meter for you if time is running short. The shampoo area is in a separate room with dimmed lights and soft music, and the massage is lovely. But this is about it for what good I experienced here. I originally called asking to see a senior stylist that same day, explaining that I have dealt with beginner stylists before with disastrous results. They had none available that day - fair enough - and offered to have me see one of their junior stylists who was very experienced and skilled with long hair. I expressed my concern and they were very reassuring so I thought I would take a chance. Bad idea. When I arrived, I was sitting and waiting for at least 30 minutes past my appointment time. They also don't have assigned stations for their stylists, so if all the seats are full when your shampoo is done, you are basically just waiting in the colouring area with your wet towel until one opens up. This isn't something I would not come back for, but it would have been nice to know ahead so I could factor in the extra time into my schedule. After a long wait, I had a stylist come to greet me and take over ... not who my appointment was supposed to be with. At first I thought he was just shampooing my hair, and I eventually asked about the mix up. He said he was assigned to me and didn't know why the confusion. This was the first major aggravation. I have no idea why I didn't see who I was scheduled to see. I found this extremely unprofessional, especially considering no one addressed it with me prior to the appointment starting. I very specifically explained what I was looking for and the problems I have had in the past and the way my hair works. I wanted thicker layers, chunkier face framing layered bangs no shorter than below my eyebrows, and a slight trim. To avoid confusion, I provided pictures. Long story short, I came home with a haircut that brought me to tears. It was nothing like what I asked for, and in fact my hair looked in worse condition than when I arrived. It now looks like dry straw, with layers that looked frayed and sheared. And the "bangs" were a nightmare: wispy, shorter than what I asked for (which I pointed out to him and received no response or apology) and looking like a 5 year old attached my hair in my sleep. I can see why some people like this place. The service apart from the haircut is good, but the actual haircut itself was a nightmare. The stylist I saw clearly had limited experience and was just spewing out information he obviously just learned in school. I haven't walked away from a haircut this upset for 10 years. All I can say is thank goodness hair grows back. I will definitely not be back or recommend this salon.

53.description: This review is long overdue! In a nutshell, I tried to find the perfect colorist and stylist for years. Nine years to be exact. My search is over (and has been over for almost 2 years). Matt is consistent, sincere and all around wonderful. I am so glad I found him. I leave happy every time! Matt is fantastic and the entire staff is welcoming and friendly!

30.description: As a full-time student who doesn't live that close to the Wicker Park area, booking was super convenient and quick through their online appointment system. Multiple stylists came up to me to introduce themselves and compliment me on my hair throughout my time there. The entire salon seems to be filled with very welcoming and friendly staff!Taya was my stylist and she did an amazing job! I was a little apprehensive as I have never dyed my hair before and was going for balayage highlights. I showed her a few pictures and she immediately came up with an idea and color scheme she was hoping to achieve. She's incredibly sweet, easy to talk to, and knows what she's doing with hair! After the addition of highlights, I got my hair washed by Matt-- who was also extremely nice-- and the massage was awesome (I even fell asleep, oops). Taya trimmed and curled my hair afterwards, and I am in love with my new hair! I have gotten so many compliments already. Definitely book with Taya!

46.description: Got a same day appointment. I had colored my own hair and made it WAY too dark. Jessica helped me out with highlights, and added a gloss treatment. Now my hair is shiny, long, and a color that I absolutely adore. She made me feel so important and paid attention to every detail, including wash and styling that was far more attentive than I've  experienced in the past at other high end salons. Wonderful!

1.description: Absolutely love this salon!! First off, everyone is so nice and welcoming. The room where they wash your hair is amazing. It's so calm and relaxing and to top it off, I got a neck and shoulder massage. I could have fallen asleep. I was able to work with Travis who was amazing! It's so nice when you find someone who listens to what you want and can help with suggestions to make managing you hair easier.  Love the cut and style and can't wait to try the suggestions given so I can stop throwing my hair in a ponytail all the time. I can not say enough good things about the salon and Travis. Thank you so much!! Can't wait to go back.

55.description: I'm not a fan of trying new hair salons in fear that the stylist will mess my hair up but Taya relived all my haircut fears! A friend recommended the salon to me and I decided to try it since it's located near my house. Everything from making my appointment (you can book everything online!) check in, wash/head massage to my finished haircut was seamless. Taya was super friendly and actually understood what I wanted her to do with my hair. I thought it was so cool how they have an open setting where anyone can help one another with cutting hair, coloring or blow-drying. I'd never seen that before but it seems to work. At one point I had two people blow-drying my hair!I've left both times feeling really great about my haircut and wanting to tell the world where I got it cut from. I've been to the salon twice and for the first time in my life; I actually look forward to booking my next hair appointment! Hidden Gem in Wicker Park! Go now!

9.description: I have mixed feelings about this place. I didn't get the light brown hair I was looking for but I did get nice highlights everyone compliments me on. Done by Bethany. I didn't like it at first I have to admit. I had to go in the next day to get them fixed but they're pretty nice now; kind of looks like ombré.

26.description: The best salon in the city. Not only do they know good hair, they are the coolest people you will ever meet. They are humble, kind, talented and there is no salon out there to match their customer service. I love going to KCS because I get to come out looking amazing and hang out with my friends at the same time.

25.description: I've been coming here for almost a year now! I always get my hair done by Jessica! She's so amazingly talented!!!! Whatever you ask for you get! I always bring her a million Pinterest photos of what I like and she talks to me about what works, what doesn't and helps me get to the perfect choice. I've never NEVER been disappointed with their services. When they wash your hair your enter this extremely relaxing "wash house" which is very Xen. Calm music puts you in the most relaxing state ever while they wash your hair AND give neck/back massages. If your ever having a bad day/week I would suggest just coming in for a wash and blow dry! Even if you don't get a cut or color, the experience alone is worth every dime! Best salon in Chicago hands down & Jessica is the best stylist!

12.description: I am a total control freak when it comes to my hair or makeup. The last haircut I got was about a year ago, and it was traumatic - I asked for a couple of inches off, ended up leaving with 8 or 9 inches off and about to cry. It's not easy for me to find a good hair stylist, and once I find one, I stick to the same person. I moved to Chicago in August, and this was my first time getting my hair done here. I did extensive research online, and narrowed it down between a few. One looked promising but the pricing was absolutely ridiculous! High prices on their site, but when I called to book an appt, they said "Oh yeah actually the prices are $100 more than listed and we've been meaning to get that fixed on our site"It would have cost me at least $500 to get my hair cut and balayage done. So I decided to come to Kelly Cardenas. Taya is amazing. She is friendly, very skilled, and works quickly. I have had all kinds of things done to my hair in the past.. from perms to dyeing to ombre, but it was my first time getting balayage. I absolutely love how it came out, and she exceeded my expectations.The entire salon was full of friendly and courteous staff. I will definitely be returning when I need something else done :)Thanks Taya!

59.description: I had a great experience here last summer with Nicole, gave me the most beautiful ahmering blonde highlights ive ever had! So naturally I returned this upcoming summer to turn my dark brown hair a lighter shade, hopefully blonde.  I have gone from black to blonde in the past as well and knew what I was in for. I sat in the chair knowing full well I would be going through bleaching, toning the whole shebang.  O received a platinum card for my dark hair which lifted immediately.  The products they use here are great, but I didn't appreciate the trim I recieved. It left my hair looking slightly uneven and she cut off more than I wanted to see on my already-short hair. Basically-color yes, cut-definitely not. Other than the bad trim everything else was fine but i am disappointed that my hair looks so odd now.

21.description: This is by far my favorite hair salon in Chicago and in life. Here's my Top 10 Reasons I Love Kelly Cardenas Salon:1. They brought me back to being blonde and I just feel like "me" again.2. The stylists have the edgiest clothes and are all best friends which I think is really cool and speaks to the cohesiveness of the company.3. All of the stylists genuinely LOVE Kelly. They speak about him like he's their God which leads me to believe he's a truly inspiring and awesome person, especially as their boss.4. They have a unique system for doing highlights that makes it easier for them to pick up when they re-highlight you.5. As Christian was massaging my shoulders after shampooing me, I thought about writing this Yelp review. They massage you. Umm yeah. Amazing.6. They have a very competitive price.7. I love the way they wrap the towel on my head. I need to learn that technique.8. They've always been able to accommodate my schedule or squeeze me in when need be.9. They have complimentary wine and coffee - try the Bon Affair.10. Just drink the Kelly Koolaid! You will not be disappointed!

17.description: Matt does my cut and color and I am always VERY happy when I leave! By far the best in Chicago! I have referred all my friends to him and will continue to do so.

10.description: I've come here once before to get an ombré & I left happy. Second time around I called and they booked me with Travis for my color. He did an amazing job getting the multidimensional brunette I was going for but it turned my ends way too dark Anyway, I'm not one to complain but I had to go back a few days later. This time not only did it take under an hour to fix I left feeling SUPER happy! My hair is freaking hot. Not even 4 hours out of the salon and got compliments! Thankfully the salon did not have a stank attitude and now I'll keep coming back! (See my picture)

5.description: As a full-time student who doesn't live that close to the Wicker Park area, booking was super convenient and quick through their online appointment system. Multiple stylists came up to me to introduce themselves and compliment me on my hair throughout my time there. The entire salon seems to be filled with very welcoming and friendly staff!Taya was my stylist and she did an amazing job! I was a little apprehensive as I have never dyed my hair before and was going for balayage highlights. I showed her a few pictures and she immediately came up with an idea and color scheme she was hoping to achieve. She's incredibly sweet, easy to talk to, and knows what she's doing with hair! After the addition of highlights, I got my hair washed by Matt-- who was also extremely nice-- and the massage was awesome (I even fell asleep, oops). Taya trimmed and curled my hair afterwards, and I am in love with my new hair! I have gotten so many compliments already. Definitely book with Taya!

3.description: I'm so glad that I met the Kelly Cardenas crew at an event 5 years ago, after which I scheduled an appointment with Taya, who I've been going to ever since. The salon is great and the stylists freely move between chairs across the salon, and retractable hair dryers are suspended from the ceiling! I revel in each visit, from the consultation to the amazing shoulder and scalp massage with the shampoo experience. Taya is the best stylist I've ever known, she understands what I'm trying to get out of my hair when I can when I can hardly verbalize it myself! I always love the way my hair looks and feels when I walk out the door.

35.description: I've been going here for at least 3 years or more. I've seen multiple stylist and have been happy with them all but within the last year I've shifted my loyalty to Cristian!  He always gives me the cut and color I want, he doesn't over cut or color and my highlights look natural which means I can go less often and my hair still looks great! Recently, I had him cut my seven year olds straight as a board hair and it's the best hair cut I've ever had for him-seriously! (It's been a long painful adventure finding someone to finally give him a great cut) now I have!

19.description: If you like to be pampered and want a good haircut, you found the place. Eli did a fantastic job!

28.description: Travis is awesome. Although KCS is on the pricey side, you definitely get what you pay for.

45.description: Really nice people working there, that's basically what the two stars go towards. I would maybe suggest booking an appointment with one of the more sought-after stylists. My girl didn't seem to have too much experience and the look I was hoping for didn't completely pan out. There was also some kind of confusion of doing a blowout with a round brush...very odd. For $300+, I would never walk in there again. I was extremely disappointed after being so sure this seemed like a great place for color.

33.description: LOVE this salon! Won't go anywhere else! Styling and coloring on point and the shampoo room is the best! Taya's my girl. Go to her.

43.description: Loved my haircut...AGAIN!!  Very accommodating! I called on a Friday to see when was Matt's next opening and they told me he had a cancellation for the day and they could fit me in. In & out on a Friday, what more can you ask for! Everyone was very attentive & personable! & Matt left me feeling beautiful!

2.description: I've never been that girl with "good hair." I've always had that frizzy, kinky hair that did its own thing no matter how I tried styling it. My saving grace in college was learning how to braid. After years and years of frustrated acceptance and hair envy, I was referred to Matt S. at Kelly's. For starters, Matt is just an incredible person - the kind of person you feel at home with. As soon as you sit in his chair, you just know good things are about to happen. He is a focused listener and will make sure you are on the same page before any styling begins. He is an expert at aligning your cut/color with your style and preferences. Matt is light years ahead of the fashion industry but also an accomplished stylist when it come to the classics. His attention to detail during the highlighting and trimming process really makes hair look so flawless.I've been coming to Matt S. for going on four years now and I'm having the best hair years of my life. He has transformed my hair into beautiful locks that get compliments from friends and strangers alike (I've actually had complete strangers ask about my hair). Last week I told Matt I wanted a change. I pulled up a few photos of short cuts and we discussed my options. An hour later, I had short hair and bangs that looked EXACTLY like the photos but somehow better? I have no idea how he did it, but it was amazing. He even showed me a few ways of styling it. If you want to find your forever stylist, go see Matt S. and get that good hair

18.description: I forget who did my color, but the experience was TERRIBLE.  I don't have particularly processed hair, but whatever they put on my hair burned my scalp, and the stylist insisted their products were so gentle that it must be "normal," so I went with it.  The end result was color - and I just dyed my brown hair a richer brown - that leeched out in weeks and left my hair a weird fake orangey color.  My hair now, even after being re-dyed, is damaged and snarls terribly.  I'll end up having to cut off about 4" to save it.  I don't know what the heck happened, but I can't say enough bad things about this experience.

41.description: ELI did my hair recently and  I have to say she is really good! She did everything I asked for, and she made sure I was happy! What I really like about her is she is very detailed orientated and a perfectionist so it worked awesome for me. Once again I love this place & it's staff!

52.description: Let's begin with that as soon as I walked in I was greeted immediately & asked for a beverage. Now, ladies...I have for the past 3 years, had my hair washed once a week to a week 1/2 bc of my color maintenance & I have never, NEVER, had a shampoo experience like here. They escort you to a private room & have all these wonderful head & neck holders to position you on comfortably for your hair to be washed while in a spa like setting with soothing music & dim lights. Your head is kneaded in a massage like scenario & a full shoulder rub after while you are escaping to a relaxing set within your head. Then, your stylist professional will talk with you through all the products & if you're like me, who likes none, they make you feel safe & secure with the few they might choose. Finally, when it's all said, done & dry, you look epic! I walked out looking like a damn Paul Mitchell commercial with my hair flowing from side to side. I can't thank Bobby Bosch enough for recommending this place to me since I moved here & to Eric for being so well educated & amazing throughout the entire process! Honestly, fuckin epic.

50.description: Was a regular for awhile but then just wasn't completely satisfied anymore so I left. Hair did always look good but just not quite what I asked for. Still the head massage was very addicting. And getting there and parking was a hassle since I don't live in Bucktown. I would say I would give 3.5 stars if I could.

4.description: Sadly I received the worst color ever . . . and from the salon director. See pic. Taya did my color and it was insanely awful. It looked nothing like what we talked about (darker base, bright, vibrant blonde balayage type highlights). I started with very blonde hair so she really just needed to darken the base and tone. When she first finished, my hair was greyish almost green. Shockingly I had to explain this wasn't what I wanted and it looked bad (wish I took a pic of that to share). She was blow drying and commenting on how good it looked. Yes she was super nice but she needed me to explain why I didn't like this gross dull grey color. Kind of awkward. Why do I need to explain to a salon director why ugly color is bad?So she "fixed" it and I left with reddish pink hair (see pic). Again nothing like I wanted. I was hoping I could deal with it for a bit but ended up calling the next day begging for someone to fix it ASAP. I was put with Jessica. Unfortunately she needed to consult Taya, the salon director, the one that screwed up my hair in the first place (no idea how she was appointed director - it's concerning). I like Jessica and I actually think she is talented. She wasn't able to do much since damage was done but she tried her best to fix it. If you go here see her. Yes the staff is super nice but that cannot make up for a complete lack of talent and I'm basing that on the "top colorist."

6.description: Let me start off by saying that this was by far the best experience that I have had at a salon. I am from the Schaumburg area, and I would drive through traffic and everything to head back to the salon!I was immediately greeted at the door with a lemon water and given a tour of the salon. Everyone was so friendly and the environment was very collaborative and fosters the social element some salons seem to miss out on. There are multiple chairs at the coloring station to facilitate conversation between patrons and the artists themselves. Coming from the Schaumburg area, I was unfamiliar with city parking and accidentally parked in a no-park area. Travis gladly moved my car to a more appropriate area and made sure the meter would not run out, but not before providing me a delicious glass of wine while my foils were under the dryer.Travis and I had a hair consultation right before I started. He explained the process and let me know suggestions to correct the color crisis I tend to have with going lighter (my hair pulls red). The area where they rinse out your hair is so relaxing and smells amazing... the neck/shoulder massage I got after I was all rinsed out was fantastic - much needed after a long day at work.Overall, I could not recommend a better salon period. Best salon I've been to... ever. Friendly environment and excellent customer service. I felt like VIP walking in and definitely a rockstar walking out.Book your appointment today and go see Travis. It will have been the best decision you've made!

22.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this salon!! I've lived in the city for 6+ years and until now, I've yet to find a salon that I love and can stay loyal to.  I actually met the owner of the salon on a flight (who was AWESOME by the way) and he told me I had to check it out.  The salon itself is really cool and modern, and the staff is so friendly!  One of the best parts is the hair washing room...they put you in a dark room, play music, give you a blanket AND give you a scalp, neck and shoulder massage!! AMAZEBALLS!!! Taya was the one who did my hair (color and cut) and she was the best!  She is super cute, outgoing and sweet...and I LOVE the way my hair turned out!!  Shawna washed my hair and she gave the best massage (she is a cute, little petite thing and I told her if I didn't know better, I would have thought a big, strong man was giving me a massage, lol!) Overall, the whole experience was amazing and unlike any other salon I've been to.  The culture and atmosphere is so fun and the staff is extremely friendly, professional and knowledgeable.  I highly recommend this salon to anyone and everyone!!

15.description: My stylist was the lovely, talented, and friendly Diana. She gave me a tour of the salon and explained the layout. Then she led me to the bathroom where I could put on a robe to protect my clothing. (Not necessary since I was only getting it styled, not colored or cut, but I appreciated the gesture.)Diana then sat down and asked what I was looking for in my style that day, even looking at a picture of my dress for the event to get a feel for what was appropriate. Then she went to work! We chatted because I love to talk to people, and she was very energetic. She let me have total authority over what I liked and didn't like, even showing me with her own hair what the crimper would do.
