In the end, I was totally pleased and would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for great service with a smile. (And it won't totally break the bank, either...my styling took about an hour and cost $65 before tip.)

57.description: I've had 3 stylists here and each has been awesome! Taya is so good at making my boring hair fun and fresh. Prices are comparable to everywhere else in the city. And really, just the washing experience is worth it.

20.description: Let me start off by saying that this was by far the best experience that I have had at a salon. I am from the Schaumburg area, and I would drive through traffic and everything to head back to the salon!I was immediately greeted at the door with a lemon water and given a tour of the salon. Everyone was so friendly and the environment was very collaborative and fosters the social element some salons seem to miss out on. There are multiple chairs at the coloring station to facilitate conversation between patrons and the artists themselves. Coming from the Schaumburg area, I was unfamiliar with city parking and accidentally parked in a no-park area. Travis gladly moved my car to a more appropriate area and made sure the meter would not run out, but not before providing me a delicious glass of wine while my foils were under the dryer.Travis and I had a hair consultation right before I started. He explained the process and let me know suggestions to correct the color crisis I tend to have with going lighter (my hair pulls red). The area where they rinse out your hair is so relaxing and smells amazing... the neck/shoulder massage I got after I was all rinsed out was fantastic - much needed after a long day at work.Overall, I could not recommend a better salon period. Best salon I've been to... ever. Friendly environment and excellent customer service. I felt like VIP walking in and definitely a rockstar walking out.Book your appointment today and go see Travis. It will have been the best decision you've made!

36.description: I've come here once before to get an ombré & I left happy. Second time around I called and they booked me with Travis for my color. He did an amazing job getting the multidimensional brunette I was going for but it turned my ends way too dark Anyway, I'm not one to complain but I had to go back a few days later. This time not only did it take under an hour to fix I left feeling SUPER happy! My hair is freaking hot. Not even 4 hours out of the salon and got compliments! Thankfully the salon did not have a stank attitude and now I'll keep coming back! (See my picture)

14.description: Thanks to the receptionist Jeannette, I got to be a hair model for Travis who was simply amazing. I was greeted and got a tour of the salon. I told travis how I was looking to go a little darker for fall and he did exactly what I wanted and kept the conversation going. The wash area was so tranquil and I got a neck massage. Normally, the service I received today would have been $210, but since I was a hair model, I only spent $25. A total steal for someone on a budget and I'm glad I went. Thanks Kelly kardenas salon!!!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Coloring

3.description: The only thing smiling in this place is the lucky person who was fortunate enough to walk away with a $5 footlong (and that is probably still rare)...or maybe a smiley face written on a table with a Sharpie.  Someone needs to give these workers some "happy pills" because I swear you feel like you are pulling teeth and nails when ordering.  (Yes, I actually want to put some toppings on my sandwich and even some sauce!)  The previous reviews about great service must have been from previous owners or workers because I can assure you that the service is far from great here.  Avoid this location if you can...unfortunately I have had to come here more often than I want because of limited time!!!

1.description: The worst customer service experienceI've ever had in Chicago. The staff literally started talking to Each other every time we opened Our mouths to place an order. Looking at me right in the eye and talking to Someone else so Loudly I couldn't hear myself speak. Never told us when we were done with the transaction. No receipt, just walked away. With hundreds of subways in the city why go to one where they could Care less what your experience is like. What does it say about other standards? I would have fired someone on the spot if this were my place. As soon as we sat down their conversation stopped. Wonder what they talk about when no customers are here. Two of the most obnoxious women  ready to ignore you in exchange for your money. Go somewhere else!

2.description: Rarely post on yelp, but this place is kind of bad. Been to a lot of subways in my time and i have to say this is quite possibly the worst.  They shrink portion sizes, allow perished toppings to sit, and i suspect they lie about offering wifi. The staff, however, are very friendly (provided that the indian banter and laughter ia not actually about the customers).  But as so many people have pointed out.. its a subway.. eat shet.

5.description: It's a Subway, so it's pretty much what you'd expect.  I've been there a few times and the service has been very good.  I've also had no problem finding a place to sit.  The tables are clean and it's close to the Blue Line.

6.description: Like another reviewer has mentioned, it's Subway, so you know what to expect.  However, the service here is fantastic.  Even on crowded days, you're in and out within a few minutes.  The employees are EXTREMELY kind, always greet you with a smile and tell you to have a nice day, and if you go there enough, remember your order.

0.description: For some reason, I love Subway. This one is especially nice because it's never packed and when it is, they don't herd you through like a bunch of cattle. The people there are really nice to boot.

4.description: They are really friendly in here and I appreciate their fast, friendly service.

58.description: Terrible and uninviting.  We called 2 weeks in advance, and asked if we could bring 20-25 people through on a Saturday at 2PM as part of a bar crawl.  The guy i originally talked to was super excited to have us through, but when we arrived the bar tender barked at us that we could not go downstairs.  We were sentenced to two tables in the back that did not fit our crew, and we ended up cutting our time short here.  We elected to move on to a bar them was more willing to accommodate us.  It was 2PM on a Saturday, it was not like we were taking up prime real estate at 8-10PM on the weekend.  Sorry we inconvenienced you with our business.

56.description: Got sick off the food here once. Been here at least 20 times, though, so maybe it was a fluke. Anyway, beer is good ("No crap on tap") and the servers are amazingly nice and responsive. The fried green beans are superb. Seating is limited, but there's a downstairs area.P.S. The burger is the #1 thing you should get here.

29.description: Pretty average place. But other than the happy hour oysters, everything seemed a bit pricey. We had the mussels and Fritas and it was $19 for super tiny mussel pieces. Not worth my money! The real reason we came were for the oysters. We asked for 3 dozen and got 38 pieces... So we had to pay the $38 not a super big deal since it was 2 pieces extra but you get my drift. The upstairs seating were filled so we were seated downstairs and we were the only table seated downstairs so that service was really slow. Ontop of slow service, the server failed to tell us what the daily specials were and we didn't realized that was option till we left the bar. Only thing I would probably come back for is the $1 oyster deal but nothing else.

42.description: I was really happy with what paramount room had to offer for restaurant week and will certainly be going back in the near future. To start, they have a great beer selection. While it isn't the largest selection in town, it was all good stuff. The "no crap on tap" mantra lives true here. For the first course, I had steak tartare and my fiancée had the onion soup. We shared and were both very happy with our choices, but the steak tartare was really great. If you like a little punch in your food, it is for you. For the entree, I had mussels, while she had the fish of the day. Again, both were great, but the Mahi Mahi was the big winner. The sauce was fantastic and the fish was delicious. Lastly, I went with the chocolate stout pudding and she enjoyed the cheese plate. The pudding had what I can only describe as a chocolate stout truffle on top, which was delicious as was the rest of it. The service was good, the atmosphere was cool, sort of divey in a good way and the food was standout quality. For the restaurant week price, this food was a steal for sure. This place is a gem.

23.description: We were seated promptly on a Thursday night for dinner. The food wasn't too good. The burger was ok and my pasta in marina marinara sauce was sadly inedible. I have been here on another occasion for their $1 oyster happy hour special which wasn't  good either since I could taste dirt in my oysters since they were not shucked properly.

47.description: Cool spot, great craft beer with bartenders who know their stuff. Go downstairs for more tables and another bar area especially if the small upstairs is looking packed. The food is also very tasty, the poutine, Reuben, and steak frites are all solid choices.

8.description: Been a pretty consistent customer here for the last 6 years. Love the space, beer list, and how there's generally not a wait. Food has always been solid, which is why I generally recommend Paramount to all new friends moving to the neighborhood. With that said - I'm totally bummed out their recent changes to the menu. They changed the burger options (probably to seem more like Au Cheval) and they just didn't hit home. Also removed the Reuben so there isn't a great sandwich option anymore. The fries though, still amazing as usual. I mainly came here for the burger and the beer list. Without a great burger anymore, not sure how often I'll be coming back.

31.description: This is our local go-to "I don't feel like making dinner" cop-out.   And it's always a treat. Great cocktails, burgers and creative dishes that are consistent.

34.description: Low rating is based on the food.For drinks, it's 5 stars. Great cocktails and beer. Food is pricey and mediocre. We had a big group so we tried a bunch of stuff:The bad:Belly sticks-Basically deep fried pork belly. But wasn't cooked long enough, so it was chewy. And it wasn't crispyOctopus-Also not cooked long enough, so chewy.Burger-Very average. Parmesan Gougere-Basically fried cheese, so not bad. But nothing special tiny portionCarrot cake-Tasted like lightly flavored bread.Steak Tartare-Nothing specialGnocchi Carbonara-Dense, not fluffy like it should be. And the sauce tasted basically just like butterThe good:Reuben-Solid. Chicken-Fried style. Great.Frites-GoodTurtle brownie-Good, but tiny.

16.description: We got our order to go. Everything we ordered was in the bag and I can't complain about them screwing up the order. However, I've had a lot of burgers in my day and this had to be the worst. For 9 bucks you get a small pattie with no flavor, some caramelized onions, and a greasy bun. I could of saved a lot of money and had the same experience by going to Wendy's. Oh yeah, and fries were not included. Add 3 bucks for that and they will give you a handful. Don't recommend

13.description: Had the burger with bacon and kaleslaw and onion rings on the side. Both were pretty bland and lacked seasoning. Also overpriced so probably wouldn't go back. The ambiance was good.

11.description: Good kobe beef style burger.  The pork belly is decent and the calamari was a good appetizer.

39.description: Original review is below.  I upped this from 1 to 2 stars due to the nice server that comped our meal.  Trust me I would rather pay and have a nice dinner than have a horrible experience for free. The entire ordeal still ruined this place for me.  I don't want to be the one complaining but this was out of control and unnecessary loudness from (given the explanation I got from the server) the temporary help who was bussing tables and screaming  in spanish to the cooks who were screaming back in spanish.  These guys were yelling and banging dishes so loud it ruined my night to the point that I literally had to yell back.  I'll never be back for food.  Maybe for drinks at the bar because I still nostalgically like this place for that.  I live 3 blocks away and have lived there for 10 years (been coming to this place since it wasn't even Paramount Room...I remember when it was 4-Taste) so it is hard for me to say this but it has gone that far downhill in management/ambiance/whatever.  The owner needs to either be there more and/or learn to tell his kitchen staff to keep it down to a mild roar and maybe people could halfway enjoy the 2 cool booths in the back.Since I'm taking this long to tell the owner what I think.  You need to replace the leather seats in the back.  They are getting old and ripped.  7 years it's time to spend on this.  People do notice things like this.-ORIGINAL REVIEW:Used to be awesome. Don't sit in back. Screaming loud Mexicans in the kitchen now. Worst.

37.description: Let's keep this concise, shall we. Hostess: surly, unnecessarily. Server: Amazing. "Lounge": sub-basement, damp, a little odd smelling. Food: Greasy and mostly unappetizing... REALLY greasy. Drink selection: Top notch. Went for the food on recommendation, really poorly prepared all around. All of us were starving going in, none of us finished any of our appetizers or entrees.

0.description: Super tasty, ever changing menu. The tap list changes every week too!They can make just about any classic cocktail to your liking. Check the specials board to see what Chef Stephen has been crafting. It's a bit hidden, but give it try sometime. The bartenders are friendly and funny as well as the regulars.

38.description: I think this restaurant is best for groups of people with varying food interests - with a menu that has oysters, mussels. burgers, and steak tartare, anyone can be appeased, especially on top of a great beer selection. The Reuben was good but not the best I've had. Love the tempura green beans, very lightly fried. Good oyster happy hour but $1 bacon was kind of embarrassing - literally 1 strip of bacon is served, nothing special about it.

51.description: Love this place. We sat upstairs at the bar with a few other couples. Everyone was pleasant waitstaff wise. Food was amazing. Drinks were very good. Close to home so we will be coming again!

27.description: Great burger!

32.description: This place was right up my alley. I had an assortment  of pickled treats, a cheeseboard, and mussels with frites. All were tasty and to my liking. I ordered a Sazerac and two different sour beers to finish off my obligatory gastropub-ish meal. I thought this place was really cool and comfy.

54.description: Fun, quirky little spot. It is fairly difficult to find and extremely tight, but that's what contributes to the charm it possesses. It's one of those places I'm glad most people don't know about. The food is among the best bar/pub grub in Chicago. Hell, why not call it a "gastropub." They have tempura fried green beans with a Sriracha dipping sauce - the most unique offering here and by far my favorite must-order item. Their pork belly bites are also excellent. The waygu burger is delicious as well, and it is offered with tempura green beans instead of fries! I've also done oyster happy hour here, which features a rotating menu of always-fresh oysters. This is hard to find in Chicago! Great beer list. Consistently rotating list of unique, hard to find brews, from IPAs to saisons to porters. Also, the cocktail list looks promising as well. Beer flights available if you want to sample some different varietals. Only beef with this place is the tiny size of the upstairs bar and dining area. The downstairs lounge area is very cool. In fact, one of the most aesthetically pleasing in Chicago, but only opens during peak hours.

48.description: Went here for dinner. Ate in the basement which had a great speakeasy vibe. Had the Pulled Pork Poutine which was great. Also ate off of the Baby Spinach & Warm Goat Cheese which was much better than I expected it to be. The staff was friendly and pretty quick. The only thing weird is that the top floor is fairly cramped, its hard to even walk through to get downstairs. I would definitely go again.

44.description: I've been going to Paramount Room at least once a week for a little over three years now. I first found this awesome place before moving to Chicago, and when I found an apartment nearby it was serendipity. The food is awesome, the drinks are great, the music is good, and occasionally there is something on television that I give more than half a crap about. The best things about this place, though, are the people. There is always a friendly crowd of (us) regulars there - having a few laughs and the occasional cry. The staff, however, is top notch. April is uncanny in her ability to never be in a bad mood. Dan has a razor sharp wit and knows an incredible amount about beer. Alan is always incredibly welcoming, Mel has an infectious laugh and a killer smile, and Susie is a radiant ball of energy. The owners and other crew are also amazing. But Danielle - Danielle! Not enough good things can be said about this one. She is always first in line for a hug - asks you about your day, your family, and remembers all of your favorite things. She has hilarious stories, is a compulsive over-sharer (which is awesome), and turns even the worst day right around. She's also a great server, but really, who cares about that?!This place is a must-visit - but don't sit at my table or take up too much of my Danielle time.

24.description: After several recommendations, I finally went. It is such a nice spot with an amazingly large basement. Great food with great drinks. Service is also fantastic. My favorite neighborhood bar.

7.description: Since my five-star review, this place changed their menu and got rid of all of my favorites. The Reuben and the gnocchi are gone, and the excellent burger has been replaced with "the slim", which is ok but nothing special. Even the tempura green beans, while still on the menu and still good, no longer come with anything. What's left is ok but underwhelming. We'll probably be back since it's close by and the beer list is good, but I'm no longer enthusiastic about it.

49.description: Decent beer selection and great food.  With a low key atmosphere and bartenders that are friendly, I always enjoy going to Paramount Room.  The one downside is the place is small so I like going during the week day and off hours to avoid the crowds.

40.description: I went to Paramount Room over the weekend for Restaurant Week on a double date and was pretty pleased with the overall experience. The woman who greeted us (I'm guessing whose name is Danielle from Brian M.'s review) was really friendly. She wasn't our actual server, but she dropped by once in a while to ask how we were doing.I was actually impressed with the serving sizes of all the food; they were much bigger than I was expecting. The Shrimp and Octopus Ceviche was refreshing. the Mussels and Frites were all right (taste wasn't anything extraordinary and not very filling), and the Turtle Brownie for dessert was AMAZING. It's a tiny little portion they give you, but it makes sense because of how rich it is. I was decently satisfied with what I ordered.All in all, I'm happy with the experience I had. I would advise against going in a big group, though - it's pretty tiny in there.

53.description: Great beer selection and a diverse menu make the Paramount Room a solid no-frills destination to unwind after a long day in the Windy City.This isn't a huge place so it can get crammed, but it's worth it. There were three of us and we grabbed the front table on the right, which meant moving the table out so we could slide in, and then moving it back towards us so they could maintain some sort to exit path. Not a huge deal.They have a nice selection of "No Crap on Tap" local beers and I settled for an Arcade Coffee Stout. It had a deep and rather pronounced roasted flavor that really hit the spot. I was originally eyeing another stout, but our waitress nudged me towards the Arcade and I'm glad she did. I hoping to try another one of their beers on tap, but I ended up going back to the Arcade. The two guys I was with did the same.For food, I went with the Wagyu burger. It's a perfectly-sized, succulent patty of American style Kobe, with the typical accouterments. It was served with fries, though there was the option to go with fried green beans. My friends went that route - I stuck with old fashioned french fries. I tried both and while the green beans were a novel change of pace, I was happy with my decision. If I was hungrier, I would have loved to have tried the pulled pork poutine....ahhh, next time...Looking forward to it!

30.description: This a great place with a lot of charm. Grab a burger and a pint special. Taste some of the many craft beers they carry. The menu is good. The burgers are great. Tempura battered green beans are delicious. I've had pretty much everything they serve, no complaints at all. Space is limited upstairs, but plentiful below ground. If you want to chill at the bar, it's plenty big. If you need a table or want to throw a party, don't worry the downstairs level can accommodate. Service is attentive. Whether you are sitting at the bar, enjoying a meal with friends and family at a table, or ordering from grub hub. In all aspects they are quick and friendly.

46.description: Good food, but the poor service kinda ruined the experience for us. Our waitress never even introduced herself to us or welcomed us, just came over and said "Do you guys want something to drink."  It was restaurant week and the hostess who was very friendly gave us the restaurant week menus, but the waitress didn't even explain or offer any info regarding the special menu. Every time we needed something we had to get her attention, as she would walk by us but never ask if we were doing ok or needed anything.  Having a server who makes you feel like a nuisance is so frustrating.  The only reason we found out her name was Danielle was because we looked on our receipt.  Would probably only sit at the bar next time.

1.description: My go-to bar for a good beer and a bite to eat; whether for date night or when I fine my fridge empty on a random weeknight.  Chill atmosphere and nice bartenders.  The burger and entrees are all great (the recent addition of the pork shoulder was unbelievable).  The Tempura fried green beans are one of the better bar snacks in the City.  Eaten here 20-25 times and the quality is consistent - never had a bad beer or food item.Truly one of the best beer selections in the City.  The "No Crap on Tap" list always features rare and freshest options from the best breweries in the area and from the West Coast.  They seem to always have Three Floyds, Founders, Dark Horse, Ballast Point, Half Acre, and Goose Island options along with the hard-to-find microbreweries like Arcade, Solemn Oath, Brewery Vivant, and even Greenbush (my fave).  Also Paramount Room will have $5 shot and beer and $3 tall boys.

55.description: The Paramount Room's Ruben is unparalleled - the best I've ever had. The bottom piece of rye is usually kind of soggy, because of all the delicious gruyere cheese and pickled sauerkraut that drips into it. In fact, I stuck my pinkie finger through it as I took a bite the other day, and it made kind of a weird NSFW noise, the sound of which I have no idea how to spell phonetically, but it was hot and great. And the top pice of rye was nice and toasted and crunchy, so you get the best of both worlds. And Danielle, one of the bartenders, is very friendly and has a fantastic taste in music, assuming you like the Stooges and the Adverts, etc. Unfortunately, one of my friends got the pork poutine the other day and said it was flavorless. He's also a devil's advocate, though, who can't live a day of his life without complaining about something, and the Bears were losing while we ate, so I guess he needed a punching bag. What a jerk. Anyone reading this should try the pork poutine, love it, make flyers about how wrong my friend is, and put them under every windshield wiper you see, or staple them to telephone poles, or make paper airplanes out of them and throw them at whoever disagrees with you about anything.At any rate, I've never had a bad time at the Paramount Room. The staff is friendly, as are the regulars, and it's usually one of the first restaurants I mention and/or take friends to when they visit Chicago. It's not cheap, but it's not a rip off. It's a good time, and they do things right. Oh, and if you love Bloody Marys, this is your spot. There's no reason not to eat and drink at the Paramount Room as often as possible.

9.description: Had the "la playa" ceviche to start. Fresh and light before getting down to business.   The paramount burger was not just insane in size (two big ass patties, house made bacon, fried egg etc) but the tempura fried green beans were a great departure from just plain French fries. Teenage son was the only one who demolished the burger completely.  But i got close...Delicious and super friendly service!

26.description: I've loved quirky Paramount Room since I moved 3 years ago from the burbs to my first place in the city, the nearby Echelon K Station, and discovered PR's awesome "wagyu burger." This is kind of their signature item, though they're a Bib Gourmand award winning gastropub and their other food is also excellent. I liked their thick juicy pork chop, Amish chicken and queso fundido. I had oysters a couple times and they were meh one time and excellent more recently. It's worth noting they have a $1 oyster happy hour 3-6 on some days. Desserts are good (cream cheese ice cream!)But the burger stands out as my favorite in Chicago. Not long ago Au Cheval got crowned the best burger in America. I've had it and it's fine, but it's a thin patty underseasoned concoction in my book. There are certain things my fellow Americans rave about (football, Miller Lite, Taco Bell, etc.) that I just don't give two hoots about and Au Cheval's hipster burger is one of 'em. Paramount Room's on the other hand is a true big pub burger and the meat seems to be lightly seasoned. This is important --- it seems many of these hype-y burger joints get by on their toppings or bacon or something...but don't season the damn meat! Quality meat is fine, it still needs seasoning!Well, the wagyu burger is moist and delicious. Served on a big pretzel bun with some kind of house made special sauce. PR is not the best at getting temps just right. A med-rare usually comes out medium or worse. Fix that and get 5 stars! Signature side tempura flash fried green beans served with a lime wedge and a sriracha-based dipping sauce are the bomb! Their fries are seriously good too.PR touts "no crap on tap" on an ever rotating menu of about 7 draft beers. You can also get a flight. For $5 get a PBR tallboy and a shot of house whiskey.Service is always friendly and neighborly. You feel very welcome here.The space is weird. It just has a small red/blue LED sign way up high out front of the door on Milwaukee that reads "Lounge." Inside it's quite narrow with a few high-top tables, a bar with maybe 8 seats and a few booths and a bathroom to the back right opposite the narrow kitchen to the left. But downstairs is a big a$s cavern with a high ceiling. I far prefer the convivial vibe of the upstairs though.Bollocks to your hip/hype-ster burger. Go get a wagyu and shut'chyer mouth!PS: PR is a member of the loyalty/cash back Spring Rewards outfit (for $10 free here: goo.gl/qjb284)

25.description: I'm giving this place 2 stars for it's cool quirkiness only. This place is good for a filling appetizer when drinking, but not for a meal. They have a very nice selection.We went to the Paramont Room because they had all my favorites on their menu. We started our meal off with the french onion soup. I love french onion soup, I eat it several times a week. I didn't finish my $9 bowl of Campbell's soup with burnt toast on top. Next, to come was the tempura green beans. The were so greasy that when you held one up the coating slid off. The dipping sauce was very tasty. We ordered poutine, which was basically chili fries. They were good, but I was expecting something very different. I know what they were trying to do, I've had it in Toronto, but they missed the mark. By the time my rueben came, I was done, but I was like, how can you mess up a rueben. Chicago has the largest population of Polish and Lithiuanians outside of Europe. My Lithuanian grandmother would of had someone's head. They used blanched cabbage instead of kraut, making the sandwich greasy and not appetizing. People seem to like their burgers, so if you go, try one of those

12.description: I am a huge fan of the hole in the wall, dive bar esque feel to the place. Plus, the menu is simple and nothing over the top. I had the Paramount burger which was excellent. However, it was not cooked medium rare but more medium well. With thin patty's, it is harder to achieve this type of cooking. Drinks are on point and the service was solid. I look forward to coming back to this place in the near future.

59.description: I've been coming to the Paramount room for over 6 years.  I still love her as much today as I did on that cold wintery night, when I first discovered her.  Pros:  Great beer, incredible food (get the burger), atmosphere, staff, location (hard to find, which keeps the tourists away), patrons, history (used to be a speakeasy... even has the vaulted door to prove it!)Cons:  Prices have gone up, not a fan of the new lamps

21.description: We loved the green beans and the slim burger! Also, the upstairs is so cozy-almost like something from a movie.

17.description: I have to agree with some of the reviewers here.  I used to come here consistently for the burgers.  I thought they were the best in town, even better than Au Cheval.  Much to my disappointment, they changed the burgers on the menu.  No more Wagyu beef.  That's what made these burgers so delicious and now they are disgusting.  Sad.

10.description: Pretty average place. But other than the happy hour oysters, everything seemed a bit pricey. We had the mussels and Fritas and it was $19 for super tiny mussel pieces. Not worth my money! The real reason we came were for the oysters. We asked for 3 dozen and got 38 pieces... So we had to pay the $38 not a super big deal since it was 2 pieces extra but you get my drift. The upstairs seating were filled so we were seated downstairs and we were the only table seated downstairs so that service was really slow. Ontop of slow service, the server failed to tell us what the daily specials were and we didn't realized that was option till we left the bar. Only thing I would probably come back for is the $1 oyster deal but nothing else.

5.description: The best thing about this place is their $1 happy hour oysters! They were served with a ton of lemons, wasabi and a pretty tasty pickled sauce. But other than that, I was very surprised at how expensive the rest of the menu seemed. We grabbed two dozen oysters, an order of fries and two beers, and it came out to almost $60. The fries were pretty standard. I would come back if I was feenin' for some oysters, but otherwise just seemed like another overpriced bar.

3.description: I came for the dollar oysters which were pretty satisfying and fresh.  The drink selection was okay and we got fries which were satisfactory.  I was kind of surprised how expensive our bill was despite only getting oysters, fries, and one drink each. Didn't feel like it met my "happy hour" expectations.  I'd probably check out the other dollar oyster deals before coming back.

35.description: This place was such a pleasant surprise. Hole in the wall that my coworkers and I came to during lunch. We all ordered a kobe beef burger and after we got our food, there was absolute silence for the next 10 min while we devoured our delicious meals. If you want a great burger, this is the no frill place you want to come

19.description: Came for the 1.00 oysters. It took 25 mins. Bartender served us drinks then attended to regulars. We weren't acknowledged again until we asked for check.

28.description: Empty on a Sunday night for dinner. The eggplant was terrible- burnt breading and small portion.

45.description: This place is in a location I never would have found without Restaurant Week.  That being written, I'm glad I went!  The layout is a bit confusing so when you walk in there is a 6-top table up against the door and a small bar with a few seats.  There is, however, one and half more levels downstairs.  The menu has a wide array of food options including fried eggplant saag, mussels and frites, steak tartare, scotch eggs, french onion soup, and fish over coconut rice.  Ecclectic to say the least, but fun.  The service is good, drink options a-plenty, and a nice ambiance.

33.description: Cool vibe. Friendly service. Drinks and beers were tasty. Did not go downstairs; will do that next time!

43.description: I was so excited to try this place for restaurant week. Unfortunately, it did not live up to my expectations. The wait staff was ok, our waitress seemed very overwhelmed when she arrived to our table. She didnt even give us her name or a proper greeting. She became more friendly as the night went on but had a bad first impression. The food was extremely disappointing as well. I tried the short rib ravioli and my boyfriend had the scotch egg as appetizers. The scotch egg wasnt even a true scotch egg, it was completely hard boiled. The short rib ravioli was undercooked. The pasta was extremely tough and almost inedible. We both had the pork chop picatta for our entrees. It came with spinach (which was actually pretty good) and bland orzo. The pork chops themselves were over cooked, lacked seasoning and barely had the lemon flavor a picatta is supposed to have. Not to mention, our food was handed to us by a rushed bus boy through the railings on the stairwell. I hope that this was a one time thing and others have had better experiences but the money we paid for this meal was completely not worth it and we will probably not come back.

2.description: Cool bartenders. Unique but small layout upstairs, a large basement you'd never expect to be there. Cocktails and food are delicious. Beer selection is better than most. They also have awesome flights for $10. I'd highly rev omens the fried green beans that you dip in a siracha-honey sauce. A neighborhood spot I try to get to as often as I can.

18.description: Have loved this place for a long time, their burger WAS one of the best burgers and best kept secrets in the city and in my circle it was talked about on the same level as Au Cheval's. Why would you mess with near perfection?  I almost cried when I went the other night and was informed the menu was changed.  No more Wagyu beef burger, it is now the slim and double or something like that, both are more expensive than the original Wagyu and don't hold a candle to it.  We lost a gem here folks hate to be the bearer of bad news!

41.description: Fantastic burger and tempura green beans!

52.description: The only reason I'm even giving this place any stars is because my dinner was good. But that's the only good thing I have to say. My friend ordered "The Silencer" which was the worst drink I've ever tasted. It literally tasted like gasoline. Our appetizer never came, and when it did, when our meal was done, they had the audacity to call it poutine which it was far from. Never got refills for our drinks, took forever to leave. I would not go again. Disappointment.

50.description: Amy was amazingly helpful in setting up my friend's bachelor lunch in the downstairs room. Thanks so much for organizing a great day!

4.description: I've loved quirky Paramount Room since I moved 3 years ago from the burbs to my first place in the city, the nearby Echelon K Station, and discovered PR's awesome "wagyu burger." This is kind of their signature item, though they're a Bib Gourmand award winning gastropub and their other food is also excellent. I liked their thick juicy pork chop, Amish chicken and queso fundido. I had oysters a couple times and they were meh one time and excellent more recently. It's worth noting they have a $1 oyster happy hour 3-6 on some days. Desserts are good (cream cheese ice cream!)But the burger stands out as my favorite in Chicago. Not long ago Au Cheval got crowned the best burger in America. I've had it and it's fine, but it's a thin patty underseasoned concoction in my book. There are certain things my fellow Americans rave about (football, Miller Lite, Taco Bell, etc.) that I just don't give two hoots about and Au Cheval's hipster burger is one of 'em. Paramount Room's on the other hand is a true big pub burger and the meat seems to be lightly seasoned. This is important --- it seems many of these hype-y burger joints get by on their toppings or bacon or something...but don't season the damn meat! Quality meat is fine, it still needs seasoning!Well, the wagyu burger is moist and delicious. Served on a big pretzel bun with some kind of house made special sauce. PR is not the best at getting temps just right. A med-rare usually comes out medium or worse. Fix that and get 5 stars! Signature side tempura flash fried green beans served with a lime wedge and a sriracha-based dipping sauce are the bomb! Their fries are seriously good too.PR touts "no crap on tap" on an ever rotating menu of about 7 draft beers. You can also get a flight. For $5 get a PBR tallboy and a shot of house whiskey.Service is always friendly and neighborly. You feel very welcome here.The space is weird. It just has a small red/blue LED sign way up high out front of the door on Milwaukee that reads "Lounge." Inside it's quite narrow with a few high-top tables, a bar with maybe 8 seats and a few booths and a bathroom to the back right opposite the narrow kitchen to the left. But downstairs is a big a$s cavern with a high ceiling. I far prefer the convivial vibe of the upstairs though.Bollocks to your hip/hype-ster burger. Go get a wagyu and shut'chyer mouth!PS: PR is a member of the loyalty/cash back Spring Rewards outfit (for $10 free here: goo.gl/qjb284)

6.description: Late-nite treasure!   The best for post opera/concert/theatre drinks and dinner....late kitchen closing, fantastic food and 5-star service.  Have had mot everything on the menu, all are stand-outs!  Mussels, braised pork shoulder, tempura green beans, burgers, tartare, oysters.....all terrific!!! Great drinks (a "deal" on a double/neat!) and extensive wine and beer selection. A must go for late-night kitchen, cool vibe without being hokey....Love you guys!!!!!   Congrats to the chef on the pork shoulder...WOW!!!!!

22.description: The seating and atmosphere are kind of stuffed.  The service was okay, nothing great.  It is a dive-y place so the atmosphere was to be expected but the prices are too high for what it is.

15.description: oh the mussels! I love this place.

57.description: The downstairs lounge is where it's at. Not many places in this city that can boast high ceilings and comfortable booths in a former speakeasy bar. The food is a bit on the overpriced side, but still pretty tasty. Stick with the fries and green beans and you'll be straight.

20.description: I love this place! The place it self is really cool, upstairs is really small and compact, but cozy. My husband and I like to sit at the bar and eat, which we do in most places we go. I like the interaction with people and the bartenders that comes with eating at the bar. The kitchen is in the back, but very open to the upstairs and I like that as well. I like to watch the action in the kitchen. If we are with other people, then we like to go downstairs. It is super cool down there! There is also a little bar down there and it is dark and seedy, you kind of feel like you are in someones basement in the 70's or something! I love it! The steak tartar is fabulous and the french onion soup is amazing. I love french onion soup and it is really hard to find anywhere, but the Paramount room does it perfectly. Mmmm, I wish I had some right now as I am writing this! Its cool, just go!

36.description: The inauspicious exterior and dark, cramped interior utterly belie the shockingly delicious food and drink this place has to offer. I still haven't stopped thinking about how delicious the scotch eggs were, as well as the burger I had (which was the reason I tried Paramount Room in the first place). My whiskey sour was expertly and freshly made (no premade sour mix). I will definitely be going back!

14.description: Great burger!

3.description: Recently we wanted to make chicken soup and there was no whole chickens to be found at Trader Joe's, Jewel or Dominick's.  So I took one look at this place and figured this place has chickens for my soup.  Nope!!!What we did find was a glass case of animal parts.  Who shops here? Why do they even have a store front?  I do now know where to go when I need a giant pig foot.  Oh yeah and there is a over powering smell of blood in the air. This stuff is fresh!!!!Now you may be wondering why 5 stars? The lady behind the counter was so nice. She said that she did have chickens but it wasn't for a chicken soup.  She said it would be too tough and we wouldn't be able to eat the meat.  It sounded like they were just for restaurants to make stock. I'm glad she told us and didn't try to sell it to us and rip off the young family.  I really do love places like these because they are how people use to shop.  You went to 10 stores just to make dinner.  I miss those days!!!

1.description: Going to Halsted Packing House reminds me of Ralph Furley. You know Ralph...the whacky landlord from Three's Company, the show that turned the art of misunderstanding into an eight season hit sitcom in the late 70's / early 80's. Many an episode would include Mr. Furley listening in on something and getting the wrong impression. His eyes would bug out and he would get all irritated and uncomfortable like. Whether it was stuffing a chicken or a cooking pot, Mr. Furley always got it wrong. So what is the connection? Well on just about every occasion I have been here someone invariably walks in and thinks this is a butcher shop. What follows is Mr. Furley-like eye bulging and body twitching as it sinks in. This is a packing house. Yet, despite the fact that it is in the name even, this establishment seems to be punished for what it is not even though it never claims to be a butcher or meat market! I even see it in some of the reviews.Our family is intimate with how food sources. My parents, aunts, uncles raised whatever they ate in the mountains of Greece and that was the only source for food. The whole lamb I get from Halsted Packing House (on four occasions now over three years) has been the closest to the real deal. When lamb is fresh, you do not need to do much to it (salt, pepper, oregano, garlic) and everyone just loves it! That has always been the case with anything I procured from Halsted Packing House.I will spare the details it but suffice it to say, you're cutting out the middleman. With that said, you're also cutting out the frills of having things presented in a manner that eases your conscious a bit. Perhaps this may be due to having been conditioned to detach from where our food really sources from when we visit the local grocer.  I'm not saying one is better than the other...it just is. However, there is substantial cost-advantage to cutting out the middleman. The 35# whole pig I got last week set me back just $122 and it was FRESH! I roasted it for the neighborhood block party and it was all the rage. I was getting text messages the next day from neighbors telling me how good it was. The meal had hang time (in a good way).What you get: Great fresh whole or large cuts. Friendly honest service from the lady that runs things there.What you don't get: Sugar coating.EASY five stars because it is as good as it gets at what it does.

2.description: IF I CAN GIVE THIS PLACE NEGATIVE STARS I WOULD!!!! i just called in asking if they had chickens to make a roasted chicken, and she had hens....and then she proceeded on asking if I was MEXICAN...she wanted to know my race, in her exact word she said she needed to know if I was Mexican, nigerian, etc....and I said "excuse me" why do you need to know my race? and she said "so I can tell you if the chicken is going to be good for you, because if you are MEXICAN then this hen will not be good for you because its not what you are going to cook, this hen is used for stew"....EXCUSE ME??? why does my race matter, i told her that i was going to make a roasted chicken, whether I am MEXICAN , CHINESE, NIGERIAN whatever I am, my race does NOT DEFINE, what I am cooking. I am not that type of person to get upset over "race" stuff easily, but this really upset me. IF this was the owner of this place, shame on her! and if it was not, I hope tis person stops asking for someones RACE and decide whether their meat is good enough! I WILL NOT GO BACK nor tell other people about it.

5.description: No, they don't have ribeye steaks or baby back ribs. You losers can to Jewel or Dominick's to pick those up. What you get here is freshly slaughtered, young lamb, goat, and pork. They will sell you whole animals at a discount and the quality of the meat is very good and fresh. Great service every time I go there. Highly recommend. Take time to get the owners and they will educate you about the meat and the animals. I hope this place is here forever.

6.description: WARNING TO VEGETARIANS: Do NOT read furtherLooking for a freshly slaughtered lamb for the holiday table?   The Davos family has been butchering lambs, goats, pigs and cows since 1933 and this retail shop is the place to go for the freshest meats around.I wasn't able to snap a photo but dear Cookie Davos took me into the cold storage and showed me the lifeless lambs, pigs, and goats hanging by their hooves.  (I warned you...!)  Had I not been on my bike, I probably would have bought a few lamb chops at $4.69/pound.

7.description: I hit this place on Saturday. Really wanted to make veal chops. They didn't have them. Kind of an odd selection here-lamb, ground beef, pig parts, oxtail. As far as I could tell, not steaks.I picked up half a lamb, which were cut into nice 1" chops. You have to buy either the liver or the head-I picked up the liver for my Yiayia. The chops were good. It really stinks in there. I think there are probably better places to go, and I intend to find them.

8.description: We dropped in quickly, and it was an interesting place. They had a lot of random parts in their small glass coolers, like tripe, liver, huge pigs feet, and it smelled like goat. I asked if they had beef tenderloin or baby back ribs (just testing them for selection) and they said no for either. Really shady place, but might try back for the lamb?

0.description: The best meat packing house on the Northside! Bought some beautiful cuts of lamb. Store is clean, and the staff is quite friendly. Prices are reasonable as well! Definitely will come back.

4.description: Love this place. This is the place to go for nice tender lamb meat, they have any size you need. No stinky odors as far as my picky husband can tell, we like their prices and of course they MEAT our high expectations :)

58.description: I heard a few people tell me this place is the spot so why not try it.  I did during lunch.  I thought the decor was cool, contemporary.   I ordered the jerk chicken meal which include slaw and a side of my choice which I selected the coconut & rice w/beans.  Sound delicious right????  Well...the food is prepared already, similar to a Chipotle restaurant.   Hmmm...the ones I go to have u wait 20-30 minutes.  I sat down and started to eat my meal which the chicken lacked the jerk seasonings I'm used to.   The slaw was ok.  The coconut w/rice & beans was ok, not spectacular.  The rum juice was good, strong.   I assumed the black female in the kitchen was the owner but the owner is white.  Nothing wrong with that but this spot is a contemporary jerk place.  I prefer the hole in the wall jerk spots like Uncle Joe's, Fire Jerk Chicken, Kingston Jerk Chicken(now closed) that have all Jamaican based cooks.  The customer service was great which made up for the lack of taste.  Also the music was great.

56.description: Went to Jerk this evening with friends and it was great!  Really chill laid back atmosphere with a very accommodating staff. The best way to describe the food is its a commercialized "Chipotle" style Jamaican food restaurant!  Although, it doesn't taste authentic, it's still good food. But it's exactly what they advertise a "Modern" jerk chicken restaurant.  I'm giving them 5 stars because the staff is amazing!! I wish I remembered everyone's names cause I would mention them,  but they were very chill and courteous!  For those writing reviews in regards to the ethnicity of the staff because there"not Jamaican" 1st of all you don't know that!  And 2nd get a life! Thanks Jerk for the great night! ;)

29.description: I was excited to try this place since there's not many Caribbean restaurants in Chicago and Jerk looked good. The staff here was friendly and provided good service. I ordered the jerk chicken with the jerk BBQ sauce along with a side of sweet plantains. The plate comes with a side of sour dough bread, hard dough roll, and coleslaw too. I asked to try the other sauces on the side too and they let me! Of the 3, my favorite was the jerk BBQ. Rude Girl just tasted bitter and the lime cilantro didn't have enough of a kick to it. Overall the food was okay. My favorite item on the plate was the hard dough roll.

42.description: Jerk was very good and affordable. However the night we were there they only had chicken as a meat option (pork and beef are other normal options). Friendly staff. The jerk sauce is very spicy. The Jerk BBQ sauce is nice and sweet. The beef patty is really spicy too! The sweet plantains weren't too sweet, more green. Jerk Mac&cheese was very tasty!! I'll be back to check out the beef and pork.

23.description: I was really excited about trying this place, and even more excited when I tasted the food!! AMAZING! AMAZING!AMAZING!! The music was great, & the environment was awesome! Dining in is a must!!

47.description: I come here quite a bit b/c it's close to where I work. It used to be amazing but recently I have noticed inconsistency that's been a deterrent to me coming here more. One night my chicken was pink and I had to dig through my salad for all the chicken to throw it away lest I die. Tonight I came back and my order was wrong. I'm guessing this place needs BETTER management STAT. Such a shame b/c the food has been really good in the past. Make sure you check your order if you come here and if there's a line, GOOD LUCK. UPDATE: The owner saw this post and contacted me. He was apologetic and refunded my order without me having to even ask. Looking forward to seeing this establishment run with his level of leadership some day. The food is truly great - when it's executed right.

8.description: I went to this place for the first time on Friday, I was craving some Jamaican food and thought this would do the trick but boy was I wrong, don't get me wrong the food was good but very spicey, it tasted like everything was cooked and the had jerk seasoning added to it, the flavor was over whelming as every bite had jerk seasoning!! . The atmosphere is great seems like a cold spot to eat and drink on a Friday night and have fun but the food needs a little tweaking by tweaking I means less jerk seasoning on everything!!

31.description: This place absolutely positively sucks...I knew it was going to be a problem when they started measuring out the chicken.. Island slaw is awful, plantains dry and overcooked, and the 1/2 of cup of rice and beans were ok. Two dinners for 32 dollars?????????? Man please never again. Please please go to Tropical Times near Maywood for a good Jerk meal....

34.description: The best way to sum this place up U.S. That it is the jerk chicken equivalent to honey butter fried chicken. If you understand the good and bad if that place then you get what I'm saying. Portions small, price is high. HOWEVER...I walked away full and satisfied and not stuffed like a Thanksgiving turkey....Soooooo maybe three on to something. I enjoyed the mail and won't have to pay for it in the gym. Rude girl sauce is on point...but just spicy, but super spicy.

16.description: Let me start off by saying, the employees are great. They were very attention and cared. They gave great recommendations and tips to essensuate the flavor. However I didn't think the food was as great as I imagined it to be. It was mediocre at best plus the price was a little pricey for a fast food takeout restaurant . The ambiance was awesome.   It had authentic Jamaican music so I was jamming as I ate my food. I ordered the double jerk chicken and yuca fries. The menu needs to be more organized.

13.description: This place was awesome. Had the pulled pork with yuca fries and mashed yuca. It was delicious. The place is cute. Will go back.

11.description: Hooooooodang Gang! Jerk is ON FIRE, literally! Your mouth will be on fire. This food truck is always the one with the longest line on the block. Waiting in that line is worth the wait, believe me my Yelpers. There's only 3 or 4 options on the menu. Jerk chicken, Jerk fries, a veggie patty (...I don't know why anyone would go to get a veggie patty, but I'm sure it's probably delicious), and a few dessert options. The Jerk chicken comes in a square container on top of a nice thick piece of Texas Toast. The portion is definitely enough for two servings, but since I'm a Jerk chicken addict, I usually eat the whole thing. A delicious little hush puppy comes inside your Jerk package of heaven. Make sure you try the Rude Girl sauce, your taste buds will be happy you did. BUT, if your sensitive to heat, I'd go with the BBQ sauce instead. The Jerk fries are spicy seasoned fries and you get a huge portion of them. Dip 'em in the Rude Girl sauce and you'll be flamin' up!Yelp, you don't know what you're missing if you haven't had this truck. It's pretty darn amazing. I heard they have a store front which I will definitely be visiting as soon as I find it!

39.description: We kept calling the restaurant many times to create a catering order for 25 people. Left messages - no response. Finally got ahold of the manager who said that we should just order on DoorDash - which we did. Nobody called to confirm our order and suggest to maybe place 20 orders of chicken in the same container. Same with the sides. Order came in and it was absolutely impossible to serve to a group. Chicken over-spiced and absolutely not authentic. The bread was rough and not good. Will never come back.

37.description: Ok so allow me to tell you about THE WORST jerk chicken I've ever had in Chicago. That's right - the worst. Brace yourselves, this post is long. Anywho, while I was in the middle of doing a 20 block walk as punishment for eating a cupcake, I realized that I got food poisoning from my favorite fast food Asian joint that rhymes with bow wao. I was at the point where I couldn't trust a fart so getting to a bathroom was mandatory. I was starting to freak out because I was around that super industrial area on Halsted Ave but I saw Jerk and felt a tad bit relieved.I'm one of those weird people who can't go to a restaurant's public restroom without buying something because I hate conflict and honestly wouldn't know how to react if an employee told me "No." *Restrooms should be open to the public but that's another story for another day.* I follow Jerk on twitter and they seemed appetizing so I decided to grab an entree to go for later or to share if I was feeling charitable.  I chose the pork *oink oink*, sweet plantain, festival, slaw, and ciltantro lime aioli (THAT SAUCE SHOULD'VE BEEN A RED FLAG BUT WHATEVS). I proceeded to calmly ask where the restroom was even though it felt like I was about to explode & there was a tumultuous war going on in my innards. When I was finished in the restroom, my food was packaged and ready to go. Cool. Or so I thought.I arrived home, excited as all get down to consume my food. However, what I tasted made all dead Jamaicans roll around in their graves. EVERYTHING WAS DRYER THAN OPRAH'S PHONE ON A FRIDAY NIGHT. I have no idea why this place claims to serve jerk....maybe the grilling preparation? Idk. The meat had NO seasoning. None. Ningun. I had to use my own seasoning and some SWEET BABY RAYS to give it some flavor. WHAT??! PREPOSTEROUS. The slaw was the only decent thing, WHICH IS SAD IF YOU'RE FAMILIAR WITH THE DELICIOUSNESS THAT IS JERK. I instantly wanted my $11 back but I live in the burbs and I'm sure that a company that serves tasteless jerk meat doesn't give a damn if you like it or not. Just go on 79th and Halsted and get some real jerk. Preparation will take at least 30 minutes but at least it will be good.

0.description: 5-star review. The flavor of the jerk-grilled chicken. The friendly and efficient staff who are happy to explain the options since this is the kind of menu you might not know.The sweet-savory of the yuca mash.The crisp-fried corn-bread hush-puppy thing that comes with every meal. The just-right bite to the slaw.The trendy up-scale fast casual atmosphere that isn't trying so hard you hate it.The craft beer list that makes me want to come back in the evening.The RUDE GIRL HOT SAUCE which you CRAVE.This River West place is a bit more of a walk, and you're just not gonna regret it.

38.description: If I could give this place no stars I would! This place is ABSOLUTELY disgusting. There is really no other words to put it, and to all Costumers please inspect your meat before you consume it. We just purchased the turkey leg dinner and it was still raw in the middle. The Mac and cheese was very strange, as if they dropped chemicals in it. Not only that we had three orders of Cole slaw which was at room temp and disgusting as well.....PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE. ( Just a forewarning!)

51.description: Definitely a mild "jerk" experience, not very spicy.  The check out process was strange, you had to go over to the bar to purchase alcohol separately from the food. I tried the pork, very moist.

27.description: I live nearby and drive by the place all the time but never have gone in. Also, I see via Instagram that they have half off wings on Mondays...I believe....Still I haven't made it in. So finally I used Door Dash to deliver the food to me. The food was solid! I ordered the chicken with the rude girl sauce (spiciest) with a side of mac. The chicken was plentiful and juicy/tender while seasoned to perfection. The rude girl sauce complimented the chicken and had a slow burning spice that eventually forced me to eat faster and faster cause the spice level continued to kick it up with each and every bite. But for spice lovers...it was amazing. The spice was delicious and not just all heat, a damn good amount of heat but worth every lick. The meal also came with a slice of bread, Jamaican cornbread, and a side of garden salad. The Jamaican cornbread and salad helped cool the tongue off. Oh yeah and the mac and cheese was great! Nice and cheesy and topped with some of their jerk seasoning...mmm..I'm a fan of the place...I will actually stop in some time cause the food is FIRE as in damn good and spicy.

32.description: It was pretty bad. Read the worst reviews and that sums it up.  The chicken and pork was both dry and flavorless. Ye be warned.

54.description: Modern jerk is great, visited the good truck many times prior to the store opening. This was my second time here had the jerk chicken was great. Wife had the salad we where both happy with our meal will definitely  come back next time we are in the area. There are only two  jerk restaurants in Chicago, this place hits the mark the bar is great with a great selection of drinks.

48.description: I've eaten here three times and enjoyed it twice. Get the Jerk chicken entree. It's delicious and it's what I had my first and second visit. My third visit was seriously disappointing after an order of Jerk Chicken wings with yucca. I couldn't finish my meal despite my voracious appetite because the entire dish tasted  like it was powered with sugar, maybe brown sugar. Felt like I was eating dessert or some jerk and sweet & sour Asian fusion. Stay away from this dish. Really good Jamaican jerk wings and authentic yuca fries taste nothing like the heart attack, diabetic, not reflective of how good this place really is, poor quality meal I did not enjoy. Ate some and trashed most, which sucks bc I was really looking forward to this tasting great.

44.description: Their jerk interpretation is awful. Was really excited to come and taste the food, unfortunately you couldn't pay me to come back. Chicken was raw!!!?? they missed the mark completely with this spot. Avoid!

24.description: Great food. Always somewhat of a wait when getting takeout, but well worth the wait. That's the only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars.

7.description: Absolutely love this place!! Everything is perfect. Never had a bad meal or drink! Service is fast and friendly! I would eat there everyday if I could!

49.description: First rule of ethnic restaurants:  Make sure someone of that ethnicity is running the restaurant.  Ever hopeful for Jamaican food in Chicago, I tried this fairly new establishment for lunch last week.  The lack of Jamaicans or any staff of color gave me pause on entry.My friend and I ordered the jerk chicken and jerk pork (no table service here).  The cashier was doing double duty putting meats on the plates and passing them down the line Chipotle-style.  After handling money?  Tsk tsk.  And every order was weighed on a little scale (see photo).  Don't want to give anyone too much.   Then a gaggle of servers handed the plates down the line adding the sides to each plate.  Seems grossly inefficient compared to systems at other restaurants.  The last server then asked "what kind of sauce".  I dunno.  Why not put up a sign?  And anyway, who wants anything but jerk sauce?  But I digress. . .The "Coconut Rice & Beans" was fine, but I couldn't find any coconut.  The slaw and mac 'n cheese?  Meh.  The jerk chicken and pork were barely spicy at all, and the chicken wasn't real whole pieces of chicken but more like jerk chicken mcnuggets.  I can take the chicken off the bone myself, thank you. And a Jamaican restaurant without escovitch fish?  A lot more effort has been made on the bar area, which offers craft beers and other imports by the dozen.  Out of Jamaican Red Stripe, however.  And what about a good ginger beer?  Details count. There was a huge array of hats, t-shirts, and other swag that were plastered liberally with the word "Jerk".  It isn't cutesy, it's just a mockery of the Jamaicans.  A mediocre effort at best.  Get some Jamaicans and save yourself.

40.description: Love!!! Their plantains are so delicious and I've had a tough time finding good ones in the city! The jerk chicken is so good and the staff is very friendly. Good job Jerk!!!

53.description: Well, Allow me to start by saying I'm a Jerk Food Enthusiast. I've tried all the best Jerk Spots throughout the City (Jerk Villa being the best) and even been to Jamaica 6 times for the authentic Jerk Jamaican Food experience. I'm such a fan, that at times I make my own marinade, spark up my own grill, and make own Jerk! :)The other day I was having a Jerk craving. I figured since this new restaurant Jerk Grill was by my place of employment me and a co-worker will give em a try.When I 1st stepped in I saw all hispanics and white people behind the counter working. Mind you this is advertised as "Authentic Jamaican Jerk". For a sec I stepped outside because I thought I entered the wrong restaurant (Chipotle maybe?). But I saw the sign on the window and I guessed I was in right place.But then I thought possibly, maybe they're Jamaican but just don't look it. So then I stepped up to order and said "Wah Gwaan", the guy at the counter looked dumbfounded like I was speaking a foreign language. He didn't comprehend a basic Jamaican Greeting (This is a Jamaican Restaurant right?). We joked it off and proceeded with the order.I ordered a Jerk Chicken entree and my Co-worker ordered some Jerk Wings. Now, I've been eating Jerk for a VERY long time, been to some of the best Jerk spots to some of the worst but this is the 1st time I ever got "slits" of what he said was boneless skinless chicken. The counter guy went as far as to put the few slits of chicken on a scale (which was annoying). He deducted what I thought should be on the platter. Serious red flags are ablazed!Authentic Jerk Chicken is usually a couple quarter chickens chopped with a cleaver. I slid down the counter and got Rice n Beans as a side and was more throwed back when the other hispanic guy gave me a mere scoop of it. At this point I knew that I wasn't in an Authentic Jamaican Food Restaurant. (Looks like Chipotle Mexican Grill employees).I looked at the total for the entree along with Soda and then looked at what I was getting. I couldn't help but to look at my co-worker and laugh as we both shared an unspoken joke.To make a long story short we go to the table and just as I thought the jokes were about to end. They bring my co-worker his 6-wings. Lo and behold, there not whole wings. They're pieces of a wing. Jokes and Laughter continues!The only good thing we spoke about this place is the decor. Clean as a whistle with good jamaican music playing.The sauce "Rudegirl" wasn't bad. I actually tasted the Allspice, Thyme Leaves, and Habaneros. My Co-Worker gave me a drum from his 6-wings and the rub was quite tasty. Makes me wonder if they learned from youtube video's how to make it.I just don't understand why I didn't see any Jamaicans or Black People in a supposedly "Authentic Jamaican Restaurant". The servers and even Cooks were all Non Jamaicans.When I go to Chinese spots, I'm served by Chinese People. When I eat Mexican Food, I'm served by Mexicans, When I eat Greek food I'm served by Greeks. When I eat African Food, well you get the picture...Based off this experience I won't be back. This place is NOT Authentic Jamaican. I predict this place won't last past 3 years.

30.description: I question if these are real reviews.  I can't imagine this place getting anything more than one star. Nothing I ordered was good.  The chicken wasn't good. The rice and beans tasted like pure coconut and was dry.  The plantains were dry.  The beef patty was slimy. The macaroni tasted like hamburger helper. This was not a good experience.  I got served fast.  And there wasn't any sort of confrontation so this isn't personal. But it appears that this is more of a popup restaurant.  If these reviews are here to lure people in, shame on the owners.  I do not recommend this restuarant

46.description: Food was good, staff was friendly. Didn't appreciate the "tip shaming" at the counter. That's why I deducted a star. Why am I tipping again? I get my own drink and bus my own table. Adding the 20% tip makes it a bit expensive for fast food. Just sayin

1.description: Drove 15 minutes to order Brisket sliders and a entre; to my dismay No beef in the building! Nothing worst than a restaurant running out of food!  Authentic Jamican Foodies turn around; this place is not for you. However, Beef patties, were on the menu and to my discovery , the patties were runny and not the  ground Beef texture.  This place is a poor jerk knock off in a loft...

55.description: We tried the jerk chicken and pork entrees with the mac n cheese and coconut rice as our sides.  Everything was really good!  The rude girl sauce was excellent (as suggested by other reviews), but the jerk bbq stole the show for us.  Staff was very friendly, service was quick, and the entree price was very reasonable.  We will definitely be back with friends.

9.description: Brick & Mortar Review!The Jerk truck was once a Thursday lunch staple for the 600 W-esters. As a tag-along one fine Thursday, I was introduced to the sweat-inducing magic of the Rude Girl chicken with seasoned fries. Their Chicago & Halsted shop was hotly anticipated since and thanks to Yelp, the boy and I trekked over on a rainy evening. LINE OUT THE DOOR!I'd liken the dining experience to that of "Green Streets Smoked Meats". There's a fully outfitted bar that's separate from the food counter. You pick a meat and the guy behind the counter slices, dices, then weighs the portions. He'll plop it onto a tray and slide it down the line for choice of sides (island slaw included), a sauce, plus any extras. Their shop has expanded choices of sides such as salted potatoes, coconut black bean rice, and mac-n-cheese. Plus you can enjoy their meats as sliders, on top of salads with other extras like yuca fries and beef/veggie patties. The chicken was just as magical as I remembered. The boy got the Rude Girl, but I decided to give my bowels a rest and try their Jerk BBQ sauce. If you're not willing to sweat it out, their BBQ sauce is a safe bet. There's also an aioli as a third option. After trying the coconut rice and mac-n-cheese, my favorite's always the tried-and-true seasoned fries. Even though it's an extra, this is a must-order!Since Jerk's been open for less than a week, I expected some bumps. The staff was still figuring out their rhythm amongst the dinner rush. When ordering an extra, like fries, they hand you a tiny laminated label that sits on your tray after you pay and sit down. We were confused if we were supposed to check-in and pick it up at the register or if someone was to bring it out to us. Eventually someone did track us down with our fries. Perhaps table number holders for greater visibility? All-in-all, if you're in the 'hood with a carnivorous mood, this is a fine place to get your fix!

26.description: Five out of five hands down BEST Jerk chicken I have had in some years. Will be back again to try the pork. Well worth the drive in my book. Oh and the festival bread yum yum.

25.description: A friend really wanted to try this place.  I checked out the website and wasn't totally sold.  I live in Edgewater so it a bit of a trek to get here.  So with a little convincing, she persuaded me, and I couldn't have been more impressed. The Chicken is surprisingly moist and spicy, the sides were incredible and the rum punch was smooth. Had a wonderful experience here.  The vibe of the place from the dj, to the decor, to the service is spot on.

12.description: Aside from it not being good, my chicken was raw. Ruined my entire appetite. The plantains were tasty. I had the beef patty as well. Luckily I'd eaten that before I looked at this raw chicken. They did give a refund, but of course we had to go pick it up since we ordered on Door Dash. I won't be back.

59.description: Scenario:  Husband and I are super hungry after his jiu jitsu class and my bootcamp class.  Closest options are tacos or Jerk (thanks to Yelp).  Now, we LOVE tacos all day errday...but we figured we should try something different.  Jerk it tis!We got here around 8:30, the place was maybe half full, and there was only one person ahead of us in line.  They have TVs, a bar, and really good music playing.Food:  We both ordered the jerk chicken with the jerk bbq sauce.  I had the corn and beans as a side, and the Mr. got the mac & cheese as his side.  I also ordered the yuca fries because FRIESSSSS.  I am not a jerk expert, but EVERYTHING was good!  Seasoning on the chicken was spicy and sooo good.  The bbq sauce gave it a nice tanginess.  And the yuca fries...so crispy and delicious!  I think it had a jerk seasoning on it as well.  Will definitely be back to try the other meats!  And to drink. :)

21.description: This jerk chicken was so disappointing. If you want real jerk chicken, try Tropical Time or Garifuna Flava. I was craving Tropical Time but chose to go to Jerk because it was much closer. I ordered the jerk chicken entree with the slaw and Mac. The jerk chicken was bland. I'm pretty sure they don't use salt and because their chicken is boneless, it lost a lot of flavor. My girlfriend thought the sauce (which came in a tiny little container, was too garlicky). I definitely agree. The slaw had the smell of nail polish and was too peppery. The Mac was.... Meh. Let's just say I didn't finish the Mac. The fritter was the best thing. I really wanted to like this place. They have great marketing, and it looks like it'll be good, but it just can't compare to real jerk chicken.Okay.... It's been 10 minutes since I wrote this review. I'm still so disappointed. Why did I have to waste a meal on this? My mouth smells of garlic and my stomachs is full. But my wallet is empty and I'm soooooo unsatisfied. I will never go back here. It blows my mind that anyone would like this place.

17.description: First: dry and bland jerkSecond: festival is tastyThird: dry and bland jerkFourth: trendy barFifth: if you don't know what good Jamaican Jerk is then you won't know the difference

10.description: Mac and cheese was highlight. But tiny portions, really? Meat was so dry. Very bland. Not enough sauce given in the delivery. By the time it had reached us (being about 6 blocks away) everything had cooled off. Coleslaw wasn't bad, probably my favorite part.Besides that, not impressed. I'd rather just go for BBQ.

5.description: The chicken is pretty good, but the menu is a little confusing.  For example, I had the chicken thigh, which isn't really a thigh, just meat cut from the thigh.  I would suggest getting that.  Sides were above average, coconut rice is recommended.  Also, they do have an impressive beer list. The one thing I didn't like is the place has a DJ and the guy spins his music really loud which is fine if this place were a bar at midnight, but it's a restaurant at 8 pm.

3.description: I live nearby and drive by the place all the time but never have gone in. Also, I see via Instagram that they have half off wings on Mondays...I believe....Still I haven't made it in. So finally I used Door Dash to deliver the food to me. The food was solid! I ordered the chicken with the rude girl sauce (spiciest) with a side of mac. The chicken was plentiful and juicy/tender while seasoned to perfection. The rude girl sauce complimented the chicken and had a slow burning spice that eventually forced me to eat faster and faster cause the spice level continued to kick it up with each and every bite. But for spice lovers...it was amazing. The spice was delicious and not just all heat, a damn good amount of heat but worth every lick. The meal also came with a slice of bread, Jamaican cornbread, and a side of garden salad. The Jamaican cornbread and salad helped cool the tongue off. Oh yeah and the mac and cheese was great! Nice and cheesy and topped with some of their jerk seasoning...mmm..I'm a fan of the place...I will actually stop in some time cause the food is FIRE as in damn good and spicy.

35.description: So sad that this isn't going to be an amazing review.. I know you all depend on my reviews .. Cool Beer Choices, Love that they have daily specials & lots of parking.. But I really wish the food was better. Under cooked chicken, inconsistent garnish of orders.. They didn't handle the "happy hour" well in my opinion.. Really nice staff, but for me food is key!! ...I really don't care to bash this joint so I won't go any further

19.description: So hot I could cry; so good I couldn't stop eating in spite of this.I went with the go-to item; jerk chicken with Rude Girl sauce; I also picked up a side of yukon gold fries to round it off. Beverages would just have to wait until I got back to the office.The odds are pretty good that you've never had dark chicken like this. It was very moist, and very well marinated with just a little bit of that jerk heat.If you get the Rude Girl sauce, this heat gets cranked up to "maximum". It tastes like habañero and many, many spices, complemented the marinade nicely and nearly made me run into Starbucks for a marshmallow frappucino right then and there. There's a piece of white bread at the bottom of the box in case you cry mercy, and a hush puppy as well that was crispy and corny.The fries were perfectly sized and had an excellent balance of sweet, smoky, rosemary and salty.Jerk is well worth finding, well worth standing in line for and well worth experiencing the pain.

28.description: Awesome options, chicken was amazing. Mac and Cheese phenomenal. Order at counter and sit anywhere. Great for a quick lunch, free parking across street.

45.description: Aside from it not being good, my chicken was raw. Ruined my entire appetite. The plantains were tasty. I had the beef patty as well. Luckily I'd eaten that before I looked at this raw chicken. They did give a refund, but of course we had to go pick it up since we ordered on Door Dash. I won't be back.

33.description: Its ok. It not terrible but its not the best. I had the brisket which was decent and my mom had the wings which she liked. The plantians are really good! Good portion sizes. The staff is friendly and they have a large drink/beer selection which is nice.

43.description: The jerk chicken is outstanding! Tender and juicy and I nicely paired it with a side of sweet plantains. The ambiance and design of Jerk feels very comfortable and I will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu. Give it a shot, you won't regret it.

2.description: Service and operations are a little confusing and chaotic.  Ordered chicken thighs - very good.  Other members of my party ordered chicken salad and thighs. They were out of brisket at 7:30 on a Saturday night.   My brother ordered chicken wings and we were done with all our meals before the wings came out - probably about 20-25 minutes.  We also ordered fries which also took 20-25 minutes after our meal.   We had to go up the front to ask for the fried food -  .  The person taking the order is also serving the chicken- people are all over in line waiting around for things.  Its very unorganized.  Might be advantageous to have some waiters.  The food is good - the default is pretty spicy - I don't mind but people who can only take mild spiciness beware.

18.description: Growing up with parents from the Caribbean and the food that comes along with it...this place is my second home. When I first moved to Chicago, it was extremely difficult to find a place that provided authentic Caribbean/Jamaican food. I saw the signs for months and couldn't wait for this place to open after having the jerk chicken from the food truck.This place nails it! EVERYTHING is on point!
