35.description: This is my new deep dish pizza destination plus they deliver. Their pizza is great.

19.description: There are very few options for late night food in this area so the pizza was decent, but undercooked and not an option under normal business hours.

28.description: There are very few options for late night food in this area so the pizza was decent, but undercooked and not an option under normal business hours.

45.description: Love this place. They are always on the money, always on time with delivery! I've ordered from them at the office at least a 10 times now, each time - fresh toppings, delicious sauce, deep dish is good, thin is awesome! Never had a bad experience with this pie place. Came upon them on a whim, seemed to be the only place with reasonable prices and good reviews, in addition to cheap same day delivery. Been with them ever since!

33.description: Ordered the gluten free pizza for the first time the other day and it was absolutely delicious. My boyfriend has been gluten free for a couple years now and we honestly have the hardest time finding a good tasting gluten free pizza. We found our new pizza home. Loves it!!!! Can't wait to be a fat a$$ and order one a week.

43.description: Our favorite place for pie delivery!  If you are craving delicious pizza with fresh toppings, this is the spot! Classic thin crust, sweet sauce, and spot-on delivery. We make sure to always add on an order of buffalo shrimp, which you can order increments of five (which is great, in case you only want a little something extra to complement your pizza). The shrimps come lightly breaded and sauced in their fantastic buffalo sauce -- which also works well on the buffalo chicken pizza! Highly recommend. Your order typically comes with coupons too for future discounts. Awesome perk for loyal customers :) FYI, for pizza-and-wing fans, their wings are breaded as well ... I only mention this because we ordered them once and forgot to ask, so we were caught off guard.

2.description: I came with the fam and had a pizza with fries combo. The fries thing was a little off but let me tell you... The fries are the only thing worth coming back for. The pizza was bland and more on the average side. The service was ok and there were no customers so finding a seat was a breeze.. Although, not offering high chairs to its customers is not only a let down but not family friend at all. Would I come back? Um, highly doubtful

18.description: I gave this place 3 chances. First time: Fried Ravioli and Garlic bread special. The grease was bad, I ate two raviolis and for the rest of the day I had an epic stomach ache. No bueno. Garlic bread was an odd combo of soggy and chewy and tasted like straight butter. Gross.Second time: Tomato Pizza with fresh Basil: Well my pizza was only reheated halfway  so the first half of the pizza was warm and decent. The second half was cold. It was just Ok. Third time: Garden Salad: Sooo much rotten lettuce that it was inedible. I want my money back but I already used my lunch break and can't get take any more time out of my day to deal with this rotten little salad. needless to say I am pissed. Bottom Line: I feel like this place only cares about their late night customers who are too wasted to know whether they are eating cardboard or pizza. Save your time and money.

41.description: Ordered for delivery through Grubhub.  PRO - There is only one.  The delivery was incredibly fast, like under 30 minutes.  CONS - The food order was messed up, the toasted ravioli was overbreaded and very greasy, and I've had better Italian Beefs at a place that looks like it should be shut down by the Health Department any minute.  I did not try the pizza so maybe I am missing out, but I'm probably not going to try again when there are so many other places that do the stuff beyond pizza so much better.

52.description: 12/10/13Please open your restrooms to your customers.  Pie Eyed pizza is still great, restroom policies are stil not great.No customer restrooms.The pizza is great and gets 3 stars for Chicago pizza and 5 for late night pizza.  But Pie-Eyed should be ashamed for locking off employee restrooms and turning away customers.  If you want to report them to the city you can Google "chicago consumer retail complaint", the first result will take you to the correct form.

50.description: this is my neighborhood pizza joint. can't say that its my favorite pie in the city but it definitely satiates my pizza fix when needed. i think i can confidently say that i like their cheese fries over their pizza. this says a lot considering i'm a bit of a frites snob. and as for the cheese, it's so fake and so good. love that stuff!

4.description: Really good offbeat local pizza joint right at the Chicago blue line stop. Don't expect anything fancy just good thin-crust pizza, huge slices and range of fried food options. Open late. The #1 with a slice, drink and fries is a good deal. I recommend heading across to the street to the Matchbox after, some of the best cocktails in the city in a really unique space.

6.description: Good pizza. Good hours. I would recommend to my friends for sure :)

22.description: I would really give it 2.75.  It's solid pizza, the people are nice and the menu has a lot of diversity to it, but I just didn't feel like it wowed me or left me with any overwhelmingly favorable impression. Also ordered some of the appetizers which were diverse but I didn't feel like had any real value or wowing taste/appearance.Solid and reliable but not can't miss.

15.description: First, I've ordered from here a couple of times now.Below Average Pizza - lacks the minimally required flavor and texture.And the surprising uncalled for cherry on top - Extremely rude customer service. It's almost like they're trying not to have sober loyal customers. Need I say more?

57.description: For being a quick grab-a-slice-on-the-go, this place is awesome!  Their pizza is pretty good.  Although you shouldn't expect a gourmet slice, you should expect a good, hot, gooey slice of pizza that is very generous in size.

20.description: First, I've ordered from here a couple of times now.Below Average Pizza - lacks the minimally required flavor and texture.And the surprising uncalled for cherry on top - Extremely rude customer service. It's almost like they're trying not to have sober loyal customers. Need I say more?

36.description: Pretty solid late night choice. Open til 5am on the weekends and they also have delivery. Huge slices of pizza too.

14.description: I went in with the kids the other day and realize this group really cares about their customers.

1.description: Crizen ROCKS. Great service, very personable, and accommodating. Chicago's best haircuts are here. Cool atmosphere in a loft setting. Thanks!!

9.description: Lesley and Michelle did the hair and makeup for me, my 7 bridesmaids, and the mothers of the bride and groom last weekend and WOW were they good!! A couple weeks before the wedding, Crizen sent me a detailed spreadsheet that outlined how they were going to get everything done that day, and they were able to stay on schedule even with all the moving parts.  Everyone's hair and makeup looked GORGEOUS and both Lesley and Michelle were so fun to work with and put all the girls at ease (especially my mom who was very emotional that day!).  Michelle even purchased the MAC products that she used on me so that I could keep them and touch up my makeup as the evening wore on.  That was so awesome of her and came in handy that night!  Thank you both so much for everything!!

23.description: Crizen did my hair and makeup for our engagement photos and our wedding in France this past summer. All I'm going to say about her is that she is the kindest, sweetest most amazing ARTIST, woman, mom, wife, sister, daughter I know and have grown to think of as part of my family. I am so blessed to have met her, not just because she made me look GORGEOUS on my day in France, but because I now have a sister and friend for life. The day I got married, I got a new husband and a new sister!!

5.description: Crizen was extremely easy and fun to work with. Her relaxed, easygoing personality, along with her professionalism made the whole process seamless. She listened to all my ideas for the trial and when I wanted some small changes on the day of the wedding, she was so accommodating and I couldn't have been happier with the end results. I looked exactly the way I envisioned it in my head. My hair isn't always the easiest to work with (it's thick and I have a lot of it!), but she was able to tame it so that I could leave it down and curly like I wanted. My curls lasted all night, and even managed to look good the next morning after being slept in! As a makeup artist, Crizen knows how to strike the fine balance between being made up for a formal event while still looking like yourself. As my best friend says: Pictures last forever. Thank goodness I had Crizen to make me look good for them. =)

25.description: She's awesome.  I will follow her wherever she goes (well..it'd be helpful if it were in the South or West Loop) :)

12.description: Crizen was hired as a makeup artist for my wedding during the fall season. She was absolutely wonderful to work with especially with her long history of working with brides. She worked around so many other people in the room and she coached me on staying calm when things were somewhat hectic. My makeup was fantastic. It lasted all day and more, brought my whole look together and made me feel gorgeous! In the photos, I still looked like me and flawless. She also did my mother's hair and makeup and adjusted it appropriately to her style and age. She too looked great! Her talent, personality and professionalism makes it all worth it!

21.description: Crizen did my hair and makeup for my wedding, as well as the hair of all my bridesmaids.  Everything went perfectly. Even though I was planning my wedding from another country, Crizen made herself available for a trial according to my visit schedule, and made sure I was happy with everything. She was amazing both at the trial and the day of my wedding. I could not have asked for more.

16.description: Crizen is nothing short of amazing! She works wonders with hair and makeup. Crizen and Ashley - a stylist on Crizen's team - traveled to Michigan to do hair and makeup for my wedding. With seven bridesmaids, my mom and me, Crizen and Ashley were asked to do nine completely different hairstyles on very different hair types, and all came out flawlessly! Everybody was thrilled with their hair and makeup, and thanks to Crizen, I couldn't have felt more beautiful on my wedding day. Equally as important, Crizen is a fabulous addition to the bridal suite! She's so much fun and fit right in with my friends and family. I HIGHLY recommend Crizen and her team - they're the very best!

17.description: I would highly recommend Crizen Hasegawa for any bride or bridal party (or anyone else who wants their hair and/or makeup done for an event). Results were perfect and more beautiful than I could have dreamed - including my bridal hair (2 looks) and makeup, hair and makeup for my 7 bridesmaids and one flower girl. Two assistants helped with various bridal party members as needed. Crizen is creative, meticulous, and professional and worked very patiently with me as I worked to figure out what I wanted. She takes and implements feedback exceptionally.  She clearly takes great pride in her work. She also showed great versatility, responding to the needs and desires of many bridesmaids with divergent styles, hair textures, facial features, and complexions. Every single member of the bridal party looked both *stunning* and wonderfully individual, and that's owed in no small part to Crizen.  Logistically speaking, Crizen was very flexible and accomodating with our demands, which included a large group, very early morning start time, and additional afternoon touchups. As a bonus, she is generally wonderful to have around, with a boundlessly positive attitude and great converstion - something I came to appreciate having during the many hours I spent in her chair (at trials and on the day)! She's simply great to work with and results could not have been better.

10.description: Based solely on online reviews, I hired Crizen to be my hair & makeup stylist for my wedding in Chicago. What a great decision that was! Crizen is so talented, artistic, kind, warm, and fun to be around. I scheduled to get my trial done for my engagement photos, and I couldn't stop gushing about how good my hair and makeup looked after we got our engagement photos back! On the day of my wedding, Crizen and 3 assistants came to the place where I was getting ready at and helped do hair and makeup for myself and 9 others! Given that there were so many people to get done, the team led by Crizen was prompt, professional, fun, had great energy, and in the end felt like friends. I loved my hair and makeup, and would highly recommend Crizen for anyone looking for a hair or makeup stylist!

11.description: I used Crizen's Senior Stylists for my wedding day and I would not recommend them for your wedding day. I coordinated everything with Crizen, however she was unavailable for my wedding day so I booked her senior stylists.  A good friend of mine used Crizen for her wedding and had wonderful reviews of both the schedule, ease of the day and overall look of her bridal party.  I wrongly assumed that I would have the same experience by working with Crizen's Senior Stylists.In working with Crizen to arrange my wedding date, I told her many times how important the timeline and prompt schedule is to me.  While she understood this priority, it did not occur on my wedding day.  The make-up was the biggest issue - the schedule Crizen made allotted 30 minutes for per bridesmaid for make-up (with 1 make-up artist).  However, the make-up artist took over 45 minutes per person resulting in nearly a 2 HOUR DELAY. No bride has an extra 2 hours on their wedding day - I certainly didn't.While working on the 2nd bridesmaid of the day, I informed the make-up artist that she was already 40 minutes behind schedule and I asked her to be more prompt.  She continued to take 45 minutes per person when only 30 was allotted.For hair - I had insisted on 2 hair stylist and Crizen scheduled 45min-1hour for each person.  This was adequate and they were on schedule; however, the make-up delays caused some delays to their schedules as well.  Also, I was personally frustrated that my stylist deviated from the hair trial and needed day-of decisions.  It was very frustrating to be behind schedule and troubleshooting my new hairstyle.  Additionally, I noticed in pictures that many of the bridesmaids' hair became undone throughout the day. I expect up-do hair styles to stay put like a statue until the girl unpins it at the end of the night.  Overall - this is the 1 and only vendor from my wedding that I cannot recommend.  The schedule delays were beyond frustrating and I'm disappointed I paid for a pricey service only to have sub-par results.  In bringing these issues to Crizen, she apologized profusely and offered salon, hair or make-up services for a future event.  I do believe her apology was sincere, but she failed to follow through on her offer after I accepted her apology and provided my contact information.  Therefore - just a disappointment and I would caution other bride's considering using Crizen's stylists.

26.description: Crizen did my hair and make-up for my wedding in August 2008.  She rocks!  She somehow managed to give me a gorgeous up-do for my wedding even though my hair was quite short at the time.  She totally listened to me at our trial to create a style and look that was funky and unique.  I'm not one to wear earth tones, despite the fact that everyone says you should stick to neutrals for your wedding day.  The make-up stayed perfectly all day despite the warm August weather.She was very accomodating and also did the hair for one of my bridesmaids.  I appreciate the fact that she was willing to work with me even though she could have booked another wedding that had a larger bridal party (and would = more money for her).  I would absolutely use Crizen again (except that I only intend to get married once).  I guess I'll just have to find a fancy party for an up-do!

27.description: Crizen did an exceptional job for hair and makeup on my wedding day and rehearsal dinner. She listen to exactly what I wanted but also gave me some ideas. I didn't want too much makeup for my wedding day but she said putting little bit more would come out nice on photo's and she was absolutely right. My makeup looked so natural  and came through so beautifully on the photos. For my hair, I brought pictures but with her creative style, she put a spin on it and made me look elegant.  She would do things that wasn't required for her job. She touched up on my aunt's hair and makeup, who flew in that morning.I would definitely recommend Crizen for hair and makeup! I was very ecstatic with my look on my wedding day and rehearsal.

0.description: I booked Crizen and her team to do the hair and makeup for myself and my entourage. I had seen her a month prior to do my trial and was very impressed. She was very easy to to talk to and answered all my hair and makeup concerns.  I saw her at 10am and did not do my prewedding shoot until around 4pbut I did not have to do any retouch. A week before the wedding she sent me a spreadsheet with the sched for the entire group which I was able to send out so not everyone had to come to my suite so early. She ( and her team) were amazing! They  came on time and was finished before they were scheduled  to get done. She help made my wedding day less stressful! I would definitely recommend her to everyone.

20.description: Crizen and her team did hair and make-up for me and my large wedding party in June 2013. She did a fantastic job and is just a pleasure to work with. She is so talented and a true professional. She is also a super kind person. Before the wedding, I had a trial with an entourage of family and friends in tow, which can be overwhelming, but she handled them with the utmost respect and professionalism. She's so charming, that everyone enjoyed talking and being around her. She and my mom quickly became great friends. In the weeks leading up to the wedding, being that I am very particular and indecisive, I had requested a second trial to incorporate last minute changes I had made and to finalize the final look. She made time in her busy schedule to do this and was very patient with me in addressing my concerns. She made sure I felt comfortable and was happy with everything. She even gave me a much needed haircut, which was great because since she knew the hairstyle for my wedding, she was able to cut it in a way that would make my hair look even better on the day of. Crizen has my highest recommendation!

19.description: Crizen did my hair and makeup for our engagement photos and our wedding in France this past summer. All I'm going to say about her is that she is the kindest, sweetest most amazing ARTIST, woman, mom, wife, sister, daughter I know and have grown to think of as part of my family. I am so blessed to have met her, not just because she made me look GORGEOUS on my day in France, but because I now have a sister and friend for life. The day I got married, I got a new husband and a new sister!!

2.description: Crizen has been my hairstylist for sometime now and it was a no brainer to use her for my wedding day.  Everyone knows that it takes one bad haircut to ruin your day.  I have been seeing Crizen for my haircuts and she has always done an exceptional job that when I leave her salon I get that extra pep in my step..lolOn my wedding day she spent even more time on my hair to ensure it was perfect and my wedding pictures reflected that.  I could not ask for a better hair day than I had on my wedding day.  Thanks Criz!!!!

18.description: I found Crizen based on her online reviews. I knew within the first 10 minutes of my trial that I had made a great decision choosing her for my wedding hair and makeup. In addition to being extremely talented, Crizen is warm and funny and immediately made me feel at ease. On my wedding day Crizen and Jenai came to our hotel suite to do hair and make up for my bridal party and me. Although it may be a little cheaper to go to a salon, the time and stress saved by having them come to us was well worth it. I have never felt as beautiful as I did on my wedding day. My hair and makeup lasted the entire day through tears and dancing and looked great in pictures. I highly recommend Crizen and her team!

13.description: I found Crizen online for my wedding hair and make-up and selected her because of the many great reviews she had. She did a wonderful job with my hair and make-up for the wedding day! I did a trial a month or so before my wedding and decided I wanted to modify my hair and make-up a bit for the actual wedding day. She really listened to what I wanted and gave me hair and make-up for my wedding day I couldn't have been happier with. Her team also did a great job with the bridesmaids hair, everyone looked beautiful!

4.description: Crizen is amazing!  She is so talented and great with customer service.  Thanks, Crizen!  You are the best!

24.description: I found Crizen by listening to other Yelpers and - woah! I am beyond pleased! Crizen is delightful and talented! She listened and gave helpful advice. I explained what I was going for and she went with it. She even pushed back when she disagreed with a style choice. Listen to her! She knows what she is doing!She arrived promptly at my home on my wedding day and easily got me and three bridesmaids ready ahead of schedule! I looked absolutely stunnning on my wedding day and I have Crizen to thank for helping to bring it out!I will add photos when the professionals prints come in!

6.description: We just got married September 13 and we feel blessed to have had Crizen and her team. Crizen and her team did my hair and makeup beautifully! My husband said he got the goosebumps when he saw me! She made our experience enjoyable with her communication and being so organized throughout our wedding planning.    We liked how she provided a timeline for the wedding day. This way our bridesmaids and family were on time and punctual.   I will definitely refer her to my friends, who are getting married this year!

22.description: Crizen is very professional. She make us feel very comfortable, and she did a very nice job making our makeup and our hairstyle beautiful. We got very good compliments with everyone. I will say she is the best of all the professional hair makeup artist I ever met.

15.description: I found Crizen by listening to other Yelpers and - woah! I am beyond pleased! Crizen is delightful and talented! She listened and gave helpful advice. I explained what I was going for and she went with it. She even pushed back when she disagreed with a style choice. Listen to her! She knows what she is doing!She arrived promptly at my home on my wedding day and easily got me and three bridesmaids ready ahead of schedule! I looked absolutely stunnning on my wedding day and I have Crizen to thank for helping to bring it out!I will add photos when the professionals prints come in!

7.description: Hired Crizen and her team for my wedding. The trial was amazing and ladies did an amazing job for the wedding. Lesley and Michelle, both senior artists, did my hair and make up as well as my bridesmaids and Mom. All of us showed pictures of the hair and make up we desired and both came out almost exactly alike. All services were provided in my home. The hair and makeup both lasted all night however, for the price I would have liked to receive a complimentary lip gloss or something. I would definitely hire them for a special occasion again but visit the salon to save on the price.

8.description: I got married June 14th, 2014 and I couldn't have been more pleased and happy with Crizen and her amazing team. I'm so grateful I was referred to her by a friend. Crizen is so amazing at what she does and I fell in love with her work from my hair/make up trial to engagement photo shoot to the wedding day. I had about 7 family members who were getting ready with me on the wedding day, plus my mom and my mommy in law and Crizen and her team of 4 got everyone's hair and make up done in time. She was so organized,professional, flexible, easy to talk to, understood exactly what I wanted and made the process so enjoyable. I really appreciate all she did and would definitely refer her to friends to family. I look forward to having hair and make up done by her for other special occasions. Thank you Crizen.

3.description: After standing up in several weddings where we had to drive to get our hair and make-up done I have to applaud Crizen again. It is so worth it to have Crizen come to you on your wedding day!! What a hassle it was driving to salons and back to change, than to the wedding venue! The brides were worried and frazzled and the weddings ended up being LATE! My wedding day on the other hand was so relaxed and laid back. Because we weren't driving around I had more time to enjoy all my family and friends being there together with me. So worth it. Thanks Crizen.

14.description: I can't express how amazing Crizen made me feel on my wedding day!  I didn't know I could look that good!  I have very thin hair, so she suggested extensions since I wanted to wear it down.  No one could tell at all!  Crizen is also a wonderful person and a joy to spend time with.  She also did hair/makeup for my sister's wedding and we were just blown away by her expertise.  She is a true wedding FIND!

58.description: Lost my stylist about 6 months ago and was sent art+sciences way by my wife.  Kept my fingers crossed that this Katie id been scheduled with was the real deal.  She is.  I got lucky being paired with such a professional, friendly and talented stylist.  My last cut was the best haircut I've gotten in my life. Easy choice for you gentleman that are searching for a serious professional and a really solid value.  Get on the books with Katie. J

56.description: Here's the thing. I'm typically a freeloader on Yelp. I use it religiously for finding new places but very rarely take the time to write reviews. Scandalous. I've always liked this salon. Hip but friendly. Trendy but accessible. And I always like popping into Levi's next door when I'm done. I recently had my hair colored only to arrive home and realize it was way too dark and that little accent piece I asked for was on steroids. I absolutely hate the inevitable phone call that follows. I feel terrible complaining and hate being one of those clients. BUT! The front desk was super helpful and fit me right back in (with no attitude). I saw Stephanie and she turned the darkness into a hair color I've always lusted after on magazine covers. She was fast and accommodating and even called to ask if I was happy after the appointment. Better yet, they fixed it for free!I've finally found a colorist AND a stylist in Chicago I can count on (because I forgot to mention Hannah works wonders with a pair of scissors)!

29.description: I have been going to Rob for almost 5 years now, and it is a totally shame that I have not written a review of him and the salon yet.  Rob is amazing - a total hair genius.  He is intuitive about your hair needs, and always gives you good recommendations if you are worried about how a style will work with your face/hair type etc.  He is such a great people person and he makes you feel totally special by remembering things about your life even if you haven't seen him in a long while (oops!).  I love Rob and Art & Science!!!

42.description: I walked 8 blocks only to find out that they had messed up my appointment. Did not offer any compensation, was just asked to come back later.

23.description: After many bad cuts and colors, I stumbled upon this place on Yelp. I decided to call and ask for a senior stylist because I was in desperate need for someone to fix my terrible, uneven cut. I was matched with Seven and boy, am I glad. I'm officially done looking for salons/stylist. Seven is my new girl!

47.description: I think three stars are generous but my hair looks good. Great space and nice people but terrible philosophy. I came in for a partial highlights and a hair cut. Normally the partial highlights takes an hour and hair cut takes about 45. Here the partial highlight takes an hour and 45 min and then you wait for an unnecessary amount of time til your haircut which takes at least an hour. The last salon I went to I had one person do everything which really cut down time. Here I dealt with three people- so coordinating three stylists is obviously more challenging than one. Instead of hair dryers to speed up the highlights you wait. Then you get a wash and wait. And wait some more. Then a haircut. I waited an extra 45 min. This could have been eliminated if they did build so many buffers in. So now I type this as I have cold wet hair waiting for my cut. Finished product looks good and you get free wine but make sure you have 3-4 hours!!

8.description: I would also highly recommend Ivan for color. Achieved Victoria's Secret level beachy bayalage both times I've seen him. Listened intently to what I wanted and he went above and beyond. He's an artist!

31.description: Typically, I absolutely dread hair cuts.   After passing Art+Science and then seeing it make the Chicagoist "The 8 Best Hair Salons In Chicago" list, I thought I would give it a go. I am so happy and relieved to have found such a fantastic salon! From the front desk to the shampoo girl, everyone was friendly and welcoming. There was great music and they offered tea, coffee, etc. Good vibes from start to finish. I had my hair colored by Susan. I cannot say enough wonderful things about her. She is fabulous! It is clear from the moment you meet her she is truly passionate about her career. I wasn't exactly sure of what to do with my hair, so she took a lot time to consult me about my options, what i wanted from my color and what she thought would be best.. My resulted hair color has far exceeded my expectations. It is very complimentary to my complexion and eye color. I have received compliments from all my co-workers, friends and family.  I love my new color and have already scheduled my next appointment with Susan. My color was followed by a cut with Seven. She also exceeded my expectations. She gave me a great cut that I have been able to manage well on my own. I love it!Thanks A+S for a great experience, I look forward to my next visit!

34.description: Bridget does such a nice job with color.  And she's very sweet and personable.  I recommend!

16.description: I tried so many salons while living in Chicago looking for an awesome cut and color that didn't make me look like a soccer mom....I wear my hair short and just because I'm 50+ doesn't mean I do not want an edgy look. I finally found Rob & Bridget at Art + Science! They are amazing! I now live out of state but drive back as often as possible to see my kids, who still live in Chicago and squeeze in a cut and color! My husband, who travels with me LOVES Katie! I can see why Art + Science was rated the best Chicago Salon! The staff is super skilled and the front desk could not be sweeter! Best part, No pretentious people here!

13.description: Ivan works wonders! I came in with a blonde that I absolutely hated and he transformed my hair into a beautiful platinum/silver. Everyone in the salon was extremely helpful and knowledgable! I've never found a salon that I want to go back to until now! Thank you and I will see you in 6 weeks!

11.description: Mitra gave me the best haircut I've ever had. We talked through what I want and what she thought would look best. She walked me slowly through the whole thing and made me feel great about my look! She also gave me lots of tips and was great to talk to. I will definitely be coming back and will recommend to my friends!

39.description: Rob is amazing. I just received what is the best cut of my life.  Besides being amazingly talented, he's super sweet and does an awesome consultation.  Then he actually does what you agreed upon! The salon is beautiful, modern, and friendly.  They served me a delicious cup of jasmine tea as well. Everyone that works here is super friendly also.Go. You will love this place!

37.description: I recently went in for some color and a cut.IVAN is the person to see if you need some color accents added. He is extremely personable and has such great style. JESSICA did my cut. Again, seriously a sweetheart and listens to what you're looking for. I asked for input and she gave me honesty, which is a whole lot better than walking around like a fool. My experience here was excellent. I'll definitely be back in soon!

0.description: This review is for hair color.  Art + Science is the second salon I tried after moving to Chicago in 2015.  I have found my spot.  It's everything a quality salon should be.  After scouring Yelp reviews and checking out websites, I decided to give Art + Science a try.  It is evident from their thoughtfully designed website, hip and trendy photos and Yelp reviews that a high level of service and professionalism could be expected.  I was not disappointed!I booked an appointment with Susan, the color director, and for a first time appointment, no prior relationship, the chemistry was great.  She is an extremely talented and competent colorist. Jamie who is apprenticing also was very polite and professional and did a great job on my rinse and style.The salon offers a variety of high-quality professional products.  The reception/scheduling staff is extremely attentive and friendly.  Overall my experience was outstanding.  I highly recommend Art + Science color service.

38.description: I love Art and Science.  Great customer service from the receptionists on the phone to everyone at the salon.  I will tell you I am super picky about my hair and have tried multiple stylists but there is absolutely no one that compares to Becca!  The hardest thing to find in a stylist is consistency but with Becca every cut is perfect (I have been a client for 2 years.) She is always engaging and listens to your ideas and makes her own recommendations, the sign of someone who knows what they are doing.  This review is two years too late but just had to give her a shout out!!

51.description: I just went here yesterday after being referred by a friend. I'm beyond happy that I went. I usually hi-light my hair and decided to do a bleach and tone instead. Ivan is an absolute genius with color. He nailed the color I wanted perfectly. I'm so glad I found this salon.  Super friendly staff, great atmosphere. Love it!!!

27.description: This was my first visit to Art and Science, and was definitely my last. The haircut I had was unfortunately the worst of my life. I saw a stylist (who I won't name here) that left the bottom line of my long hair completely crooked, and cut incredibly uneven layers. I am going to have to visit another salon to have it fixed. I feel as though the time and care that should have gone into my appointment was not afforded to me by the stylist -- she left in the middle of my cut to wash her next client's hair because she was behind schedule. I can only assume that this is the reason why she made such glaring mistakes while cutting my hair. While she was blow drying she twisted my stick straight hair with product so that the errors in the cut were not so apparent and made the comment that she "liked the choppiness." It wasn't until I went home and washed my hair that I saw the 'holes' in the layers and the crooked lines. I can't wait to have someone fix this - this haircut was a complete waste of $65.

32.description: The receptionist (I believe her name was Anna) was so entitled and unprofessional, she completely discouraged me from wanting to come try out the salon! Potential first time customers should not be scolded when trying to make an appointment.

54.description: I got my hair cut here around the end of April/beginning of May and realized I never wrote a review!I had a great experience here. When I called, they were able to fit me in same day which was really nice. Coco cut my hair and she did a great job. I hadn't gotten my hair cut in 2 & 1/2 years (Horrible I know), but I had been a broke college student for most of that time. Nonetheless, I loved my haircut. I told Coco that I wear clip in hair extensions normally and have been for about 4 years and she cut my hair so it would still be easy to blend my extensions in or still look good without them. Super please with my final cut and need to go back soon to try out their colorists!

48.description: First time to one of Wicker Park's haircut places. First impression I got when I went in was friendly service who offered me water. Place was really nicely decorated and had a vibrant feeling.I went in with my groupon. Katie was the only barber that accepted groupon.  I can say for sure that this is the place to get a men's haircut despite the price being quite hefty (especially without a Groupon). Katie is a great barber and I would recommend. Only downside to her is that she's quiet throughout the haircut.

44.description: Groupon requires specific barbers. Unable to book special barbers. Hence, unable to use services. The haircut I did get was rushed and felt that would have been better off using some of the other salons in the Wicker park area. I would suggest those who go here to try somewhere else first.

24.description: I recently tried Art + Science after getting a not-so-great cut from my former stylist. I LOVE ART + SCIENCE. The attention to detail my stylist had when fixing my cut as well as the professionalism and care I saw other clients receiving was top notch. I can't wait until my hair grows out and I can get a full cut (not just a fix) from someone there and see what they can do!

7.description: Wow! Lexie did amazing things with my hair, I'm traveling from Australia and have had the same hairdresser for 10 years there, and I normally don't trust anyone else with the blonde, took a chance and it was amazing! My color looks fabulous and it was exactly what I wanted!! Definitely a place to go!!!! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago!!!!

49.description: I had a great experience here. I would assume that my hair is pretty easy to cut. It's long and straight and I usually just get a trim. However, I thought Coco did a great job. She got rid of all my dead ends and suggested adding in some long layers. My hair looks healthy and I can tell she did a much better job than the last haircut I received. I gave this salon 4 stars instead of 5 because my old salon gave head massages and this one doesn't. I'll definitely be back. Also, getting an appointment was super easy.

40.description: Jessica was my hair stylist here and was really great! Very knowledgable and terrific personality!

53.description: After having a pretty miserable experience at another neighborhood salon that I had been going to for years, I looked to Yelp for direction. I called A & S and was scheduled with Bridget. She was fabulous; she understood what I was looking for, took time reviewing the photos that I had brought, and asked questions to fill in any gaps (because I know I'm not very salon-vocab savvy). I'll definitely be seeing her again, and I highly recommend her!

30.description: I've been coming to this salon for about 4 years, my person was Guy. When he left I bounced around different stylist and then I came across Yana. I love her! She understands what a light dust off the ends means (I'm trying to let my hair grow). My hair was slightly brittle due to cold weather, and I walked out with soft luscious hair. Thanks Yana!

46.description: I have been going to Art + Science for about a year now and I have never been disappointed. I go to Bridget for my color and she is absolutely amazing. I went in not knowing what to do and she gave me the most beautiful ombre. I get comments on how pretty my hair is weekly with people wanting to know my secret for such a great color. I like to think I am a walking billboard for her dye jobs! Bridget will never settle until you are happy with your color. She is also super personable and genuinely cares about you and your opinions. I have never met such an amazing colorist and I will never let anyone besides her dye my hair again!

1.description: I came in today Saturday around 2:00 pm to see if I could get a haircut, the lady in the front desk (the one with short hair and an earring in her nose) welcomed me with a very upsetting face and rude attitude. I simple asked if walk ins were welcome and with a very despicable tone of voice she answered me with a "YES BUT WE ARE ALL BUSY"  then I asked her if maybe I should wait or come back later and she looked at me from head to toe badly and again very rude tone of voice she said they were all busy by the rest of the day and I just come another day or call for an appointment !!" She didn't even say thank you for coming , good bye or we are sorry no body is available. Poor costumer service!!! What a rude welcoming , that makes me have a bad feeling about the salon in general. I'm afraid the stylists might be the same.  I will definitely never go there again! Sometimes the owners forget that the ladies helping in the front desk are the face of the salon too!

55.description: Love my new haircut! This is my first time visiting and I couldn't be happier. My stylist, Jo was amazing. I was hesitant at first because of how much I was cutting off but Jo walked me through every step and was cool with answering my (many) questions. I will definitely be back again. Thanks Jo!

9.description: I. LOVE. This salon. I came in to refresh my color (I'm currently rocking a grey bang) and Ivan was able to take care of me, no drama, and the color came out not only gorgeous but EXACTLY the way I wanted. He really listened to me, which I appreciated. I was blown out by Andy who was WONDERFUL, asked me how I blew my hair out, what products I wanted, and gave one of the best blowouts I've ever received. She also seemed to have a real understanding of my texture (her hair is naturally straight) and listened to all of my instructions. I left the salon with big, fluffy, beautifully colored hair and happy as a lark. Lol

26.description: I have been going to Art and Science in Wicker Park for about a year and a half now. I at first saw Vanessa, but upon her leaving the salon I was transferred/recommended to see Jana. I just saw Jana for the first time last week for a cut and there is no way I would see anyone else!  The best part of a cut with Jana is she takes the time to listen to what you want, your hesitations about cuts (if you've ever had a bad cut im sure you come in with some worries), and talks honestly about what she thinks will look best. In addition, as she's cutting she asks for your opinion to be sure that the cut is spot on. FINALLY- I told her that I am awful at styling my own hair, and she offered to make another appointment with her and I could come in and she could teach me a bunch of different ways to style my hair. She's so friendly and great. I have continued to get my hair colored with Susan. I cant say enough good things about her. She's amazing!

25.description: Art + Science was the second salon I tried after moving to Chicago in 2014. The fashion-forward Logan-Square-esque vibe of the place appealed to me, so I decided to try it out.Seven is my hairstylist.  Ready to make a change, I requested a lob that would emphasize the semi-wavy texture of my hair.  I also wanted bangs back. She asked me a few follow-up questions, and ended up giving me one of the best haircuts I've ever received.  Seven was great at helping me to figure out what I wanted and at working with my round-ish face shape, hair texture, and concerns about maintenance [I like low-maintenance hair]. She also offered free bang trims between cuts, which is great.  The price is good for Chicago as well.  I've been coming to her for several months now, and I'll continue to do so.

12.description: Mitra is the best! She gave me an amazing bang, and I thought a bang would never look good on me, but she proved it wrong. It came out excellent and gave me some amazing layers. Highly recommended!

59.description: I have tried all the usual Men's haircut outfits around Chicago, paid anywhere from $15 to $75 in search of a guaranteed great cut every time I sat down in the chair.  Needless to say, that was a challenge.  Several years ago I was lucky enough one day to stumble upon Katie who now works in Art + Science's barbershop division.  I followed her from a less expensive men's only haircut place to Art + Science and happily pay the small up charge as the venue itself is super clean, fun and friendly.  When you find something (or someone) this good where you know exactly what you're going to get every time, exactly how you want it, you don't let that go.  Ladies, send your men to see Katie.  Dudes, go see Katie if you have been on the hunt for awhile.  You won't be disappointed.

21.description: Seven at Art + Science is amazing. She's been cutting my hair for several years, which means she's given layers & texture to my very long hair, chopped that into a mid-length bob, and, most recently, given me an asymmetrical pixie. In short, she can do anything! I appreciate how she really listens to my nonsensical descriptions and then runs it back to ensure we're on the same page before she goes to work. She's forthright and helpful about what can work with my hair and what can't, which I find invaluable. I think that's why I leave loving each haircut more than the last. Seven will rock your hair's world!

17.description: Typically, I absolutely dread hair cuts.   After passing Art+Science and then seeing it make the Chicagoist "The 8 Best Hair Salons In Chicago" list, I thought I would give it a go. I am so happy and relieved to have found such a fantastic salon! From the front desk to the shampoo girl, everyone was friendly and welcoming. There was great music and they offered tea, coffee, etc. Good vibes from start to finish. I had my hair colored by Susan. I cannot say enough wonderful things about her. She is fabulous! It is clear from the moment you meet her she is truly passionate about her career. I wasn't exactly sure of what to do with my hair, so she took a lot time to consult me about my options, what i wanted from my color and what she thought would be best.. My resulted hair color has far exceeded my expectations. It is very complimentary to my complexion and eye color. I have received compliments from all my co-workers, friends and family.  I love my new color and have already scheduled my next appointment with Susan. My color was followed by a cut with Seven. She also exceeded my expectations. She gave me a great cut that I have been able to manage well on my own. I love it!Thanks A+S for a great experience, I look forward to my next visit!

10.description: I have gotten my color and cuts done at Art + Science for some time now. I started going because I knew Jo who works at the Evanston location from a previous job. She does an awesome job cutting! I am pretty picky about my cut and she gets what I want every time. She is always professional and meticulous. I don't think I could ever have someone else cut my hair! I would highly recommend her for for detailed hair cuts and mens cuts. I was recommended to see Elvis for color. I had been going to another salon for color and they were not getting what I wanted at all. On the first visit to see Elvis, he totally got what I wanted and I was really happy with the color. I have since seen him a few more times and every time it turns out great! I have worked in a couple salons before in reception and have worked alongside a lot of stylist, Elvis totally has natural talent and has an understanding of color that not all stylist have. I highly recommend Elvis and Jo!

5.description: Made an appt for cut and color by phone. She called later to confirm and to take credit card since it was my first time there. I just trekked all the way out here - it's -15 wind chill - and they don't have my appt in the computer. Seriously? After talking to someone at your place TWICE about it? Figure it out, Art + Science. Won't be coming back if you can't even book appointments correctly.

3.description: Obsessed with my haircut from Art + Science. I picked the salon because of its reviews and Yelpers did not lead me astray! I noticed that Tara had great reviews, so I called and made an appointment. She gave me exactly the cut I was looking for, but took into consideration my hair type and how I style it. She also straightened it for me (which is no easy task, since I have a full head of curly hair). Lastly, she recommended a Bumble and Bumble product which I love. I'm hooked and I'll definitely be coming back to Art + Science in the future - especially since I was given a coupon for my next visit!An important thing to note: Street parking is limited and metered, so give yourself a little extra time if you're driving.

35.description: This review is for Rob Reyes - he's truly a master hairstylist and the best and what he does. Love my cut!

19.description: Moving to Chicago, I had to find a hair place for a trim/refresh. Art + Science has great reviews and decent prices so it seemed like a safe bet.Hannah shampooed, cut and styled my hair. I loved everything she did. I also love that she did everything from start to finish vs. some salons where different people handle different parts of the process. She was nice, friendly and did a great job.The space is more hipster-y. I hadn't been up to Wicker Park in this area but since the entire block was similar, it made sense.I'll be coming back here for my haircuts. I don't do anything fancy, just like to maintain the length but keep the hair healthy.

28.description: I loved my haircut!

45.description: Moving to Chicago, I had to find a hair place for a trim/refresh. Art + Science has great reviews and decent prices so it seemed like a safe bet.Hannah shampooed, cut and styled my hair. I loved everything she did. I also love that she did everything from start to finish vs. some salons where different people handle different parts of the process. She was nice, friendly and did a great job.The space is more hipster-y. I hadn't been up to Wicker Park in this area but since the entire block was similar, it made sense.I'll be coming back here for my haircuts. I don't do anything fancy, just like to maintain the length but keep the hair healthy.

33.description: I tried this one in December via Groupon which once said It was good and a must try.On the paper, it looked good even though I prefer barbershop than "fashion" salon.Well, it was only on the paper...- check-in: hostess busy and don t look at you kindly,- A bit noisy and you keep your coat with you,- Timing: perfect !- Staff member was nice unlike the check-in staff,- She took my coat and put it near the floor surrounded by hair...(no hanger)- shampoo was fast and not something exciting...- cut was fast and my ears hurt."Art and Science", to me it's "Fart & Silence", sorry I pass.Ben

43.description: It would be great if they had someone who can do brown people hair. I have natural curls that are really easy to manage (conditioner & finger comb that's it!) and once in a while I would like to get it styled. Except I can't find a single place that employs someone who has the skill to even try. I came here a couple months ago, asked if they had anyone who can do curly hair and they immediately said no and continued about their business. I live down the street from here and it's a shame I can't contribute to a local business.

2.description: Mitra cut my hair yesterday and she's awesome. The consultation gave me confidence. We talked about my wants, her thoughts, and made a plan. We had good conversation during the cut. And I love my new hair -- it's is doing exactly what I'd hoped it would do. I'll definitely be back to see Mitra again.   I can't comprehend why I ever went anywhere else for a haircut. A+S is the best from start to finish. If you want a great haircut and to feel valued as a customer, this is the best place.

18.description: I am NEVER coming back to this place ever again. I was told that to get the blonde ombre I wanted it would take a few sessions because my hair was jet black and that would be a process. (Totally understandable, I get it.) Stephanie worked on my hair and when she talked about ombres/bayalages it seemed like she knew what she was doing. I had RANDOM streaks of brown in my hair, and there were patches of brown and black horizontally like they were horizontal stripes. I was not happy. They told me to come in for a 2nd session and I wasn't going to be charged, thought it would be better and we talked more about ombres and how they looked like, after being told I was wrong I felt tension and not good vibes. At the end it was the SAME thing after the second session only the streaks that she bleached were lighter. VERY DISAPPOINTED that I spent $140 to have random streaks in my hair, I've had to wear my hair in a pony tail. Even over July 4th, I felt very ugly because of my hair. I gave it a 1 star because the lady who washed my hair was very nice but that's about it. I posted a before and after picture also to show how horrible it was.

41.description: Steer clear of this salon! My mother had gorgeous hair and was looking to get her hair permed to curls. I called in on her behalf and was told that she needed to go in for a consultation first. We made the appointment and also took pictures with us of the "look" she wanted. The consultation lasted an approximate 5 minutes and we where told that her hair would look fabulous as they could get the exact curl she wanted. We set up another appointment and came in to get my mother's hair permed to tight curls. The experience was beyond horrific. Curl rods where placed in her hair, and she was left seated for a good 45 minutes with about one check up from the stylist. They then proceeded to remove the rods. I was standing next to her during this time and saw no kind of curl forming as the rods where removed. I saw the faces of both hairstylist removing them and they seemed to be questioning what was happening amongst themselves but assuredly said "beautiful curls". Halfway through the process my mother took her hair into her hands and began to panic. I also touched her hair...I was HORRIFIED. Her hair had NO CURLS and her hair was ELASTIC. She began crying. She was taken to the styling chair where the stylist STEVE took a diffuser and told her the curls where there even though there where NO CURLS. My mom was in TEARS. AND WHAT DID THE STYLIST STEVE DO???? HE WENT BACK AND LAUGHED IT OFF WITH OTHER CUSTOMERS AND STYLISTS!!!!! my mother's hair was destroyed and burned. She had to recruit to wearing wigs. She had to cut her hair completely off as it was destroyed to the roots. To this day, her hair is not the same. To this day we are working on a lawsuit against this salon for all the damages, expenses, and troubles (both physical and psychological) that my mom suffered. Beware....This place will ruin your hair. I must make this known to the public and customers. It doesn't deserve a star..it deserves to be closed down!!!!

52.description: I can't stand hipsters or wicker park. Wasn't sure what to expect other than indifference and high prices. I was certainly proven an ass by making that assumption. Staff were very attentive, the space is beautifully maintained, and my stylist, Katie, was amazing! $45 for a shampoo and phenomenal cut. One of the best I've had. I'll be back when I'm in town again.

50.description: Jessica did an incredible job cutting my hair! She really listened to what I wanted and gave me a great cut for a very reasonable price ($55). Also, she suggested some products for my hake without being overly pushy. She is a sweetheart! Will definitely be back!

4.description: Art + Science was the second salon I tried after moving to Chicago in 2014. The fashion-forward Logan-Square-esque vibe of the place appealed to me, so I decided to try it out.Seven is my hairstylist.  Ready to make a change, I requested a lob that would emphasize the semi-wavy texture of my hair.  I also wanted bangs back. She asked me a few follow-up questions, and ended up giving me one of the best haircuts I've ever received.  Seven was great at helping me to figure out what I wanted and at working with my round-ish face shape, hair texture, and concerns about maintenance [I like low-maintenance hair]. She also offered free bang trims between cuts, which is great.  The price is good for Chicago as well.  I've been coming to her for several months now, and I'll continue to do so.

6.description: I went in yesterday for a haircut. I have long curly hair. The stylist was nice, but honestly all I did was cut a trim. (4 inches) Nothing spectacular, I was charged 55 dollars. 55 dollars and I left outta there with my hair wet. I was so disappointed. That's just entirely too much for a trim. I didn't even get my hair dried.  I usually go to silk style salon, I just always forget to book the appointments ahead of time. The stylist are amazing. I recommend Caroline, she's awesome with curly hair! And you definitely won't pay 55 for just a trim.

22.description: I enjoyed my stylist, Hannah - she was down-to-earth and did a great job with the cuts. But the color I got was lacking - it looks like several strands are not evenly colored. Great location. Cool place without being too snobby feeling. I am moving, so I will not be returning.

15.description: Coco did my hair and I absolutely LOVE it!! I was here my first time over the weekend just wanting a trim but changed my mind literally 5 seconds before cutting my hair. My hair was long and I went for a long/medium assymmetrical bob and Coco did fantastic! She knew what I wanted. She styled my hair exactly like the photo I showed her. Get your haircut here! I left the salon feeling like a totally different person! ;)

57.description: I have been on the lookout for a good stylist for the last THREE YEARS! I have tried many many places and it resulted in pure hatred towards all the salons. Thank god i decided to give art + science a try! Jessica cut my hair and honestly I don't remember it looking as good as it does now. She was super helpful, informative and fun to talk to. I am totally coming back.I took my mom with me as well- she was in the same situation as me- Seven did her hair and she keeps praising the haircut everyday.I'm giving them 4 out of 5 only because of the receptionist- she seems like she's bored with her life- never looked up from her computer to ask if we need any help when we walked in, never offered us anything to drink. Maybe she just had a bad day, who knows.

20.description: I. LOVE. This salon. I came in to refresh my color (I'm currently rocking a grey bang) and Ivan was able to take care of me, no drama, and the color came out not only gorgeous but EXACTLY the way I wanted. He really listened to me, which I appreciated. I was blown out by Andy who was WONDERFUL, asked me how I blew my hair out, what products I wanted, and gave one of the best blowouts I've ever received. She also seemed to have a real understanding of my texture (her hair is naturally straight) and listened to all of my instructions. I left the salon with big, fluffy, beautifully colored hair and happy as a lark. Lol

36.description: I've been coming here for over 3 years and am a loyal client of Shana. Hands down the best colorist I have ever had. I recently moved to St. Louis and am planning a trip back up to Chicago next month to get my touch up done! It's not everyday you find a stylist who is worth that trip! :)

14.description: I have very fine, curly hair, around 2b/2c that goes past my shoulders. I do a low-poo routine for my hair - I'm not strict curly girl method. I like some silicones in my hair.After a terrible experience with another salon, I decided to try Art and Science. I was able to get an appointment about a week after I made the call (don't try to walk in, they're pretty busy).I asked for a curly hair specialist, and Mitra was my stylist. I feel like she did a really good job. She did not do a dry cut for my hair like many curly haired people prefer, but she was really good at estimating how my hair would react when wet. Mitra then used the Bumble and Bumble Don't Blow It hair product on my hair because I mentioned how I used minimal products and air dried. This is a silicone product, Amodimethicone being the main -cone, but WOW, this stuff makes my hair curly and bouncy. She did diffuse my hair in order to help it dry, but she did so gently. The end result was a bit poofier than it normally is, but I really liked the general shape. it's been about a month since I had my hair cut from her and I am very pleased still with the shape. It's not poofy at all, and every time I look in the mirror with it down, I'm just shocked at how well my curls are defined. i ended up buying the bumble and bumble Don't Blow It and I love it in my hair. It does not weight my hair down, it adds a lot of bounce and curl, too. And it doesn't feel like there is really anything in my hair, like other products.On top of all that, Mitra was very pleasant to talk to. I get anxiety around salons because finding a good curly hair stylist is unpleasant to say the least, but I felt really comfortable around Mitra and am happy that I found her.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

3.description: If I could give Spencer and his employees 6 stars I would!  First his team did a great job with a number of different prints I needed finished.  He gave me a bunch of options and never looked to upsell me - just to find what was best for my taste and pricing options.  Also When he found out I needed to ship one of my framed prints, he went down stairs and packaged one up for me at no additional cost - probably saving me $50 at the UPS store.  These guys truly love what they do and will go out of their way for you.  Top notch!

1.description: I'm an avid poster collector and have worked with Spencer for nearly 10 years. Spencer is very knowledgable about his art and has a great collection/selection from which to choose, whether early lithographs or more contemporary originals. His in-house framing and restoration shop is also second to none. I've always found him to be honest, reasonable, and great to work with. I just wish I had more walls to fill!It's always a pleasure visiting Spencer and his gallery.

2.description: Spencer "fixed" two vintage propaganda posters for me several years back. One had slight water damage that needed repair. He was very nice and convinced me that he could do the repairs and would use the best ink/archival ink that would not fade. The posters looked amazing when I picked them up and they went right into proper storage. About a month ago I pulled out the posters. The poster he repaired looks atrocious! The ink he used has more than noticeably faded. It would make sense if I had the poster displayed near a window with direct light on it for the past 3 years. Any art that has been properly stored with NO light should not look this bad. Very disappointed to say the least. Any company or person that is trusted to fix your cherished art should be ashamed when they use sub-par ink and less than promised techniques, basically ruining your pieces! Would NOT recommend!!

5.description: This man is amazing! Spencer is a wealth of knowledge with posters as well as antique furniture. He helped me and spent at least 1/2 hr and didn't charge me anything to help me understand the lithograph I had brought in. I learned so much in a such a short amount of time. He is thorough, fair, and knowledgeable. He does not cut corners.

6.description: Great with selling you something. But if you want any help after that, you can forget it. Doesn't call back when he says he would.

7.description: I met Spencer at a vintage poster exhibition in downtown Chicago earlier this this. Having been to the same exhibition a year earlier, I was interested in making a small purchase to start my collection. Spencer was the easiest gallery owner to talk to at the exhibition by far!After searching Spencer's website for available posters; which by the way was very easy to do, I found what I was looking for. So I made the drive into the city and found his gallery... Awesome is the only word I would use to describe his collection, his support staff and prices of his vintage posters in comparison to others!There is so much to see, so many different styles to choose from... I guarantee, you'll find something you like. Check out his website from time to time for new additions, I do!

0.description: I walk by Spencer's gallery nearly every day on my way to work and finally, having a few things needing framed, popped in to get an impression. Spencer, from the moment we met, was very friendly and professional. He steered me to a group of frame styles that he keeps in bulk to help keep the cost down for clueless folks like myself. He gave me a general quote, shook my hand, and out the door I went. This was a Wednesday evening.Fast forward to Thursday. I drop back into Spencer's gallery with my art. He was out, but I was able to leave the pieces there. I got a call from Spencer not long after, letting me know that he LOVED my art and that he was excited to set me up. I came back after work and Spencer gushed over the prints I had dropped off and gave me a final number. Now I'm no framing expert, but I've asked about custom framing before and the responses have always sent me running. Spencer's pricing was incredibly reasonable, even for a chain store like Michael's. He promised that they'd be finished sometime next week and gave me a slip with the agreed upon price.Friday afternoon, I'm busy at work when I get a call from Spencer letting me know that the art has been framed and letting me know that I'd be very happy. After work I popped in for the 3rd day in a row to see Spencer attaching the brackets and wire to the back of my frames. When he flipped them up, I was blown away. His suggestions, materials, and final product beat my expectations at every turn. Now this isn't your standard framing affair - at least from my understanding. Where can you get custom framing done in less than a day and at incredibly low prices? I hadn't found it until the day I stumbled into Spencer's gallery and I may never find it again. It's worth noting, that Spencer's frame jobs are totally legitimate. The materials are great, he makes sure he's using acid free backing paper and uses Plexiglas that protects your art from UV light, and uses a heavy duty wire to hang the frame from. This is "museum style" framing. And if you're interested in vintage art, you'll want to spend some time in this place poking around. Great stuff.Spencer will take care of you - trust me.

4.description: Spencer is extremely knowledgeable and helpful with all my custom framing questions! I had a couple items custom-framed. Not only did he do an excellent job, but the turnaround was very fast (a few days). Pricing was totally reasonable (as a comparison, one place near downtown quoted me a price 5x more with a turnaround time of 2+ weeks).

1.description: Near the Chicago blue line stop and got a sweet tooth? Stop in here for some pretty decent gelato or a dessert crepe. You won't be disappointed. They've got some different flavors like avocado or wasabi almond which are my favorite features. More of a savory guy myself though and those options aren't very plentiful or tasty for that matter. Not terrible, but not really noteworthy. Just some veggies wrapped up in carbs. There is parking even though the place is super tiny and the guy working was incredibly nice. Other than that...just stick to the sweets and it's a great little spot.

9.description: Eh, it's okay, but I've had better.  There were 8 flavors to choose from and one scoop was pretty much $5.  It was tasty, but not that thick.  To be honest, I didn't think it was gelato at all.  I thought I was eating plain ice cream because it started melting incredibly fast.  Wait, I know what you're going to say -- "Amanda, gelato pretty much means "ice cream" in Italian."  Thanks, Grandma.  So, do you think that maybe they could stick to an Italian recipe then?  Whole milk vs cream, Yo!  Slow churning?  No quite frozen?  Capite italiano?I would go back, but only on a hot day when I'm desperate for ice cream and can't get anywhere else.

23.description: FINALLY! they are open....its just such a convenient location and I felt like by a place called GELATO GRECO to be sitting there tempting me and not being open...it just really made me want gelato even more! So tonight on this exact rainy night I saw 2 ladies working and went in. I tried the flavors they had to offer and I liked most of them. I was very fond of their Hazelnut, Chocolate, and Ricotta flavors. I can not remember the exact names of them but they were delicious. I went with an affogato which is one of my favorite treats...I went with the hazelnut gelato and a decaf espresso to top it. It was very good. For $6 I got a big scoop of gelato and a shot of espresso. I've paid $11 at other places. Fair price and delicious. I'll be back to try the crepes next!

25.description: This place is way overpriced.  $4.50 will get you a tiny of scoop of mediocre gelato.  Save your money and go somewhere else.

12.description: FINALLY! they are open....its just such a convenient location and I felt like by a place called GELATO GRECO to be sitting there tempting me and not being open...it just really made me want gelato even more! So tonight on this exact rainy night I saw 2 ladies working and went in. I tried the flavors they had to offer and I liked most of them. I was very fond of their Hazelnut, Chocolate, and Ricotta flavors. I can not remember the exact names of them but they were delicious. I went with an affogato which is one of my favorite treats...I went with the hazelnut gelato and a decaf espresso to top it. It was very good. For $6 I got a big scoop of gelato and a shot of espresso. I've paid $11 at other places. Fair price and delicious. I'll be back to try the crepes next!

21.description: Had been waiting for months and months for this place to open and was so excited when it finally did! But man, what a disappointment. I've definitely had better gelato in the city - for example, Mariano's who gets theirs shipped daily from Milwaukee. So so sad because we were going to make it our dessert place to go on a nice night. But the price just doesn't match the quality, unfortunately.

16.description: The best peach gelato I have ever had.

17.description: The ice cream is definitely worth the price. They offer a variety of flavors that are not easy to come by.

10.description: Best gelato in Chicago. Full stop. I'm new here just moved from Italy, so I remember pretty well how gelato should be. Guys, few flavors but well done. This is the trick. Suggestion: pistacchio. Nocciola. Gianduia. Fiordilatte. Amen. Giovanni

5.description: I live by Black Dog and you can't compare the two. Go Greco or go home. It's obvious the other is owned by a bunch of hipsters who had the bright idea to start a gelato shop without the skills and panache. Skills and panache in abundance at the GC.

11.description: Went there on Friday around 7, lights were on but the chairs were put up and no one is there... no signs..  yelp says you guys a open...   I am not sure what the deal is..

22.description: By far the best crêpes I've ever had. The staff are always so welcoming and nice. Great place for a date, or to hang out and catch up over awesome dessert. Chef krystin is imaginative and creative, this place is a hidden gem that deservesTo be noticed

0.description: Came here on a whim in Chicago--kind of because I am a female who demands ice cream be fed to her on a regular basis, else all hell breaks loose, and kind of because, well, gelato is freaking delicious. Can you blame me? (This is a rhetorical question, but if you were to answer it, the correct response would be "No.")It's so conveniently located that I can't even fathom where else they could possibly put it that would be more convenient. So simply for that, they get another star. It's right off the exit for the Blue Line subway, so you can make this pitstop whenever you like.The only flavor I ended up liking was the Strawberry Yogurt, which was actually really really good. Their portions are also pretty generous considering they're only one scoop. Sure, it's a little pricey, but it's gelato we're talking about here. What do you expect?

20.description: Bought 3 pints ($$$) for a special occasion and was greatly disappointed.  We had 3 different flavors, expected high quality (especially for the price) and experienced low quality gelato.  It was grainy - and not very enjoyable compared to other gelatos that we've had (for much cheaper).  We will not be back.

19.description: I've been to dozens of gelatorias in nearly every major city and region of Italy, and my Italian husband and I were very impressed with this welcomed addition to our neighborhood.  All organic ingredients and made right there in the shop.  Nice selection of classic flavors, plus we've seen some bold concoctions as well that look interesting.  Looking forward to trying different seasonal flavors.  The small outdoor patio is also pretty cute and cozy place to sit with a friend or sweetheart and enjoy a cup of gelato.

2.description: Is this place ever open!? I live right by it for about 2 yrs now and any time I would like to try some gelato from here it is always closed! A sign giving hours would be nice...

18.description: Had been waiting for months and months for this place to open and was so excited when it finally did! But man, what a disappointment. I've definitely had better gelato in the city - for example, Mariano's who gets theirs shipped daily from Milwaukee. So so sad because we were going to make it our dessert place to go on a nice night. But the price just doesn't match the quality, unfortunately.

13.description: Amazing place. My wife and I spent time in Italy and this is exactly what gelato and sorbet is in Italy. This place is amazing. If you want a true taste of Italia than this is it. Go and I mean go now or the the next they are open because this place is a must for anyone looking for true Italy.

4.description: I took a flyer on this place because the CTA bus was 15 min away and I saw a "Dulce de Leche" flavor.   I won't be back. The flavor was only mediocre.  Worse, the gelato had ice crystals in it -- more than a few.  That's a sign of poor craftsmanship.  And they charge $3 for a single scoop?  Black Dog gives you two scoops (and better flavor choices) for $4.  And I've been to Black Dog at least a dozen times and never had ice crystals in my gelato. Heck, even Marianos gelato is much better quality, and you get the same amount for $1.25 than this place charges$3 for.

24.description: Ermahgerd, I've died and gone to heaven & no one can convince me otherwise.I had an extremely busy day yesterday & forgot to make dinner, and my morning has been so hectic that I didn't have time for breakfast.  I stopped at Gelato Greco for something to eat and I found utter bliss!!!Typically, I temporarily avoid "Now Open" restaurants because I like to give it a week or two so they can get their stuff together and work out the kinks.  This place has worked it all out and is running as smooth as smooth can be.  And who came up with those recipe ideas!?  I LOVE YOU!I ordered the Peanut Butter Maple crepe.  Not only was it an absolutely delicious, melt-in-your-mouth, flavorful crepe, but it was priced nicely and decorated beautifully.  Someone has their food artistry down pat.I also ordered the Coconut Custard Latte.  If it wasn't for the fact that I had many more things to cross off of my heavy to-do list, I might have bolted myself to the chair and just ordered lattes all day long.  I have never, in my entire life, had a better latte (psst, I was a barista, and I made some bomb-diggity-awesome lattes).The atmosphere is lovely, up-to-date, and super clean!  Seems like a friendly place for all!  The employees are superb, too!  I tend to expect snotty baristas who wouldn't know foam art if it hit them in the forehead, but Krys knocked the foam art out of the park and had a fantastic personality to boot.  Her professionalism and eagerness to please her customers was astounding.  It's always so refreshing to see a true artist (of any medium) to exhibit a love for what they do.  She's great.  Gelato Greco is great.  Great is such a small word, but look up the definition... GREAT 1st time visit.  I will be a regular, just you wait and see.

6.description: Get out of here. You're kidding me. Who is giving this place 5 stars, and has your tongue been injured in some sad accident?The price is ridiculous for the smallest adult size. Granted, it's a sizable portion, but I'd take half the portion for half of the cost. Just because the name of your company is exotic sounding, I don't want to have to pay the conversion rate prices for a frozen dessert. Odd selection (would you like the sweet corn, mushroom, or the sun-dried leather?) And here's a snippet of conversation from my visit."Would you like to try a sample?""Well what is Fior De Latte""It's like vanilla.""Oh...hmmm""It's vanilla"Too many other places out there.

15.description: This is where we go for a special summer treat. The flavor are always unique and quite delicious. It's a bit pricey but go for it!  Spoil yourself, you won't be disappointed!

7.description: Not happy at all. Chocolate tasted like some sugar free ice cream or something. The salted caramel, which is usually my favorite flavor, was way too salty. I wasted money on this. The guy behind the counter was really nice but not enough to where I would want to try this place again.

8.description: Stopped by on a Saturday night and they had 4 flavors. I repeat... just four flavors.It's worth it to keep going up Milwaukee to Oberweis, or trekking over to Wicker Park for Black Dog Gelato.

3.description: Yes yes and yes! First of all it's right in front of the #66 bus stop annnd right upstairs from the Chicago Avenue Blue Line. Win! Secondly, The service is awesome! Win! Anthony was very nice and helpful and just cool af. Best of all, the chocolate gelato is slamming! Win!The honey bourbon strawberry -goood and the organic whipped cream-sinful! They use natural, organic and locally sourced products. WIN WIN WIN! It's a small place but there is some window seating inside  and some outside seating as well. The prices were reasonable too. Yeah, I like this spot. It really made an impression on me.
