14.description: Ermahgerd, I've died and gone to heaven & no one can convince me otherwise.I had an extremely busy day yesterday & forgot to make dinner, and my morning has been so hectic that I didn't have time for breakfast.  I stopped at Gelato Greco for something to eat and I found utter bliss!!!Typically, I temporarily avoid "Now Open" restaurants because I like to give it a week or two so they can get their stuff together and work out the kinks.  This place has worked it all out and is running as smooth as smooth can be.  And who came up with those recipe ideas!?  I LOVE YOU!I ordered the Peanut Butter Maple crepe.  Not only was it an absolutely delicious, melt-in-your-mouth, flavorful crepe, but it was priced nicely and decorated beautifully.  Someone has their food artistry down pat.I also ordered the Coconut Custard Latte.  If it wasn't for the fact that I had many more things to cross off of my heavy to-do list, I might have bolted myself to the chair and just ordered lattes all day long.  I have never, in my entire life, had a better latte (psst, I was a barista, and I made some bomb-diggity-awesome lattes).The atmosphere is lovely, up-to-date, and super clean!  Seems like a friendly place for all!  The employees are superb, too!  I tend to expect snotty baristas who wouldn't know foam art if it hit them in the forehead, but Krys knocked the foam art out of the park and had a fantastic personality to boot.  Her professionalism and eagerness to please her customers was astounding.  It's always so refreshing to see a true artist (of any medium) to exhibit a love for what they do.  She's great.  Gelato Greco is great.  Great is such a small word, but look up the definition... GREAT 1st time visit.  I will be a regular, just you wait and see.

58.description: I really liked this salon.  It was very clean and nicely decorated and the price is better than most salons you will find in the city.  Melissa did a great job on my highlights and I would definitely go back again.

56.description: I thought my hair was hopeless. I'd abused it so much with chlorine, swim caps, pulling it back in ponytails/buns for marathon training, that I literally had a line of breakage around my head. Disgusting.Given that Great Clips is my normal stylist (and knowing that they couldn't fix this mess), I jumped on the Rue La La deal to 4 elements. And I'm so glad I did.Rebecca was an absolute delight and did an amazing job with my poor damaged hair. After studying my strands, and listening to me plead not to cut it all off, she managed to salvage my hair AND keep it past shoulder length. It looks fabulous, and I can't speak highly enough of her and the fantastic job she did. Basia did a great job with my manicure, though I did manage to chip it a day later. But I'm sure that was from swimming, bootcamp class, and softball practice. There's a reason I don't get my nails done.Everyone at the salon was extremely welcoming and friendly, and offered advice afterwards on hair products, etc. (without trying to sell me on anything).I think I may pay for a real haircut like a big girl from now on.  And 4 elements will be the place.

29.description: I went to Rebecca for a cut and color and she did a wonderful job! My regular stylist couldn't fit me in and since I live close to 4 Elements, I thought I'd check it out. Rebecca did a better job -  I will be returning for sure!

42.description: If you want your hair to be cut by someone who knows better than you, go to Rebecca! If you want someone to cut a year worth of hair growth without being asked to do it, book Rebecca! If you want to spend months loking at yourself with disgust in a mirror, schedule an appointment with Rebecca today!I was in need for a haircut and couldn't go to the usual stylist I go to so I went to 4 Elements salon, which could acommodate me.I explained to Rebecca I wanted a round bob. She convinced me that for my face shape square bob would work better. I agreed, but told her I still want it to be a bob, and minimal layers (only at the ends).We ended up with short hair, not a bob. Mind me, I went there with hair past shoulder lenght, 15 inches. I ended up with yucky 3 inches layers on top, and the rest of my hair 5-6 inches longAlso, she chopped off more on side than another. The haicut doesn't even remotely resemble the one she herself recommended.It wouldn't have been so bad had she kept the lenght longer, as I told her, around jaw line. Mid me, I went there with hair shoulder lenght, so she had plenty to satisfiy her uncontrollable cuttning frenzy and still keep it medium lenght.What is particularily maddening in this whole experience, is that after the job was done she asked me: do you like it? I did not answer; I was speachless processing how can you just chop off a year of hair growth with no respect to what the client wants. Rebecca, however, answered her own question - "well, I think it's kind of cute". I am so happy you're pleased, Rebecca, after all it's what matters most.

23.description: Tim is amazing.I have thick, curly, frizzy, difficult hair. I came in yesterday to receive a Brazilian Blowout and a haircut (I was 6 months overdue for a trim). I had an idea for what I wanted my hair to look like and I showed Tim some pictures for inspiration.Not only did my hair turn out EXACTLY like the pictures, Tim was a delight for the 3.5 hours I sat in his chair getting everything done. He was so fun to talk with and the best part is that he TAUGHT me the correct way I should be blow drying, flat ironing, and curling my hair. I have been to many, many high end salons and never have I had a stylist actually teach me how to do my hair at home!I will for sure be back and you know without a doubt I will be scheduling my appt with Tim.

47.description: I've finally found my go-to salon in the city, and go-to hair dresser.  It's out of the way of the hectic downtown areas, yet still close to the city, and street parking is fairly easy to find.  Prices are reasonable.  The atmosphere is relaxing but clean and well run.  Front desk staff is really nice, as are everyone else I encountered.The best part for me was my stylist, Tim.  I almost don't want to talk him up even more than that other yelpers have in fear that he may become too busy!  I went in for partial highlights.  My hair had become pretty saturated with blond and I told Tim that I wanted it to be more natural looking, and a little closer to my natural color.  He did just that, getting the foils close to the roots, and making it look very natural.  However, after it was complete, I felt like it was a bit too toned down.  Tim quickly said that he guarantees his work, and that I could come back for a correction.  I went back, and my highlights are perfect.  I will be back :)

8.description: I got a manicure today and the woman was a delight! She was so kind, gentle and welcoming to me. It was my first time at the salon and I would definitely go back. I had a relaxing and enjoyable visit.

31.description: I started coming here because I moved and it's much closer to where I live. I have gone twice, both times Rebecca cut my hair. Very good job.

34.description: Just went to 4 Elements for the first time.  Everyone is super friendly and nice.   Tim did my cut and color and I'm very happy with the way it turned out (and I'm picky!) He took the time to show me how to blow dry and style my somewhat unruly hair.  Knowing what other salons charge for similar services I would say 4 Elements is a also a good value.

16.description: Tim is amazing.I have thick, curly, frizzy, difficult hair. I came in yesterday to receive a Brazilian Blowout and a haircut (I was 6 months overdue for a trim). I had an idea for what I wanted my hair to look like and I showed Tim some pictures for inspiration.Not only did my hair turn out EXACTLY like the pictures, Tim was a delight for the 3.5 hours I sat in his chair getting everything done. He was so fun to talk with and the best part is that he TAUGHT me the correct way I should be blow drying, flat ironing, and curling my hair. I have been to many, many high end salons and never have I had a stylist actually teach me how to do my hair at home!I will for sure be back and you know without a doubt I will be scheduling my appt with Tim.

13.description: I have been going to Four Elements for many years now. I love this place. Ricky is masterful. Since going red 4 1/2 years ago, people that I meet all think I'm a natural redhead. I always say, "What God didn't give me, Ricky does!" Sara does an awesome job with nails and waxing. My manny's with her last a good week. I have recommended friends to go here and all have been happy they did.

11.description: Alexis did a wonderful job with my haircut, was easy to talk to and really listened to what I wanted. I also had a relaxing express pedicure with Claudia who did a great job and suggested a good color combination for my polish. As a newcomer to the area I was happy to find this gem on my first try!

39.description: Loved it. I was visiting Chicago for my birthday and purchased the yelp deal prior to my arrival. I received the manicure and pedicure. I cannot remember the young lady's name but, she was excellent. Very meticilous and careful with my nails. All of the staff was very courteous and nice to me during my visit. My friend loved it as well. She raved about the eyebrow wax. I will definitely return to this spa whenever I come back to visit Chicago.

37.description: Amazing! Great customer service, great hair! Love Ricky!

0.description: I stopped in last minute today, needing my roots and color done ASAP. I spend a lot of money on spa and salon services throughout the year. I get extensions done regularly, blow outs, color, etc...  I have been very loyal to the person that does my extensions, have not found a good blow out and have been trying to find someone that can get my color right, bouncing between 2 people. I have gone to this salon before for blow outs and trims, but never color. I met Alexis when I walked in and explained my dilemma and what I was looking for. She was able to take me when I walked in, which was a godsend. She took me to her chair and proceeded to ask me more questions to really understand what I was looking for. This was the first time, in a long time, that someone actually gave me a true consultation. As we discussed it more, she was able to understand what I was looking for. Previously, I'm sure I was not articulating it correctly, this is partly my fault and mostly the stylist fault. Part of a stylist job is to consult with you to truly understand what you want. I was reminded of that today and left the salon very happy. I also was pleasantly surprised when I wasn't charged a ridiculous amount, like other places, which added to my positive experience. I could tell that Alexis truly enjoys what she does, she explained the continuous education they do (which was apparent), she walked me through my options and she did an awesome job. She just got a new client!

38.description: Great salon. I was satisfied with my hair cut and highlights for the price I paid with the yelp deal.

51.description: Great massage. Spa/salon a lot nicer than expected for neighborhood. Gave 4 stars instead of 5 because service ran about 10-15 minutes behind.

27.description: I give this place 3 stars as every time I'm in there I have mixed feelings about it.  The staff always seem slow to warm but once you get them going they are ok.  Also they are always behind schedule and you end up waiting a whole 15-20 mins before your appointment starts.  They do, however, carry great products, some of which I can't live without and they always have appointments available in a pinch!

32.description: I've been meaning to post a review for a LONG time but just never got around to it.  Well here I am, 10 months later after my bangs finally grew out.  I saw Rebecca back in February for the second time and wanted an overall trim but still something a little 'different' this time.  I decided I wanted side bangs and expressed to her that my hair has a hard time staying a particular way because it's so straight.  She told me that if she put a shorter layer of bangs under my side bang, it might hold...She completely chopped off my bangs. I was TERRIFIED. My face showed it too. I said "Oh..I wasn't expecting you to cut them that short". And she replied with "Well, it's hair, it will grow out." I was in disbelief and tried to hide my anger. I didn't even know how to feel for the rest of the haircut. I think I almost cried. I had one layer of short bangs way above my eyebrows and another layer of bangs that were supposed to be 'side bangs'. I've never seen this 'look' before and couldn't tell if she even meant to do that or not to my hair.I checked out and paid, and the front desk lady didn't even ask about my service and if I liked me haircut. In fact, she was kind of rude.Needless to say, I will not be going back here.

54.description: I recently enjoyed a spa pedicure at 4 Elements. The team was very professional and courteous. They greeted me as soon as I walked in, took my coat and offered me a beverage. I also saw the esthetician who was great. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that the brochure said the spa pedicure was supposed to last 90 minutes and excluding the dry time it really only lasted a little over 60 minutes.

48.description: Tim convinced me to color my hair for the first time since college! And I really like it. he did a great job and really took his time with me. Like others said, he definitely educated me also! I had an event in the evening and he stayed late to make sure I was ready - I'll be back! Thanks Tim!

44.description: After reading so many fabulous reviews about Timothy, I had to go check it out myself!  I have never had a set stylist because of location, price or they just didn't listen to what I really wanted!  Timothy has got it ALL!  After setting up an appointment online SPECIFICALLY with Timothy, I got to the Salon and they said I was with a woman stylist.  I said I had specifically requested Timothy because of his great reviews.  I had to wait 30 mins for him to fit me in, but it was well worth the wait!  It was like love at first sight!  Timothy asked so many questions to learn what kind of person I was, what kind of products I use, and what kind of tools I have at home to work with!  He taught me so many things while doing my hair, he even had time to teach me how to curl it in loose waves!  My hair is perfect, the way I had imagined it and I am excited to say I have found my stylist!  Timothy also offers a referral incentive as well as discounted rate for first time customers (if you did not buy the Yelp Deal, which I had!)  EXTRA BONUS!LOVE LOVE LOVE!  Two thumbs up for Tim!!

24.description: I like Johanna.  She has cut my hair three times now and has done what I asked for and more.  I have long, very straight hair and wanted her to cut it so it curls a little on it's own or is easy to curl with rollers or a curling iron.  After she does her magic all I have to do is spray some curling spray into it and it has nice body.  When I actually curl it , it's amazing!

7.description: I had such a great experience at this salon! I came in not knowing at all what I wanted to do with my hair...just wanting a change. Alexis was awesome! I ended up getting a cut and color (the color was a last-minute decision and I'm so glad I did it!). I honestly have never been so happy with a haircut. Alexis walked me through how to easily style my hair (which is helpful for someone like me who doesn't always have the patience/time to style). She was also extremely patient with me as we figured out together exactly what I wanted to do with my hair. The salon was also very nice and my cut/color was very reasonably priced! I will definitely be going back for my next haircut!

49.description: I got a yelp deal for 4 elements salon, & made an appointment with Tim, for a color and cut.  I was ecstatic, & got a wealth of education while I was there.  I will definitely be back!

40.description: Timothy was awesome.  After seeing the same woman in Las Vegas for 9 years, I was reluctant to get a cut (and a bang trim) in my new home.  After extensive review searching, I made an appointment with Tim specifically, and couldn't have been happier! Extremely welcoming staff, and I will definitely be back for some highlights soon!

53.description: I finally found my girl!  Melissa was great.  Awesome color and cut.  Relatively affordable salon with a great atmosphere.I'll definitely be back.-Happy client

30.description: I started going here because it is so close to my house.  Everyone is very accommodating and friendly.  Ashley color's my hair and love the color.  Agnes cuts it, I get so many compliments on the cut.  My husband and step son's go to Ricky.  This is a great salon that is very accommodating and has a stylist for all!!

46.description: Good quality highlights. I liked my girl, but ended up being charged additional money because the girl apparently put in more foils than usual for a partial, which I never asked for nor was I told she was doing that.  Disappointed I had to pay additional money for something I never requested.

1.description: Fernando is the absolute best! He's honestly a hair genius that gets it. I really wanted to try a subtle Balayage look, but was afraid of adding to much blonde . Fernando not only conquered the look but made a plan for my hair to grow out perfectly and stay healthy.  This is my first Yell review ever! I just think other women should know that Fernando is THE guy for highlights in the city!

55.description: I needed to find a new stylist as my old one had stopped doing hair.  I made an appt at 4 Elements because it was convenient with location and time and had some great Yelp reviews.  I was not displeased.  My appointment with Rebecca was wonderful.  I got a cut and color.  She was knowledgeable about color and style and made some great suggestions.  A week later, I love it even more than when I left the salon.  Rebecca took the time to look at my hair, discuss color and cut options and what would work best for what I had going on.  She gave me what was right for me.  Another note, the salon itself is small, elegant and relaxing.  I'm looking forward to trying their massage services with my next cut.  Thanks Rebecca...Great Job!!!

9.description: Done my ombre hair color with Tim, he is super nice and knowledgeable. And the price is not high!He doesn't push product!!

26.description: Ask for Tim!  He is the best!I've went to many high end salons in the chicago area (Michael Anthony, Sean Patricks, Mixed Co, act... the list goes on) and this is the best salon in Chicago.Tim gives a consultation and listens to what you want. He also asks you about your hair care and gives you helpful tips.  He will not fry your hair like many other stylists do to clients who want highlights. I had a great experience here and will be making this my regular salon.  My search has ended!

25.description: Rebecca is the best! She is very friendly and easy to talk to. I had one up-do and one blow out/style. The up-do was better than the picture I showed her so I was very pleased! I received so many compliments at my friend's wedding. My blow out/style was ok...I expected a little more volume but still liked it. I will definitely be back.

12.description: Today was my first time here and I loved it. I called in the morning and they squeezed me in right away, adjusted my mani/ pedi to "express" so that my appointment would not interfere with the next appointment. This was not a problem for me, I actually thought it was a very considerate of them for the clients. My mani/ pedi was with Sarah and she was really great. I enjoyed every minute chatting with her and she did a great job. The entrance to the salon is where people can get their hair done and then you go through a glass door to the serene spot where im guessing all the other spa services are performed. It was really relaxing, as opposed to places that are all connected and you end up leaving with a headache from all the noise. I will definitely be going back for more services!

59.description: I had driven by this place several times so I decided to go on Yelp and check it out.  I saw nothing but great reviews.  I needed a haircut so why not try it?!  It was a great decision and I am now among the many Yelpers raving about 4 Elements.My appointment was with Tim.  He's great!  He actually explained everything he was doing and why he was doing.  I was getting my hair colored and a much needed hair cut.  He explained the different types of color options and what each means for my hair.  We decided on what was best for me and future hair plans I had.  He also showed me how to blow-dry my hair and how to curl it.  Neither of which I'd ever officially been shown.  It's now much easier to style my hair and takes no time at all.My color turned out great and the cut is awesome.  I definitely have a new hair home with 4 Elements.  It's not outrageously priced like some of the other salons in the city.  I beleive you get more than you pay for.  It's small and you get personal attention.  I felt like I mattered and so did my hair.  I'm telling all my friends about it.

21.description: Hair by Tim...now, go see him!

17.description: I had the WORST experience ever. I went for a brazilian wax with Sara as purchased a groupon. As I stepped in, The receptionist redeemed my groupon and I was guided to one of the spa rooms and Sara asked to undress so she can do the brazilian. Then she comes in the room and says that they cannot honor the groupon price since I am not a first time client and to proceed I will have to pay an extra 35$ on top of 30$ paid for the groupon. I found the attitude and behavior of Sara very disrespectful and unprofessional that I am never going to go to that salon ever. They could have told me about this before asking me to undress. It is so RUDE and indecent.  I live in the same community so have used them for some of the services before but from my experience last nite, it was certainly my last visit. I dont think this business is worth my single penny. They really need to work hard on their customer dealing especially in this highly competitive Chicago market.

10.description: Went here for body services (not hair) and was very impressed. Been going to the same person for almost 10 years, and after she had switched salons for the 4th time I decided I was done and needed to find a spot more convenient for me instead of her. Their ad on Milwaukee Avenue has 25% off for first time customers, so I checked it out and will continue to go back. The salon is well designed, clean, and modern. There is no pressure to buy "extras" like products, and there's a nice selection of coffee, teas, etc. while you wait. Top notch and excatly what I look for in a Chicago salon.

5.description: My favorite salon! Maggie is the best and always knows what great things to do with my hair even when I'm not entirely sure what to do. I always walkout feeling like a million bucks! Easily the best salon in Chicago, certainly the best in River West. Also the prices are way more reasonable than any other salon in the area.

3.description: I've been coming here since the salon opened; loved it then and love it now. I followed my esthetician here from another salon since Iryna works magic on my bushy eyebrows.They carry one of the best skin care lines (Yonka) I've ever used. I was also able to find a wonderful stylist, Timothy, whom I've been going to for at least 6 years now. He does a great job with my hair cuts and color and always leaves me laughing. This salon is like one of my second homes in the neighborhood and if it wouldn't seem weird, I'd probably go in there to hang out even when I didn't have appointments. The fire place and refreshments make it easy to get comfortable while waiting for your color to process.

35.description: I'm writing this one on behalf of my mom :--)  My brothers and I sent her to 4 Elements for a pedicure and foot massage. She came back feeling like more than royalty. Thanks 4 Elements!

19.description: I thought my hair was hopeless. I'd abused it so much with chlorine, swim caps, pulling it back in ponytails/buns for marathon training, that I literally had a line of breakage around my head. Disgusting.Given that Great Clips is my normal stylist (and knowing that they couldn't fix this mess), I jumped on the Rue La La deal to 4 elements. And I'm so glad I did.Rebecca was an absolute delight and did an amazing job with my poor damaged hair. After studying my strands, and listening to me plead not to cut it all off, she managed to salvage my hair AND keep it past shoulder length. It looks fabulous, and I can't speak highly enough of her and the fantastic job she did. Basia did a great job with my manicure, though I did manage to chip it a day later. But I'm sure that was from swimming, bootcamp class, and softball practice. There's a reason I don't get my nails done.Everyone at the salon was extremely welcoming and friendly, and offered advice afterwards on hair products, etc. (without trying to sell me on anything).I think I may pay for a real haircut like a big girl from now on.  And 4 elements will be the place.

28.description: Have been getting my hair cut by Rebecca since last summer, and I have no complaints. It's a short cut, styled beautifully. She takes her time and does not chop away mindlessly. She considers your face and color and what will look good.  If you are clear about what you want, she'll do it. Would recommend her to my friends. Compared to the $70 the Logan Square salon was charging, this is the same cut for half. And she dries and styles it, something the LS salon didn't want to do - yes, she told me to go natural. Honey, I don't pay someone $70 to go natural.

45.description: Bought a yelp deal to go to an esthetician. Cleanest wax I've ever experienced. They are extremely thorough and they use the best wax available. My esthetician was super knowledgeable about what she was doing and never hesitated to answer any questions. She made me feel pretty comfortable.Also got a manicure. The lady was pretty thorough as well. She took her time to make sure everything was well done. I would go again if I could afford doing this every month! The yelp deal definitely helped out but only for first-time customers.

33.description: I asked to go darker from a over-processed bad decision of caramel highlights.  Although my natural color is dark brown, I asked to go lighter than my natural.  When I came out, I was transformed into a gothic chick--dark BLACK.  I hated it but the ladies at the front desk insisted that it looked good.  Needless to say, I had it fixed at a different location shortly after.  Staff not very accommodating.  Will not recommend

43.description: Timothy is a Rockstar!!

2.description: I think this salon has the foundations of being great  with a beautiful space and fantastic product lines lines like my beloved Oribe, but my manicure and pedicure were so strange. I really liked my technician, I think her name was Sarah, but I've never had a manicure or pedicure where they don't apply a basecoat when using regular nail polish. I think everyone knows that if you apply polish directly to the nail, it will show ridges and appear super super thin! It won't have a glossy richness or smooth appearance. That's what happened here, and the polish I chose from CND was a classic blue red but it was a manicure I could've done at home for free. I paid $60 for my mani and pedi excluding tip. I wouldn't go back.  what a disappointment.

18.description: I've been meaning to post a review for a LONG time but just never got around to it.  Well here I am, 10 months later after my bangs finally grew out.  I saw Rebecca back in February for the second time and wanted an overall trim but still something a little 'different' this time.  I decided I wanted side bangs and expressed to her that my hair has a hard time staying a particular way because it's so straight.  She told me that if she put a shorter layer of bangs under my side bang, it might hold...She completely chopped off my bangs. I was TERRIFIED. My face showed it too. I said "Oh..I wasn't expecting you to cut them that short". And she replied with "Well, it's hair, it will grow out." I was in disbelief and tried to hide my anger. I didn't even know how to feel for the rest of the haircut. I think I almost cried. I had one layer of short bangs way above my eyebrows and another layer of bangs that were supposed to be 'side bangs'. I've never seen this 'look' before and couldn't tell if she even meant to do that or not to my hair.I checked out and paid, and the front desk lady didn't even ask about my service and if I liked me haircut. In fact, she was kind of rude.Needless to say, I will not be going back here.

41.description: I went to Rebecca for the first time for a haircut and make-up application, and I couldn't be happier with how both ended up!  I walked in needing a haircut that was low-maintenance, yet still retained some sense of style.  I also wanted to keep my length.  She listened intently, and she worked my hair a bit before washing it.  I absolutely love the style - I'm able to wash & wear it to work, but I can also style it into something nicer.  My make-up job was equally good.  I was attending a daytime event, so I needed something natural, yet more elaborate than what I normally wear during the day.  She explained what she was doing throughout the application, and she checked with me about color selections before applying them.  My make-up ended up looking natural and polished, but not overly done.  Perfect.  I initially made the appointment because it was the only salon anywhere near the West Loop that is open on Sundays, but I definitely will be returning to Rebecca very soon!  Location is perfect - near the blue line and the Kennedy, on Milwaukee Ave.  Prices are very reasonable.  The salon itself is very clean & comfortable.

52.description: LOVED my experience at 4 Elements!!!  Yesterday, I went in for a facial with Kinga and a cut and color with Tim - every bit of the experience was fabulous.  The staff is friendly, the salon is clean (and smells so awesome) and the day spa area is so inviting, I didn't want to leave!  My face is still glowing today from Kinga's facial.  She took the time to analzye my skin and she molded the facial to suit my personal needs which was so helpful.  I was relaxed, my skin was invigorated and Kinga taught me so much more than I knew about my own daily skin care routine.My hair appointment with Tim was just as amazing.  I tend to ignore my hair until the weekends when I just flat iron it to all hell and suffice it to say, my hair has definitely paid the price for my negligence.  Tim not only cleaned my hair up with a simple, stylish cut, but the color he did was perfect.  My hair looks more natural now and he somehow managed to fix my previously botched color job.  He took the time to explain everything he was doing to my hair which was really helpful for someone as hair ignorant as me.  Other amazing aspects of Tim's cut/color: the shampoo and hot towel treatment (to die for!!!) and a little styling lesson to boot!Be prepared for a more expensive salon experience but don't let that shy you away from 4 Elements.  Agnes, the owner, explained all of the pricing so that I felt comfortable with what I was spending.  She promptly replied to my email inquiries which I really value considering so many other salons are impossible to work with via email.Overall, my visit to 4 Elements yesterday really made my weekend!  I've already booked my next appointment and I have definitely found my new salon!

50.description: I really enjoyed the spa manicure. I bought the yelp deal to use on mani/pedi with my mom for her birthday. They ladies were very nice and pleasant. Nice atmosphere too.

4.description: Best salon ever!!!!   I was referred by a friend and had my hair colored by Agnes, the owner!!!  I had been doing it myself and it was a mess!!  In just a couple of visits my hair feels like hair again!!  I recently had a cut and it was one of the best I have ever had!!!  I am getting a keratin treatment soon and cannot wait!!!

6.description: Best place to go for natural nails and hair services! Ricky did an amazing job turning my bad dye job to a more sophisticated elegant look! Sara's nail art was on point!

22.description: Ricky is great.

15.description: Ask for Tim!  He is the best!I've went to many high end salons in the chicago area (Michael Anthony, Sean Patricks, Mixed Co, act... the list goes on) and this is the best salon in Chicago.Tim gives a consultation and listens to what you want. He also asks you about your hair care and gives you helpful tips.  He will not fry your hair like many other stylists do to clients who want highlights. I had a great experience here and will be making this my regular salon.  My search has ended!

57.description: I went here with a deal I bought on Rue La La.  Now I use Groupon all the time and often businesses are less than happy to see you.  Not here!  Everyone was very gracious and happy.  I had a great manicure with Basia.  I had an amazing haircut and color with Timothy.  I am usually very picky and it's been years since I have had such a great cut.  I love this place and I will definitely be back!

20.description: Tim is fantastic!!!!

36.description: I got the 60-minute massage after a long week and after developing several kinks and knots in my neck and back.  She (jinga or zinga?) was able to work it all out.  Relaxing environment, nice oils.

14.description: I love this place! Everyone is so friendly, professional, and just great at what they do. Sara is a masterful make up artist, I wish she could do my make up every weekend.

58.description: Years ago when I went to Simply Thalia in the pedestrian walkway between the Red Line and Blue Line at Washington Street, I was left a bit nonplussed about the food, as it was painfully apparent that it was for a rather milder palate. I returned and had a flight of appetizers, which I had found to be much better than the watery curry dish I had the first time.Fast forward to 2013 and I visited Thalia Spice, the parent restaurant. (Pause ... still pausing)The service, much like at Simply Thalia, was inviting. They had lychee juice, so that was a good beverage option. The ginger chicken soup reminded me of tom yum gai (chicken). That was the highlight and a soup option I would gladly indulge during the cold months in Chicago. Where it all fell apart was with the Indian chicken makhani. Indian food is my favourite ethnic cuisine and that means I have a tendency to be more critical of said cuisine because I love it so much. As wonderful as the presentation was, the dish failed in terms of flavour. The average American may find the chicken makhani to be very appetizing. However, having a palate that is accustomed to a bloom of rich flavours, I cannot cosign that the dish would satisfy those who love spices.Thalia Spice seems to cover the gambit of Asian cuisines. That could be both good and bad. It's good from the standpoint that a patron can have one-stop options for their dining experience. It's bad from the standpoint that something gets compromised and shortcuts get introduced into the cooking at times. Not all Asian cuisines are all similar and those with trained palates like authenticity when it comes to their meals.

56.description: I appreciate having this place close to my work, but that's mostly because there really isn't anything close to my work. I liked Thalia Spice but overall, there isn't anything about it that's too memorable. The food was good, and the lunch deals are especially nice. But for not being too crowded, the service was extremely slow. I would expect that they are used to people being in and out pretty quick during the workday, but they didn't seem to pick up on that at all. There is a nice outdoor seating area that I'll try to take advantage of next time. I'd go back mostly because it's convenient, but not because it's one of my favorites.

29.description: Horrible on line ordering app.   No way to adjust order, needs to be fixed. VM when tried to call on order.   Ordering from butterfly... .

42.description: I got delivery from here and was not at all impressed.  It took 1 hour 15 minutes to arrive and the food wasn't great.  We split sushi and panang curry.  The sushi fish did not taste all the fresh.  The panang curry was too creamy and peanuty.

23.description: Fusion restaurants typically offer my favorite types of cuisine. However, Thalia Spice is Pan-asian and was a lot of ok tasting foods. They have a lot of food on the menu from Thailand, China, Japan, India, Philippines etc but none if it was really impressive. If you're going with a group of 6+ that have a wide range of tastes on their palate, I'd say its worth it.Service wasn't that stellar either. Note to all the service snobs out there - this is not the place for you. It wasn't busy and food and drinks seemed to take forever.

47.description: Went there this Friday. Food was really tasty and flavorful. They had half price wine bottles, which was an added perk.The -1 star is because the waiters kept rushing us to order since it was so close to closing time. The dim lighting makes it more romantic and perfect date night atmosphere. I can't wait to go back and try new dishes.

8.description: Two stars was a generous rating for this spot. Not sure if it was just because it was a Sunday night that I went here but the service at this place left a lot to be desired. It's a smaller place and there was only one waiter working but there were only 2 other tables. Had to wait 5+minutes to even get a menu at our table. Now onto the food. I got the YAYA noodles with chicken which were pretty decent however the dish had hot and cold spots. The veggies were cold and the noodles only warm at best. Not sure why that was. The two people I was with both had issues with the temperature of their dishes as well.Decided to order a sushi roll and got the Thalia roll. The roll was the only reason I didn't give this place a 1 star rating. The roll was a little too saucy for me but it had good flavor and tasted very fresh. I would consider going back to this spot but only if I was just ordering sushi.Good luck on trying this spot out.

31.description: We decided to try this place as it was recommended to us from a friend.First off, even though my Groupon was for 2 people, we were unable to use it because we were at a table of seven (for a Birthday party) and they did not allow split checks.  Who, in this day and age, does not allow split checks?!  I really don't understand why they could not have subtracted the value of the Groupon from the group check, and kept it moving from there, but ok whatever.Secondly, most of the alcoholic drinks were watered down.  We had to send 2 lychee martinis back and should have sent the 2 Thai-grias, their take on Sangria, back as well.Lastly, the food itself was just ok. I had the Rising Sun Maki roll and the Chef's Roast Duck.  Out of seven people, only one person thought their food (she ordered the spicy eggplant) was exceptional.  My maki roll was good, but my duck was just ok.  Out of the group we ordered the Thai Chicken Wings, Pad Thai, Thai Fried Rice, and the Filipino Adobo Chicken.  Everyone else also thought their food was just ok.  Not bad, but nothing special.  Overall, I feel that if the service had been better concerning the Groupon, it would have more than made up for the lackluster food and the watered down drinks.  So, we will go back as we have an unused Groupon and, hopefully it will be better.  For everyone else, I say if you are in the area and have a taste for Asian Fusion food, then stop by - but don't expect to be blown away.

34.description: A solid neighborhood option. 3.5 star food but they are friendly and remember your face. Great option for legit gluten free/celiac, very careful. I wouldn't go too far out of my way, so luckily I live 2 blocks away.

16.description: Years ago when I went to Simply Thalia in the pedestrian walkway between the Red Line and Blue Line at Washington Street, I was left a bit nonplussed about the food, as it was painfully apparent that it was for a rather milder palate. I returned and had a flight of appetizers, which I had found to be much better than the watery curry dish I had the first time.Fast forward to 2013 and I visited Thalia Spice, the parent restaurant. (Pause ... still pausing)The service, much like at Simply Thalia, was inviting. They had lychee juice, so that was a good beverage option. The ginger chicken soup reminded me of tom yum gai (chicken). That was the highlight and a soup option I would gladly indulge during the cold months in Chicago. Where it all fell apart was with the Indian chicken makhani. Indian food is my favourite ethnic cuisine and that means I have a tendency to be more critical of said cuisine because I love it so much. As wonderful as the presentation was, the dish failed in terms of flavour. The average American may find the chicken makhani to be very appetizing. However, having a palate that is accustomed to a bloom of rich flavours, I cannot cosign that the dish would satisfy those who love spices.Thalia Spice seems to cover the gambit of Asian cuisines. That could be both good and bad. It's good from the standpoint that a patron can have one-stop options for their dining experience. It's bad from the standpoint that something gets compromised and shortcuts get introduced into the cooking at times. Not all Asian cuisines are all similar and those with trained palates like authenticity when it comes to their meals.

13.description: This place is on the corner of our block and we go there occasionally for take out and very rarely for dine in. Our favorite is the duck curry, although the last time we ordered they said the new chef took it off the menu, but still gave it to us anyhow. I have never been disappointed with what I ordered, however the staff is mildly unfriendly. That doesn't bother me too much though because they always get my order right and it's reasonably priced. Recommend for good take out.

11.description: Went here after purchasing a Groupon. I actually live a few blocks away and have never been here before. I went in on a Sunday and it was pleasant, not to packed but just a hand full of people. The service was a little spotty but not bad. The food and drinks are good. This place is a little more expensive then a few other Thai places I frequent. The Crab Rangoon was the best part of our meal! Not sure that I will go out of my way to eat here but I will more than likely come back one day.

39.description: This is a great place for relatively inexpensive Thai food.  I always try to stop on here while I'm visiting Chicago.  Their asian spice fire fish is great, but very spicy.  Ask to have it medium hot instead of the way they make it.  For non-alcoholic drinks, try their fresh ginger ale.  Warning it's kinda on a random side street in an industrial looking area...cabbies sometimes miss it when they are driving.

37.description: faux Asian! decent tasting, but do not come here expecting anything authentic or remarkable. also, there is an up charge for gluten free!

0.description: Thalia Spice is a great place to enjoy all you can think of Asian Fusion Dishes. The drunk noodles and dragon roll sushi are the best! As well as the Pink Fire! Amazing!!!  Oh, highly recommend the red bean sticky rice dessert! - very refreshing.All the servers are great and nice to chat with! The decor of the restaurant is romantic and well-though, great place for a date and simply enjoying Asian Fusion, plus great cocktail!!

38.description: Love the ambiance and has more space than it appears.  Made reservations for 8:15 but didn't look like we needed themWe started with the crab rangoon (super fresh and recommend) and the coconut shrimp.Generally I love coconut shrimp. However this looks like a nest of coconut with shrimp somewhere buried inside so not an appetizer I would have again there.For a drink I had the Thalia-angria (like sangria). Again I love sangria and was stoked about this but it arrived with a little too much rum in it for me.  The sake variety was good and yummy (per friend).When I saw Rama on the menu I became very very excited! I haven't had it a long time and was really looking forward to the peanuty goodness! The sauce came out on the side (waitress gave an option).Upon mixing the sauce with the chicken and veggies it became a lil watery :(My friend ordered the river boat noodles which was beefy brothy goodness with noodles and such.  If you're into the soup type meal I recommend it! Yummy!It is rumored that the sushi here is amazing particularly the Kama sutra roll but we'll have to wait for next time as our bellies were full!

51.description: Nice cozy little place. There are two dining halls and has a nice decor to it. Dark, candle lit and very intimate. Had the Clay Pot Muscles, Malaysian Chicken bowl, their menu won't show it but they have some sushi too. The menu is larger than what's shown online. Nice special rolls.All the dishes were unique and tasted great. A bit pricey but a nice place to check out now and again. Their drinks are unique too.

27.description: This is a good spot to order for take-out for those living in the neighborhood, unless you have the patience for mediocre service. Decided to have dinner here on a Friday night. The restaurant's ambiance is cozy and intimate and the food is tasty. For an appetizer, I ordered the coconut shrimp which was a delicious way to start the meal! To try something new, I went for the Filipino Chicken Asado that did not disappoint me.Overall, the food is good but the service needs improvement.

32.description: This place is on the corner of our block and we go there occasionally for take out and very rarely for dine in. Our favorite is the duck curry, although the last time we ordered they said the new chef took it off the menu, but still gave it to us anyhow. I have never been disappointed with what I ordered, however the staff is mildly unfriendly. That doesn't bother me too much though because they always get my order right and it's reasonably priced. Recommend for good take out.

54.description: What a fabulous little spot! The bi-level dining room in front is cozy and hip, the outdoor seating is well-maintained, and the formal dining area on the side is super cute. Our servers were attentive without smothering us. I chatted up the bartender for about an hour after our lunch, which was a nice surprise. He gave me several useful recommendations for crisp white wines and tasty variations on gin cocktails. I watched him prepare some ginger ale from scratch for another customer, which looked amazing. I was hoping for a taste, but no such luck. I'll have to order it next time. As for the food, everyone's dish was fresh, delicious, and artfully presented. The portions were huge, so I would recommend splitting a dish unless you're hungry enough to gnaw on your foot. Can't wait to try some of the other menu items and hand-crafted cocktails!

48.description: I've ordered take-out from here a bunch of times and the food has always been excellent.  My girlfriend and I finally decided to dine in last night.  The bar area is on the smaller side, but with nice decor.  There is a dining room as well, but most of the patrons were in the bar area and we did not want to dine in silence.  For apps we ordered the spicy edamame, lettuce wraps and samosas.  The edamame was good and not too spicy, the lettuce wraps were small but tasty, and the samosas were some of the most flavorful I've ever had.My better half ordered the Yaya Noodles with chicken.  The dish was excellent and very light considering it was a noodle dish.  Thalia Spice loses a few points because they were out of my first choice of an entree, the Filipino adobo chicken, but the Indian Chicken Makhani was more than an adequate substitute.Finally, as an added bonus we learned they have drink specials every night, and stumbled into $5 lychee and mango (and a couple of other flavors I cannot remember) martinis on Thursdays.  A check-in on Yelp also earned me a buy 1 get 1 brunch voucher.Our only complaint was the table of loud, f-bomb dropping and obnoxious millennials next to us complaining about their jobs, co-workers and supervisors.  This is of course was no fault of the restaurant and they were more than happy to let us move tables before our food arrived.We will be back for great food and whatever the daily drink special is again.

44.description: We got the vegetarian egg rolls, Korean Kimchi mundos, volcano bisque soup, tofu pad thai and chicken fried rice, mango avocado sushi and some california rolls and to wash it down I had a thai ice coffee and later an appletini. Everything was pretty tasty but my favorite was definitely the mango avocado sushi.  I've never had that combination before and it was so good.  The ambiance was good and the prices were fair.  My friend introduced me to this place and I'm glad he did. I can't say I'll be here too often because I live out in the burbs but next time I have a date in the city I think this would be a good place to take her.

24.description: I enjoyed the dark, date like atmosphere.  The service is why I dropped a star.  The girls were very sweet, but less than attentive.  We sat for 10-15 minutes and no one took a drink order so we order our drinks and food together.  After we finished our meal we waited another 10-15 minutes until someone asked if we wanted our check.Besides the service, the food was fantastic.  We had Pad Thai with Tofu and Curry.  Both had great flavor.  I don't love overly spicy food, and the curry left just the right amount of spice after each bite, it was delicious. The pad thai was made with thinner rice noodles than we are used to, but it was a nice change up.Next time we are in the area, we would for sure return!

7.description: I ordered from here last night with a friend. It was OK but it gets 2 stars because of a major misstep.First of all, the Tom Yum soup was pretty good. It was watery but still had nice elements of citrus and spice. My friend enjoyed her green curry dish, too.I was excited for scallops on top of mango and avocado salad. I love all of those things! The scallops were tough to get down, so I left a lot of them uneaten. They were a bit dry and gummy, and the taste was very fishy. You'd think the salad would be better, perhaps able to disguise the scallops' taste. But no. The avocado was OK, but the tomatoes used in it (surprise guest...but I like tomatoes so it was OK) were a bit mealy. And the mango chunks themselves were slimy and well past their prime. The mango had acquired a bit of an "off" taste that was bad on its own, and extra bad when combined with the "off"-tasting scallops as well! I think you can do better re: Thai places in the city.

49.description: Although the service was a little off (kind of slow and fumbled...) I can't say that the food wasn't by any means. Started with the Crab Rangoon, very delish and fried just right. We had the Drunken Noodles and Green Curry, and have to say was some of the best green curry I've had in the city. Flavored perfectly with a generous portion of veggies and brown rice. Wine list is very decent, although it would be better as a BYOB. Decent bottle of white runs about $25 so you're not in too deep for a dinner for two. Side note, couldn't figure out what the place used to be -- but convinced it used to be a club in the early 2000's and definitely still has that vibe with the separated rooms which would make for a good club, but a bit of awkward seating arrangements.

40.description: Terrible place. Food was cold and disgusting.

53.description: I would definitely go back again! My friends and I had such a great time trying this restaurant. We all got the martini specials, apps, entrees, and dessert. All of the dishes were good, but I believe it was an eggplant entree that everyone agreed was exceptional.The service was pretty good. The server was very patient with all if our questions. However, I think there was some confusion with one of our entrees, and it wasn't what we thought we were getting. No matter- they handled it well and ended up not charging us for that. The restaurant was on the small side, but not too busy when we were there on a Thursday evening.

30.description: We went with a man who never tried sushi, maki or shashimi. We were able to get him to try all 3 ( not an easy task) but he is now a believer! Yum!

46.description: Food was very ok and nothing impressed us and very not healthy.Service was no good showed lack of a good management.The weird thing is I don't know why choose this place, for lunch(too expensive) for dinner, not good enough, for brunch the food is weird, location is tricky isolate in the middle of no where hard to park. If you want to bring a date don't come here. They will not be impressed.I saw a guy piss off by the service.You don't want to be embarrassed. Overall, not satisfied with this place. Will not be returning - think three times before visiting. Don't waste your time.

1.description: A group of eight friends decided to celebrate a birthday here. As we made reservations earlier in the day, we were quickly seated. We order a variety of appetizers: lobster chip ceviche, crab rangoon, saigon roll, coconut shrimp, and chicken satay. Out of the appetizers I tried, the saigon roll was nothing extraordinary but the crab rangoons were phenomenal. Without a doubt, the best crab rangoons I've ever had, and I've had a lot in my lifetime. Unfortunately, a potential bias to my lack of interest in the saigon roll was that it was not made to a restaurant-quality standard. Despite this mishap, the Thalia Spice team was very receptive and remedied the situation quickly. Not only did they negate the cost of that appetizer, they gave us two extra servings of the crab rangoons. We, again, ordered a variety of entrees including various sushi dishes, chicken pad thai, and the pad prix king. I primarily had the pad prix king, which is a tilapia dish. I was underwhelmed with this dish. The flavor profile was average. As a point of improvement, as a group, we mentioned multiple times through the night that we were celebrating a birthday. No acknowledgement of this was made by the team, such as notifying us about dessert specials or providing a surprise. Overall, our waiter was quick and attentive to the group's needs. Despite the mishap noted above, I'm more than willing to come back to explore the menu further. It was an enjoyable night out with friends.

55.description: You can certainly tell this place isn't what it used to be and I think their original chefs have now left. The service was terrible - they simply forgot about us. When we ordered the roti with the curry and requested tofu, they brought it with chicken and insisted it was tofu. when they finally agreed to take it to the kitchen to confirm, turns out it was indeed chicken. our noodles didn't seem to be prepared with the same attention to details as it used to be - it was more oily now and hastily prepared.

9.description: Fusion restaurants typically offer my favorite types of cuisine. However, Thalia Spice is Pan-asian and was a lot of ok tasting foods. They have a lot of food on the menu from Thailand, China, Japan, India, Philippines etc but none if it was really impressive. If you're going with a group of 6+ that have a wide range of tastes on their palate, I'd say its worth it.Service wasn't that stellar either. Note to all the service snobs out there - this is not the place for you. It wasn't busy and food and drinks seemed to take forever.

26.description: Got the green curry here and asked for it to be extra spicy, and surprisingly, it was decently spicy! It was a tad salty but pretty darn good. I had a Groupon deal so the price was also very reasonable.

25.description: Went here after purchasing a Groupon. I actually live a few blocks away and have never been here before. I went in on a Sunday and it was pleasant, not to packed but just a hand full of people. The service was a little spotty but not bad. The food and drinks are good. This place is a little more expensive then a few other Thai places I frequent. The Crab Rangoon was the best part of our meal! Not sure that I will go out of my way to eat here but I will more than likely come back one day.

12.description: We thoroughly enjoyed every item we got here and for the groupon price, we ordered a lot. The crab rangoon and salad wrap appetizers were tasty, though the salad wraps were challenging to eat and had way more salad than filling. I probably would skip them next time but did not regret having tried them.We ordered two rolls, the Thalia Roll, which was my favorite, and the Sweet Fuji, which was also delicious, and YaYa noodles, which I wanted to devour and am so thankful that they deliver because I will be ordering these as my go to weekend noodle. My only issue with this restaurant was the background noise, which was either water falling or oil frying, I couldn't figure out which, but it was loud and continuous and definitely took away from the relaxed ambiance of the place.The groupon was a groupon booking one and for whatever reason, the reservation and the groupon didn't go through, but they gave us the deal anyway and would work it out with groupon later. I'd almost steer you away from the groupon booking, because it has given me problems more than once- I much prefer the voucher groupons- but I'd hate to steer you away from trying this place out.

59.description: Used to be one of my favorite, local neighborhood spots but it has become extremely expensive for very ok food.  We often ordered in from this place and our last few orders have been pretty disgusting and overpriced.  Most of the food/curry's are watery with tons of oil skimming around.  Better places in the neighborhood to go too!

21.description: Don't believe in the hours that are posted on their website and menus. They wouldn't even accommodate some one who lives less than a block away from the restaurant 15 min before their closing.

17.description: Just finished our meal. Loved the variety of Asian dishes on the menu. We went mostly Thai tonight. Really liked the crab Rangoon and the roti canai bread - awesome. The green curry got even better as I ate it. The Lard Nar was strong as was the Pad Thai.

10.description: Love this place.  Great Thai food.  Good service good value.  I have never had a bad dish at this place.

5.description: Thalia Spice has great food. My friend and I sat outside in the summer and ordered two different pad thai dishes. The food has a lot of flavor and the service was good. I would definitely recommend the the pad see ew (might have spelled that wrong) but it was delicious!

3.description: Thalia's food is really good with great vegetarian selections.Food was delicious and the drinks were a surprisingly excellent. Waitstaff was a little slow to get us a table, but very sweet and accommodating. I look forward to my next visit. All in all a great experience!!!

35.description: I have lived in the neighborhood about 5 years now and I have been here many times since it is very convenient to me.  At first I thought it was "good" but it really has always been average and has never anything new and it is just very very average.  Strike 1.I have tried to become neighborly with them on several occasions and they just aren't interested whether you live in the neighborhood and can come their often or not.  Strike 2.So over the years I have stopped going to them frequently because they aren't that great but the other night I decided to try them one more time.  One of the things I got an appetizer on the menu (The Sea Sampler).  It was listed on the menu at $13.  When I got home I noticed it was listed on my receipt for $19.  When I went back to tell management, they showed it listed in their computer at $15.  They did give me my money back but offered no remorse, just confusion that it was listed as 3 different prices.  Exactly what they should have done but no more.Strike 3.

19.description: Gave this place one star because after waiting for an hour to get one of our entree's while everyone else got there food who came after house we got nothing but free dessert that we didn't even want. This place doesn't know how to take care of customers and how to serve food in a timely matter. We got my sushi dish first then our appetizer and then 45 minutes later my boyfriends green curry came out. You can get this food anywhere else in Chicago nothing special here.

28.description: This is BF's and my new neighborhood favorite. Great location...nice quiet street corner not far from the hectic river west/north neighborhoods. Everything we've tried has been fresh, delicious and comes out quickly. My usuals: crab rangoon- not a speck of grease and the sauce is a perfect pairing.Lettuce wraps- a nice change of pace for me, since I usually settle for a boring salad. Rising sun roll- right up my alley.VOLCANO SOUP!!! Changed my life!

45.description: First dine in experience was great. Food was very flavorful. Everything in my dish was fresh and high quality. I will definitely be back for more.

33.description: Great food, amazing service and atmosphere. The lunch specials are tasty and affordable.  Good selection.

43.description: Great place to eat. Very fresh food and unique dishes. Service was great too. Our favorite dish was the lobster chip ceviche. It is definitely a little out of the way but worth going to if you can get there. A fun date night place especially if you order tapas style.

2.description: Ordered takeout here. I had the pad Thai and coconut shrimp. They only give you two coconut shrimp, but they were big in size. The pad Thai lacked the peanut sauce and was very underwhelming. There are better Thai places to order from.

18.description: A regular at this place. Vegetarian specialities.For drinks don't miss out Jack Meets Thalia...made with fresh ginger. Really strong taste. Also try out the Asian beers. For apps, try the kimchi mondu (steamed veg dumplings)For Sushis, do check out Sweet Fuji, its veggie and delicious. For entrees, go for Pad Prix king tofu...best dish I ever had.

41.description: Got the pad Thai lunch special. Speed, cheerful service. Portion size was adequate but no leftovers. Food came out piping hot. Tasty. Wish I could have tried some of their drinks!

52.description: The ambiance is a little better than your average mass chain Asian restaurants but the food quality is mediocre at best. I had the buhn mi for lunch and there were several things that was disappointing. The bread it was on was the soft sub bread you would find at the local grocery stores deli department. The traditional Vietnamese BAHN mi is served on a French baguette. The Indian pork curry that it was stuffed with was over sauced and in between cold and hot. A very unsettling lukewarm where bacteria would find a nice home in. The vegetable dressings was inconsistent throughout the sandwich. One half had cilantro and the other didn't. I requested extra jalapeño and received 2 slices, and the daikon was overwhelming, to the point it was battling between the pork. All in all, I suggest the restaurant to pick an Asian cuisine and become an expert in that region before trying to tackle 7 different cultures.

50.description: We went there for NYE dinner. Only about half the place was full. The service was horrible. Our appetizers came before our drinks. The waiter forgot to write down our dinner order and had to remind him to write it down. We ordereded a mojito and they forgot to add the mint. We talked to the owner and he said he is aware of these issues. The food was pretty good but for the price i would rather go somewhere else.

4.description: I was here for a rather large group dinner. I liked that we were seated at a table in the bar area...almost felt like a private party. Being that we were with a large group, we ordered a variety of appetizers. Clay pot mussels, lobster chip ceviche, mango seared scallops, chicken satay, and some Laotian beef. Everything was pretty tasty, but none of those items would be the subject of my cravings! We washed down our appetizers with the sangria...which I really enjoyed! I loved the lychee in it...yum! :) For my main course, I ordered the Panang Curry. It comes with rice, but I substituted it w/ the naan. The menu calls it naan (Indian paratha), but it was more like Malaysian roti. I think they should clear that up on their menu...naan and paratha are two different types of breads. Sorry for that side note. Anywho, the curry was decent. Good amount of spice. My only gripe is that the "naan" that I ordered (mind you there is an upcharge) was so tiny for the massive amount of curry they served. My "naan" was finished in a few bites and is nowhere the size of a "real" naan bread. So, skip that upcharge and stick to the rice! We didn't order dessert. Service was decent. They forgot a couple of our friends' meals. That always annoys me and shouldn't be a mistake that is made in restaurants! And my "naan" came out about 10 minutes after my curry. Nice place to check out.

6.description: been here a few times as I lived close by. This is a small space but quite nicely laid out and decorated. They serve your standard thai and Asian food and carry some Japanese beers as well. I really liked the food and pricing was rather decent for the area as well.I did go there once when one of their cooks was out so it took them forever to make our dishes but later refunded us most of the money. definitively a nice place I would recommend if you live close by.

22.description: I ordered from here last night with a friend. It was OK but it gets 2 stars because of a major misstep.First of all, the Tom Yum soup was pretty good. It was watery but still had nice elements of citrus and spice. My friend enjoyed her green curry dish, too.I was excited for scallops on top of mango and avocado salad. I love all of those things! The scallops were tough to get down, so I left a lot of them uneaten. They were a bit dry and gummy, and the taste was very fishy. You'd think the salad would be better, perhaps able to disguise the scallops' taste. But no. The avocado was OK, but the tomatoes used in it (surprise guest...but I like tomatoes so it was OK) were a bit mealy. And the mango chunks themselves were slimy and well past their prime. The mango had acquired a bit of an "off" taste that was bad on its own, and extra bad when combined with the "off"-tasting scallops as well! I think you can do better re: Thai places in the city.

15.description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Chicago. The food is excellent. If you like sushi they have a large selection . The Vulcano soup is my favorite and for desert the best will be the mango sticky rice -yummy .Don't forget to tray some of the Martinis .

57.description: Food was quite good (although portions are smaller than expected), and the place is nice.  What troubled me today was service.  We went there for lunch and our waitress was a little weird.  I think she might be training, or just started today -- I don't like being judgmental to people who are just starting on a job.  I start new jobs over and over again and I know how it is.Still, It's always good to hear some feedback so we can improve our skills. This lady took a long time to bring our food (which I think was sitting at the kitchen for a while, once people who got there after us received their food first).  She was a bit lost and not really paying attention to us.  When I asked her if my food would be coming shortly, she had a puzzled face and just answered "I'm sure it will" and then there was this weird silence followed by me saying "well.. can you go check with the kitchen please?"  She wasn't well informed about the drink menu, kept just asking if we would like to order any beverages... ?Then we asked for the check while eating (we were in a hurry) and she never came to take the tab.. we ended up asking another server to bring the change.I don't really want to be a b***.  I respect all professionals in this industry because I've tried  working in this environment and failed miserably --  that was just NOT for me.  I know it's hard work and a lot to do.  I am not even saying that she should've acted this or that way, once again, this is just a feedback.  The restaurant has been there for a while and food is good.

20.description: Just finished our meal. Loved the variety of Asian dishes on the menu. We went mostly Thai tonight. Really liked the crab Rangoon and the roti canai bread - awesome. The green curry got even better as I ate it. The Lard Nar was strong as was the Pad Thai.

36.description: We thoroughly enjoyed every item we got here and for the groupon price, we ordered a lot. The crab rangoon and salad wrap appetizers were tasty, though the salad wraps were challenging to eat and had way more salad than filling. I probably would skip them next time but did not regret having tried them.We ordered two rolls, the Thalia Roll, which was my favorite, and the Sweet Fuji, which was also delicious, and YaYa noodles, which I wanted to devour and am so thankful that they deliver because I will be ordering these as my go to weekend noodle. My only issue with this restaurant was the background noise, which was either water falling or oil frying, I couldn't figure out which, but it was loud and continuous and definitely took away from the relaxed ambiance of the place.The groupon was a groupon booking one and for whatever reason, the reservation and the groupon didn't go through, but they gave us the deal anyway and would work it out with groupon later. I'd almost steer you away from the groupon booking, because it has given me problems more than once- I much prefer the voucher groupons- but I'd hate to steer you away from trying this place out.

14.description: Love the ambiance and has more space than it appears.  Made reservations for 8:15 but didn't look like we needed themWe started with the crab rangoon (super fresh and recommend) and the coconut shrimp.Generally I love coconut shrimp. However this looks like a nest of coconut with shrimp somewhere buried inside so not an appetizer I would have again there.For a drink I had the Thalia-angria (like sangria). Again I love sangria and was stoked about this but it arrived with a little too much rum in it for me.  The sake variety was good and yummy (per friend).When I saw Rama on the menu I became very very excited! I haven't had it a long time and was really looking forward to the peanuty goodness! The sauce came out on the side (waitress gave an option).Upon mixing the sauce with the chicken and veggies it became a lil watery :(My friend ordered the river boat noodles which was beefy brothy goodness with noodles and such.  If you're into the soup type meal I recommend it! Yummy!It is rumored that the sushi here is amazing particularly the Kama sutra roll but we'll have to wait for next time as our bellies were full!

28.description: I'm so happy I was referred here. These dudes are more than helpful. They are knowledgeable on all of their products and make sure you leave with what you need. They get all the dang stars.

1.description: Great place! Although the city is cheating us with taxes, they give a great discount, 15% off 3 or more bottle of juice!

9.description: They have this line called chaos that I don't see at many other shops at the moment , that stuff is great. Especially the Black Flag Waffle. If you are looking for some quality juice that is made in Chicago give them a visit. Not looking for some juice sent from the gods? No worries, they have a awesome selection of mods and other accessories ( and many other lines of juice) The workers truly enjoy their job and are very helpful .From beginner to expert vape enthusiasts , this shop is a must see. They have everything you need at a great price.And that Matty guy is pretty cool too.

29.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

23.description: This is as good as it gets for Vape shops! They are super knowledgeable and extremely helpful. If you're just starting or advance, they treat everyone with respect. They have earned my business as a customer! The quality of juices they carry is epic and they have a great tasting bar. Plenty of room to relax and vape for a while too. Anyone looking to get into Vapes or wanting to try something new, check this place out!

5.description: These guys are the best!! I'm trying to quit smoking and they are so helpful in doing so. Friendly staff and great customer service. I've recommended this spot to a few people and everyone is completely satisfied with the products. Numerous flavors and the juice bottles are affordable and last long. Definitely coming back.

31.description: I'm new to the vaping world, so my buddy suggested going to vape, so once we got there it was a really cool experience... The guys were very knowledgeable about the products and the juices that they carry, and they were very personable.. And I must say that the easydoesit juice is great!!! I'll be back...

25.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

12.description: Great selection. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. This is why I'm a return customer that travels from the suburbs. Highly recommended.

21.description: Go here when you are ready to get something more than the easily breakable and disposable vaporizers you can get at a headshop. Wide variety of liquid flavored and they let you try them!

16.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

17.description: My mom gave me one of her vape pens which she used to kick a 30+ years smoking habit. I was skeptical because I had tried vaping before, but didn't know what I was doing and would go back to cigarettes. I ran out of cigarettes yesterday and decided to go cold turkey. 24 hours in, I was feeling super crazy and everything in my body was like GO TO THE STORE AND BUY A PACK OF CIGARETTES. I went up to Vape and Matt helped me enormously and showed me what to do properly. He let me try so many wonderful tasty satisfying flavors. I left feeling so much better and with the true hope that I can quit this time!

10.description: So I was looking for my first mod. I've been reading about them online and I was ready to take the plunge. I was greeted right away by Eric who was fully knowledgeable and broke it down super simple. I didn't feel rushed or any thing. I got a basic mod with a Kay fun tank. It's super simple and easy to use. Even got a ruthless ez duz it on Ice. I absolutely love it. Thank you. Love the atmosphere inside. They have a pretty decent juice bar with a tablet full of flavors to choose.

11.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

26.description: Ok, I don't normally leave reviews for every place I visit, but I couldn't pass on this one.  When I went into Vape I was 100% new to vaping.  After reading the excellent reviews I decided to check it out and what an experience!! The staff was extremely helpful, and the guy that helped me out went to lengths explaining the differences between devices and the pros and cons of each. As you can see in the pictures they also have a juice bar where you can test any and every flavor you would like.  This was a fantastic experience and I would recommend anyone looking for a great Vape store to give this place a try!

27.description: I stopped in yesterday for a mod, while they didn't have the exact mod I was looking for, they did everything in their power to hook me up, and I left with something even better than what I came for. Their selection is bar-none the best I've seen in the Chicago-land area and the prices rival even online Chinese vendors. I was able to taste every juice I could handle, and they would not settle until I was 110% satisfied. I can't say enough good things about this shop, the staff, and the products. If you're shopping anywhere else, you're missing out.

35.description: Nice selection... Hope to see more products on my next visit. I only bought a spacer thing for between my Vivi Nova and Vision Spinner. Nice juice selection... Will ask to sample next time. Didn't bring my vape. Nice friendly peeps, nice overall feel to the shop. A/C works, *phew* :) There is street parking and a Dunkin just a couple steps away, you can get your happy hour on.  thanks!!

0.description: If you haven't switched from smoking to vaporizing you really, really should! This place is tiny, attached to a car wash. But it had the product I needed, and at half the price. I was so excited I did a dance. Quick service, good location. Friendly staff who were explaining to the customer before me how to use an E-cigarette. Now its moved to a larger location with even greater selection. Do hit this one up!

20.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

19.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods!
