They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

33.description: Vape is an amazing vapor shop with high end mods, tanks, atomizers and a great selection of premium juice. The prices are more than reasonable and the service is five star. Every Chicagoland vaper should stop in.

2.description: Great place. Grabed the ipv3 from vapegut. .....And didn't see bearded clam..place is one of the best in city. Owners are cool and carry the best authentic mods

34.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods! They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

32.description: So glad I discovered Vape today which is walking distance from my home. They just opened up two months ago so this was the first time I found out they were there. Bought a bottle of a berry / mint / watermelon concoction just to try something out since I was there anyway and I like it a lot. Going to head back in when I have more time and get a battery and sample some juices. Been ordering online so-far but you know, the cost of postage and the waiting . . . so glad something opened up nearby.

18.description: Vape is the ONLY vape shop anyone should patronize and I'll tell you why. These guys give a shit and it shows. Everything about the place is solid. Staff, helpfulness, selection, shop appearance. These guys are true vape enthusiasts and they have a genuine love for spreading knowledge of all things vape related. I went in to this shop over the summer as a beginner with my lady. Neither of us knew dick about vaping. Paul, one of the employees started us off on our vaping journey with care, compassion and mature guidance. He explained everything we wanted to know and didn't talk down to us or make us feel dumb for not being seasoned vapers. I have been to other vape shops in the area and no one compares to the level of service that is provided at Vape. The juice bar is my favorite part of the shop. All their flavors are on Ipads and it makes selecting and discovering new flavors fun. The staff are experts on their products. Often I ask for a recommendation and am rarely disappointed with their suggestions. It's shops like this that keep me from shopping on the internet. I know I could save a few bucks but I like giving my business to Vape. They have actually talked us out of spending money when myself or my fiance got overzealous in our spending. Only hiccup was one time a short Filipino dude shorted us like 200 points on our frequent shopper rewards card but we got it sorted out the next time we came in. Don't even bother with other vape shops. Vape is the only place you need to go. You will not be disappointed!

13.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

4.description: My friend went here and bought 2 mods from them and got a $250 mod that shocks her finger whenever she presses the firing button, she went back to exchange for the $150 Petri mod, which was better. But the next day, Mattie charged her $10 for a new build?!?! (Who charges for builds???). Plus, when she wanted to use her fivestar points, same guy Mattie had excuses why she couldn't use her points for juices. But other than that, other employees are nice! But those experiences really turned us off from going back.

24.description: Best vape shop in the city hands down!!! Has a wide variety of vaporizers AND juices. Not to mention the staff is great, very knowledgable and patient! Me being new at vaping, Eric helped me tremendously to guide me in the right direction with my purchase. Definitely recommend this shop to everyone!

6.description: I couldn't have had a better, easier experience at Vape.I'm a pack-a-day smoker, and I'd planned on moving to vaping for some time, if only so I could start running again. I went into Vape after reading the Yelp reviews, and I'm glad I did. They gave me a great walkthrough on the basics of vaping, and didn't try to hard sell me on any piece of equipment. They gave me exactly what I wanted -- something simple, something good for newbies.I spent probably too much time trying out different juice flavors. After asking how much I smoked, we found a nicotine amount that would work for me, and went through several flavors. Never once did I feel rushed, and never once did I feel like they were pulling me towards specific products.All in all, it was a perfect experience for a beginner, and I can't wait to go back once my juice is finished. I'd recommend this place to anybody.

22.description: I love this place....High quality juices, tanks, mods, etc. Great customer service and very knowledgeable and patient staff.  Special shout out to Joe who hooked me up with a great kit and great juices.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  If your in the area. ..make sure you stop by for a visit. .. You will not be disappointed! !!

15.description: I'm very new to the vape scene and have juggled between having some friends build ones for me or to just by a quality one from a quality store. After a quick bite in the city I hit Google for the nearest vape stores by me. There aren't many by where I live, so I figured here's my chance. It's a bit hard to spot driving down western, and I missed it once. Walked in waited for the people before me to finish their order and was quickly shown everything there is to know. Before you know it I was buying a vape and couldn't be more pleased. Hopefully this helps me quit smoking cigarettes. But on to the shop, product was good, service was very patient and helpful and answered all of my silly questions. I'm telling you I have completely no knowledge of vapes and these guys guided me from A to Z. If your new to the scene this is the place. And if you're a seasoned pro they have a good amount of mods, nice setting, chilled atmosphere, and a ton of juices to TRY before you buy!

7.description: Is there a 6 star option Because these guys go the extra mile to make sure you had a good experience in their vape shop. Even though there are a lot of vape shops in the Chicago area I think Vape beats them all. I drive 25 miles to get product from these guys and will continue to. keep up the good work!

8.description: Walked in to buy a 150 watt mod and a couple batteries. Had gotten a quote for a whopping 10% off for black friday. One guy wouldn't even get off the couch, and the other guy tried to sell me a $10 Ego kit for $60 or something. What I mean to say, is that he talked down to me. Then I was told that the quote I got on the phone "was not real". I walked out. Save your time, money, and breath, do not shop at Vape.

30.description: Just got into vaping and was pleased to find Vape around the corner from my house about a week ago and I think I have already been in 3 times. I have been to tons of tobacco stores that sell limited amounts of e-cigs and vaporizers but none of them seemed to know anything about what they were selling. Vape is the complete opposite. Joe and Daryl answered every questions I had and their prices are really reasonable even when compared to the online stores. If you're in the area, stop purchasing online...support a local business and stop in to Vape.

3.description: Excellent place. I was just there (by recommendation from St Lucia's Smoke Shop) with intent to take the step from entry level ecigs to a proper 'intermediate' vape setup. The staff members helps me do this with ease, especially Royal (I think that was his name).Thanks. Will definitely be back soon for some more juices.

14.description: Honestly the best customer service I have had in a while. I always come in with problems and they maintain a positive attitude and set me up. They do great builds and are the experts of the Chicago vape scene. Matty knows what he is doing and he gave a great customer experience. I work in the service industry, and I am pretty stern about good service, and Matty is awesome!!!!! Thanks Vape!!!!

58.description: Great service. Delicious wine. We didn't eat- but the food smelled wonderful (for their BBQ Wed). Check them out!!!

56.description: I can't recommend the place. The first thing we noticed after going inside it really smelled bad, like old fat or something. The Atmosphere not really what I expect of a Wine Bar!

29.description: good for a date night.

42.description: I love wine and cheese type places, and so I've been wanting to try this place out for at least a year but never seemed to make it over.  Finally last night I made it in.  It was a great night for some wine, and the space is warm and inviting, with a nice patio in the back.The service was a little spotty.  The table next to me was seated after me, but got all their dishes before I'd gotten one of mine.  I also ordered what they call "Red Wine Experience of the Week," which is basically a random glass of red wine.  Right in the text it says it'll be delicious, they "promise."  Well, they didn't bother to ask if I liked it, and I didn't like it.  I tried to like it.  I drank it by itself, I drank it with food, it was incredibly sweet - something the server didn't mention when I ordered it, but should have.  The server should also have made sure I liked it.  Finally, I told the server I didn't like it and requested something else. She brought something else, but still charged me for the Red Wine Experience.  Not much of a "promise" if you still charge me even if I don't like it.  When it came to the food, I tried three of their cheeses.  Three cheeses is $24.  At Naha, you can get a cheese plate with 6-8 cheeses for $28, with better accompaniments, and they're in the heart of River North not on an abandoned stretch of Milwaukee, so I'm not sure where the price point comes from.  Of the three cheeses, two were ok, one was quite good.I also ordered an endive/tuna salad.  The menu said the tuna was made from belly, which is usually best just plain so the higher fat content can really shine.  But they'd made it into a tuna salad mash, where the benefit of it being belly is completely lost.  It tasted fine, but I think turning belly into tuna salad is silly and a waste of money on their part.After I'd eaten, it started to rain.  I took the better wine with me, and left the "Experience" wine on the table - that's how much I disliked it.  They didn't bring it in or ask me about it.Inside, it was lively and I talked to some local patrons.  They were friendly and nice and made it a pleasant evening.  Overall, I'd say I was disappointed mainly due to price.  The service wasn't horrible, the food was acceptable and most of the wine was good.  But they were all more at a neighborhood level, yet they were charging downtown prices.  I can't justify spending over $100 for dinner for what was really at best an average experience, and it really did bother me a lot to be charged for a wine I obviously didn't like - no other restaurant I've been to would do that, so I'm not sure why 694 thinks that's acceptable practice - it's a deadly fault for a wine bar.

23.description: I came here with my boyfriend on a rainy Thursday evening when I realized my $100 groupon was about to expire. I'm very happy I didn't let this one go to waste because it was wonderful!I showed up just as it opened and was seated immediately. The boy was running late, so I ordered a glass of wine (vinho verde, my favorite!) and looked over the menu while I waited for him. Honestly, I could have ordered everything. The whole menu sounded delicious. While it is a small menu, it's more than made up for by the quality of menu items. I decided to put in for an order of Devil's Bread so it would be coming out right around when the boy showed up.He ordered the Prairie Path when he arrived, despite not being gluten free, and said it was great. The Devil's Bread came out and was akin to a very fancy french bread pizza, with spicy salami. Delicious! It sounds simple, but sometimes simple can be simply great! We decided to order the hot sopressata (sp?) and the mole charcuterie, along with the delice de bourgogne and cheddar cheese. The plate came with nuts, honey, and dried fruit, and a generous amount of bread. All SO tasty! The mole was incredibly unexpected, as it was very sweet, but went very well with the creamy cheese. I ordered another glass, this time the rose cava. While it was tasty, it was a bit too sweet for my liking. He ordered a glass of the Red Wrangled (I think that's what it was called), a mix of a few different reds. I wish I had ordered that too! So good! For dessert, we split the brownie flight, which I can only describe as orgasmic. Good lord. So good. We didn't quite hit the $100 with all that, so we split a glass of the Red Wine Experience of the Week, which, once again, was delicious. The ONLY downside to this place is the rather sketchy block it's located on, and the prices. Without a groupon, I would have a hard time justifying spending this amount of money on a wine and cheese night out.

47.description: What a great find! My friends had an engagement party in the upstairs space and on the upstairs deck. It is a great place for a party. The staff was great and they have a great drink selection. The upstairs deck is lovely.

8.description: Visited on my touristy trip to Chicago and loved it. I passed by the area on accident and that's how I found this gem but it's one place I crave since then...The atmosphere, the wine and the grilled cheese sandwiches... Yes please! However, everything in the menu looked amazing due to its selection and menu layout itself...The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and playful. I loved this place and I'd recommend it in a heartbeat.

31.description: We love this place, it is one of our weekly stops.  The wine selection is great, the staff is awesome and the cheese and meat selection is yummy.  Wednesday night they have grilled specials that are always wonderful but get there early.

34.description: Love this place. It's super close to our house, has a great selection of wine, and seller patios - there are 3 so no shortage of outdoor space.  The food selections are limited so don't plan on grabbing a full dinner here.  Grab some friend and catch up over wine!

16.description: I've been here a couple of times before and actually recommended the place to friends. However, tonight I took a girlfriend there for her birthday celebration and we ended up with a cheap wine, stale bread and old cheese (not in the correct way). My friend threw up at the end of the night. And you would think a restaurant/bar would be more accommodating instead we received the most horrible service and were asked to leave right away (after we paid the bill)..by some random guy. He ket saying "how could you throw up". The last I checked throwing up is involuntary .

13.description: Surprisingly, the salads are always my favorite and the beer/wine/liquor selection is great. Everyone's very friendly and it's a really chill place to hang out.

11.description: Came here last night for some cheese, meats, and wine. They recently had a groupon, and it was totally worth checking this place out. I live 5 blocks away and had no idea this place was here. The customer service was great, the wine was delish. This is a good place to catch up with a friend and share small plates. The selection and pairing of the meats and wines were perfect.

39.description: I have been to 694 Wine & Spirits which is in the same location as the original 'Iggy's' restaurant that was so popular 10 years ago.  I love the decor of the restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed dining there on a Wednesday which is the night that the owner grills several specialty items for guests.  The Jerk Chicken, Sizzling Jalapeño Brown Sugar Burger and grilled swordfish were all awesome as well as our wine selections!  The music and ambiance were terrific and I highly recommend this place.

37.description: I threw my husband a surprise party here, and it was perfect. I rented out the entire upstairs which includes their beautiful outdoor patio, for a very reasonable price I might add. I paid for the space rental, small bites, and a nominal fee to bring in a cake from an outside bakery. Guests bought their own drinks from the bar. We had about 35 friends and family, and it was a phenomenal evening. Our bartender was friendly and accommodative. The wine, beer, and cocktail choices are incredibly pleasing to experienced winos and easy-going, nonchalant drinkers. The party food included lots of cheese and charcuterie and this delicious, warm cheesy bread that everyone devoured. I think it was supposed to be from 7-10pm, but we were not at all rushed out. It was just so simple. Jenn was the events coordinator and answered all of my questions via email. The space is gorgeous, so other than some balloons, we didn't need decorations. The candles twinkled in the dim, artsy surroundings. It's not too large where an intimate party will feel overwhelmed in a giant space, but we easily could have had another twenty people move around comfortably.  Lastly, it was really quite the perfect spot for a surprise party because the second floor space is well-suited to gather everyone opposite the stairs and scare the bejesus out of the honored guest. When my husband realized so many of his friends and family had come out to celebrate his birthday on a Friday night, it was just so damn adorable. And 694 really helped to make that happen so easily!

0.description: Seriously one of my favorite places ever. We moved here a few months ago and assumed this adorable wine bar would be a special date night place that we would go to occasionally. Who knew we would be going at least once a week if not more. Bacon night on Tuesdays has become a tradition! The owner and staff make you immediately feel like they've known you forever. They always make the best recommendations of wine, cheese, etc. I couldn't say better things about this bar. I recommend it for a fancy date night or an easy relaxing night with your friends. Also, they have a great upstairs that can accommodate parties - perfect for engagements, birthdays, graduations, etc. You're missing out if you haven't been here!

38.description: My favorite wine bar in the city. It's a hidden gem. Their flights are unique and reasonably priced. On top of that, their cheese is amazing. I love their almonds and could eat and drink here every day. Unfortunately, I would then be dead.They have very cool modern pop art as well. Music is good and the place is perfect for a group outing.

51.description: You should go here.  Honestly.  Great food, excellent cocktails - really great whiskey selection, fantastic wine selection.  Cheese plates are outstanding. BLT is amazeballs.  Service is always very good, nice outdoor area when weather is pleasant.

27.description: I had luck on my side tonight :)Called 694 at 5 p.m., hoping to get a table for seven ladies at 7 p.m. Fortunately they had a spot. Once we got there, we had a fantastic time. Jen, our server (pretty much everyone's server on the street-level floor!) took great care of us and gave great recommendations based on the bottle(s) of wine we got.Full marks for everything we got, from the almonds to the olives to various meats and toasts (devil and angel; how appropriate).Didn't wander upstairs. First time meeting some of this group, so we wanted to talk. To that end, downstairs was perfect for us.Sad to admit that, although I live about a 10-minute walk from 694, Saturday was my first time going there. Good news: it won't be my last!

32.description: This is  a cute spot in an odd stretch along Milwaukee.  There is basically nothing around....  We got there around 6:30, and there were only three other patrons.  Odd...  The wine, cheese, butter flight (yummmmm), and service were all great!  The cheeses I selected were enjoyable (one soft and one "stinky"). The butter flight  was delicious, with three types of butter and sea salts.  Can't go wrong with bread and butter!  I loved the pop art on the walls!  We drove by later in the night on our way home, and it looked to be packed inside.

54.description: This place is great!  I went there last night with a group of 7 girlfriends for a birthday.  We did the wine tasting and had the whole upstairs to ourselves.  Jenny was are wine sommelier and she did a great job.  We were able to taste 5 whites, 5 reds, a sparkling wine & a dessert wine and then after it was a free for all and we could drink any of the wines we tasted. The food was delicious. I would highly recommend this place for a special event or just a good night with friends. We all had a great experience and will definetly go back.

48.description: I do enjoy Groupon deals and this one was useful to discover the place. There was a private party that night so all the top lounge and rooftop were privatized. But I'm sure it's a great place to go. Food and wine were great. Nice choice of wines. You will have a good quantity and quality concerning the food.This will be a great spot for outdoor summer seating.The only thing is the location

44.description: Met a friend here on a sweltering hot July summer evening and opted to sit on the back patio (I savor hot nights).  The patio was super cute and secluded from the traffic on Milwaukee.  Our wine, cheese plate, and killer BLT were all delicious.  Service was incredibly friendly.  Parking was easy.  I'll be back!!

24.description: My favorite wine bar. But my absolute favorite place to get jerk chicken on a Wednesday night! 694 has a great atmosphere and a super friendly staff. They know just the right wine to recommend every time depending on my palette mood. Ps. Their angel bread is pretty amazing too!

7.description: Love this place! Such a hidden gem. You've gotta check out DJ Rod on Thursdays and Fridays for some good soulful house and disco music!!

49.description: great local spot a bit off the beaten path.  great vibe and cool artwork make this wine bar a great spot for dates.  bartender was awesome with his recommendations and food pairings.  while they don't have a full kitchen, the apps are delish.  we got a tour of the upstairs, which has an outdoor patio... will definitely going back this summer!

40.description: I thought about not writing a review - as they say,"if you have nothing kind to say then say nothing at all."  Allow me to break that rule. There's nothing warm and friendly about this place. I came here to meet a few friends for drinks and this silver haired guy with glasses had this, " Why are you here" look on his face. Was he rude? Yup. While I was outside the service was slow so I had to go inside to get an overpriced beer.I like the décor of the place however the only thing missing is a "No Colored Allowed" sign. To the owner: Every guest that comes through your door, is the most important guest you'll ever have.

53.description: Eaten by myself: about 24 whole olives from the olive plate, the bread and butter, several ounces of cheese, half of the enormous thick-cut BLT, and an entire large format farmhouse/saison ale.Yea, I'd say it was a pretty good night. The best part: somehow I didn't need my water re-filled.

30.description: I went there with a groupon. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Food was great. Art Deco good diverse music. Swanky, dim lighting, drinks were great but this is strictly a wine bar I tried a dirty martini and I sent it back for my champagne.

46.description: Great wine bar! The downstairs is great if you want to sit at the bar or out on the patio on a nice day. We've had and been to private parties upstairs and it has a more club feel (not in a bad way, DJ playing, darker). The servers have always been very knowledgeable and have given great recommendations.  We've been introduced to a couple of our faves here! The food is very good too - great meats and cheeses to snack on. And I love their art!!177/365

1.description: The space is small and cute with a cozy feel to it, but for a wine bar, it has a VERY limited wine list. In fact, I would give them 3 stars if they didn't call themselves a wine bar. Its just an insult to the concept. In my mind a wine bar is an establishment where you can taste rare, unusual wines from different places of the world and learn more about it. This place has 6 red and 6 white by-the glass options some of which are similar to one another blends. The have only 2 options on the sparkling!!! 694wineandspirits.com/re…There are no flights at all! On Thursday night they were missing a wine selection from their list which already offers slim pickings... They do not make up for it in food. Again very few options to snack on (one of the cured meets missing) and the breadbasket contained a 5-day old baguette. Our waitress agreed to have it toasted, but without much enthusiasm. If you are going to make cheese and cured meat board, your main focus - you had better make sure your bread you serve with that is fresh and memorable. Other than decor, this place is sad

55.description: I purchased a groupon for this joint.. It is a very cool place to hang out, the ambiance is great and so was the music.. and the food was greatNow that is out of the way.... here we go... We walk in and my buddies girlfriend describes what kind of wine she likes and he tells her "you're describing wine that is out of your price range".... She did not tell us what he said til we left, which was lucky for him... And she has enough money to buy this joint btw.... but either way what a completely disrespectful thing to say to a customer, especially considering we were the only ones buying bottles in the joint lol... Our server also was very, very rude the whole night to us. If it wasn't for my buddies girlfriend being so nice I would have left her absolutely no tip!! And our server had no idea about how to serve wine... after the first bottle we asked the busser for new wine glasses, she stormed over, got mad at him and poured a different wine in the same glass we were drinking our original wine in!!! I told her not to and she informed me "Don't you know it doesn't matter because it's from the same varietal", LOLOLOLOL I think she needs a lesson on how wine works... I was stunned, and just the disregard for my request was just rude and disrespectful!!! And their wine list is sub-par at best

9.description: We live about a block away so 694 is one of our favorite spots for a glass of wine and cheese plate.I will preface by saying that 90% of the time we stop by after work on a weekday so I cannot attest to a weekend evening atmosphere. I've noticed other reviewers comment on the music volume. I have noticed this as a bit of an issue, but on the occasion that the music is a decent volume, it can be a relaxed vibe. I'm not offended enough to not return.Service has always been great because we are either the only ones there or one of two or three parties in the entire restaurant. LOVE LOVE LOVE the assorted butter plate (can you just pass me the tub??) and pretty much every meat and cheese plate they offer. The honey, nuts, figs and other garnishes are unexpected tasty treats on the side. I'm no wine expert, so their wine selection suits me just fine and I have enjoyed everything I've ordered.4 instead of 5 stars because it is a bit pricey and the music volume issue.Plan to return.

26.description: Don't let the outside appearance fool you, you must go inside.  It's located on a pretty dead block of Milwaukee.  The place is really small, but really funky inside and the music selection is really nice.  Good eclectic mix of alternative, pop. electronic and some other stuff I have no idea about.  The artwork is not my cup up tea, but overall it has a really nice vibe.  There is an upstairs room that fits about 70 people that would be cool to rent out for a private party.  Will definitely keep it in mind should the need arise.Food was AWESOME. The spinach salad and devil's bread were amazing.  Couldn't have improved on either of them.  We found out on Wednesdays they BBQ outside.  By the time we got there (9 pm) they were sold out of burgers and chicken, put the pork chop was just perfect.Wine selection was really diverse as well.  I was hoping they had flights, but only glasses and bottles.  Service was great as well.  The owner was very friendly.  It's definitely the place to become a regular and I would def recommend it as a place you would bring a date to whom you really wanted to impress.

25.description: My favorite place in the city of Cheese and Meat plates, always a great selection of both with exotic meats too. The service is always great downstairs, the wine selection is awesome. They dont have much of a liqueur selection and dont ask for a cocktail.I have been coming here for over 3 years and I highly recommend it, always cool local artwork on the walls and pretty close to the blue line.

12.description: Great ambiance especially on their outdoor patio.  The owner was very helpful and gave us suggestions and even changed wine she suggested but noticed we weren't THRILLED by (regardless of our willingness to enjoy it). Fabulous local spot with some really fun cheeses and meats to pair with what we thought was all distinctively delicious wine!  A great little secret must visit spot in Chicago.

59.description: A good wine list with good food to accompany your wine.   Service was very friendly.

21.description: After being somewhat disappointed with my previous experience here, I decided to go back to 694 last Friday.  I sat at the bar and ordered the delice cheese with a glass of the rose cava.  Now I remember the first time I came here and ordered cheese and they didn't give me enough to even spread on one slice of bread.  This time however, I received what I considered a normal portion size and it was exquisite! They paired the cheese with some honey, dates, dried apricots and cranberries that all came together and were delicious.  The bartender was very nice as well and overall, I had a really nice experience.  I will be back!

17.description: I really enjoyed 694 Wine and Spirits. It is like a cool little hole in the wall that you would probably never wander into if you are not nosey. So I am happy that I am nosey because this place is awesome. While the menu is small, I can actually say I walked away feeling full. I came here with my boyfriend one evening before the rush and I am sure glad we decided to try it out. I have no idea what he was drinking but I know I had a glass of the Hooked Riesling... Um what can I say it was super delicious. Honestly I had a couple of glasses of it.Then we ordered the devils bread which was really good. It had a spicy marinara sauce with smoked paprika salumi and truffle oil on a texas toast type of bread. It was good, But what amazed me was the salt and butter flight. Who ever knew bread and butter could taste soooooo good. Then our waiter suggested that we try the Finocchiona which is just meat that was cured with black pepper corn and fennel and that was delicious. I think we also had the coppa but I don't remember. What I do know I do is that my boyfriend had Valdeon Blue cheese and omg. I took a whiff of that sucker and I swear I almost puked. It was a strong pungent cheese and somehow my boyfriend got me to try some of it. I can honestly say it was rich and creamy, it was good but I good not get over that smell. Its imbedded into my brain. However what made my night was the special of the day which was a grilled cheese sandwich with jelly and bacon. I know it sounds weird but it was actually good. So glad I got to experience this place, I think we will be back soon.

10.description: Amazing find in River West! We just moved to the neighborhood and have been meaning to try this wine bar. We came in on a rainy Friday right as they opened at 5p. Wine was amazing - everything we tried was good. Ordered 3 cheeses and a meat board and the portions were much larger than charcuterie you get at other places. Garnishes included honey, nuts and a few other things. Lovely presentation and sooo yummy. Staff was nice and friendly. This is now our new go-to spot!

5.description: After two years of living next door I just found out that they do a secret menu every Wednesday night that's incredible! The owner brings a bunch of meat to throw on his grill and serves up some hearty eats other than the cheese boards they normally do. What he grills up varies, but he does it every Wednesday year round and this stuff is so damn good it's truly surprising that hasn't decided to do it full time.

3.description: Service was great, wine was great& the cheese was great! Jennifer, our server was very knowledgeable on the wine & food. A cute little place that plays awesome music- Tears For Fears, Duran Duran, Madonna, etc.

35.description: Meh.  Have some real food!  No idea who wrote all the good reviews....what am I missing at this overpriced so called wine bar  that only has a handful of wine choices?  How do they pay rent?  Oh I know, it's the 40 Malbec that you can get at the grocery store for $8.  And don't let me forget about the "pork" dish.  Another $9 for 8 slices, think standard pepperoni slices here mind you, for $9...and calling it pork?  It was a type of salami similar to what you get in one of those cheese/salami plates from Jewel when you're running late for a party.  Brutal.After your loving response to this post; I had to make a few things even clearer-  check out the "not recommended reviews section". Here you will see more truth about this dump.  Many and I mean MANY other local choices that actually have food beyond a grilled cheese.  17 whole bottles of red wine?  And you're boasting about this?  I have more kinds in my house....and also a more palatable food selection too!

19.description: 694 officially gets bumped up to 5 stars by me. I went for dinner on my birthday and had an amazing experience. It was not as packed as my last visit and when not packed to the brims, I love the atmosphere here. The servers are very knowledgeable about their food & drinks which makes for a pleasurable dining experience. I love the setup of 694 and the booth-tables. I'm a fan!Once again, I had a glass of bubbly The Saint - best champagne ever, I swear! We had an amazing cheese and meat plate and I'm happy to say they had all cheese and meat selections in stock unlike the last time I went. It's succcccchhhhh a good plate and selection of cheeses they have. I got their grilled cheese once again because I know it's the best grilled cheese in the city. It didn't fail me one bit. And we made sure to go on a Tuesday for Tuesday BLTs! They have the best BLT I've ever had in my life. We ended our meal with the brownie flight for $10 which had three different kinds of brownies. The types are always changing but on the night we went, I liked the toffee brownie best. Yum! They were a bit more dry than I usually like but the flavor was very good.694 has THE best cheese plates, THE best BLTs, THE best grilled cheeses and THE best champages. Plus the prices aren't bad to boot. I wish lived more closely to 694 because it is beyond amazing. Next time I need to remember to get a grilled cheese to go for the next day because I'm madly in love with it.694, I heart you like crazy.

28.description: Came here on a chilly, snowy night in January. Cute little spot tucked in River West. I expected more of a wine by the glass selection, but I think the unreasonably loud music and loud crowd made it an unpleasant experience for my friend and I. We ended up leaving after just one glass of red.I'll venture back here in the warmer months for the cute patio I've heard so much about.

45.description: Yum. Everything is being done right here, or at least that was my experience. There is a cute upstairs deck and upstairs lounge, front seating, inside seating, but the star is the back patio, airy and spacious, private and warm, breezy and shaded. It is inviting and pleasant. Waitstaff is extremely friendly, explains the wines well, and is attentive to the glasses as they get low.For me there were a few highlights here that I don't see often or ever at other places.1) There is a BUTTER & SALT appetizer: Served with sliced Red Hen baguetteThree amazing butters from three amazing regions, paired with three equally amazing sea salts. 8One was hints of parmesan, one was cow with a black salt, one was goat with a red salt. The salt really brings out the taste in the butters and you've never been so excited for a butter appetizer.2) On Wednesday nights only the owner grills on the charcoal grill, this time making amazing chicken and pork chops. The pork came with a hint of mango, steamed asparagus, chives, and was terrific. The sign of good pork grilling: ability to get some edge on the outside while not drying out the inside but still bringing it up to medium or medium-well.3) Wine appears to rotate regularly and is carefully selected. The unisex bathroom was clean and classy, with no wait. This place is tucked down the street from the famed Matchbox bar for a nightcap. What a little gem!

33.description: Funky interior,  but fun.  Very, VERY pleasantly impressed.  Wine and small plates place, the bread and butter is phenomenal.  Had a Groupon, otherwise never would have tried this place, but the experience will definitely bring the wife and I back on another date night, probably with friends.

43.description: This is a very nice wine bar- a little more on the divey side. They have a great wine selection, some good appetizers, and the staff is great. The outdoor seating area is great for a sunny day (or in Chicago, non-rainy and only partially cloudy).

2.description: Stopped by here for a friends birthday. What a great wine bar!The place is really cute. The decorations are different are a great conversation starter.  The service was great. We were able to enjoy different wines. They also have a upstairs area but were weren't able to go up due to a private party. We plan to go back again for some great wines. I may have to go on Wednesday for the secret menu.

18.description: Well, hellllo Juicy...Oops...I mean, 694.  It's been awhile, you see.  I'm still used to referring to the place as Juicy as I've had so many great memories here through the years.  (Just refer to my previous reviews if you don't believe me!)I was a little afraid to see that Juicy morphed into more of a "sports" bar.  Something to appeal more to men.   But, as soon as we set foot in here, I could tell that everything was still the same.  Classy, yet fun atmosphere, as always.  Glad to see that the moscato was still lovely and that the cheese plates were a plenty.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive and, even though we were at a wine bar, clued us into fantastic bourbon.  (Banker's Club, ftw!)    694 is still the perfect spot for one of those chill nights out.  Next on my list to try?  One of those amazing looking paninis.  Yum.

41.description: Have been here twice with friends and it is a great spot for appetizers and eclectic wine. Near my office for after work cocktails and easy to park!

52.description: Loved this place! Everything we ordered was divine, our waitress was so friendly and informative, and the ambiance was perfect - not too casual, but not too snooty. It is a bit pricey, but we came with a Groupon, so that helped. The cheese is phenomenal - I highly recommend the Delice de Bourgogne. You will never want to eat plain old Brie again. We ended up getting a 2nd order because it was so delicious. We also got the Manchego and Gouda, which were outstanding. We got an assortment of meats as well - Salumi, duck prosciutto, pork shoulder prosciutto - all melt in your mouth perfection. The devil's bread was tasty as all hell (hehe) too. I would go back in a heartbeat.

50.description: Buying a Groupon for a business I've never visited worked out this time around. (Trust me - I've had some unfortunate experiences with other Groupon gambles.) For $49, I got $100 worth of drinks and snacks that equated to about two rounds and two plates to satiate me and four others. Not bad, considering the hip setting and quality of products.Ambiance with attitude-On a Friday night, it was bustling but we were able to snag a cozy corner booth. The music was pumping but not too loud that I couldn't hear what the person next to me was saying. Local comic book-type art adorned the exposed brick walls. And despite the small space, the high ceilings made it feel bigger.Sipping and dipping-Glasses of wine ranged around $8-18. I am more into semi-dry reds, while one of my gal pals with me likes sweeter whites. The server was knowledgeable about suggesting what we would enjoy.However, when my husband inquired about the beer choices, the server incorrectly claimed to have a "triple IPA" available from a Grand Rapids, Mich. brewery that we actually visited recently. He ordered this drink and ended up with a tripel dubbel. At least, it was from one of our fav microbreweries - Brewery Vivant.Lastly, the cheese plates are addictive - We loved our super soft Triple Creme with the honey and dried fruit on top of thinly sliced French bread. Just wished it was on a bigger plate overall because it seemed a bit crammed.

4.description: The outdoor patio is so cute! We came here after work one night with a group of friends to enjoy a couple bottles of wine, cheese, and some food. I was intrigued by everything on the menu and loved how they have weekly specials. We tried the "stinker of the week",  manchego, and the creamy sexy blue cheeses along with a bottle Pinot Noir and Malbec. I also had the Angel's Bread while my friends had the Tuna, Devil's Bread, and bacon. The Angel's and Devil's Bread were good but my friend said the tuna was not, and you can't really go wrong with bacon. However, the portions are not terribly large so I wouldn't recommend this place for dinner, but, overall, we had a great time and loved the atmosphere!

6.description: Went here with some girlfriends to continue our happy hour(s), and five of us were able to sit down right away around 7:30pm on a Friday night. Staff gave great suggestions!

22.description: A completely off the beat path wine bar, which is good because that means it doesn't get crazy crowded.  They have the downstairs area which is cozy, upstairs which features a DJ many nights, and the lovely outdoor patio where they grill out.The servers know their stuff, and the owner is a wine genius.  Try the Bigaro, an Italian dessert wine.  Close to a Moscato, but tastier.98/365

15.description: So so good, a friend suggested that I visit to get the best grilled cheese sandwich in town, and boy....it was so good.  The detail to the top notch ingredients cannot be beat.  Truffle honey....yum.....great cheese....just go! And I had the best Moscato.  Great date location!

57.description: The atmosphere, food and drink are all great.  But the place smells terrible of fryer grease or whatever and our clothes and coats all had to go to the cleaners to get the smell out (it was still in our coats 4 days later.  I'm sure you know what I'm talking about....reminds me of a greasy taco joint)  I read this same complaint on one of the other reviews here.  So, if they could fix their ventilation system, we would be back for sure.  Or wait until the summer when the windows are open :-)

20.description: I really enjoyed 694 Wine and Spirits. It is like a cool little hole in the wall that you would probably never wander into if you are not nosey. So I am happy that I am nosey because this place is awesome. While the menu is small, I can actually say I walked away feeling full. I came here with my boyfriend one evening before the rush and I am sure glad we decided to try it out. I have no idea what he was drinking but I know I had a glass of the Hooked Riesling... Um what can I say it was super delicious. Honestly I had a couple of glasses of it.Then we ordered the devils bread which was really good. It had a spicy marinara sauce with smoked paprika salumi and truffle oil on a texas toast type of bread. It was good, But what amazed me was the salt and butter flight. Who ever knew bread and butter could taste soooooo good. Then our waiter suggested that we try the Finocchiona which is just meat that was cured with black pepper corn and fennel and that was delicious. I think we also had the coppa but I don't remember. What I do know I do is that my boyfriend had Valdeon Blue cheese and omg. I took a whiff of that sucker and I swear I almost puked. It was a strong pungent cheese and somehow my boyfriend got me to try some of it. I can honestly say it was rich and creamy, it was good but I good not get over that smell. Its imbedded into my brain. However what made my night was the special of the day which was a grilled cheese sandwich with jelly and bacon. I know it sounds weird but it was actually good. So glad I got to experience this place, I think we will be back soon.

36.description: Great wine bar. Small and quaint on the inside. Good selection of wine and all the menu items we tried were great.  Service was excellent.  Definitely going to make this my new neighborhood wine bar.

14.description: Came here with a friend who could not stop talking about this one wine. Anziano and  Gournier white are my favorites now.  The place is small and tables are actually right next to each other but it was cute. Angel's bread was amazing. We had some cheese and meat as well but I will stick to the bread and meat next time.Street parking wasn't hard at all and we went on a Saturday night around 7.

58.description: the food is amazing! we got the pesto and carbonera pastas and they were delicious! the crepes were even better! Our service was excellent Nadia was our server, she was fast, had a great personality, and was very attentive! you will not regret coming here!

56.description: At this moment and time - (past 12am)I'm thankful we have places open like this, especially when you have an early flight to another state- it's conveniently nearby the blue line train station which takes you to the airport.Anyways I had the bougatsa - I looked at the other reviews and thought I have a late night dessert. It was my first time, I had the genius idea to put Nutella on the ice cream one... Big mistake - it was too sweet. But it was good for first time, it had its flaky crunchy texture on areas not drizzled by caramel or the Nutella and the creaminess and cool ice cream made the temperature hot dessert more enjoyable. Atmosphere is comfortable to talk at night, the worker/busser always hussles to take away trash, and refill your water. I was thankful it was opened conveniently for me to get a little dessert and figure some things out- thanks If I ever come back from California - I'll try something else and give another rating. :)

29.description: Not too bad....we stopped here for an evening coffee and dessert.  Probably should have only ordered a half serving as the full was quite much.  It's been a while since I visited this establishment so I don't remember specifics but I would return.

42.description: Amazing food, great price for Chicago.  Small but large in taste.  Nice atmosphere if you are looking for an out of the way place for a glass of wine and great crepes with anything you can imagine.  Even chocolate and fruit.  My kids loved it!

23.description: Just got a simple vanilla milkshake and let me tell you it is the best shake I have had in a long time. As I was waiting for it I saw them bringing out some delicious looking crepes that I will be back to try!

47.description: This is my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood, if not the entire city itself.Firstly, all types of food, available all the time. I can get the best sweet crepes in town at 2 am.Secondly, their Pasta Carbonora is the best in the city, around 10 bucks, and there is always some to share or take home.Thirdly, the coffee and drinks are delicious and potent. The staff is European mostly and super friendly. This is a must go in Chicago.

8.description: The cafe place is European and open late!The customer service is not so great! The waiters seem to only care for large groups! I always go for the European dream with strawberries on the side and it is delicious!! I have also tried to Neapolitan pasta and it is also good!

31.description: Immediate reaction after eating: loved it, amazing and filling crepes, reasonable priced, yummy chai latte and iguana special frappe, lovely and friendly staffWas walking around after visiting blommer chocolate factory store and on a lark and with the guidance of yelpers decided to stop in for brunch. On a random Monday at 1130, there were a few tables and some people stopping in for a quick coffee to go. So we got a table for 2 and ordered drinks first and got a cold iguana special frappe and a hot chai latte, both were excellent and I usually don't like chai latte and I drank every drop! Then we ordered the the savory crepes (though we heard so many great things about the dessert ones), my wife got the Sparta (with spinach feta, mushrooms, tomatoes and chicken) and I got a create your own crepe which included Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella cheese, black olives and avocado...we kept a menu cause we were worried it was not going to be enough food, but when the food came out we were extremely pleasantly surprised by the size of the crepes and the amount of ingredients inside, and the crepe itself was so yummy, it came with this sauce that was a perfect pairing with the crepes...the server was extremely nice and the water girl was on the ball and very attentive to my water drinking needs (which I love) all in all we brought some of the crepe home and were really happy with everything!

34.description: Coffee tasted great. Bruschetta is absolutely delicious and only $6!Staff are all friendly and attentive too.

16.description: It was late night and I was our craving something sweet so I decided to check the place out based on the reviews and I was not disappointed at all. Service was friendly and helpful and the food and drinks were amazing. I definitely want to come back for breakfast when I'm in the area

13.description: This food is delish.  BUT, the service is blah.  The only person that was attentive was the busboy.  The waitress was busy socializing with the bartender and the other waitress.  I had to signal or call for her four times to order and pay the bill.  I agree with the other reviews, the waitress did not smile nor speak to you.

11.description: I live pretty close to Iguana and have been there several times whether it be for dinner and drinks, brunch or just stopping in for some coffee to go. I'll say that their crepes are pretty damn good, and their coffee as well. They have some decent wine selections too. My only beef on Iguana is there service. Most of the employees are foreign and I believe there is a disconnect to an average Chicagoan. They are friendly and timely in their orders but there is just something missing and I can't quite pin point it. Anyone else get this vibe? Regardless, a great atmosphere and definitely worth a try for pretty much any occasion. Hope this helps. Cheers!

39.description: I have been a regular to this place for the past two years. However, tonight will be my very last time. A group of four of us entered the cafe. We were given a small round table that only seats two people. I had asked the waitress to bring another table. Instead of answering my simple request, she just ran away without even communicating to us. We were later told that the table cannot be given to us because they were reserved. I only saw reserved signs on one of the tables, whereas the other table was clearly free. I decided to let it go and enjoy my meal.When it was time to pay the bill, we were given one check. Being an avid foodie in Chicago, it is customary to give separate checks for the convenience of the customers. Instead, we were told to only pay one bill. He suggested to use the ATM which would be an additional  2.25 charge. We offered to give our individual credit card information for each customer, he still did not oblige. He did not try and help us in any way. Although the food is good, the cafe did not treat their customers respectively. The waitress was rude, and the manager did not offer us any comfort during our dining experience. We were forced to eat in a crammed table and had a dispute on how to pay the bill.I am giving this cafe 1 star due to the terrible way they treated their customers, especially to a regular. Thank goodness Chicago is full of other great restaurants!

37.description: Great spot for lunch or just dessert and drinks! Ordered a variety of items on their menu including wraps and sandwiches, coffee, and savory crepes. All tasted excellent! Free wifi is a plus for working on the go.

0.description: This place is chill, low key and pushed off from a busy intersection (including the subway that runs below)Sandwiches are simple and deliciousCheap prices Literally, a giant iguana cage (I assume?) about a story above the dining roomWill return

38.description: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I've never had such horrible service in Chicago. The owner or manager was SOO rude. We would ask him simple questions about splitting the bill and he got very upset. It was just a simple question.  The waitress just ignored us when we were trying to ask questions about the menu. At the end of the night I told him, his food is good but him and his staff need to work on their customer service, he just denied everything and was rolling his eyes. Very unprofessional! Never coming back here.

51.description: Iguana Café never disappoints. It is the perfect place to catch up friends, especially for desserts and coffee. What makes it ideal for meet-ups is that it is open late [until 2 AM]. My go-to crepe is the chocolate monkey: nutella, banana, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It truly is a taste of Europe.

27.description: Food is good, sometimes the kitchen and waitstaff don't communicate the best and orders are missed. Other times, I get the best service I have ever had. I love the beautiful girls that work here. I hope they find rich guys to marry! They are so sweet. Pasta salad is yummy. Also, the art on the wall is really, really good! Great taste in art!

32.description: We met here for a book club, and I thought it was a good place for a group to meet--had decent parking (had to go over a couple blocks), quiet enough to have a conversation without yelling, spacious, etc. The food was just okay--I would not come here specifically for the food, but it worked well for the purposes that I came there for, so I give it four stars.

54.description: This place was a great surprise! I've passed it many times during the day and it was a welcoming coffee shop. However I went at night for the first time and was pleasantly surprised to find a vibrant, European-style atmosphere. Coffee and full bar options along with desserts or full meals. I had a delicious cappuccino and chocolate cake. My friend had the bougatsa, which was a nice, different option. Live music was a nice touch, enjoyable, but not so loud that you couldn't still hold a conversation. Service was good. I'm really looking forward to going back and trying the crepes.

48.description: Rude, unprofessional and very unwelcoming. Forced us to order something because 3 of us weren't eating. Sharing not allowed. And then they gave us a hard time charging 3 of our cards for it was less than $8 per person. Poor service.

44.description: I love this place and I always feel welcome when I come here (which isn't as often as I'd like, due to the location being far from my apartment). After reading some really negative reviews here I decided to give my two cents and explain why I love this place so much. In the process I plan on addressing some of the complaints I've seen on their yelp page. Firstly, the coffee shop is very nicely decorated and isn't crammed at all. So, coming here for an afternoon get together with friends over some coffee and food is aesthetically pleasing. I was always greeted by the staff nicely and felt welcome. Speaking of the staff, one of you guys is owed a huge thank you for helping me get my friend out of the restroom that wasn't even locked (said friend is simply confused by how doors work). Thanks for helping and laughing it off. Since I've been here quite a few times I can speak for several dishes that I personally enjoy: Savory- Italian sandwich (get the potato salad as a side, much better pairing than pasta salad), carbonara and napolitan pasta, tirokafteri and the Mediterranean plate are great appetizers. They make a good club sandwich as well. If you want a lighter option their salmon salad is a good choice.Sweet- the Greek yogurt and Nutella & banana crepe. Coffee- I've tried a bunch of their coffees, they make European style coffees that taste great. But I'm not going to give suggestions for the coffee, they have so many options I can only suggest you get adventurous and try something you haven't had before, or explore the different syrup options for a custom drink. Now that food and drinks are covered lets talk about the service pace. Yes, it takes a while to get the check. The famed European style service that I hear about and experience a lot when dining in Eastern European places around town (and, well, in Eastern Europe in general) is present here as well. It truly is a thing, and I firmly believe it is due to trying not to have the patrons feel rushed, as opposed to what others have said (facebooking and ignoring patrons for no reason). Having that said, your water glasses will always be full and you will have ample opportunity to order additional items off the menu if you so choose. In a hurry? Don't appreciate the European dining pace? Me too! So now that you've been warned, make sure to mention to your server that you'd like the check to come out with your food and it will. Problem solved. As for the review about split checks and being forced to order food... I split checks just about every other time I go here and it is never a problem. You were asked to order something at a place of business that offers food and beverages? How shocking! Iguana might have a homey feel to it but you are not, in fact, in your own living room. Another thing I should mention for those that live or work around the area but are in a rush and don't have time to sit down and enjoy a meal- call them about 15 minutes before you can come in and place a to go order, your food will be waiting for you and you can merrily go on with your day. Iguana saved me from plenty of bad lunch option days at UIC.

24.description: Decent small place, we went in there last week for brunch. We went more for the food advertised than the coffee part. Overall an ok place except for one huge detail, see below at the last comments.I had one of there crepes, it was good, a little sloppier than id prefer butit still tasted good. We shared the crab/cheese dip app and it was also very good. In fact it was probably the best tasting thing of the whole time we were there. My wife had the chicken sandwich and complained it was very dry. The staff didnt seem too motivated to be serving but we were there early around noon, not sure if thats an excuse or not but whatever. Our server cracked a smile here and there but nothing that made you feel comfortable or made you want to jump at the idea of goin back soon. Pricing was ok i guess, although I can count on one hand an easy number of places that serve much better food in larger portions for the same prices if not less. Overall it wasnt horrible and if I happen to be in the area and hungry enough I may stop by again. One of my BIGGEST disappointments was their Bloody Mary....After a night of normal drinking and waking up the next morning hungry for a good meal and thirsty for a nice hearty Bloody Mary to just start your day off right and set you up for a good day, a place like this you would imagine might offer just that right bloody for ya. Nope, it literally was like they cracked open a store brand can of tomato juice and added vodka to it, thats it! My wife is an experienced bartender so on top of me knowing good drinks thanks to her I also know and understand the level of certain places a place can offer and what can be expected. But there was honestly no excuse for this poor Bloody Mary. They couldve AT LEAST added some lime, and 3 olives as a garnish and it wouldve been an attempt, hell a pickle, celery stick. Salt on the rim, SOMETHING. Haha i never expect a fancy tower of garnishes and a bloody mary that has to be prepared by a chef type of deal but like I said...its not hard to put a toothpick through 3 olives, a squirt of lime and maybe a dash or two of hot sauce and your off to a good start lol. A couple bottles of either Zing Zang or Tobasco's bloody mixes to have around would make a WORLD of difference and still keep your cost down. PS. The live Iguana is in a small window on the back far left side of the wall all the way up top lol

7.description: Cool atmosphere, big portions, delicious crepes-- this has become a favorite date night spot for me! The two times I've been here for dinner, I've opted for pasta (oven baked in a clay bowl with a nice layer of cheese on top!) and crepes, and I definitely recommend both! The first time we came, my date and I were overenthusiastic and ordered a pasta bowl and crepe each-- oops! Way too much food! This past time we shared an appetizer (crab dip- yum!), the carbonara pasta, and a crepe. Even that was too much food! It looks like everything on the menu is delicious, but I'd say order conservatively-- you can always tack on a crepe or five at the end if it's not enough food ;)

49.description: My go to place! We are there almost every week, typing/working away in our favorite spot for 7 to 8 hours, eating delicious crepes, great mochas and awessommmee baked pastas. Fracking great food, authentic ambiance, attentive staff and prompt service. These guys are exceptional.  We've also had several date nights and late night eats. IGCafe is one of my fav spots in the city!FAVORITES: Amsterdam Savory Crepe with onions and Tempting Trio Sweet Crepe with strawberries instead of bananas; mocha with almond milk and their baked pastas! YUMMM

40.description: we went for some drinks and appetizers and were not disappointed. the cheesy crab dip was extremely tasty and the mozzarella basil plate was refreshing. this was a great find for us out of towners.

53.description: I had Bougasta and nescafe. Pretty decent combination. I know what to order next here. This place is open late which is big plus.

30.description: This is my favorite go-to spot for a late night grab.I've never ordered there dinner menu but their crepes are one of the best! I also love the Bailey's chocolate drink. It has a very quiet abd sophisticated ambience. Any crepe you order will always fill you up. Price is pretty decent, since crepes at any good restaurant will be a little pricey. The service is okay, nothing really outstanding. You don't really have to call for a reservation unless you have a big party.If you don't love crepes, you will fall in love with it here!

46.description: This place has a relaxed and casual vibe.  They offer a ton of different items, but my friends went for the crepes.  While I'm usually not a crepe person, these were actually pretty good.  They have a nice menu since there's a ton to choose from and there's enough to keep everyone happy.Very reasonably priced as well!

1.description: Affordable cafe that provides late night options. Definitely a casual date spot - that dim lighting, close seating, a large iguana watching you from one story up... But really, it's definitely a date spot.I had only been for coffee before, but I stopped by on a Saturday with two friends and came in for a late lunch/early dinner and found ourselves waiting... A little too much time passed before we were able to order, and a little to much time passed before we could get the bill (even when we had asked for boxes already). Eh.We all got crepes, and they were affordable (sub $10!) and good portions. I love that they offer alcoholic coffee options!Really cozy spot with decent food at decent prices. I will return!

55.description: Had breakfast with my boyfriend .... we enjoyed their crepes!  Servers are very friendly ...loved the ambience and the decor..it's a good place for brunch too!!

9.description: The decor is amazing. It such a cute little cafe. But upon arrival, we took the hostess a moment to sat us down. That should have been a trigger that everything else was going to be a wait. It took awhile for our crepe to come out when we ordered it the same time as our other food items. Then afterwards, the waitress too so long that we didn't even bother waiting on her to ask for our check so we just paid at the counter instead. It could have been a 4-star if their service was a bit better. I had a croissant sandwich with sausage, egg & provolone. Nothing out of the ordinary. Simple and savory. The table got a hummus plate to share and the hummus was really creamy so it was pretty good. I would recommend sharing this as an appetizer. We also had the creamy caramel creations and the dulce de leche ice cream was what made it stand out. Really good crepe just wish there was more ice cream dab on top. Can't wait to try other crepes!

26.description: I tried their bruschetta for takeout once and it simply put was inedible - it was extremely oily and over seasoned. Needless to say, I won't be back.

25.description: This is 1 of my favorite places in the city. Definitely the best Freddo cafe, food and crepes. The staff is super friend and place is super clean. I highly recommend it.

12.description: Immediate reaction after eating: loved it, amazing and filling crepes, reasonable priced, yummy chai latte and iguana special frappe, lovely and friendly staffWas walking around after visiting blommer chocolate factory store and on a lark and with the guidance of yelpers decided to stop in for brunch. On a random Monday at 1130, there were a few tables and some people stopping in for a quick coffee to go. So we got a table for 2 and ordered drinks first and got a cold iguana special frappe and a hot chai latte, both were excellent and I usually don't like chai latte and I drank every drop! Then we ordered the the savory crepes (though we heard so many great things about the dessert ones), my wife got the Sparta (with spinach feta, mushrooms, tomatoes and chicken) and I got a create your own crepe which included Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella cheese, black olives and avocado...we kept a menu cause we were worried it was not going to be enough food, but when the food came out we were extremely pleasantly surprised by the size of the crepes and the amount of ingredients inside, and the crepe itself was so yummy, it came with this sauce that was a perfect pairing with the crepes...the server was extremely nice and the water girl was on the ball and very attentive to my water drinking needs (which I love) all in all we brought some of the crepe home and were really happy with everything!

59.description: Went with a group of 5 and had a great time!  Cheap drinks and great food and, best of all, a relaxed atmosphere where we felt we could hang out and not be hassled.  We'll be back!

21.description: Came here for dessert after dinner (Velvet Taco) around 9pm Saturday. Our group of three was seated promptly, as there were a few open tables. Soon after though, the place filled up. The space is quite interesting. It's dark and intimate but with a fun eclectic vibe as well with the art and décor. This place seemed perfect for a date night.I ended up getting a cup of the creamy tomato basil soup, a scoop of vanilla and dulce de leche ice cream and a hot pomegranate green tea.Note that their portions are quite large. I thought my cup of soup was really the bowl size. Def not complaining. The soup was delicious and loved the texture as it had chunks of tomatoes in it and wasn't quite your standard tomato basil soup. The ice cream was alright, nothing special there. The tea was perfect and also came in a giant tall mug. It had the perfect note of pomegranate and was definitely brewed with loose leaf tea.I tried my friend's 'Sweet Sin' and that was yummy. Those caramelized apples were perfect. My other friend's brownie a la mode (with mint choc chip ice cream) was good too.Our server was great, even though she appeared to be the only one for the whole place. Definitely need to come back for dinner and try some food and more offerings. Everything seems super fresh and affordable. Also great that they are friendly to those with dietary restrictions.Location seems a bit odd but right by the Halsted #8 bus and the Grand Blue line stop and also walking distance to the West Loop-Randolph and Fulton Market areas.

17.description: One of the places that understands crepes and coffee. I have the one with Nutella, fresh strawberries, almonds and whipped cream whenever I go, with cappuccino on the side. I can also recommend their salmon salad or sandwich. Great taste and presentation. The service is always very good and friendly, which I appreciate.Prices are very reasonable and music is always good. Iguana has a cozy European vibe which reminds me of home.

10.description: The only late night cafe in the area/intersection.  It can get busy, but you never feel that you have to leave.  A true European Cafe where you can enjoy coffee and alcoholic beverages.AFFORDABLE DATE VENUE -- dark, intimate and you can still hear and see your date.  I can't say romantic as there is a TV screen.  Easy commute with access to CTA Blue Line Grand stop.GOURMET EUROPEAN CAKES -- it is popular cakes made by a Greek bakery.  Skip the Red Velvet Cake.  I did enjoy the non-Mexican Tres Leches (the cake icing was odd).  Maybe the cheesecake is a better option, and I am slightly curious if it is European or American cheesecake.BOUGATSA -- a reliable dessert that is unique.  I haven't seen it on many menus.MENU -- diverse from salads, crepes, sandwiches, croissant.PARKING -- limited FREE parking on the west side after the mini bridge and before Iguana Cafe.

5.description: French ever-thang!   Love the food n drank!.  This is a very pleasant place to eat and conversate.

3.description: Lovely little cafe. We just had dessert and coffee, but both were delicious and the service was excellent. The ambience here is relaxed, quiet, and dark. Perfect for a date, studying, having a glass of wine with a friend. If I lived in Chicago this would be my go to.

35.description: This place has a nice, relaxed atmosphere and a huge menu of reasonably priced items to choose from.  For the atmosphere, and the service, I would give it a 4.  But, the food and drinks just weren't that good.  Not bad, just not special.  My pasta dish was okay, but would have been better with more vegetables.  The artichoke spinach dip was not creamy like one would expect, probably because it was mostly spinach.  For drinks I got a mojito and a pomegranate martini.  Both were a little weak, a little too sweet.  So, not bad, just not special.

19.description: A great coffeehouse serving delicious crepes and also offering a solid menu for all day dining - all at a reasonable price. I don't live in the neighborhood so it is a bit of a trek for me but if I lived near the Iguana I would be there often.

28.description: I got the Greek Crepe. Just okay. Not the best.

45.description: Came here late on a Saturday nite and found the vibe to be relaxed and lounge-y. It was mostly groups and even a couple families. The menu featured beer, wine, cocktails, coffee, food, and desserts. The hours are 8am-2am and it seems like they were well equipped to serve all three meals plus cater to the late night crowd. I had the hot chocolate with baileys, European Dream Belgian waffle, and the caramel crepe (can't remember the exact name). Everything was delicious, flavorful, and very rich. In my opinion, the portions were generous considering the price. My friend and I easily could've shared one dessert instead of getting two. The service was fairly good although it took the waitress a little while to come to our table initially and then to take our checks at the end. This seems like a place that people tend to stay at for quite a while so perhaps the staff doesn't want to usher customers out. The waitress was very friendly and more than willing to recommend items on the menu. Someone would also come around and refill my water if it was even half empty. Overall, this place was great and I plan to return! Also, if you look toward the left on the back wall, you'll notice they have a pet iguana :)

33.description: Just randomly Yelp and found this place.. Love the crepe and their selections!! The iced cappuccino is good!! The atmosphere is great!! Totally recommend to my friends who love crepe even to my friends who loves beer.. Can't wait to go back to try their breakfast or brunch

43.description: The carbonara and bruschetta were excellent. We went end of shift. The kitchen closes about 1:30am but the drive was worth it from Rosemont. I'm from Tampa and I will definitely come back!

2.description: Really cute place with a great atmosphere. The server was a little abrupt and I don't think she smiled at all but the crepe was good. We had the chocolate delight which comes with Oreos. It's fantastic. Also, there are actual iguanas in here which I did not expect. Definitely recommend.

18.description: This is my favorite go-to spot for a late night grab.I've never ordered there dinner menu but their crepes are one of the best! I also love the Bailey's chocolate drink. It has a very quiet abd sophisticated ambience. Any crepe you order will always fill you up. Price is pretty decent, since crepes at any good restaurant will be a little pricey. The service is okay, nothing really outstanding. You don't really have to call for a reservation unless you have a big party.If you don't love crepes, you will fall in love with it here!

41.description: This place can sometimes practically be my kitchen. I live in the neighborhood and I am always here. As I write this, the bruschetta is in front of me. They carry a nice stock of teas black and white for hot or iced consumption. They can make all the fancy drinks you can think of. I have never had bad service here, disclaimer I am in the service industry so I get along with staff and we speak the same language. I recommend any of the pastas, in the mood for crepes, they are superb. Desire desert, they have you covered with ice creams, fruits, waffles, desert crepes and much more. Just don't go in and try to buy one thing for five people and then expect to split it five ways on a credit card, that's rude.

52.description: Had a crepe and a couple of drinks here today for lunch. Everything tasted awesome, server was super friendly and helpful. Totally recommend this place.

50.description: The decor is amazing. It such a cute little cafe. But upon arrival, we took the hostess a moment to sat us down. That should have been a trigger that everything else was going to be a wait. It took awhile for our crepe to come out when we ordered it the same time as our other food items. Then afterwards, the waitress too so long that we didn't even bother waiting on her to ask for our check so we just paid at the counter instead. It could have been a 4-star if their service was a bit better. I had a croissant sandwich with sausage, egg & provolone. Nothing out of the ordinary. Simple and savory. The table got a hummus plate to share and the hummus was really creamy so it was pretty good. I would recommend sharing this as an appetizer. We also had the creamy caramel creations and the dulce de leche ice cream was what made it stand out. Really good crepe just wish there was more ice cream dab on top. Can't wait to try other crepes!

4.description: Came here late on a Saturday nite and found the vibe to be relaxed and lounge-y. It was mostly groups and even a couple families. The menu featured beer, wine, cocktails, coffee, food, and desserts. The hours are 8am-2am and it seems like they were well equipped to serve all three meals plus cater to the late night crowd. I had the hot chocolate with baileys, European Dream Belgian waffle, and the caramel crepe (can't remember the exact name). Everything was delicious, flavorful, and very rich. In my opinion, the portions were generous considering the price. My friend and I easily could've shared one dessert instead of getting two. The service was fairly good although it took the waitress a little while to come to our table initially and then to take our checks at the end. This seems like a place that people tend to stay at for quite a while so perhaps the staff doesn't want to usher customers out. The waitress was very friendly and more than willing to recommend items on the menu. Someone would also come around and refill my water if it was even half empty. Overall, this place was great and I plan to return! Also, if you look toward the left on the back wall, you'll notice they have a pet iguana :)

The space is quite interesting. It's dark and intimate but with a fun eclectic vibe as well with the art and décor. This place seemed perfect for a date night.I ended up getting a cup of the creamy tomato basil soup, a scoop of vanilla and dulce de leche ice cream and a hot pomegranate green tea.Note that their portions are quite large. I thought my cup of soup was really the bowl size. Def not complaining. The soup was delicious and loved the texture as it had chunks of tomatoes in it and wasn't quite your standard tomato basil soup. The ice cream was alright, nothing special there. The tea was perfect and also came in a giant tall mug. It had the perfect note of pomegranate and was definitely brewed with loose leaf tea.I tried my friend's 'Sweet Sin' and that was yummy. Those caramelized apples were perfect. My other friend's brownie a la mode (with mint choc chip ice cream) was good too.Our server was great, even though she appeared to be the only one for the whole place. Definitely need to come back for dinner and try some food and more offerings. Everything seems super fresh and affordable. Also great that they are friendly to those with dietary restrictions.Location seems a bit odd but right by the Halsted #8 bus and the Grand Blue line stop and also walking distance to the West Loop-Randolph and Fulton Market areas.

22.description: Cool atmosphere, big portions, delicious crepes-- this has become a favorite date night spot for me!
