8.description: Order the coffee. It's nutty and wonderful. I did not regret it.  I had Eggs Benedict - the sauce was really yummy and we'll flavored. I would highly suggest it. Our waitress was friendly and overall I really enjoyed the experience. The potatoes were also really tasty.  The portions were good sized but not so much food that you would need to take leftovers.

31.description: We enjoy this spot, quality ingredients, big portion sizes.  My wife orders an omelette, I get a skillet.  A bit pricey, but you always have leftovers.  Their is parking on site, but it is tricky to get in and out of. Parking could be an issue, so plan to add that time in.  Wait is less than 5 minutes for a party of 4.

34.description: Polite yet somewhat indifferent wait staff doling out insipid, boring, lackluster food. Mediocre mediocrity with a half-smile.

16.description: I can't think of any other place in the city for warm oat meal and hot coffee. Here I feel at home.

13.description: If I could live above this place I would.  Although then I would probably go here for every meal.  The service is excellent.  Sometimes they offer coffee to go which is a huge plus.  Their Biscuits and Gravy are some of the best I have ever had.  Skillets are excellent, omelettes are huge, and their eggs benedict are on par with any other place around.  Big Shoulders coffee is also fantastic.  Can't say enough great things about this diner.

11.description: My husband and I stopped here for lunch after taking a yoga class at Moksha down the street.  We had a totally delicious, casual lunch.  I had a tuna sandwich and was very impressed.  I think my husband had something with eggs--can't remember what--but I think he got breakfast potatoes and they were really good.They also have iced coffee from Big Shoulders nearby, which is nice.  Overall, a great little place in the neighborhood.

39.description: My favorite neighborhood go-to breakfast spot. The service is always friendly and quick and has a nice clean, bright atmosphere with pictures of old Chicago days gone by on the walls. While my husband I don't have kids (yet!), this is a very family-friendly, vibrant place. We frequent this place on early weekend mornings. We always order the mozzarella sticks (yes, even at 8 a.m.) and either share the tuna melt or get the Health Club (cottage cheese, fruit and veggies, poached eggs, and an English muffin, add cream cheese, please!). They serve Big Shoulders coffee here, which is a little strong and bitter for my taste, but I can doctor it up with cream and sugar. I really enjoy having this place in my neighborhood.

37.description: We just moved to the neighborhood and tried this place last Saturday. Loved it! It's such a neighborhood-y place, packed with locals and super friendly waitstaff.Our waitress, Jennifer, was awesome super attentive and made good recommendations. I had the healthy eggs Benedict and the portion was huge. My husband had a healthy omelette and said it was really good. Good food, friendly staff, clean establishment, and very little wait. We will be back!

0.description: Breakfast is always a great option. A little bit of a wait on a Sunday but what you'd expect. Our waitress was so sweet and very pleasant to talk to! I order the burrito and a bagel. Both very yummy. Their coffee is Big Shoulders and that is some darn good java! I really liked that she gave me a to-go cup too!Place was small, a great diner feel, quick service, food was hot and everything was just delicious. Soaked up the alcohol from the previous night!Would recommend to anybody looking for a great sized portion of a breakfast with plenty of choices for healthy eaters or hungover brunchers!

38.description: A great breakfast spot. Great food prepared with care and amazing multigrain toast. Very reasonable prices and clean.

51.description: This is a pretty solid breakfast spot. I had a Spinach, Bacon & Cheddar omelet with potatoes(very good), toast and Big Shoulders coffee. It gets pretty busy pretty fast. The service is friendly and the prices are reasonable. It's in a pretty good location too for those on public transit.

27.description: I'm a regular here.  Apart from being the closer breakfast/lunch spot to me, it's relatively cheap, delicious and well staffed.  If you like spicy, get the South of Border Skillet.  If you want your traditional pancake breakfast, get one of the clubs. If you want healthy- they got it, I've just never tried it. Don't get their croissant though, unless you plan on using it as a bun. To clean leftover plate sauce.

32.description: Very good breakfast, you're set for about 7-12 dollar per person for a (very) large breakfast!Service is great too, the coffee was free refill and the pancakes were the best american pancakes I've ever had.

54.description: I took my mom here for a birthday brunch yesterday and we were both very pleased with the food. This is saying a lot because my mom is literally one of the judgiest (I know it's not a real word, but I need to use it here. lol) eaters on planet earth. She had the Edgar's skillet which is packed full of meat and cheese. I stole a few bites and was jealous that I didn't pick it as my meal. I had the omelet that was on special that day (forgot the name, sorry). It had avocados, spinach, cheese and applewood smoked bacon. Needed a pinch of salt but was extremely tasty with fresh ingredients. It comes with potatoes and a side of toast but I passed on the toast since mom and I decided to split a half order or french toast. The french toast was easily the highlight of the meal. You don't need too much syrup, they were moist and SO flavorful. I enjoyed every bite. The half order comes with two slices cut into four and it was more than enough for my mom and me to split with our entrees. The service was good, our server was very friendly and he was wearing a hilarious Christmas sweater that said "All I want for Christmas is Beyonce". Minus one star for the small space in the front with virtually no waiting area and my slightly cold potatoes. Despite the minor issues I liked the atmosphere and will definitely be back!

48.description: Food is good. I live down the street but don't come too often. I recommend this place to anyone in the area.

44.description: This place is just walking distance from me and I love it. The people that work in this great diner are always so friendly and accommodating. I usually order the Number 3 half order of french toast, eggs, sausage and my coffee. However my boyfriend ordered a breakfast skillet and that was the bomb! Those potatoes that came in his skillet were made to perfection and that ham was marvelous! I wanted to almost exchange my dish. But nahh, all just come back and order that instead! :-D

24.description: My gripe is they give you one slice of toast with omelet orders, esp take out.   That is a bit of a rip off. $10 omelet should at least get you 2 slices of toast.  2 slices of toast = benchmark

7.description: Great value, fresh food, and great presentation. This was a win.

49.description: My family and I have dined here 2x, and we'll be back for more! My son recently moved to the Ukranian Village and several times a month, I visit him. Our 1st experience with Windy City was noteworthy. Our server, Mujju was informative and attentive. The food quality was superior to other cafes/diners. I told our waiter I had to pay for parking on the street, cause the Cafe is located on one of those weird 6 corners of Chicago. He informed us that parking parallel to the diner was allowed and free and they had a private lot in the back. Good tip!This past weekend, we had the opportunity to dine at Windy City for a 2nd time....yeah! Parked in their private free lot... yeah, again! This time we arrived at the height of Sunday Brunch, 12/noon. Not to panic, the Host was like a orchestra conductor. He took names, watched when guests would leave, so he could clear the table(s) for the next guests, processed payments, and basically pitched in where help was needed. Gotta say, when you have a line of hungry guests at your door, I appreciate the extra effort a Host helps his team.Our waiter, Ross H. was awesome! Friendly, attentive and a sense of humor. Windy City changes their menu with the seasons, which keeps the family owned business interesting and you want to return for more. Our favs are the South of the Border skillet and anything with corned beef hash.

40.description: Windy City Cafe, y u never disappoint? Friendly staff and always quick service. My only suggestion is to stay away from the Sunday church rush. Other than that, I never have a problem getting a seat.

53.description: Great place for breakfast.  We were visiting and wanted to stop by a place before jumping on the highway.  Better value than eating downtown without sacrificing quality and quantity.  I had an egg white omelette with chicken, mushroom, broccoli and cheese...excellent.  Kids and wife also loved their food.

30.description: I came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch with one other friend. The wait was less than 5 minutes and I was able to be seated while I waited for the other member of my party. The best thing about Windy City Café is the expansiveness of the menu. There is something for everyone here. Everything from the healthy to the decadent is covered. I had the smoked salmon benedict and whole grain pancakes. The salmon benedict was delicious. The English muffin was perfectly toasted and buttered. The egg was poached perfectly with a delicious runny yolk. My only disappointment was that it did not come with spinach. The pancakes were moist and fluffy (which for whole grain pancakes isn't a given). If you like diner breakfast WCC takes that fare up a notch. I'll definitely return.

46.description: Great selection (HUGE menu) and good service.  Had the Farmer's Omelet and it was absolutely delish.  Just the right amount of goat's cheese with spinach and chicken sausage.  I was pleasantly surprised with the side of fruit as it was fresh and had better types of fruit than other breakfast places.  My boyfriend loved the buffalo chicken wrap.  Great coffee.  Definitely coming back.

1.description: I popped into this place for lunch on a random weekday.  Sadly, I was too hungry to stop and take a picture of my food.  But that's a good thing, right?To start off, I wish I could give 3.75 stars.  This is a cute little place with a decent sized menu and ingredients seem nice and fresh.  I ordered the Caesar Wrap from their lunch menu.  Their breakfast menu looks really tempting, but it was past that "Oh, it's not too late to order breakfast" cut off time for me.  Thus, I ordered lunch.Location, easy peezy from CTA Blue Line stop.  Parking, however, looks to be paid only on the major streets.  Clean and tidy.  Friendly staff.  There is a back room for additional seating, so don't let the smallish front part scare you away.The wrap was decent.  Not exciting, but good.  Filling.  I have to admit I didn't order anything out of my "comfort zone" (the Caesar Wrap was my second choice.  My first choice on the menu had been discontinued very recently) so I ordered something simple.  But it was good. My only question was.... why are there tomatoes in a Caesar Wrap?  Caesar salads don't come with tomatoes.So, if you are in the area, this is a nice place to check out.  I'd definitely aim for breakfast. Their menu looks pretty good.

55.description: Good food, good people. Great spot for breakfast or lunch, and you won't have to wait long(or at all) to get a table like most other places in the city on Saturdays and Sundays. Food is basic but still really good. Price is great too.

9.description: We happened upon this place due to other Yelp reviews and we were pretty happy with our decision. The prices were reasonable and the portions were generous. The service was good, but the coffee was just okay.

26.description: This place awesome! I went for breakfast there this morning. They have a huge selection, lots of vegetarian friendly options. I opted for the veggie benedict with a fruit cup - nice and filling. They even put the hollandaise sauce on the side (I took it to go) so it wouldn't get messy. Great service, delicious food, awesome price point - everything you want in a local breakfast spot.

25.description: I have been a customer for about five years now and I've never been disappointed in the service, staff or food.  I've tried just about everything on the menu but my favorites are the frittatas, hangover burger, and the salmon eggs benedict.

12.description: Terrible line management upon entering paired with a member of the wait staff lecturing us about the inner door being opened as if she was our parent wasn't a great experience. This should be rectified as I'm sure I'm not the only one who has had a negative experience like this.

59.description: Growing up and now living as an adult in this neighborhood, I've really tried to give this place plenty of chances. While the food is generally good, it lacks many diner qualities. Cons: -The service is slow. Don't think you can order out either because you'll wait just as long.-I've had my order mixed up on my last three visits now. -The prices are pretty higher for a diner. $6 for a bowl a soup? $12 for an omelet? For that price I'll go to Summer House. Pros:-As I mentioned, the food generally tastes good-Friendly wait staff

21.description: Order the coffee. It's nutty and wonderful. I did not regret it.  I had Eggs Benedict - the sauce was really yummy and we'll flavored. I would highly suggest it. Our waitress was friendly and overall I really enjoyed the experience. The potatoes were also really tasty.  The portions were good sized but not so much food that you would need to take leftovers.

17.description: Huge, huge menu, very friendly hipster-ish staff, eclectic clientele (big table of cops, neighborhood guys, families with kids), low prices, quality diner food (as someone else mentioned, fresh-squeezed juice at low prices was really nice surprise!), large portions.  What's not to like?

10.description: This place awesome! I went for breakfast there this morning. They have a huge selection, lots of vegetarian friendly options. I opted for the veggie benedict with a fruit cup - nice and filling. They even put the hollandaise sauce on the side (I took it to go) so it wouldn't get messy. Great service, delicious food, awesome price point - everything you want in a local breakfast spot.

5.description: Great diner in River West.  It's an easy spot to grab a good breakfast on a saturday or sunday ( or any day!).  The menu is large with lot of options and the prices are great ($28 for two breakfasts and two coffee's).  Service is beyond friendly and they really strive to create a welcome environment.  I also never felt rushed, despite the line out the door.

3.description: They're friendly. And everything looks clean. Seems like their menu is always under construction. I've been here 3 times and every time I order something they hit me with the "ohhhhhh, we don't have that today.." Even though it's a "cafe" the don't have anything but plain old coffee. No lattes, cappuccinos... The plus though is that the coffee they do have is from "Big Shoulders Coffee" from across the street. Yelp them. They're awesome. Anyways, don't come here for dessert, for you will be highly disappointed like I was the first time. Oh, and they close at 3 pm.

35.description: Probably one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. I ordered a veggie skillet. It was very very very fresh, I actually ate all the vegetables. The only downside is that my water tasted a little funky and the the food took a little to come out, otherwise it was amazing!

19.description: This place is just walking distance from me and I love it. The people that work in this great diner are always so friendly and accommodating. I usually order the Number 3 half order of french toast, eggs, sausage and my coffee. However my boyfriend ordered a breakfast skillet and that was the bomb! Those potatoes that came in his skillet were made to perfection and that ham was marvelous! I wanted to almost exchange my dish. But nahh, all just come back and order that instead! :-D

28.description: My husband and I stopped here for lunch after taking a yoga class at Moksha down the street.  We had a totally delicious, casual lunch.  I had a tuna sandwich and was very impressed.  I think my husband had something with eggs--can't remember what--but I think he got breakfast potatoes and they were really good.They also have iced coffee from Big Shoulders nearby, which is nice.  Overall, a great little place in the neighborhood.

45.description: Super friendly service, delicious food (and a massive menu), cosy and bright atmosphere. And my coffee cup was never half empty before a top-off was offered.  Great place all around.

33.description: I live in River West and this is definitely my go to spot whether by myself, or if I have family/friends visiting. The staff is very friendly, the service is quick, and the food is delicious. They use Big Shoulders Coffee (across the street) which is awesome!Some of my go-to items incude the "Capone Burger" and any of their egg's benedict. I really don't think you can go wrong here. Keep up the good work!

43.description: Went to brunch here after Pilates at West Town Pilates, and it was absolutely amazing! While the place doesn't seem huge upon entry, there is a second room around the corner that allow for more seating and has several booths. The potions were generous but not too huge, and the price was excellent! Our server was polite, attentive, and offered various suggestions and modifications to accommodate the diets of our group. The huevos rancheros was prepared very well, with the eggs not too runny, and just enough salsa verde. The biscuits and gravy were not soggy or mushy, but also not dry, which seems to be a challenge for some other restaurants. Th coffee was also delicious, and is roasted just across the street, and the servers were quick to fill an empty mug. I would definitely go again, and would recommend to a friend/family member.

2.description: Good place to relax on a lovely Sunday.  My favorite things are the wraps, cinnamon bun French toast, breaks fast burrito and their pancakes.  Yum.Update:  The Buffalo Chicken Wrap could have been better.  It was literally breading with hot sauce, diced tomatoes, lettuce and a little blue cheese.  I barely and I do mean barely had any chicken. Disappointing.

18.description: Came in for very late breakfast 45 minutes before closing.  We were cheerfully greeted, and our late breakfast omelette a were prepared to order perfectly!! I love the fluffy moist egg white (up charge $1.50 for egg whites only) omelets here!!! They were out of mushrooms so we were allowed to request a substitute vegetable. Found out that Windy City Cafe has over 30 kinds of bread, including marble rye and multigrain, you can choose for your toast! No up charge for tomato slices or a 1/2 cup of fresh fruit instead of potatoes with your eggs!! Love this.The husband's omelet was soft without brown edges anywhere, just the way he likes it!  I love not listening to, 'No one can properly cook eggs anymore! The test of a good chef is how well the eggs are cooked.' while trying to enjoy my meal!Lovely and on a tropical Chicago Monday afternoon.Now, that's how I like it!!!!

41.description: Ordered a breakfast sandwich.   It's nothing to write home about.   The english muffin wasn't even toasted.   I won't be back, the traffic isn't worth it.

52.description: You can find me here at least twice a month on a weekend morning and although it is always crowded, I've never waited more than 10 minutes for a table. Everything I've ordered has been wonderful and the service is always excellent (coffees and waters always filled).

50.description: Great food, GREAT service, great prices, and great variety on the menu. Haven't been disappointed yet

4.description: My favorite diner in the River West area. The food is good and the staff is friendly. They also have parking in the back. Yesss, I would definitely recommend them!

6.description: This is a great neighborhood diner that is on my rotating breakfast spot. The food is delicious, the service is top notch and the prices are reasonable. I highly recommend

22.description: I am a big fan of egg bennies and this place is on point. Great service and decent prices.

15.description: Very good food.  Also very conveniently located next to St. John Cantius for after Mass meals.  Food is good and decor is comfortable for a breakface place.

57.description: Great food for a great price and friendly service. I recommend the huevos rancheros, but you can also piece together a great meal from the list of sides.

20.description: I love this place! Great customer service! Great food! Great prices! and Great music!

36.description: Just moved to the area and went for breakfast this morning and had the linebacker omelette. It was fantastic and so were the potatoes.

14.description: Friendly staff and a big menu started our lunch. I ordered my typical lunch salad and it was tasty. In hindsight I should have been more adventuresome. Be prepared for a short wait, it's busy and vibrant. All the other entrées I saw looked delicious and few plates had anything left for taking home. Can't wait for my next visit, I'll definitely avoid my standard salad.

1.description: DO NOT ARRANGE A PICK UP DONATION WITH THIS PLACE!i am livid right now! I arranged a pick-up two weeks in advance for several items including a sectional sofa, washer, and dryer among several other things. Like the reviewer above, I waited and waited only to have them not show up and not call. I call to see what happened and they tell me their truck got full so they didn't pick up my stuff.Um, what?!?!?!!!?? You knew what you were picking up for the day why didn't you prepare accordingly. Further, why did I have to call YOU to find this out.  Then these fools tell me they can pick it up on the 1st. But there's just one problem, I NEED TO BE OUT OF MY CURRENT PLACE ON THE 30TH! I have absolutely zero room for all the items I'm donating at my new place and no time to sell. Disgusting. I'm trying to give away items (nice items not junk) and this is how I'm treated. Ugh!

2.description: I schedule a donation pick-up for an estate.  The potential pick-up time was to between 8am - 4pm on the given day.  On the day of pick-up I waited and waited and waited.  I called around 12:30pm to validate  the appointment.  4pm arrived and no one ever came.  No one called.  Nada.These people are completely unreliable.  I will never do business with them again.  They are completely unprofessional.

0.description: Salvation Army will never ever receive a penny from me!!I have been waiting since 8AM for a couch pick up and no one showed up. I called several times and each time I was cut off by the dispatcher and transferred to a voicemail. After the 4th call and bitching at the dispatcher I finally got connected to a human being. And he tells me the driver started from the wrong side and there are 4 people ahead of me and can't guarantee they will pick up the couch.What kind of business are they running?! No accountability and horrible customer service. I will donate to goodwill, screw Salvation Army.

58.description: This place is about as spacious as a hallway and the service on the patio is questionable, but boy do they have a quality old fashioned.  They are not skimpy on the good cherries here either.  Despite the cramped quarters, those old fashioneds will bring me back here for sure.  Maybe I'll even try the mysterious gin and jam next time.

56.description: This bar has the best drinks in the neighborhood. They make a mean Pisco Sour and it's hard to order wrong when all the drinks are made this well. They have a large amount of seating outside and that is much more comfortable than drinking inside. It's the size of a matchbox so if you are drinking at the bar inside every 40 seconds someone will graze your back trying to make it down the narrow walk to the bathroom. That can be annoying. It gets less annoying the more you drink. The bartenders here are awesome. Inside this bar you really feel like you've left the city and are in your own little world.

29.description: I love this place, it's one of my top places to get a drink it the city. Cocktails are amazing and they make the best Gimlets. People complain about rude pretentious bar tenders but they're what makes the place. Nothing makes me happier than to hear them talk to dumb girls who "like OMG want a Cosmo like literally"

42.description: I used to bike past this place every day or two. The Matchbox is small. It is very very small. If you get a seat at the bar keep it. Hold on tight because in five or ten minutes the place will be packed and you will basically hug everyone who walks past. Oh, there is that guy who sits and pretends to read! I get a kick out of that! Man, he can do perhaps 1 page every 10 minutes. Oh, but the atmosphere. This place has it. It has the after workers, the graduate students going on about gentrification (which they cause), and the industry people here having a beer. You may see lots of bartenders and servers from other places. I did. I thought that was funny. Lots of "Haven't you?" or "Don't you?" and that wasn't me. Anyhow, if you can find a seat or a wall to hang against grab a beer or a cocktail and hang for a bit. Classic Chicago joint.

23.description: If we're being honest...and as most know, I usually am.  I was walking home from Binny's in Lincoln Park and my bladder was starting to protest.  I have been curious about this odd little Bar since I moved here last May.  I get off the Blue Line right across the street when I am traveling for business and I always look across at it when waiting for Uber to arrive.  I decided to stop in and have a drink so I didn't feel guilty about using the loo.  What an awesome surprise!  It's shaped like a sliver of aged cheese with pressed tin ceiling and a brick outer wall.  The spirits selection is impressive and they have a few decent craft beer choices.  The wine selections look decent as well.  I am guessing this place holds 30-40 people tops.  The bartenders are super nice and last but not least the cocktails are the most reasonable priced I have found for the quality in Chicago.  You should add this to your list of places to try in Chicago.  Next time I fly home and get off the Blue Line stop at Chicago Ave., I think I will stop here for a wee nip before I summon Uber

47.description: It has been too long since I came here for a cocktail!  Ha ha, looking back at my old review in 2007, my cocktail taste has definitely changed.  If you want a classic non pretentious dive for a classic cocktail, go for it.

8.description: Oh, Matchbox. If only you'd been five minutes closer to my apartment -- then, I really would have been a regular.This place is small (ok tiny, but everyone else's review can hit this point), but it feels more comfortable than that (except when you're skirting by five people to get to the bathroom). It looks like a dive, but it feels more like a no-nonsense bar where you go for some drinks. It doesn't have a specific time or occasion -- it is there for whatever you may need. I don't know how to explain it, but I just felt welcome here.I'm not big into cocktails, but the cocktails here came in a reasonable end (all of the normal things) and a higher end (fancier drinks). I had something made with jelly and gin that was shaken up and it was delicious and I would get it a million more times.Good beer selection too! Some interesting things, some normal ones, more or less reasonable prices.When it comes to it, five star reviews are reserved for places that force me to give them. As a consumer, I really value feeling welcome and belonging -- and I got that sort of calm, no-nonsense vibe here.

31.description: The Matchbox may possibly be my new favorite bar for cocktail drinking.  The bartenders are very knowledgable and are perfectly consistent with their drink creations. I recommend the sidecar which is a classic but strong and delicious.   I couldn't believe how good the service was despite the crowd.  The bartenders are very laid back and the patrons are extremely friendly (mostly regulars).  I was lucky to fall upon this bar while walking through river west and turns out it is the smallest bar in Chicago.  I hope to return soon :)

34.description: When you are entertaining out of town friends, you try and provide them with the best Chicago experience, even if their idea of "going out" involves Bud Light and horseshoes (oh them Nevada folks).  After dining at one of my favorites- Ada Street- I looked for a bar to continue the evening, as uncomfortable as it already was.How I would describe Matchbox (besides the aforementioned tiny): In one of the many, MANY OK Cupid quizzes, there's one that asks what a perfect first date would be: a really divey bar, a nice restaurant or a day at the beach (there might be one more choice but I can't remember).  Matchbox is an oxymoron- an upscale divey bar.   If you judge a book by it's cover, you will be sorely disappointed when you miss out on stellar drinks (try the margarita), a decent bottle beer selection, a pretty extensive choice of liquors, and the caveat of "no red bull, no Jager." (praise Jesus for that one).  Yes, it's cozy, but if you're on a date, what better way to see how the night is going to turn out than being squished up against someone (unless, like me, the person you are with is completely uninterested in you).I will mention that I found one of the bartenders to be friendlier than the other, which would bum me out if I came here alone but otherwise wasn't a big deal.Definitely this place is bookmarked for good.

16.description: We were told to come to the matchbox to experience real bar in Chicago. I think it's the narrowest bar in the planet. It's really cool though. You definitely get to know people around you. We tried a couple drinks there. The woodmans are really good and refreshing. They make the best margarita and old fashion. Totally recommend coming to this place.

13.description: im visiting from california. on the night on 12/13/15 i came to this bar around 6pm-7pm and the bartender was bluntly rude, giving me the most stalest answers back. visiting from another state and reading all the yelp reviews i expect some kind of customer service but it seemed like right as we walked in (being a group of asians) he had this attitude that could be handled with a ass whooping back home but i kept calm and continued to ask questions on what he did have, politely of course. after answering no to all my questions, i decided to leave. i wasnt greeted as i walked in or out. to the bartender working that night. go fuck yourself, you are a blight in the world. idk why this bar has good reviews. its fucking tiny! the walk-way into the bar is no wider then 2/12 ft wide. fuck this place.

11.description: it might be the smallest bar in the city, hardly anywhere to stand, tho i suppose if you can get a seat at the bar its ok, but still you gotta keep scooting up for people to walk by, but i suppose thats the charm, some good beers on tap, reasonably priced, tho i doubt id come back cuz its so small

39.description: This place is pretty amazing, but a star off because cramped quarters are not my thing.  Is it worth a visit though?  As long as you've braced yourself to get VERY cozy with everyone in the bar, yes!We arrived shortly after 5 on a Tuesday and snagged two of the few chairs left (yes, at 5:15 most of the 15ish bar stools were taken!)  Drinks are delicious and reasonably priced.  My friend drank Ladybirds all night (gin, ginger and yellow chartreuse concoction).  I sampled the pisco sour (pretty solid), the gin & jam (sweet but worth a try, it's definitely different - any yes, there's literally jam in it) and the Ladybird.  Word to the wise: eat first.  After 4 cocktails each, we were pretty gone.  We snacked on the salt & vinegar chips available, but regretted that decision the next day....  if you're looking to drink in moderation, you're in the wrong bar ;)

37.description: Nothing but great things to say about the Matchbox.  It has everything you can want in a bar:  friendly, knowledgeable bartenders; a superb drink list featuring classic as well as modern cocktails; a great beer list with a couple of cool Belgium beers; and shockingly good wine should you be in the mood for that.  We've never had a bad time here, and it really is thanks to the bartenders, who couldn't be nicer and make a mean cocktail.Word to the wise:  it is very small, so get here early and snag a seat.  It opens at 4pm, so it's a great early bar should you want to get the day started before the normal 5pm bar opening time.79/365

0.description: This has been our favorite go to bar for years. Go here. Order a vodka gimlet. Drink and repeat. You're welcome.

38.description: It's a dive bar is fantastic cocktails. Reasonably priced. Right next to the Blue Line. Nothing else matters as long as you can find a spot to stand (it's rather small). If you're hungry, there's the Silver Palm right next door.

51.description: It's already been established how tiny this place is so I won't bother mentioning it.  I will mention that they have an absolutely amazing selection of liquors, with an equally amazing bartender that was a master of his craft.  I went on a very uncrowded Saturday afternoon.  This was the perfect place to have a perfect martini with an old pal.  There's no other place like it.  This place is a must.

27.description: If you don't like the grit of this place, then this place just isn't for you. This place is small, if you don't get in, or if you are cramped........its always expected, don't base your review on level of service, because.......they don't care. And neither should someone going to 'the smallest bar in chicago'.I believe that only a few places do certain things extremely well, and you should judge those places, based on those few things. Get a margarita. Order the 1/2 ribs. Order the shrimp cocktail.If you do this, you should expect to give a great review - Service is by bikers.....so you shouldn't rate just based on that (because its not bad......its just cold/expected). If you want warm service w/ great bartenders, go to the Silver Palm, which is basically the same place (upstairs). Then, and only then, should you order the fantastic fish tacos and many other their other great food options.

32.description: I don't get it, or maybe I do. The matchbox is the size of a matchbox. It's a tiny bar that seems like it was built as an afterthought and smells exactly like a college frat house. We came here on a recommendation of a rather lovely gal and was sorely disappointed. The bar is small enough for patrons to sit at and just enough room behind the seat for ppl to walk by and bump you with their sweaty arms. The drinks are alright, they looked imaginative and the tenders make a large portion. They shake up your drinks and give you the shaker to pour out the rest. I wanted to give this place 2 stars, however, the drinks bumped it up. The drinks are cheap, sweet and refreshing. I suppose if the outside area was open my review would be completely different. I just, hate the smell of college frats.

54.description: You just can't find places like this anymore. Authentic and original. The Sidecar was awesome!

48.description: The name of this bar, Matchbox, is very apropos to the space. It is simply one long bar. The decor is very casual and relaxing. Seats up to 29?! Depending on the crowd it can fill up very quickly and without a seat can be very tight. The people are friendly as many times I've frequented. They have their popular powdered sugar gimlets but they also have a pretty decent whiskey collection. Their prices are very fair & the bartenders' alcohol pour are generous. No food. Unless you consider a bag of chips fuel for the stomach which it had been for me on several occasions.Definitely a stop on the dive bar crawl. It's easy to become a regular there. Oh and there's a silver train diner parked just behind the place. Never been inside but an excellent visual nonetheless.

44.description: If we could, both Rob Thomas and I would give this place 20 stars. Since we can't 5 will have to cover it. Not necessarily applicable in this winter weather, but the patio is pretty dope with way more seating on the sidewalk then inside the bar itself. Until a warmer climate comes you''ll have to fight for one of the maybe 30 spots inside, but if you're lucky enough to get one you'll enjoy awesome drinks cheaper than almost any craft cocktail bar in town.Perfect to post up at alone and enjoy some convo with the bartenders or bring a date to showcase your coolness. Matchbox makes for an awesome spot to start off a night of almost any occasion if you're not rolling with a deep crowd.

24.description: I'm still working my way around the area, but this is way up there with my favorites. It's tiny, touting being "Chicago's most intimate bar". That's not a lie, it's very little, like nine stools in a hallway, and it's divey. But the beer selection was very good, they also made Old-Fashions and other cocktails with great care. Silverpalm next door is amazing as well, I believe there owned by the same people.

7.description: This place is definitely small, or should I say narrow.  I stopped in before happy hour though, so I was able to nab a seat.  Right in front of the show too (where the bartender mixed up fine concoctions that had me at hello).  It's dark and a great place to come if you just don't feel like dealing with the world or the hassle of a busy trendy bar.  The cocktails are on point, and I did get checked for my ID.  Kudos to the bartender for being on the right side of the law.  The music brought me back to a time before I was 21... Portishead.  I actually stayed longer because I felt like I was in a perfect time warp.  A few creepers straggled in, but I kept to myself and then ordered a Please and Thank You.  Rightful moniker too, I would have followed it with a "yes SIR, may I have another!!, " but it's still mid day and I had to drive home.  It tasted creamy and gingery.  If I had to date a drink, it would be this one.  Bourbon, brandy, apple pie shrub, demerara, lemon, and ginger beer.  Topped with citrus peel, and the straw right through.  I am for sure coming back, probably around the same time, as I've seen other yelpers having difficulty grabbing a seat later.  #doyouevenmatchboxbro  Yes, yes I do.  btw, there are no "bros" here, thank the lord.

49.description: Solid drinks that are not wimpy, great atmosphere and always interesting people in there.  Great selection of spirits!Patio is nice in the summer.  The service is consistent.  The place is small on the inside.

40.description: The Matchbox is a great hangout.  Tiny, and quaint - with knowledgeable bartenders.  The Blue line is right across the street, so a very convenient for people visiting from out of town.

53.description: Small, narrow watering hole that holds a very eclectic vibe.  Great hidden gem if you're looking for a unique drink in a unique location.

30.description: Went in 8/15.When I walked in I realized just how small this place is. We weren't sure if out door seating was seat yourself. As I stood at the bar while the bartenders were figuring out what kind of shot they wanted to take I interrupted to ask. Yes. Seat yourself and he said first come first serve? We sat ourselves on a sticky, unbalanced table. We waited about 5 minutes before we were greeted. Where I had to ask if the table could be wiped down. The menus were really sticky as well.I went with the mule and my friends went with the gimlets.The drinks were really delicious. I really enjoyed sitting outside. Our server seemed un interested in us,  I felt like we had to flag her more than her actually popping in.No small talk nothing.  She's a blonde with a pixie.We ordered guacamole,  calamari,  and bruschett a,All amazing. We asked the server for a salad about 20 minutes after our apps,  and she told us they already had last call. (Which we weren't told)She then said she'd ask if the kitchen could throw a salad together,  and literally never came back,  until they closed the patio.Even when closing the patio I felt like they were really rude. Why would you bring me a full drink ten minutes before you close the patio, then say everyone has to drink up. It was awkward.Food and drinks really good. Service.  Pretty bad.  This could have been a 5 star.

46.description: smallest bar in Chicago! decent parking around the area.. good vibe! good prices!look for a bartender named Trino ! dude is nice and will make anything you want from fruity girly drinks to i wanna black out drinks.

1.description: It's small. It's a bar.They have a few beers on tap and they are more unique options, which was nice to try. Lots of rye, whiskey and bourbon options for people that like those drinks. They have a TV, but since it's so small in there you really have to strain your neck to get a view of it. All in all, I would stop back in if I were in the area, but I'm not settling up weekly visits any time soon.

55.description: Love Matchbox.  Best Gimlets anywhere. I'd 5 stars but they need more tables outside as inside is well, a matchbox.  Always a great place to grab a drink plus Silver Palm is next door and same owners so bonus.

9.description: Its a bit tight on the inside - hence the name, but what they lack in size they make up for in strength - of their cocktails.  Generous pours at the watering hole, highlight are martinis and ice cold bottles of beer. I never pass by and don't stop in for a taste here.

26.description: Great cocktails hands down. Tony the bartender rocks.nice neighborhood spot.

25.description: Great drinks. The space lives up to the name, you ar certainly a match in the box with no wiggle room. Perfect for the datin' and romancin' folks. Excellent drinks.

12.description: Good ambiance, tight squeeze, and fruit flies in your drink. What more could you want from a Chicago strong hold.

59.description: Best bar in Chicago. Good beer. Great cocktails. You can order deliciousness from next door. It's small and cozy enough that you can talk with everyone there. The resulting impracticalities (the restroom; sometimes getting hit with a door) weed out the folks who would rather be on Hubbard or in Wrigleyville. The service is always spot on. Love it.

21.description: After 2 years, our extensive research and data collection has lead us to the conclusion that the Matchbox best ginger gimlet that Chicago has to offer...  Especially when Chris is behind the bar and accents the cocktail with his fabulous rim job.... A special nod to Colleen who comes in a close second.  LUV this place and happy to see cheetos return on the menu...

17.description: Went in 8/15.When I walked in I realized just how small this place is. We weren't sure if out door seating was seat yourself. As I stood at the bar while the bartenders were figuring out what kind of shot they wanted to take I interrupted to ask. Yes. Seat yourself and he said first come first serve? We sat ourselves on a sticky, unbalanced table. We waited about 5 minutes before we were greeted. Where I had to ask if the table could be wiped down. The menus were really sticky as well.I went with the mule and my friends went with the gimlets.The drinks were really delicious. I really enjoyed sitting outside. Our server seemed un interested in us,  I felt like we had to flag her more than her actually popping in.No small talk nothing.  She's a blonde with a pixie.We ordered guacamole,  calamari,  and bruschett a,All amazing. We asked the server for a salad about 20 minutes after our apps,  and she told us they already had last call. (Which we weren't told)She then said she'd ask if the kitchen could throw a salad together,  and literally never came back,  until they closed the patio.Even when closing the patio I felt like they were really rude. Why would you bring me a full drink ten minutes before you close the patio, then say everyone has to drink up. It was awkward.Food and drinks really good. Service.  Pretty bad.  This could have been a 5 star.

10.description: If I'm in the mood for a cocktail, I go to The Matchbox. In my opinion- it is the best gin gimlet in town. I suggest going on a weekday when it is quieter.. or in the summer when you can utilize the patio space.

5.description: Meh. Nothing special, and its a pain to come with a group because they don't allow splits on credit cards.  The only thing keeping us coming is that there are not many nearby options.... Matchbox is too small.

3.description: Literally a hole in the wall. This place is tiny and made a little person like myself slightly claustrophobic. I truly wonder how grown men can sit elbow to elbow like sardines and have a good time. The alcohol probably helps...Only one bartender that doesn't seem too chipper. He seemed pretty shocked that we ordered straight shots and the concept of shot glasses also don't exist in his world. He pretty much served us a half a glass of vodka each (equivalent to at least 2 shots). The shot in itself was also warm and did not go down smoothly. We also tried their Dark and Stormy which was AVERAGE and their banana daiquiri which was borderline undrinkable. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

35.description: I had always enjoyed my trips to the Matchbox: terrific cocktails, affordable prices, "intimate" setting. Ask me a couple weeks ago, I would have had nothing but praise for this bar.I recently went with some friends, and after my latest experience I will never, ever return. We were sitting at the end of the bar having drinks and some pizza. (Normally you can order in from the hotel restaurant next door, but since the place was temporarily closed, the bartender recommended the pizza joint across the street.) I hadn't paid much mind to the folks next to us until one of the guys left, returning a few minutes later with an unmarked white box. The contents of this box? Several hunks of raw meat. Which he proceeded to remove from the box, place on the bar, and cut into smaller pieces for his friends. Did the bartenders ask him to stop? Did it ever occur to them that raw meat on a bar is a pretty significant health hazard? Of course not: the guy was cutting the meat into pieces for the bartender. Admittedly I can be a little bit sensitive about things I find icky, but I rather think that raw meat on the bar can reasonably be considered unacceptable for a certified public eating and drinking establishment. I am never going back to this bar and I sincerely hope that they get shut down.

19.description: This place is about as spacious as a hallway and the service on the patio is questionable, but boy do they have a quality old fashioned.  They are not skimpy on the good cherries here either.  Despite the cramped quarters, those old fashioneds will bring me back here for sure.  Maybe I'll even try the mysterious gin and jam next time.

28.description: Can't live without this lovely slice of heaven. Best margaritas (according to CNN, second best in the country).Awesome ambiance.No bullshit.Best bartenders.Best food from sister restaurant, the Palm (try: veggie burger, fried, asparagus and ribs)If you don't agree, please don't come back - I'll happily hog your spot!

45.description: This was a great little surprise. The staff is super friendly and helpful, and the drinks were great-- I loved the maple leaf. It's very small, but it's a fun little place that's off the beaten path. Wouldn't plan on spending the whole night here, but if you're in the area and want a couple drinks or are looking for a unique find to add to the list, this is definitely a good spot.

33.description: It tries so hard to be cool, kitchy, and hip(ster), in one of the cool Chicagoan neighborhoods (it's kinda cool).  But, when have a place that is indeed the size of a matchbox, it's impossible to go during any hours respectable to grab a drink.  Fortunately, I was drinking when it was not indeed respectable, so rather enjoyed myself, but it was still almost impossible to find a seat.It's one of those places you have to try at least once, because of its trendy appeal, but it'd be hard to go regularly if every time you might not actually get to stay.

43.description: wonderful. tiny, little bar. the bartenders here surely know how to make a drink and they do it without pretension. the weekends can be a bit of a sardine can but once you get your order to your lips it'll be worth it.

2.description: This place has it all:Small: YupCheap Drink options: CheckSurly Bartender: Fo ShoGents who appear to be regulars looking at you funny because you wore a cardigan sweater: Indeed that happened.Overall good time: You Bet Your A$$$

18.description: When you are entertaining out of town friends, you try and provide them with the best Chicago experience, even if their idea of "going out" involves Bud Light and horseshoes (oh them Nevada folks).  After dining at one of my favorites- Ada Street- I looked for a bar to continue the evening, as uncomfortable as it already was.How I would describe Matchbox (besides the aforementioned tiny): In one of the many, MANY OK Cupid quizzes, there's one that asks what a perfect first date would be: a really divey bar, a nice restaurant or a day at the beach (there might be one more choice but I can't remember).  Matchbox is an oxymoron- an upscale divey bar.   If you judge a book by it's cover, you will be sorely disappointed when you miss out on stellar drinks (try the margarita), a decent bottle beer selection, a pretty extensive choice of liquors, and the caveat of "no red bull, no Jager." (praise Jesus for that one).  Yes, it's cozy, but if you're on a date, what better way to see how the night is going to turn out than being squished up against someone (unless, like me, the person you are with is completely uninterested in you).I will mention that I found one of the bartenders to be friendlier than the other, which would bum me out if I came here alone but otherwise wasn't a big deal.Definitely this place is bookmarked for good.

41.description: $7.50 for a well drink at happy hour? Definitely does not qualify as a dive bar. I suppose they have to maximize profit for their small size. Save your money and elbows and go to a real bar.

52.description: Our favorite bar in Chicago by far. Whenever we want to go out and have a drink we always go to matchbox. Cozy place, Amazing staff with great taste in music and tasty drinks. They are very creative with the menu and the drinks they create are all great. Try Woodsman :) you can always order in some food from Silver palm next door too. Whenever we have visitors in town that's one of the places we take them too. It's one of the highlights of Chicago...

50.description: Bottom Line Up Front: Interesting layout, good selection of booze, fun clientele. It's "smallness" forces you to meet new people. Hanging out at the Matchbox is kind of like drinking with my brother. Like my brother, the Matchbook is dimunitive in size, lives off the blue line, and doesn't really bat an eye if you fart. Even if you've never been there, it has an "everyone knows your name" familiarity that larger, less tattooed, more successful bars (brothers) can match. I like dive bars, primarily because they usually lack the requesite 25 Flat Screen televisions on the Sportscenter loop. It seems to me that the less "entertainment" at the bar, the more human interaction. Well, the Matchbox adds the element that every time that you want to go to the bathroom, order a drink, or turn around, you're literally bumping into another patron. some might rate this as a negative, but it was kind of cool to be absolutely FORCED to meet the people surrounding you at the bar. Matchbox DOES have a small television right above the door. It was playing "Last House on a Dead End Street," a 70s slasher movie. The aforementioned restroom is unisex, and at the far end of the bar from the entrance. It was pretty clean.The Box had an incredibly impressive selection of craft beer and spirits. Only 3 draught beers, but a good selection of local midwest microbrews from Bells, 3 Floyds, Left Hand, and Great Lakes. Behind the rail, the Box has 10, 12, and 15 year old Pappy Van Winkle Bourbon... pretty much the most delicious bourbon in the world. You know it's good because it's featured prominently on the TV show "Justified" - a drama where a Sherrif's Deputy drinks bourbon and/or moonshine, slays all of the goodlooking babes in this town, and shoots with impugnity (because it's justified). Sidenote: if you're looking for a guilty pleasure TV show, give it a watch. Long story short. it's a great place to grab a drink if you're in the neighborhood.

4.description: This tiny bar has that cozy feel that I loved during the winter - although I am not sure I would be as much of a fan on a hot summer day! Even though I usually am easily claustrophobic, the communal and friendly environment made this place seem larger than it is. Cocktails are creative and delicious!

6.description: Not my idea of fun being jam packed in the tiniest bar.  It's uncomfortable being in there, but I guess they have their regulars, so good for them.

22.description: Great local spot in the neighborhood! Room for maybe 15-20 people in the entire bar, it makes for an intimate outing where conversations can easily be held. The prices are also spot on as a $10 cocktail comes with a shaker which is basically a 2 for 1 deal. They make the best gin gimlet I've ever had and you can't beat the price. This is a very unique bar in Chicago and a definite must-see.

15.description: Great cocktails and strong drinks!The place is SUPER narrow but definitely check this place out. The decor is fun and the bartenders are pretty nice. The booze selection is great!

57.description: Great, cozy neighborhood bar on one of the best street corners in Chicago.  In my book, this is definitely a winter-feeling bar, but even on a late summer Thursday night, it was just perfect.  Great booze selection and creative cocktails.

20.description: It may be small and cramped during peak hours but the bartenders are great and the silver palm next door tends to be less crowded if you want a more cozy atmosphere. The vegetarian options for food are pretty good and I enjoy the whiskey options! Its a neat place to talk to new people and its even got a great laid back atmosphere in the early evening for a drink with a friend

36.description: Question: How many people can you fit inside this bar. Answer: 20 children.  This place is miniature. I guess anyone who likes "small" things would like this place.   I prefer to drink my liquor while not stepping on someone.

14.description: I'm still working my way around the area, but this is way up there with my favorites. It's tiny, touting being "Chicago's most intimate bar". That's not a lie, it's very little, like nine stools in a hallway, and it's divey. But the beer selection was very good, they also made Old-Fashions and other cocktails with great care. Silverpalm next door is amazing as well, I believe there owned by the same people.

1.description: Absolutely the best salon experience I have had in years, I'd give more stars if I could! My initial call with Amie was very pleasant and I was able to schedule an appointment within a few weeks. First impression is her salon is so cute, inviting and very clean. Amie was also a delight from the moment I walked through the door. We first sat and chatted about my hair concerns and what I am looking to achieve. I have naturally blonde hair with blonde balayage highlights... at least that's what I've been wanting. The salon/stylist I visited the previous three times I had my hair colored ended in results that I did not like. I have been trying to achieve a very cool, creamy blonde color but ended up with awful yellow balayage highlights. On top of that my roots were colored to be very warm, which is exactly the opposite of what I wanted/asked for. I was told by the previous stylist that my hair could not get to the color I wanted and that my hair is "stubborn". I knew this wasn't true as my hair has been highlighted cool blonde most of my hair coloring life. Anyway, that made me search for a new stylist and I am so grateful I found Amie! She listened to every single concern I had, explained the best way to get my color where I wanted then did her magic. She is a true hair artist. The color turned out way better than I expected, she transformed my yellow blonde hair to the beautiful cool, beige blonde exactly like I had envisioned and almost given up hope I could achieve. She also managed to tone down the brassiness of the base color so now the colors blend beautifully. I have not felt this great about my hair in so long and it's all thanks to Amie. Also, she is extremely friendly and easy to talk to. I've already recommended her to multiple people looking for a new stylist, they see the amazing transformation of my hair so her work actually speaks for itself. Her pricing is also extremely reasonable. Thank you Amie! The search is over... after 8 years of salon hopping in Chicago I finally found an amazing, talented stylist :)

9.description: After asking around Facebook for hairdresser recommendations, a friend led me to Amie! She took her time assessing my hair and what was going on with it and how to make it better, which definitely put me at ease. I trust a stylist who takes her time before anything is cut or colored! She also made sure we were on the same page with what I wanted. I had some super bright highlights that I wanted calmed down a little bit, and when the toner didn't fix it one time through, she added more toner-- no one has done that for me before even when I voiced my concerns about too light of highlights. She knew exactly what I wanted!Also, I have to mention what a positive light of a human being Amie is! It was a delight to chat with her during my appointment. She did an excellent job on the decor of the salon! Everything was bright, shiny, modern, and clean. I definitely will continue to go to Amie and her salon- my experience was wonderful and it was perfectly in my price range, which in Chicago is hard to come by!

23.description: Amie has been doing my hair for years, and I've followed her wherever she has worked. I always tell her what I am thinking and she suggests how that look will work for me, the result is always perfection. She's done cuts, color, highlights and extensions for me. I couldn't give her enough praise. I always trust her hair advise and her prices are more than reasonable. Her new salon space is beautiful! I highly recommend Amie to anyone looking for a new stylist!

25.description: Amie is great! She's done my hair in the past & I LOVE the new space! Super girly & modern. She really listens to your ideas about your hair & magically makes it happen even better than what you could have imagined! I'd recommend this place to anyone. I'll definitely be back! :)

12.description: I always love coming in to see Amie, my fellow Aries lady Came in to get my Balayage done, told Amie a general look that I was going for and that I wanted to switch it up a bit, the color came out amazing, beyond my expectations and so natural!This lady knows color and it comes to her with such ease. Needless to say I won't be going anywhere else for my hair needs besides Amarie's!

21.description: I was referred to Amarie's by a co-worker who had great hair and great things to say about Amie.  I had an evening appointment on a Monday, which I was impressed by because its so hard to get an evening appointment.  The location is great, plenty of street parking and easy to get to.  The salon itself is beautiful, very comfortable and extremely clean.  Amie was friendly from the moment I walked in.  She gave me the best hair consult I've ever had.  I've never had anyone take the time to discuss what I wanted, what could be achieved and how they would go about doing it, in such great detail.  It gave me great confidence that she would do a great job, and she really did.  I have long and very thick hair.  She did a sombre, color correction and a cut.  It looks beautiful and I couldn't be happier.  Amie really knows her stuff!  She's up on trends, product and new techniques.  We were there until midnight and it was worth it!

16.description: I'm not one to write reviews but just had to say a few things about the magic that Amie does on my hair. I've been going to Amie for about over 6 years now. EVERY time I've come in to see her and either need a cut, highlights, style it is complete perfection. She did my hair for my wedding and my bridesmaids hair as well and each girl was different, classic and on point. I moved to LA but when I travel back to Chicago I still see Amie as my stylist because No One has colored my hair or changed it up for something new and fresh like she has. If you live in the Chicago area, she is by far the BEST hairstylist in the city.

17.description: I've been meaning to write a review about Amie for sometime now, she's been doing my hair for almost 6 years! Not only does she give a beautiful cut, but she's a genius at color. I change my hair a lot and she's always been super excited with each change. She's creative, and loves to give suggestions along side your own ideas of the look you're going for. I saw a review on here complaining that Amie's clients must all be her friends. Amie started out being my hairstylist and several years later I worked at a Salon with her. When I decided to go out on my own with Esthetics she was one of my biggest cheerleaders and mentor. Always being supportive and giving advice when needed. A friend indeed. Women helping women. Amie has worked for herself for several years and does everything on her own. She's one of the busiest people I know in the Industry! I've sent several of my own clients to her without hesitation because I know they'll be happy with the results they receive. Amie loves what she does. She is not just a five star, Amie is a Ten!

10.description: Amie is fantastic! She has been cutting my hair for several years and always does an amazing job. Last year my grays came in (ugh) but I didn't want to do a major color job so I started getting a gloss from her and it's the best!! She always gets the color just exactly right - never too dark, and it's full of shine and bounce for weeks!Amie also did my hair for a wedding and gave me the most gorgeous, soft updo. It was so pretty that I was sad to have to take it down! One other thing that really sets her apart is her amazingly positive and sunny attitude! Even after 8-10 hours on her feet, she is so incredibly pleasant and clearly loves what she does for a living! She's so much fun to chat with when I'm in the chair - I always leave the salon with a smile on my face and pep in my step!I just wish there was an Amie in NYC since I recently moved!!

5.description: Amie is amazing. I've been seeing her since 2008 and wouldn't dream of trusting my hair with anyone else. I have thick, curly hair and she knows exactly how to cut, color and style it so that it looks good straight or curly. She helps me to change things up and is open and honest about when I come to her with a bad idea. ;) We have great conversation and, when necessary, I can use her WiFi to get a little work done - although I never want to because I'd rather catch up! I've recommended three or four co-workers to her - all of whom have become lifelong fans as well. It's also great to be able to book by text which saves me time and is my preferred form of communication. Always respectful, always professional, always a great color and cut - she's the best!

11.description: I LOVE Amie! I'm super picky and indecisive especially when it comes to my hair. She listens to what I like and don't like, gives me her honest opinion about how a cut or color may look on me. She's professional and always up to date on trends with color and cuts. Not only that, but Amie remembers so many details about me. I only see her a few times per year, but she always remembers what we talked about the last time I was in (which is especially impressive given how many other clients she has). I have gotten cut, color, and formal styles with Amie and have absolutely loved everything. Also her salon is just the cutest! I can't say enough good things about Amie as both a professional and a person. She's truly one of the good ones.

22.description: After asking around Facebook for hairdresser recommendations, a friend led me to Amie! She took her time assessing my hair and what was going on with it and how to make it better, which definitely put me at ease. I trust a stylist who takes her time before anything is cut or colored! She also made sure we were on the same page with what I wanted. I had some super bright highlights that I wanted calmed down a little bit, and when the toner didn't fix it one time through, she added more toner-- no one has done that for me before even when I voiced my concerns about too light of highlights. She knew exactly what I wanted!Also, I have to mention what a positive light of a human being Amie is! It was a delight to chat with her during my appointment. She did an excellent job on the decor of the salon! Everything was bright, shiny, modern, and clean. I definitely will continue to go to Amie and her salon- my experience was wonderful and it was perfectly in my price range, which in Chicago is hard to come by!

0.description: I moved to Chicago 6 years ago and spent a lot of time reading reviews to find a new stylist (I'd been burned before by too many too expensive and terrible haircuts).  I found Amie when she was at a salon in Lincoln Park and she had RAVE reviews.  I became an instant fan.  Amie does great hair.  No question.  Color is always impeccable and style is always well-executed while still fitting my needs, time allowance, and skill level.  Amie also gives the best scalp massage ever.  I've now followed her to three different salons and travel 45 minutes via CTA to get to my appointments.  So worth it!What's equally important though is that Amie is just plain cool.  She puts off a really comfortable and approachable vibe.  She's honest about what would and won't work in styling decisions and doesn't make you feel bad for asking silly questions.  Amie is lot of fun to chat with through the process.  Last shout out -- my husband has been going to Amie for the better part of four years and has never looked better.  He has thin hair and a receding hairline.  He used to get a cut at the neighborhood barber who just never did anything but exacerbate the situation.  Enter Amie.  She has worked wonders and he enjoys going to see her.  Everybody wins!

20.description: I positively LOVED my experience at Amarie's Hair Studio. From my initial emailing with Amie through the entire service, Amie was so sweet, knowledgable and professional. She has cultivated an amazing space that feels very welcoming and relaxed. Apart from the customer service, my end result is what really blew me away. I'm pretty adventurous with my hair and started the process of going platinum blonde a few months ago and was always so frustrated with how brassy and yellow my hair was turning after only a few washes. Amie was reassuring and really understood what my hair needed. She also used this new product Olaplex on me which I don't exactly understand but essentially my hair feels and looks Better than it has in years after having bleach on it so I'm sold. Anyhow my end result was exactly the "pearly", cool, silver white that I've always wanted and her prices were extremely reasonable. She really put in work and I was so impressed by my entire experience. I can't wait to go back, I seriously feel like I've found my girl!!

19.description: I have been following Amie for 10 years as my only hair stylist and she is amazing! I've been with her through 4 salons and I'm so happy she's opened her own. It's absolutely adorable in there and is a perfect intimate setting for her to focus during my service. I get both cuts and colors from Amie and I always leave 100% excited, no matter if we do a touch up or drastic change. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS SALON!!!

2.description: Cute shop.  Great location.  Not stuffy.

18.description: I have been a loyal client of Amie's for about 5-7 years now.  Not only is she great at cutting/coloring hair, but she is very accommodating as well.  I have a "trouble" area right in the middle of my hairline, and of course my grays like to pop up, right there in the middle.   Often times I start to see gray in the hairline before other parts of my hair, so I will text Amie for a hairline touch-up and she always finds a way to squeeze me in as she knows it's only a quick touch up. I travel frequently for trade shows, so my schedule is not accommodating yet she always finds a way to make it work.   She is affordable especially in the city of Chicago, and does not "nickel & dime" you with separate washers, expensive toners, etc... Her salon is very cozy and she has a great personality.  I would definitely recommend her!

13.description: Amie is truly gifted when it comes to hair--I have been going to her for 5+ years for color & cuts and she always makes my hair look beautiful. I get compliments all the time. She is so easy to talk to, her salon is clean, beautiful and not stuffy, and her prices are super reasonable...I would not dream of going anywhere else!

4.description: I love amie. Prior to her opening her salon I used amy for an In home beauty party and it was one of the best girls nights out (at home) I ever had the pleasure of hosted. She was professional, efficient and reasonably priced. I am thrilled she now has a salon that I can visit and will be for sure visiting her for future hair needs. I also enjoy following her on Instagram and Facebook to see firsthand the amazing work she does on her clients.  Highly recommend.

24.description: I have gotten my hair done twice by Amie (cut and highlights), and I love it every time. I always bring in pictures and she tells me what will and will not look good. She makes sure you're pampered and pleased the whole entire time. I also like how she explains which products she's using for your hair and gives you tips on upkeep. The salon space is fabulous and easy to get to. All in all - the experience with Amie is fabulous!

6.description: If you are looking for someone who knows hair and does a great job (and who isn't?) Amie is it!  I have been going to Amie since I moved to Chicago about 4 years ago, and have never looked back.  First, she actually talks to you about your hair, and explains the type and texture and how what you want will (or won't) work!  Amie also explains everything as she goes so you feel a part of the process, and not just waiting to she how it turns out.  I love that!  Finally, she's fun and great to chat with if you want to.  I have been to many hairstylists over the years, and have never had such a great overall experience as I do with Amie.  And I can not speak highly enough of the work she does, I mean she took me from dark, dark brown to a fun blonde that acutally looks cute and natural!  I've never left not feeling awesome about my hair.  Highly recommend!

15.description: I have been going to Amie for about 2 years now and I can honestly say she is the best! I have gone from super blonde ombre to dark for winter and she nails it every time. She really takes the time to understand what you are looking for and sets proper expectations about what will work and what won't. I usually don't trust anyone with my hair, but anything she says I'll go with. All my coworkers ask where I go and I get so many compliments. It's no wonder why she is completely booked months out, but she's so worth it!

7.description: I moved to Chicago about 7 years ago. An old co-worker recommended Amie. I haven't gone to anyone else since! I have pretty thick hair, and a lot of it. Amie knows how to make it manageable! And I am very lazy when it comes to styling my hair, Amie makes it so I can let it air dry and it still looks great! Whenever anyone is looking for a new stylist I always recommend Amie! She's definitely hard to get an appointment with though, so book early!

8.description: BEST salon and BEST hairdresser there is!!! I have worked with Amie for many years and refer her to all my brides and friends!! she is amazing at what she does and is responsive and responsible !! Can't say enough good things about her!!!! LOVE her and her services she provides!!

3.description: Best hair salon ever! Amie is magical and gifted when it comes to making anyone look beautiful! Whether it's keeping my long hair, going short, adding highlights, or introducing me to a new style; her professionalism is refreshing and her energy is contagious! I would recommend her to anyone because she gives every client her best and we always walk out feeling gorgeous!!

14.description: I started seeing Amie in 2011 for my wedding and we have been together ever since. I have followed her to three salons and happy that she has one now with her name on the front!  Together, I have been brown, blond, red, short and long and have always come back because of the expert service and talented workmanship. Amie is the best. She is good at what she does and she is fair. 5 Stars...great if you are looking for a change, to stay the same or for amazing wedding hair too!

3.description: Honestly, shopping is not my thing and a friend of mine suggested I get a consultation from Jason at "My Style i." I didn't really know what I was getting into, but he came over, looked at my clothes, and immediately made suggestions based on my own limited fashion sense. Since that first consultation he has come over a half dozen times, each time with tons of clothes that fit well and align with my own style. And it's so reasonably priced! I feel like I am saving money, not leaving my living room, and getting clothes that I would not be able to find on my own. What more could you want out of a shopping experience? Plus- Jason is a great guy, who I actually trust. When I'm out on the town or at busy at work people have noticed that I have been dressing better and I always give all the credit to Jason. Why not? He's great. This has been the best shopping experience possible for me, and I'd imagine there are tons of other people like me out there who are looking for the same thing. Could not recommend this more. Keep up the good work!

1.description: I really had no idea what to expect having a person doing shopping for me. The idea sounds amazing since Im a professional consultant plus entrepreneur and have NO TIME for shopping.  Since my new business is around fashion I .eeded.an upgrade from my boring engineer clothes. I hired Cheryl and... wow. Besides a very realistic questionnaire, she came to my home, listened to my concerns, to what I like and...  few weeks later as agreed (actually even earlier) she came back with amazing pieces and everything fit amazing as well. Be careful, you are going to love then all!!! She is great!!

2.description: I just started a new position in an industry where my clients range from corporate business executives to local hardware store owners, so my attire must be flexible and I was really struggling with how to keep a balanced look.  The consultation and survey were comprehensive, yet painless and the final looks that Cheryl & Jason pulled together gave me so many wonderful options and really complimented what I already had in my closet.  They worked around my time and budget and presented pieces that I would not normally consider, but completely love.  The service is friendly and professional and I will definitely be coming back to them for my fall wardrobe!

0.description: I would like to start out by saying that I do not have much fashion sense.  I'm the kind of guy that would think it would be okay to wear socks with sandals or a blue shirt with black pants.  That is why I decided to go see Jason.  He is extremely nice and best of all not judgmental.  He started off by asking me what occasion the clothes were for or what setting the clothes would be worn in.  I told him I wanted some nice clothes to go out in. The clothes he brought back to me were perfect.  They were trendy, comfortable, and in the price range I wanted.  One of my main concerns was finding a nice pair of jeans that weren't too skinny.  I can't stand how they feel.  Jason even managed to find a pair that looked tight fitting but aloud for good mobility.   Overall this was a great experience and I plan on using Jason's services in the future.

28.description: La Scarola's one of my favorite restaurants and since I'm not extremely fond of the second hand smoke one's subjected to at Richards, Clover is usually where I go to drink my dessert. It's a chill spot spot that you just can't help but like. Nothing outrageously noteworthy about it, but the staff is always friendly, the prices are fair and they've got a MyTouchTunes jukebox. I've never seen it extremely packed which is what I love about it. Great place for post dinner date drinks. If the name has anything to do with it you might even get lucky...

1.description: Bartender was so friendly and service was quick, although it wasn't very busy last night, so that may have helped. Beer selection was OK. Beers on tap were limited, but that was fine. This is a fun local neighborhood bar for a relaxed night, love it. We ordered appetizers, which I found out were from Emmit's across the street - best bar food! I recommend the Irish Potato Boxty. Divine.

9.description: Jess and Anna are friendly, fast and make you feel apart of the hood. They remember your name, and treat you like an old friend. Quaint neighborhood bar, great for sports, and reasonable priced drinks in a rather pricey area. Thankful for bars like the Clover.

29.description: Started out as a real believer. Great place for Sunday football, tons of TV's, very accomodating. and was there 5 out of the past 6 sundays. Got to know the whole crew, great folks. Until last weekend. Once the Bears game was done and all the late games started, the sound was turned off and an awful mix of country and Madonna music was started, and loud!Several requests to get any of the game sounds (which happened with no issues in the past 5 times I was there), were completely refuted by the owner. Despite a couple dozen people there, staring at the TV's trying to watch the games, the owner insisted that folks want to listen to music and don't care about the games. Note that the music was so damn loud you couldn't even have a conversation. My group then promptly asked for the bill and we walked out. I hope the owner reads this and realizes how absurd his argument was and how easy it is to lose good customers. You go to the trouble of putting a dozen TV's in the place, play all the games and advertize it, and then put on Madonna? Then you argue it's what people want? Seriously?

23.description: Great pub!  Great beers!  Rob the owner talked to us all night....place "gets" it !

5.description: I had a great time here watching the iowa football game, they had good drink specials-$4 20z bud lites and $9 pitchers, plus free walking tacos!
