I also won an iowa hoodie from the free raffle you can enter just by walking in, it didnt get too packed but still had a good crowd, also free popcorn, and after iowa won we got free fireball shots, it's now my favorite place to watch iowa games in chicago

31.description: I became an instant fan of Clover after one visit. It took me longer than it should have to stop in, partly because their storefront is a bit unassuming relative to the Funky Buddha next door and also because I prefer American / Belgian craft beer. First, the beer selection. Their taps include too many mass-produced beers for my liking, though they do have a respectable bottled craft selection (e.g., Three Floyds, Brooklyn, Delirium Tremens). While I wouldn't grade them 5 stars on their beer selection alone, the service and charm at Clover is unbelievable. Our first visit felt like walking into Cheers. The manager greeted us, the bartender introduced himself, the wait / bus staff were friendly and attentive, and everyone said goodbye and thanked us for coming when we left. It seemed that all of the staff were on the same page about creating as warm and welcoming of an atmosphere in a neighborhood pub as you could ask for. Another point: I like to support local businesses, and value businesses that do the same. As best I know, Clover doesn't have a kitchen, though they've partnered with neighboring stores La Scarola and Toni's pizza to offer great food at reasonable prices. I've tried a lot of food from Toni's and La Scarola, and they're consistently excellent, but the dishes not to be missed are: bruschetta, pasta & fagiole (best I've ever had), chicken vesuvio, and Toni's spinach pizza.

25.description: Love this place, the place is hip and friendly.The place has a lot of tv's to watch whatever sporting event you are looking for.The drinks are great and the bartender is so friendly.Love this BAR!

12.description: I moved across the street a few months ago and this has become my favorite spot to either start or finish the night. The prices are good, there is a neighborhood feel, the staff is extremely friendly and Sasha, my precious pup, is always welcome as are other well behaved and reasonable four legged companions. It's is a Hawkeyes bar, but hey, no one is perfect.

21.description: Great specials, lots of TVs, free popcorn and great service.  The downfall?  They order food from across the street so theres not a lot of options.  The nachos we ordered came in cold and soggy before we really got to enjoy them.  Otherwise the staff here is a lot of fun, especially during hawks games!

16.description: The owner Rob left one of my favorite drinking neighborhood joints (River Shannon with the Rush and Division Group) to open this place with a partner.They certainly do a great job of making the customer feel at home. Too bad it's sorta distance from my place. Else I'd be there all the time!

17.description: Clover Sports & Leisure is an old-fashioned drinking joint, taking a page from the days when it wasn't frowned upon to have a smoke and a drink, and when sports icons played for the love of the game, not for fame or money.  Located in the definitive six-corner intersection that is also home to Chicago institutions as La Scarola, Richard's Bar and Emmit's Irish Pub, near Grand and Halsted, Clover Sports & Leisure will be in good company.The concept is simple, and it was formed by two veterans in the bar business who became drinking buddies upon meeting at The Lodge Tavern in Chicago years ago.  Dana Ronk, who has over 20 years in the business managing establishments, most recently Mahoney's Pub & Grille, along with Rob Dalton, with over 14 years behind the bar, up till now managing River Shannon, know what it takes to make patrons feel welcome in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere.  Ronk and Dalton have created a warm and inviting tavern, referencing a time of the good-old-days with a focus on the leisure of life, encouraging customers to relax-well in their aptly named Clover Sports & Leisure.  They credit The Lodge Tavern's Jimmy Borchers with schooling them on how to be 'proper barkeeps'.  Clover Sports & Leisure featrures lots of flat-screen, plasma televisions nestled in and around the large oak bar with plenty of barstools and some comfy cushioned chairs.  Every seat is a great seat to kick back, relax, and take in a televised sporting event while enjoying a preferred adult beverage.  Clover Sports & Leisure offers over forty beers, seven on tap, and a full bar of premium liquors, including a nice variety of scotches and whiskeys, as any respectable watering hole would.  While imbibing, patrons may feel the urge to snack, and for that reason Clover Sports & Leisure will offer hot pizzas and fresh popcorn, as it is all about simplicity and going back to a time when less meant more.

10.description: I love Clover.I moved nearby around June, and this place has become my go to place to grab a quick beer or get a night started with Friends. They have specials all the time (get a PB&J!) and a pretty diverse selection of beers, usually with plenty of chicago local brews. Come Friday/Saturday nights, it is usually pretty full, but very laid back. Giant Jenga is hilarious to play with a group of friends, as each block has a dare for you to do. There is also free darts and all you can eat popcorn. They also have lots of TVs, and is an ideal place to catch a Bulls/Bears/Blackhawks game.If you want food, they can order from emmitts next door and deliver, but no in house options.

11.description: I love walking into Clover after a long day at work. The staff is friendly and very pleasing to talk to and the great beer selection doesn't hurt. Good place to watch sports as they have plenty of TVs! They always have the sound on for Blackhawks games but never too loud so that you can't hear your friend sitting next to you. I wish I could give this place more stars!!

26.description: Clover Sports & Leisure is an old-fashioned drinking joint, taking a page from the days when it wasn't frowned upon to have a smoke and a drink, and when sports icons played for the love of the game, not for fame or money.  Located in the definitive six-corner intersection that is also home to Chicago institutions as La Scarola, Richard's Bar and Emmit's Irish Pub, near Grand and Halsted, Clover Sports & Leisure will be in good company.The concept is simple, and it was formed by two veterans in the bar business who became drinking buddies upon meeting at The Lodge Tavern in Chicago years ago.  Dana Ronk, who has over 20 years in the business managing establishments, most recently Mahoney's Pub & Grille, along with Rob Dalton, with over 14 years behind the bar, up till now managing River Shannon, know what it takes to make patrons feel welcome in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere.  Ronk and Dalton have created a warm and inviting tavern, referencing a time of the good-old-days with a focus on the leisure of life, encouraging customers to relax-well in their aptly named Clover Sports & Leisure.  They credit The Lodge Tavern's Jimmy Borchers with schooling them on how to be 'proper barkeeps'.  Clover Sports & Leisure featrures lots of flat-screen, plasma televisions nestled in and around the large oak bar with plenty of barstools and some comfy cushioned chairs.  Every seat is a great seat to kick back, relax, and take in a televised sporting event while enjoying a preferred adult beverage.  Clover Sports & Leisure offers over forty beers, seven on tap, and a full bar of premium liquors, including a nice variety of scotches and whiskeys, as any respectable watering hole would.  While imbibing, patrons may feel the urge to snack, and for that reason Clover Sports & Leisure will offer hot pizzas and fresh popcorn, as it is all about simplicity and going back to a time when less meant more.

27.description: Nice intimate and friendly place.  Our plan was to do a bar crawl on Super Bowl Sunday, this was our first stop and we never left.  The owners were having a semi private party and they welcomed our group of 4 like we were regulars.   They had a buffet that included pizza, italian sausages, pasta, hummus, and a whole lot of chips and salsa.   Would reccomend and would definitly go back when we're in Chicago again!

35.description: Love this new kid on the block. We  stopped in tonight with friends after work  for a few drinks and got a nice table in the back. Meet both of the owners Rob and Dana while they were hard at work. Nice crowd, nice atmosphere and good drinks. Everyone was having a good time watching the game , playing giant Jenga and / or dancing. We will be back....

8.description: Clover is one of the most fun and lively bars I've been to in Chicago. It attracts a pub crowd that is generally made up of staff and patrons that want to drink and mingle, with a  strong distaste for solitudinous sobriety. Great place to start or top off a night with friends.  But if you go, promise me you'll keep it light and friendly!  Btw- Jessica, Jamie, Hana and Luis fucking rock.  Also the bartender, I think his name is Devin, who coined me as the "sleepy surgeon."  For yelp's peace of mind, I'll let you all know that I'm not actually a surgeon, clover just happens to brew aspiring comedians.

0.description: My favorite little neighborhood bar! Great staff, wonderful drink specials and steel tip darts...what more can you ask for. Recently they expanded and offer pool and shuffleboard. This bar is mine and my boyfriends "go to" spot for fun and friends!!

20.description: i have been here several times.  the first few times I enjoyed the experience, mainly because it wasn't crowded or too loud, and the drinks were good.  however, the music was basically the owner playing his personal music off of his laptop behind the bar. the sound was awful, the taste in music was a mix of billy joel and bob seger, and forget about him taking any type of request.  and since the bar was empty, it should really have been a no-brainer to be a little accommodating.and therein lies the problem.  Rob, who introduced himself as the owner, swings from friendly to aggressive in a heartbeat.  it took a couple of visits to recognize this.  Rob seems to have opened a bar so that he has a place to hangout with his buds.  from what I could tell, we may have been the only paying customers in the place.  and when his friends lit up their cigarettes it was the final straw. apparently the fact that I complained about the second-hand smoke, not to mention a law against smoking, meant that I was the problem and had overstayed my welcome.which I guess explains why the place isn't crowded when the other bars on this corner are hopping.  if you go, I would definitely not challenge Rob in any way or you may be given the same treatment as I was.   I recommend emmitt's

19.description: Love this bar. Its pretty chill and laid back. Great staff and good drinks. They also have free popcorn and a jukebox. Its a really friendly bar seems mostly locals attend. Its never a big crowd. They also have the jenga!

33.description: I really love this bar.  It's not too crowded and there's fairly good deals.  The staff is friendly and I always have a good time when I hang out here!Free pop corn and a over-sized Jenga game what's not to like! :-)

2.description: What a sad excuse for a bar. My party of 6 sat at a table for 10 minutes before we were given menus. Another 10 minutes pass and our sad excuse for a bartender finally comes back to take our order. What was she doing in the mean time? Talking to other customers. Probably because we look like "hoodlums" in our hoodies. Who knows. 10 more minutes pass and she isn't even pouring our beers. To top it off, she comes back and forgets my drink order. What a terrible excuse for a bar and bartender. We asked about their nacho bar and they said they had to "restart" it. What does that even mean? Also, they need to stick to their soundtrack and stop switching the song mid track. I can officially say I despise this bar. They don't serve food. You can order food from the bar next door. Our solution? We're going there instead.

34.description: Love love love! So many good things to say I just don't know where to start!So first of all both the owners are awesome... because they are the one's making your yummy drinks! Second, how could you go wrong with free popcorn or ordering  food from two amazing restaurants right next door. Third, the atmosphere is exactly what I want as my watering hole. It's crisp and clean with plenty of TVs for sports game but still comfy like a locals pub. I must say I am very excited this place has come into our Chicago bar scene and will be back often!Maybe I'll see you there... have a RumChata shot waiting for me!

32.description: Stopped in on Friday after work and had a great time.  Great staff, great drinks and a very friendly atmosphere.  Great addition to the neighborhood!

18.description: Went here Saturday night with a group of friends. The two bartenders were absolutely amazing! They were so fun & engaging. I wish I could remember both of these ladies names because they really did make our evening such a fun experience!!!  The jenga & popcorn kept us entertained for hours. :-)

13.description: La Scarola's one of my favorite restaurants and since I'm not extremely fond of the second hand smoke one's subjected to at Richards, Clover is usually where I go to drink my dessert. It's a chill spot spot that you just can't help but like. Nothing outrageously noteworthy about it, but the staff is always friendly, the prices are fair and they've got a MyTouchTunes jukebox. I've never seen it extremely packed which is what I love about it. Great place for post dinner date drinks. If the name has anything to do with it you might even get lucky...

4.description: We came here Thanksgiving night. We were orginally set for Richard's Bar, across the street, but I walked in, took one breath, and walked out, after taking a few puffs of my inhaler. It's a total smoke fest in there. Anyways, I asked someone outside, "where can I get a beer without having to burn my clothes in the morning?" Yo.I walked across to Clover and went inside. It was warm, not too crowded, and someone had a dog there. The beer menu was decent, with some solid IPAs and craft beers, and the bartender was responsive. If you like Jenga, they have a few gigantic versions set up for your amusement. Apparently, this is an Iowa bar. I'm not sure if it's Iowa State or Iowa Univerity nor if there is more than one.Overall, not a bad place. I had a few decent, tandom conversations. The dude with the dog was letting him walk around aimlessly and then would get ticked if someone pet him. Beers are $6-8. They have a jukebox and TVs.

24.description: Great spot. Bartender was great.  Turned out to be owner. Definitely recommend.   Rob seems to be in touch with his clientele. And, the music is great. #jacksonbrownerulesa

6.description: The Clover is everything you could ask for out of a neighborhood bar! good specials and beer selections, free popcorn, a lengthy bar with plenty of seating, and plenty of TVs to watch sports. (Not to mention a complimentary nacho bar for Blackhawks games). Oh, and Giant Jenga or darts anyone? There's always an upbeat friendly vibe in this place. What REALLY sets Clover apart is the staff- Jessica and Anna are absolutely fantastic. Friendly, accommodating, quick service- they're awesome. My husband and I have lived nearby for a year now and it is hands-down our favorite neighborhood bar.

22.description: An impressive looking bar in Chicago. I think it is fairly new and is a great place to watch a sporting event. The bartender was really friendly and this is a much better alternative in the neighborhood than Richards bar or that Irish bar right next door to it.

15.description: FYI, no food here BUT they get food from Emmit's across the street! Yes they have an Emmit's menu, the staff will take your order, and voila...it's delivered to your table at Clover - and added to your bill.Or I think you can bring your own food or order delivery.We came here on Sunday to watch football. The bartender-waitress was was very nice and accommodating at first. We had a table and she came to the table taking our orders and delivering them but as the hours went by we had to keep going to the bar to get anything.This is a pub but it's not all ratty and run-down like most I've seen. They have nice TV"s and furnishings (including the bar) that doesn't look deteriorated. The bathrooms are nice too and you get your own "fortress of solitude".

7.description: Megan is  the best bartender I've encountered so far.   Great service. Very fantastic  at her craft.  It was nice meeting  her.

36.description: The bartenders and staff are so wonderful!  I went during the week and they had amazing beer and liquor specials.  I am so glad this place opened and its been a needed addition to the West Loop area of Grand/Halsted/Milwaukee. I will definitely be returning!!!

30.description: Great place to have a few beers, hang out with your peeps and watch sports.  It's not an enormous bar but there is a television on every inch of every wall in the place.  The service is friendly and prompt and even when crowded I never had a hard time getting a fresh beverage.Important note regarding the food situation:  Don't go here looking for dinner and drinks, but if you need to eat there are two VERY different options.  Option 1 is ordering one of their frozen pizzas (i.e. Tombstone).  Option 2 is ordering delivery from the restaurant across the street, which happens to be some of the best Italian food in the city.Also: This is an Iowa Hawkeye bar.

3.description: Iowa Bar!!! Gamedays are real fun with a raffle at halftime where you can win some pretty sweet prizes. Service is great and staff is friendly. Free self-serve walking taco bar brings me back to IC... Wide selection of beers and they serve food from the adjacent restaurant. LET'S GO HAWKS!!

14.description: I took a date to this bar so we could see the blackhawks game. The atmosphere is nice however they refused to play the blackhawks game since a group of customers previously requested to watch a college basketball game. That's fine, but judging how they had more than four TVs. I am not quite sure why they couldn't put the game on one of their TVs. The crowd was obnoxious and loud. I get it's a bar, but when you have people falling out of their seats and hitting on your date that's a bit extreme. I find it naive to even call this place a Blackhawks bar when they don't even play the game for you live.

3.description: Today I had a massage from Amy. All I can say is Fantastic! My shoulder had been bothering me, but after my time with her, it's 100% better. This is what I'm after when it comes to bodywork. I'll be back back for sure.

1.description: Amy was my masseuse and she was amazing. She really worked on all the knots in my arms and back but also knew when it was getting to be too much. This will be my go-to massage place from now on. I definitely recommend.

2.description: Today I got a Thai aroma session on the mat with Amy. OMG!!! I'm on the verge of becoming a  massage addict. It's funny that I've tried massage everwhere but this little place is the best!!! I completely understand the meaning of real Thai bodywork! I recommend that you try Amy.

9.description: Just got my first Thai massage with Nida. So pleasantly surprised! I didn't know what expect and it's definitely not your traditional massage at the spa but I went in with a migraine and came out feeling great! They work and stretch every muscle. It was amazing and I will definitely be back. Nida was great so recommend her as well. The prices are also very reasonable so that's an added bonus. I'll definitely be back!

10.description: Authentic Thai technique that the masseuse was happy to explain to me.Best massage I ever had, and the current prices are hard to beat.Will definitely be back.

4.description: Had a Thai massage w Nida - best massage of my life.... And I've had lots of them. I was a little hesitant about the traditional Thai massage with stretching involved but sooo glad I did it. My whole body feels amazing. She's very sweet and was very considerate asking me about weather pressure was enough or too much and I really liked that too. I didn't even have to tell he's where I was tight - she immediately found all the right places. I will definitely be back on a regular basis - such an amazing experience.

6.description: My wife and I were in Chicago for a couple of months performing with a touring production. We came in and saw Melody and Amy basically once a week to "reset" the muscles. So glad we found this place! Will return whenever we are in the city.

12.description: A very, very good thai massage.  The place is spotless and a nice atmosphere with good prices. Melody did a great job at getting all of the knots in the my shoulders out too.  I actually had to tell her to lighten up on the pressure (which almost never happens). I'll be back.

5.description: My boyfriend and I each had a great Thai Bodywork session here last Saturday. My only complaint is that I made an appointment for 2 people at the same time, but was told upon arrival that they only have one bodywork room and so we would have to have back-to-back sessions. Luckily we live close by and this didn't cause too much of a hassle for us, but others in the same situation would be stuck spending an hour waiting for the other person in their party to have their bodywork session.That being said, the session itself was excellent. I will definitely come back for another session, because we both felt like a million bucks afterward!

11.description: Excellent massage and super clean place. Shower before and after massage included. Super nice staff.

8.description: I just got a massage from Nida and it was great! I'm Thai so I know what is good or not. Try her

0.description: A great massage. Table or mat. I've never been disappointed in the year I've been going. Neda, Melody, both great. Take the shower and steam. You'll leave transformed.

7.description: Best Thai Massage ever. My wife & I are Thai massage enthusiasts. We have had Thai massages in San Francisco, NYC etc... Princess Spa was by far the best for both of us. The massage was amazing and you can't beat the price.

1.description: I wrote my original review when I had just started classes at Riverwest Fitness. Almost 3 years later, I am still doing group reformer classes with Heidi, and have also had a few sessions with Abigail, one of the massage therapists. You'd think the honeymoon would be over after all this time, but I still get as much out of my sessions now as I did back in 2010. The advantage of sticking with Riverwest Fitness is that it gives Heidi time to know your body. She's helped me through several (non-Pilates) injuries over the years, as I'm quite accident prone - and always knows how to modify exercises so that I'm getting maximum workout within my own range of motion.A great thing about both Heidi & Abigail is that if you tell them what you want, they LISTEN and DELIVER. Just this last week I told Heidi I wanted to work on my arms. 2 days later, I was still feeling the burn. During massages with Abigail, when you tell her the areas that need attention, she not only massages those areas, she also kneads the surrounding musculature and tendons to make sure the source of the knot has been addressed. You feel drunk after her massages....she's that good.Give this place a chance - you (and your body) won't regret it!

0.description: Outstanding! I recently moved to the neighborhood and hadn't worked worked out in a LONG time... I'm so grateful to have stumbled upon Riverwest Fitness Studio!  I used to lift weights and seriously 'train' years ago. But, I had better results in one month of personal Pilates sessions here than I ever had with weights. I never knew Pilates could kick my a** so hard! I feel better, look better, and actually look forward to my workouts now. Everyone here is super friendly, dedicated to their profession, and very well trained & knowledgable.  No two sessions are the same, and Annette always seems to know exactly what I need to work on every time I come in. The second floor studio space is beautiful! (I'd love to have an apartment like this place...) Very open with hardwood floors, very high exposed timber ceilings, and exposed brick walls. The equipment is new and very well arranged. They do an amazing job of keeping everything clean, safe, and very well maintained. All sessions are by appointment, so it's never crowded and there is no need to ever feel self conscious about anything. One of the areas even has the ability to be closed off for privacy or just to not disturb anyone else. If you haven't worked out before, if it's been a while, or if you just need a little extra help or motivation...I highly recommend coming here! They even do boxing lessons, massage, and a few other things; you'll never be bored. I wasn't sure what I wanted or needed, so I sent them an email. I received a phone call the next morning from the owner. She was very friendly, explained everything I needed to know, and set up a meeting for me with a great trainer whom I am still working with today. If you have any questions at all or are just curious, give them a call and tell them Dave sent you! You'll be very happy you did.

3.description: Great event, packed last night before the rain.  If I was a single guy, I would really like it - lots of single girls around!

1.description: Ribs? On the river? I'm in!Normally a $10 admission, I took advantage of a early family hours special (free until 3 pm on Friday). It looks like they are going try and utilize the Freedom Center (so that's what it's called) as an event space more and more. They had used it for a haunted house last October, and now it makes for a relatively accessible event space with some degree of parking.There's 12 places that are serving ribs, a mixture of local places, and a number of out of state places (even one from Ontario, Canada!). Given that I was trying to try this during lunch, I could only have so much, so here's what I tried:Texas Thunder:Pork Sandwich for $7The pork was tender and juicy, but in a way that was somewhat unremarkable despite my choice in adjectives. There were 3 sauces you could add to taste: Mild, Sweet and Spicy. Although there was spicy to their spicy, it just tasted like they added black pepper to one of their base sauces, versus blending something differently. The sweet was average at best.Famous Dave's:1/2 slab rib for $12Given a light brush of original sauce, you'll also have the option of adding some additional original or spicy. These sauces were a bit more distinctive and the meat was thrown back on the grill before serving. The meat was juicy and fatty in the right spots, almost cleanly off the bone. A good way to cap off my rib eating for lunch. There was a 1/3 slab option which I probably should have done instead, and dinner options with bread and beans.Original Rainbow Cone:Small on a Waffle Cone $4.Yes, yes, I know there's one on State Street now, but I couldn't resist.There are two main stages for music, plus a lounge area that I didn't get to check out. There's pop, water, lemonade, wine, and beer as well. This is cash only everywhere with ATMs outside the event space and inside as well.I selfishly would like these events to do well, so that they continue to hold events so close to me.

2.description: Sunday afternoon visit:Pros: Been to the Naperville Ribfest and this is one is waaay smaller. But, that has it's perks: less crowds, shorter lines, no fighting for a seat in the precious shade, and the city has a better skyline. The sponsors give away free pop by the can because...they can. Every so often you could hear the air and water show.Cons: since there were less people, the stands were not cooking up fresh stuff. There was only one place selling drinks and they were six dollars. Very few dessert options. (That's important to me and many others I am sure.) It's still ten bucks with less vendors and no carnival.After all, it looks like a glorified parking lot. Oddly enough, some vendors had packed up and left by 2pm.Still a great option for ribs though, it had a good variety of local and not so local rib vendors. Winner: Texas Thunder ribs, in which the meat fell of the bone and *shock* didn't need no sauce. Johnson's came in second, but it was slathered in sauce and really...could you go wrong with bbq sauce on grilled meat? Jacks and Rasta in third for taste. However, Rasta gave me a large slabs of jalapeno cornbread and they had the best sauce overall. They had plenty of bands and two stages, and that does give it a nice fest-feel to it. Also, there was a VIP area, but it would have only been useful when Good Charlotte was there on Friday night or if I was going to spend a lot of time there under the bridge.

0.description: Our family loves going to concerts and festivals around chicago. this one worked for ages 4-50 yrs. old and that never happens. younger kids loved inflatables, driving police cars, tattoos, hoops and friendliness of vendors and workers at the event. tween/teens had fun too and were able to wander off safely. food was delicious; beer selection great. this was no sausage-fest. we all had a blast! Layout was open and great with bands on each end. No sound system overlap and room to move despite 4000+ there on FRIDAY!!!!Pork Sandwich for $7The pork was tender and juicy; kids loved it and the buns were great tooFamous Dave's:1/2 slab rib for $12we went back for 2nds.....and 3rds.Lemonade $6seems high, but cup is huge and servers very friendly. worth it!There are great booths advertising vacations and whatnot with REAL DEALS on your way in. Pop, water, wine, and beer as well. This is cash only everywhere with ATMs outside the event space and inside.

58.description: I was forced to goto Richard's a number of years back and fell in love.   It has become one of my favorite places to frequent when I am back home.   Place is old school the whole way,  a very "interesting" crowd.  It truly epitomizes the phrase "dive bar". Also, make sure you try one one of the pickled eggs, it will def complete the experience.

56.description: Ok, I'm torn about this place. It's a smoke filled place that absolutely doesn't give a #$%# about laws and rules.  It's a dive bar's dive bar.It's smoke filled (did i mention that?).  Not just smokey but literally as if all 8 people that were in there had smoked two packs of cigarettes.  They have a good selection of beers at an inexpensive price and they pretty much let you drink your drinks on the streets if you're waiting to be seated at La Scarola (restaurant next door)The 34 year old me would hate to bring my wife here and go home reeking of cigarette smoke but the 34 year old me who is reliving his 25-28 year old days would probably love to frequent this bar as a starter/ender of the night.

29.description: By far my favorite bar in the city. The atmosphere is to die for especially if you are Italian or love the Italian culture. Ive been here on dates & with groups. The juke box has all my favorite tunes. The bartenders are beyond wonderful. I feel like I am right at home in this place. I love all of you wise guys. Thank you for making me feel apart of your family each time I am there.

42.description: Although this place won't fit everyone, if you're looking for authentic Chicago where they do whatever they want (i.e. smoke indoors), serve you hard boiled eggs for 75 cents and provide free drinks quite regularly , you definitely need to check out Richard's.  I hate cigarette smoke and this place will make you smell like smoke for 3 days, but suck it up and enjoy the history because place has HISTORY written all over it.

23.description: They smoke in here, so you will need to dry clean your clothes after a few drinks.  But you can't beat the old-school charm of this Chicago favorite.  Here, you can get a shot and a hard-boiled egg at a really great price for its location. Love the regulars here and always a good crowd any day of the week.

47.description: This bar is fantastic.  Great party, and they keep it old school (the way it should be).  For anyone complaining about smoke in the bar, here's an option...head back to the suburbs and DON'T GO HERE.

8.description: OLD SCHOOLThis is everything a dive bar should be. Drinks are super cheap (even the good stuff), not only smoking is allowed but they sell smokes (even the bartender smokes), cash only, full of regulares even early in the morning.Besides the fact that you will probably spend everything you saved on drycleaning your clothes, the atmosphere probably can't compare to anything you can find anywhere else in the city.Definitely a must try, at least once.

31.description: If you can stand the smoke (I'm obvi not a smoker) but love a good jukebox, it's AMAZEBALLS!!

34.description: This bar definitely knows who it is!! Smoking is allowed, you can buy cigarettes and beer to go-- it was like entering a different world! It wasn't my kind of scene, but it was very popular to those who were there! Crowded, we had to get a table near the door. We ended up staying for just one drink, since majority of us didn't have cash and they bar didn't take credit cards. It was an interesting experience, to say the least!!

16.description: Stopped by during a recent visit to Chicago. Inside and outside, it looks like a dive bar teleported here from 1974. It might look a tad intimidating for newbies, but it's got a great, relaxed atmosphere. Friendly bartenders, diverse crowd, rat pack on the jute box and hard-boiled eggs. It's got it all. You might get your ass kicked however, if you refer to anyone behind the bar as mixologists or order something fancier than a beer and a shot. Oh, and the hand written "no smoking" sign is ignored by all. If you wanted to reminiscence about what it smelled like after a night of bar hopping in the 20th century, this is the place to be.

13.description: My fav. bar in the city. I have to admit a bias as I know someone who works there. There's nothing like having a double shot of Rumple Minze at 7:30AM and having people glance in the windows as they walk down Grand Avenue with a look of 'what the heck? Who drinks at this time of day??' And me with a cig hanging out of my mouth. It's an olde school joint, but my one time there was very memorable and I recommend it for anyone in the area.Fun stuff!

11.description: Best juke box in the city.  Bartenders provide some of the best banter you will find.  Cash only and they allow you to buy some beer to take home.  Stiff drinks and cold beers.  Don't ask for any special cocktails unless you want to get made fun of.  I hope this place doesn't go hipster.  If cigarette smoke bothers you don't go.

39.description: This bar has potential for greatness, but it is jam-packed with people smoking cigarettes indoors.

37.description: We stopped at Richards bar on Friday, May 9th as part of a pub tour bar crawl and it was absolutely awful. I wasn't in there for very long, but it seemed as though the only thing they served was beer. I had to leave soon after entering because it was so infested with cigarette smoke that it was burning my eyes. Might I add that smoking inside of a restaurant is ILLEGAL?! We went next door to Emmitt's to save ourselves and have a drink at a much cleaner bar. Thank you Emmitt's!

0.description: A true throwback dive bar - and not the ironic kind that draws hipsters and world travelers.$4 Old Style bottles (don't ask what's on tap, there is no tap), Sinatra on the juke box (music made since 1990 need not apply), video slots that spit out tickets and styrofoam cups full of used cigarettes, a food menu that consists of hard boiled eggs and potato chips, that's how Richard's rolls.  And don't even think about breaking out a credit card...greenbacks are the only coin of the realm.Open early, open late, friendly service, and I defy you to be sober after spending $30.Not for everyone, but definitely for me!

38.description: Class place where time stopped on 12/31/07. Freedom Freedom Freedom. It may not be the Bar at the Peninsula, or the Season's bar at The Four Seasons, but to be able to do what I used to do in those places is a blessing...........never change.

51.description: If you don't like fun, go elsewhere.

27.description: My fav. bar in the city. I have to admit a bias as I know someone who works there. There's nothing like having a double shot of Rumple Minze at 7:30AM and having people glance in the windows as they walk down Grand Avenue with a look of 'what the heck? Who drinks at this time of day??' And me with a cig hanging out of my mouth. It's an olde school joint, but my one time there was very memorable and I recommend it for anyone in the area.Fun stuff!

32.description: Cough cough. Is it 1998? I stumbled on this place this past week.  The stench inside brought me back. Kinda missed when you could actually smoke at a bar.  20 minutes later the nostalgia wore off and we went to paramount down the street.

54.description: I don't think I will ever come/leave here sober...I don't think I will ever leave here without smelling like a pack of cigs. People smoke in here. It's gross. They have a great jukebox. Lot's of drunk dancing. It's a shit show to say the least....but a fun one at that. Richard's is truly a Chicago dive.

48.description: They allow smoking. I think Daly banned that a number of years ago. Nasty. If not I'd give it 3 stars. The bartenders are friendly and it has atmosphere. They need to stop the smoking.

44.description: So I was here for a night out with the girls. The vibe was great. Until, I got a drink from the bar. I ordered a glass of wine. Everything was great. The mood was good. But then I turned around to talk to my friends who were dancing to the music that was playing on the jukebox. Eventually, I turned back to get my glass of wine that I ordered. It was gone. To my dismay, the bartender had actually disposed of my glass of wine that was half full. When I asked him where my glass of wine was, he told me I had no wine left in the glass. My wine glass was half full. I consider that a drink that is unfinished. But apparently, the bartender didn't think so. He yelled at me at the top of his lungs and said that my glass of wine was empty. A half glass of wine doesn't seem empty to me. He said to me that if I just wanted a free glass of wine he could give me one. Are you kidding me? As if I was some gold digging little women that could handle or afford to buy her own drink. This throw back from the early 1900's who obviously feels that women should be barefoot and pregnant in the kitchen, couldn't possibly believe that I had enough money to pay for my own drink. How insulting? What a disgusting and insulting and unacceptable way of acting. If this establishment feels that it is acceptable to discriminate against woman, what kind of world could we actually still live in? How awful. Any woman or man with any sort of decency, should never enter this place. It is a disgusting and insulting place to ever have a drink. This place should be closed down.

24.description: One of my favorite bars in this part of town. Old school Chicago joint. Seems like nothin has changed here for 40 years (including some things that maybe should have changed). This is kindof an old guy bar, in the best way.

7.description: Great bar to come to if you miss the good ole days when you could sit at the bar and smoke a cigarette with your beer.You can do that at Richards.

49.description: Where else can you get beef jerky Cajon style, a hard boiled egg for $.15 and a 6-pack of virtually anything for $6-$8 ... so what you leave smelling like you just made love to a carton of Marlboro Lights ... John Denver followed by Phil Collins happened on the juke and a hot mess was trying to get the entire bar to slow dance with her ... all this happend in the half hour waiting for the 8 bus. RICHARDS is legendary!

40.description: The last true Chicago dive (or so i'm told, by those old enough to know).  Richard's serves a mix-bag of patrons from old traders to hipster lads to unusually attractive women whose ages are hard to pin down.  A hand-written sign above the bar suggests "No Smoking", but you can barely make it out through the clouds of smoke.  One of the best jukeboxes in town keeps the place upbeat and the cheap beers guarantee you'll never leave without a buzz.  The only downside is your clothes reeking of cigarette smoke the next morning, but it's a charming reminder of a bar that stayed true to the authentic Chicago dive scene...right down to the box tv in the corner showing the Hawks game.

53.description: A dive bar, Chicago-style, replete with disrepect for the law.  Yes, they made me take out my ID and prove that I'm older than 21 when I ordered a beer, but NO, they didn't say anything to my friend who pulled out a cigarette and started puffing away inside.  We Americans too often worry about the wrong things.  There are more comfortable, friendlier, and more reasonably priced dive bars in Chicago, particularly ones you can enjoy without the bombardment of smoke you need to endure to frequent Richard's.  All this said, the bar has a wide selection of beers and if smoking inside is your thing, I guess this is one of your best bets in Chicago.  Enjoy, I guess...

30.description: There is nothing quite like Richard's in Chicago or any city in the world!   To classify it as a "Great dive bar" is not doing it justice.  The bar  has history and character that can't be manufactured.  People going to Richards are going to have a good time, and they're rarely disappointed.  Jukebox is phenomenal and people of all ages and background are there which makes for an experience unlike any other.  It's the only bar in Chicago at can remember frequenting in my early twenties and continually into my mid thirties, and I'll be surprised if I can't make that very same statement twenty years from now!

46.description: A nice urban bar that has a unique mix of patrons from older men ,hot chicks, to local hipsters,. There is a simple beer selection and this bar is one of the more popular ones in the city for a small dive bar. Perhaps its approximation to downtown is the reason. The one bad thing is they allow smoking and it is illegal and I hope state authorities shut this disgusting aspect out as all other bars have to abide.

1.description: Smoking is an insurmountable obstacle (without banning it). That being said - Most characterful bar in the city. I talked to a guy once who you would have thought was Steve Buscemi. STILL looks like some of the patrons are mob-whatever. People you'd swear were brought up in the 1950s, although you know they couldn't have been cause they're not that old. Also a lot *nicer* inside than you'd think. I could go on, but they have more than enough to be #1 in their genre - except for that obstacle. But perhaps then they wouldn't be fully...them; idk. On my list to go in early morning for egg in a beer when the cloud cover is down.

55.description: The first time I went to Richard's I was on a date with the most boring man I've ever met. Go figure, he he brought me to the best bar in the city, if not the world. I fell in love with the bar, though not the man, and spent the duration of the date talking to an old man next to me. That's the great thing about Richard's: it's full of fascinating old-timers. I've never once been to the bar without at least one free drink from some sweet geriatric who just wants to chat for a bit.Free drinks are great and all, but better than that is the fact that this bar allows you to smoke INSIDE. Fancy that, cigarettes and alcohol under one roof! Richard's is like a step back in time, with its old timey jukebox selection and friendly atmosphere.

9.description: Simply the best dive bar in Chicago. High Life, jukebox and darkness.

26.description: Stopped by during a recent visit to Chicago. Inside and outside, it looks like a dive bar teleported here from 1974. It might look a tad intimidating for newbies, but it's got a great, relaxed atmosphere. Friendly bartenders, diverse crowd, rat pack on the jute box and hard-boiled eggs. It's got it all. You might get your ass kicked however, if you refer to anyone behind the bar as mixologists or order something fancier than a beer and a shot. Oh, and the hand written "no smoking" sign is ignored by all. If you wanted to reminiscence about what it smelled like after a night of bar hopping in the 20th century, this is the place to be.

25.description: Great dive bar

12.description: One of my favorite bars in this part of town. Old school Chicago joint. Seems like nothin has changed here for 40 years (including some things that maybe should have changed). This is kindof an old guy bar, in the best way.

59.description: I love this bar and have been coming here for years...literally since I was not old enough to drink but knew which bars didn't care enough to look at your fake ID. Which brings me to my next point...Richard's gives ZERO fucks about laws they don't agree with. As a person sharing a similar philosophy on life, I applaud them and try to give them my business whenever I am in the neighborhood.However, that may soon change as I just can not handle the cigar smoking. I don't mind the cigarettes (in case you don't know, everyone still smokes those inside here). I don't smoke cigarettes, but the smell reminds me of my grandmother whom I love dearly. I didn't care when people were able to smoke cigarettes in bars. But people were NEVER allowed to smoke cigars inside. That is just a total, pompous dick move. Thanks a lot, Guido. You don't even inhale the cigar smoke so why must I?Great place to people watch, CHEAP drinks, fun and eclectic music selection...but I will no longer be coming here if they continue to permit cigar smoking. That's where I draw the line.

21.description: Great bar to come to if you miss the good ole days when you could sit at the bar and smoke a cigarette with your beer.You can do that at Richards.

17.description: This bar definitely knows who it is!! Smoking is allowed, you can buy cigarettes and beer to go-- it was like entering a different world! It wasn't my kind of scene, but it was very popular to those who were there! Crowded, we had to get a table near the door. We ended up staying for just one drink, since majority of us didn't have cash and they bar didn't take credit cards. It was an interesting experience, to say the least!!

10.description: Pretty much the main reason to go here is just that you can smoke inside, plus the cheap beer, i admit i sometimes social smoke, so i think its cool that theres still a place where one can smoke inside, granted it looks very smoky, but screw it, its part of the experience, if you have sensitive lungs then you'll likely hate it, but i thought it was a cool experience, you can buy cigarette packs for $12 at the bar too

5.description: What The Godfather is to cinema, Richards is to Chicago dive bars. It's a staple, it's a classic, it's every cliche word you can use. Most people will go once, and only once, but will usually walk out with a great story and continue the recommendation trend ... Just do it. Cheers!

3.description: If I had a bar in my basement (and I don't even have a basement), I would try to make it a replica of Richard's. That's how much I love this bar.

35.description: The greatest bar in Chicago, period.All the non-smoking whiners can shut up and go elsewhere. Like anywhere. Everybody is welcome here. Old, young, rich, poor, it doesn't matter. A true dive bar, a Chicago classic. if you've never been, you need to go.

19.description: Amazing dive bar. Super friendly people. Cheap drinks. Classic juke box. If you smoke you can buy cigs.

28.description: Don't let the outside intimidate you, this dive bar is very cool inside.  Has an old school mobster feel to it.  People smoking, Sinatra playing, bartender smoking a cigar...This place was awesome.

45.description: Let me say first and foremost, I love dive bars. The ambiance of this place is extremely cool in a very unique way, and one cannot complain that they have pickled eggs for sale. They sell packaged liquor. They then have half of the equation correct.What really pulls down this review is the crowd that they attract. Its always jammed packed with the most hodgepodge and sketchy people in the entire city. People apparently don't care about smoking bans either.I just couldn't wait to leave the moment my buddy dragged me into there.

33.description: Nothing special. You can buy cigarettes here and smoking is allowed inside. Probably the divey-est bar I've ever been to. Have really great jerky here, though, so ask for that.

43.description: Awesome dive bar. However, since it's one of the only bars that allows smoking, the vast majority of everyone smokes inside. I even saw people smoking cigars inside. Every time I go, I need to wash everything I'm wearing. Perfect bar if you're a smoker. Nightmare if you hate cigarettes.

2.description: There's much to be said about any bar which transports you back to a time when smoking was allowed, there were no DJs and when drinks were dirt cheap. What is there not to love about a jukebox with old classics, a laid back environment that is open as early as 7am seven days a week and a core group of down to earth regulars who can hold their own and cheap prices?!! Drinks are practically given away when purchased by the half dozen. Single beers are $3-4 each, but Six 12oz bottles or cans are only $6-8. Hard ciders are $4. $6 mixed drinks. If you like draft beers, there are none. In addition to extremely affordable drink prices, drink tickets are passed out at random which can be redeemed for a free drink. I would be lying to say the tickets are passed out to every single patron but the prices are so low that there should be no hard feelings even if you are not extended a drink on the house offer. Need protein? Hard boiled eggs  $0.75  and Planters salted cashews are $1.00. If you forgot your smokes, you can buy them here too for 12 bucks. There is a no smoking sign in plain view but it's a real smokers paradise and the association for tobacco free living's worst nightmare. Upon entering, I apparently misjudged the amount of smoke inside and quickly realized it once I left. I seriously smelled like I had just finished fighting a few fires. I had to open the windows on the ride home to prevent a smoke inhalation injury. Smoke aside, I absolutely enjoyed every other aspect of this joint. It was a great time had by all.

18.description: Love it good company good pours good overall - it's my go to when in the city cum down for good time 80s at its finest a flashback !!!!!!

41.description: There are ladies smoking. (It's 2014.) The bartender is sharpening a knife on a flint. He's smoking too. The hipsters mingle seamlessly with the long-time regulars. This is a bar's bar.

52.description: What a complete shithole.  Not only is their beer selection crap, but it's full of middle aged flabby women and people smoking cigarettes.

50.description: I should admit, I'm a sucker for nostalgia. I especially love nostalgia when it comes to a bar. Enter Richard's. A couple friends and I decided to head here one weekend shortly before my move. The place reeks of old school style. Neon signs, a bar that looks like you could find it in a 60's basement, old posters, a payphone and some people that really rock the creapy mustache. Even the bar keeps look a bit old school. Either way I had a blast! Beers were relatively inexpensive, and if your your hungry, no fear they sell chips, and hard boiled eggs if your heart desires. If your looking for something not the norm in Chicago, head to Richard's. Its got a lot of old school charm!

4.description: If you're okay sucking down some secondhand smoke and the elevated potential for shoulder-to-shoulder tobacco and PBR enthusiasts, well...this throwback Thursday hangout will be your dive bar utopia. Cramped and dirty, yet this in-your-face watering hole manages to pack in the patrons begging for $3 Hamm's and High Life's. Bring a crowd and grab 12-pack at the bar! Yes, they sell friggin' 6 and 12 packs inside. Richard's is the epitome of dive bar triumph, if you're into the aforementioned sorts of things...

6.description: Solid no frills dive bar. It is so old school and irreverent you gotta love it. Smoking in the bar, cheap drinks, juke box, the mix of people from greasers with a chain wallet and cigs in their sleeve to men in business suits, to celebrities (I saw Lady Gaga there a couple years ago) all make this place a unique and special dive bar. It is where you can go to get away from the scene. It seems like while you are here nobody cares who you are, what your wearing, or really how much you got...blue collar, white collar, no collar. Love Bob the bartender.

22.description: OLD SCHOOLThis is everything a dive bar should be. Drinks are super cheap (even the good stuff), not only smoking is allowed but they sell smokes (even the bartender smokes), cash only, full of regulares even early in the morning.Besides the fact that you will probably spend everything you saved on drycleaning your clothes, the atmosphere probably can't compare to anything you can find anywhere else in the city.Definitely a must try, at least once.

15.description: Complete dive bar, but always a lot of fun. Only thing you'll regret about going here is the next morning when your close smell like you puffed 10 packs of Reds!

57.description: Went here for a party for the roomie.  Great jukebox, take no mess bartenders and laidback crowd. Except for the smoke(I'm asthmatic and my roomie and pals smoke like chimneys) it was great fun! We danced to the oldies, dranked and had fun. One of the best dive bars in the city. Lot's of character. Can't go there a lot i.e. smoke but will always recommend to others!

20.description: Old school, definitely old school. Cheap drinks, smoke filled rooms and regulars who have likely been there longer than I have been alive. No one questions your palate or flavor profile here. It's a gritty place that is reminiscent of bars 20 years ago where people went to smoke, drink and listen to the juke box.

36.description: Good place for cheap beer and great place  if you feel the urge to smoke a cigar in a bar.

14.description: Jesus if you don't go here you've missed Chicago great jukebox lots of dancing. There is no smoking unless you want to God this is a great place good prices nothing politically correct. Get your car detailed across the street and have a great meal at la scarola.  This is America. Don't miss it I think it's Bob who has been here forever

1.description: I am the office manager here at my company and am used to ordering many things for our office and employees. I have never EVER had an experience like this with complete lack of  customer service. I ordered custom TITLEST golf bags that were supposed to take up to 6 weeks. It has been over 3 months and I can not get anyone to answer the phone or an email regarding the almost thousand dollars we spent on these things. DO NOT order anything from here.Melissa

9.description: Have been going to proline off and on for the last three years. When I first started going was not impressed with the selection or service. Over the last year (I believe under updated ownership) the shop has really improved. Have all clubs anyone would be interested in purchasing, updated apparel, and wide selection of grips and balls. The practice facility is legit as well. Would definitely recommend this shop. I just purchased some titleist irons and was a great experience.

12.description: I went there for a golf lesson. I am an absolute beginner so was kind of scared/hesitant. Met with Marcus who immediately put me at ease. He gave me a solid demonstration of a "good swing" and then happily got handsy to adjust my posture and grip.Not too much a fan of all the non-golf discussion, but may be it is just the culture.All in all, a great place to learn the game if you live downtown and are starting up.

21.description: Overall, Proline is a decent golf place.  Having seen a few in my times since my dad used to rep golf products, they have a pretty good selection.  It's convenient for downtown since they actually have a parking area right nearby, so you won't have to lug your newly purchased clubs to your car.

16.description: I know golf, I was a PGA Golf Professional specializing in golf equipment and instruction.  I am out of the business but stay up to date on all the latest trends and participate in many blogs.  I would say they are cheap at best.  Not in a good way.  I have to say they are golfs equivalent to a auto service station.  Imagine that time you took your car in and everything was wrong because they thought you knew nothing about golf.  The shop is disorganized and has mostly used ebay stuff.  Save yourself the drive and parking $$$ and just use ebay.

17.description: This is a great golf shop.  All the sales people I've dealt with there are knowledgable and helpful, prices are good, my club-fitting was great.  I don't understand the negative reviews from the Calif. customers -- perhaps they had on-line or tel. purchase problems.

10.description: BUYER BEWARE! I purchased a 10 lesson package with them and had only used 6 or 7 to date. When I stopped in today to see exactly how many lessons I had left I was told by the Owner that the Pro who had given me the lessons was no longer working there so I was out any remaining lessons. I was shocked and said that my purchase and receipt was from ProLine Golf, not the particular Pro himself. The owner then said "it was just rung in our cash register but the deal is with him".  Huh?!?! That makes zero sense - so basically if you buy any lessons there and that particular Pro leaves, you are out of luck. Solid business policy...

5.description: Gabe is a great teacher, I recommend him to anyone from beginning golfers two more experience golfers.I've taken many lessons from him and I always come away with a better understanding of my golf swing which allows me to play better golf. His understanding of the game is impeccable , he's teaching mannerisms are relaxed and comfortable don't be afraid he might laugh at you but it's only because he loves what he does!! (Bombing it pass my weekend playing partners!!)

11.description: Awesome place to work on your game! Great brand new practice aria! Staff super friendly and customer service amazing. I'll recommend Proline to all my golf buddy's !

22.description: This is a one stop shop for the golf enthusiast in your life!  With Christmas just around the corner its a great place to find gifts!  The prices are pretty reasonable.  CHeck out their website too, its got some great deals!

0.description: Gabe helped me out with wedge loft adjustments during a practice session shortly before a golf trip. I really appreciated the friendly customer service. There are plenty of hitting bays so ample room to practice when the weather isn't cooperating. If you love golf, then you should check this place out.

20.description: A great store for anything golf related. Plus they have 2 adorable chiuahas (I don't know how to spell that).

19.description: This is a one stop shop for the golf enthusiast in your life!  With Christmas just around the corner its a great place to find gifts!  The prices are pretty reasonable.  CHeck out their website too, its got some great deals!

2.description: I would NOT recommend booking any sessions at Proline Chicago. When trying to schedule (after I already paid) they wouldn't return any of my emails for two months. When they finally did we scheduled my next session. I showed up only for my trainer to completely blow me off and not show up! The staff called them and covered for him and gave me a free towel. They told me he would contact me to reschedule...he never did. I finally insisted on another instructor to finish my sessions.I wanted to keep working with Proline but Chicago has no shortage of golf facilities and I'm now going elsewhere.

18.description: In order to buy Japanese forged Miura clubs, the customer has to go through Miura's dealers and has to buy shafts and grips from that dealer. ProLine Golf did the poorest job possible as the grips were the wrong size and the shafts were the wrong lengths without consistent increments. Not wanting to put myself in their hands again, I had my guy re-shaft and re-grip the clubs. When I returned the shafts and had ProLine Golf verify the errors, I asked for my money back on the shafts and grips. I was offered less than half of what I had just paid. Wanting to preserve some value, I had to send in the club heads to get their shafts re-installed. And I had to pay all return shipping!  Run don't walk from doing business with ProLine Golf. And while you are at it, pass on Miura clubs. They offered no help and hid behind the dealer, whom of course they had chosen. By not selling club heads only, Miura has disqualified themselves from the custom club category. They just make expensive clubs with no quality control. And ProLine Golf does not have the craftsmen and service to be in the game.

13.description: I've had nothing but good experiences with Proline Golf. They're knowledgeable, and professional. They're really good.If they don't have it, they'll get it. I recommend them.

4.description: Gabe is an amazing teacher.  My girlfriend gave me golf lessons for Christmas from living social. I've never had any lessons previously, but seriously wish I did so years ago. From just one swing Gabe could tell you about 10 things you've done wrong and can pinpoint precisely how to fix your mistakes. He explains them in a way that makes so much sense when you try swinging again that it will forever improve your game. He even has a video golf app on his phone that he can quickly draw angles with to show you exactly where you have mistakes in slow motion.I'd absolutely recommend him to anyone and surely even the most avid golfers could learn a few improvements they never would have realized before.Going into the lesson, I'd bring up specific points that you're struggling on, and if not just say what you want to improve the most and start swinging.

6.description: Went into practice on the simulator and Gabe noticed that I was using a bad swing practice. He stopped and help me adjust my swing to correct a nagging slice.  Very friendly and knowledgeable - didn't know what to expect while I was there but was very pleased with the service.  Would - without a doubt - go back to Proline Golf.  Great place, lots of room and state of the art equipment.

15.description: My brother and I checked out Proline.  The people I met there were really nice and really seemed to know what they were doing.  I ended up backing out of actually going forward with anything there simply because of the cost.  My brother invested in a couple of new clubs and went with a package deal and has been very impressed with the results from his golf swing analysis.  For me, though, the services just seemed out of line with the cost and the equipment was nothing out of the ordinary.

7.description: I came in recently to have my clubs regripped after hearing good things about their work from a friend. Their work certainly did not disappoint and they had very good prices.Overall, it's a really relaxed, pleasant experience in the store. The employees are happy to let you try out the clubs and get a good feel for what you're buying. Their simulators are top quality and the employees are very knowledgable. This is a different experience from some of the larger golf stores in that there doesn't seem to be as much pressure to buy something after hitting it a few times in the simulator. The employees are serious about you having a good experience and coming out with the right equipment for your game.

8.description: I am a huge fan of Proline Golf. Near the intersection of Chicago Ave and Halsted, Proline offers lessons, club fitting, indoor golf and practice and a lot more. They have free parking and a friendly staff and real accurate golf simulators. I took lessons from the Manager Gabe Rios. He is definitely the best pro there and can fix your game. His laid back approach and ability to quickly diagnose and help fix my swing was great! I also attended a Men's Night which was really cool. Gabe had food catered and drinks served. He did a clinic for the people attending and put the Hawks game on the big screen. Afterwards, we all smoked cigars on the back deck and I truly enjoyed it.  This is the best Golf Shop in Chicago!!!

3.description: Friendly staff. Terrible selection. I'm sticking with Goldsmith/PGA Superstore.If you're desperate to find something, or just too lazy to drive to Downers Grove, then go ahead and try this place out.  They had a very limited variety of clubs and putters to test (didn't have a single Nike putter when I went there). If you're really into golf, and want to find a great selection of items, then head over to the PGA Superstore in DG.

14.description: Got some unique golf items you won't see at dicks or golf galaxy, like mizuno hats.
